data.v: दानान्न दुष्करतरं पृथिव्यामस्ति किंचन । अर्थे हि महती तृष्णा स च दुःखेन लभ्यते ।।
data.md: Vyasa said : O child, there is nothing in this world more difficult to practise than charity. Men thirst for wealth and obtain it with great difficulty.

data.v: परित्यज्य प्रियान्प्राणान्धनार्थं हि महाहवम् । प्रविशन्ति नरा वीराः समुद्रमटवीं तथा ।।
data.md: O high-minded one, even abandoning (the hope of) dear life itself, heroic men enter into the depths of the sea and the forest for wealth.

data.v: कृषिगोरक्ष्यमित्येके प्रतिपद्यन्ति मानवाः । पुरुषाः प्रेष्यतामेके निर्गच्छन्ति धनार्थिनः ।।
data.md: For wealth some take to agriculture, some to the tending of the kine and some serve others. Therefore it is extremely difficult to part with wealth which is obtained with such great difficulty.

data.v: तस्य दुःखार्जितस्यैवं परित्यागः सुदुष्करः । न दुष्करतरं दानात्तस्माद्दानं मतं मम ।।
data.md: As there is nothing harder to practise than charity, in my opinion, even bestowal of boons is superior to every thing.

data.v: विशेषस्त्वत्र विज्ञेयो न्यायेनोपार्जितं धनम् । पात्रे देशे च काले च साधुभ्यः प्रतिपादयेत् ।।
data.md: Specially this is to be remembered that wellgotten gains should in proper time and place be given away to pious men.

data.v: अन्यायसमुपात्तेन दानधर्मो धनेन यः । क्रियते न स कर्तारं त्रायते महतो भयात् ।।
data.md: But the bestowal of ill-gotten wealth can never rescue the giver from the great fear (of the evil of rebirth).

data.v: पात्रे दानं स्वल्पमपि काले दत्तं युधिष्ठिर । मनसा सुविशुद्धेन प्रेत्यानन्तफलं स्मृतम् ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, it has been said that by bestowing in a pure spirit even a slight gift in due time and to a fit recipient a man obtains inexhaustible fruits in the next world. In this connection a story is told about the fruit obtained by Mudgala by giving away only a Drona of corn.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । व्रीहिद्रोणपरित्यागाद्यत्फलं प्राप मुद्गलः ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, it has been said that by bestowing in a pure spirit even a slight gift in due time and to a fit recipient a man obtains inexhaustible fruits in the next world. In this connection a story is told about the fruit obtained by Mudgala by giving away only a Drona of corn.

data.v: व्रीहिद्रोणः परित्यक्तः कथं तेन महात्मना । कस्मै दत्तश्च भगवन्विधिना केन चात्थ मे ।।
data.md: Yudhisthira said: O exalted one, why did that highsouled one give away a Drona of corn? To whom and in what prescribed way he gave it. Tell me this.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षधर्मा भगवान्यस्य तुष्टो हि कर्मभिः । सफलं तस्य जन्माहं मन्ये सद्धर्मचारिणः ।।
data.md: O exalted one, I consider the life of that virtuous man as having borne fruits with whose acts the supreme one himself is well-pleased.

data.v: शिलोञ्छवृत्तिर्धर्मात्मा मुद्गलः संशितव्रतः । आसीद्राजन्कुरुक्षेत्रे सत्यवागनसूयकः ।।
data.md: Vyasa said : O king, there lived in Kurukshetra a virtuous man, named Mudgala. He was truthful and free from malice. He was self-controlled. He led the Sila and Uncha modes of life.

data.v: अतिथिव्रती क्रियावांश्च कापोतीं वृत्तिमास्थितः । सत्रमिष्टीकृतं नाम समुपास्ते महातपाः ।।
data.md: Although leading his life like a pigeon that great ascetic entertained his guests, celebrated the sacrefice called Ishtikhita and performed other rites. That Rishi, with his wife and son, ate for a fortnight and during the other fortnight he led the life of a pigeon collecting (but) a drona of corn.

data.v: सपुत्रदारो हि मुनिः पक्षाहारो बभूव सः । कपोतवृत्त्या पक्षेण व्रीहिद्रोणमुपार्जयत् ।।
data.md: Although leading his life like a pigeon that great ascetic entertained his guests, celebrated the sacrefice called Ishtikhita and performed other rites. That Rishi, with his wife and son, ate for a fortnight and during the other fortnight he led the life of a pigeon collecting (but) a drona of corn.

data.v: दर्शं च पौर्णमासं च कुर्वन्विगतमत्सरः । देवतातिथिशेषेण कुरुते देहयापनम् ।।
data.md: Celebrating the Darsa and Paurnamashya sacrifices that guileless Rishi used to pass his days by taking the food that remained after the deities and the guests had eaten.

data.v: तस्येन्द्रः सहितो देवैः साक्षात्त्रिभुवनेश्वरः । प्रत्यगृह्णान्महाराज भागं पर्वणि पर्वणि ।।
data.md: In (all) auspicious lunar days, the lord of the three worlds, Indra accompained by the celestials, O great king, used to partake the food offered at his sacrifice.

data.v: स पर्वकालं कृत्वा तु मुनिवृत्त्या समन्वितः । अतिथिभ्यो ददावन्नं प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.md: On such (auspicious) days that Rishi leading the life of a Muni cheerfully entertained his guests also with food.

data.v: व्रीहिद्रोणस्य तदहो ददतोऽन्नं महात्मनः । शिष्टं मात्सर्यहीनस्य वर्धत्यतिथिदर्शनात् ।।
data.md: As that high-souled one distributed his food with great speed, the reaminder of the Drona of corn increased as soon as (fresh) guests appeared.

data.v: तच्छतान्यपि भुञ्जन्ति ब्राह्मणानां मनीषिणाम् । मुनेस्त्यागविशुद्ध्या तु तदन्नं वृद्धिमृच्छति ।।
data.md: By virtue of the pure spirit in which the Rishi gave away (food), it increased so much that hundreds upon hundreds of leanred Brahmanas were fed with it.

data.v: तं तु शुश्राव धर्मिष्ठं मुद्गलं संशितव्रतम् । दुर्वासा नृप दिग्वासास्तमथाभ्याजगाम ह ।।
data.md: O king (once upon a time) having heard of the virtuous and bow-observing Mudgala, the naked Rishi Durvasa, with his dress like that of a maniac and his head bare of hair, came there, O Pandava, uttering various insulting words.

data.v: बिभ्रच्चानियतं वेषमुन्मत्त इव पाण्डव । विकचः परुषा वाचो व्याहरन्विविधा मुनिः ।।
data.md: O king (once upon a time) having heard of the virtuous and bow-observing Mudgala, the naked Rishi Durvasa, with his dress like that of a maniac and his head bare of hair, came there, O Pandava, uttering various insulting words.

data.v: अभिगम्याथ तं विप्रमुवाच मुनिसत्तमः । अन्नार्थिनमनुप्राप्तं विद्धि मां मुनिसत्तम ।।
data.md: Having arrived there, that foremost of Rishis spoke thus to that Brahimana, “O best of Brahmanas, know that I have come here for food.

data.v: स्वागतं तेऽस्त्विति मुनिं मुद्गलः प्रत्यभाषत । पाद्यमाचमनीयं च प्रतिवेद्यान्नमुत्तमम् ।।
प्रादात्स तपसोपात्तं क्षुधितायातिथिव्रती । उन्मत्ताय परां श्रद्धामास्थाय स धृतव्रतः ।।
ततस्तदन्नं रसवत्स एव क्षुधयान्वितः । बुभुजे कृत्स्नमुन्मत्तः प्रादात्तस्मै च मुद्गलः ।।
भुक्त्वा चान्नं ततः सर्वमुच्छिष्टेनात्मनस्ततः । अथानुलिलिपेऽङ्गानि जगाम च यथागतम् ।।
data.md: Having eaten up all that food, he besmeared his body with the uncleaned remainder and went away as he had come.

data.v: एवं द्वितीये संप्राप्ते पर्वकाले मनीषिणः । आगम्य बुभुजे सर्वमन्नमुञ्छोपजीविनः ।।
data.md: In this manner during the next sea-son, he came again and ate up all the food given to him by that wise Rishi leading the Unccha mode of life.

data.v: निराहारस्तु स मुनिरुञ्छमार्जयते पुनः । न चैनं विक्रियां नेतुमशकन्मुद्गलं क्षुधा ।।
data.md: Thereupon without eating any food himself, the Rishi Mudgala again became engaged in collecting corn, following the Unccha mode. Hunger could not disturb his equanimity,

data.v: न क्रोधो न च मात्सर्यं नावमानो न संभ्रमः । सपुत्रदारमुञ्छन्तमाविवेश द्विजोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Nor could anger or guile or sense of degradation or agitationenter into the heart of that best of Brahmanas leading the Unccha mode of life along with his son and his wife.

data.v: तथा तमुञ्छधर्माणं दुर्वासा मुनिसत्तमम् । उपतस्थे यथाकालं षट्कृत्वः कृतनिश्चयः ।।
data.md: In ths way Durvasa during successive seasons came for several times before that best of sages living according to the Unccha mode of life. But that rishi could not perceive any senses agitation in the heart of Mudgala. He found the heart of that virtuous-minded Rishi always pure.

data.v: न चास्य मानसं किंचिद्विकारं ददृशे मुनिः । शुद्धसत्त्वस्य शुद्धं स ददृशे निर्मलं मनः ।।
data.md: In ths way Durvasa during successive seasons came for several times before that best of sages living according to the Unccha mode of life. But that rishi could not perceive any senses agitation in the heart of Mudgala. He found the heart of that virtuous-minded Rishi always pure.

data.v: तमुवाच ततः प्रीतः स मुनिर्मुद्गलं तदा । त्वत्समो नास्ति लोकेऽस्मिन्दाता मात्सर्यवर्जितः ।।
data.md: Thereupon becoming very much pleased he thus spoke to the Rishi Mudgala, There is no other simpleand charitable being like you on earth.

data.v: क्षुद्धर्मसंज्ञां प्रणुदत्यादत्ते धैर्यमेव च । विषयानुसारिणी जिह्वा कर्षत्येव रसान्प्रति ।।
data.md: The pangs of hunger drive away all sense of virtue and deprive people of patience. The gongues, that always love, delicacies, attract men towards them.

data.v: आहारप्रभवाः प्राणा मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् । मनसश्चेन्द्रियाणां चाप्यैकाग्र्यं निश्चितं तपः ।।
data.md: Life is sustained by food. The mind is however fickle and it is hard to keep it in subjection. The concentration of mind and the control of the constitute (true) asceticism.

data.v: श्रमेणोपार्जितं त्यक्तुं दुःखं शुद्धेन चेतसा । तत्सर्वं भवता साधो यथावदुपपादितम् ।।
data.md: It is very hard to abandon in a pure spirit a thing earned by pain. O virtuous one, but all this has been duly achieved by you.

data.v: प्रीताः स्मोऽनुगृहीताश्च समेत्य भवता सह । इन्द्रियाभिजयो धैर्यं संविभागो दमः शमः ।।
data.md: In your company we feel obliged and gratified. Self-restraint, Self-restraint, fortitude, justice, control of the senses and of the faculties, mercy and virtue are all established in you. You have conquered all the worlds by your deeds, you have obtained the highest state.

data.v: दया सत्यं च धर्मश्च त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् । जितास्ते कर्मभिर्लोकाः प्राप्तोऽसि परमां गतिम् ।।
data.md: In your company we feel obliged and gratified. Self-restraint, Self-restraint, fortitude, justice, control of the senses and of the faculties, mercy and virtue are all established in you. You have conquered all the worlds by your deeds, you have obtained the highest state.

data.v: अहो दानं विघुष्टं ते सुमहत्स्वर्गवासिभिः । सशरीरो भवान्गन्ता स्वर्गं सुचरितव्रत ।।
data.md: Even the dwellers of heaven are proclaiming your great deeds of charity. O vow-observing Rishi, you shall go to heaven in your own body.

data.v: इत्येवं वदतस्तस्य तदा दुर्वाससो मुनेः । देवदूतो विमानेन मुद्गलं प्रत्युपस्थितः ।।
data.md: When the Rishi Durvasa was thus speaking, celestial messenger appeared before Mudgala in a car yoked with swans and cranes, adorned with numerous bells, scented with divine fragrance, picturesquely painted and possessing the power of going everywhere at will.

data.v: हंससारसयुक्तेन किङ्किणीजालमालिना । कामगेन विचित्रेण दिव्यगन्धवता तथा ।।
data.md: When the Rishi Durvasa was thus speaking, celestial messenger appeared before Mudgala in a car yoked with swans and cranes, adorned with numerous bells, scented with divine fragrance, picturesquely painted and possessing the power of going everywhere at will.

data.v: उवाच चैनं विप्रर्षिं विमानं कर्मभिर्जितम् । समुपारोह संसिद्धिं प्राप्तोऽसि परमां मुने ।।
data.md: He spoke thus to the Brahmanas. Ascend this car. O Rishis, the result of your acts, you have obtained the fruit of your asceticism.

data.v: तमेवंवादिनमृषिर्देवदूतमुवाच ह । इच्छामि भवता प्रोक्तान्गुणान्स्वर्गनिवासिनाम् ।।
data.md: When the celestial messenger was thus talking, the Rishi told him, O celestial messenger, I desire that you should describe to methe attributes of those that live there. What is their asceticism and what is their purpose? What is the happiness in heaven and what are its defects?

data.v: के गुणास्तत्र वसतां किं तपः कश्च निश्चयः । स्वर्गे स्वर्गसुखं किं च दोषो वा देवदूतक ।।
data.md: When the celestial messenger was thus talking, the Rishi told him, O celestial messenger, I desire that you should describe to methe attributes of those that live there. What is their asceticism and what is their purpose? What is the happiness in heaven and what are its defects?

data.v: सतां सप्तपदं मित्रमाहुः सन्तः कुलोचिताः । मित्रतां च पुरस्कृत्य पृच्छामि त्वामहं विभो ।।
data.md: O lord, it has been declared by nobly born virtuous men that friendship with five men is formed by only walking with them seven faces. In the name of friendship, I ask you, tell me the truth and that which is good for me to know. Hearing you, I shall according to your words fix the course I ought to follow.

data.v: यदत्र तथ्यं पथ्यं च तद्ब्रवीह्यविचारयन् । श्रुत्वा तथा करिष्यामि व्यवसायं गिरा तव ।।
data.md: O lord, it has been declared by nobly born virtuous men that friendship with five men is formed by only walking with them seven faces. In the name of friendship, I ask you, tell me the truth and that which is good for me to know. Hearing you, I shall according to your words fix the course I ought to follow.

data.v: महर्षेऽकार्यबुद्धिस्त्वं यः स्वर्गसुखमुत्तमम् । संप्राप्तं बहु मन्तव्यं विमृशस्यबुधो यथा ।।
data.md: The celestial messenger said: O great Rishi, you are very simple, for having obtained that celestial bliss which brings great honour, you are still delebrating like an unwise person.

data.v: उपरिष्टादसौ लोको योऽयं स्वरिति संज्ञितः । ऊर्ध्वगः सत्पथः शश्वद्देवयानचरो मुने ।।
data.md: O Rishi, that which is known in the world by the name of heaven exists above us. It is high, it is furnished with excellent paths and is always frequented by celestial cars.

data.v: नातप्ततपसः पुंसो नामहायज्ञयाजिनः । नानृता नास्तिकाश्चैव तत्र गच्छन्ति मुद्गल ।।
data.md: O sage, atheists and untruthful persons, those that have not performed asceticism and those that have not performed great sacrifices, cannot go there.

data.v: धर्मात्मानो जितात्मानः शान्ता दान्ता विमत्सराः । दानधर्मरताः पुंसः शूराश्चाहतलक्षणाः ।।
data.md: Only virtuous souls and those of subdued minds and those that have their faculties under control and those that have controlled their senses and those that are free from malice and persons intent on the practice of charity and heroes and men bearing marks of battle, after having subdued senses and faculties and performed the most meritorious rites, attain to those regions, O Brahmana, capable of beings obtained only by virtuous acts and inhabitatedd by pious men.

data.v: तत्र गच्छन्ति कर्माग्र्यं कृत्वा शमदमात्मकम् । लोकान्पुण्यकृतां ब्रह्मन्सद्भिरासेवितान्नृभिः ।।
data.md: Only virtuous souls and those of subdued minds and those that have their faculties under control and those that have controlled their senses and those that are free from malice and persons intent on the practice of charity and heroes and men bearing marks of battle, after having subdued senses and faculties and performed the most meritorious rites, attain to those regions, O Brahmana, capable of beings obtained only by virtuous acts and inhabitatedd by pious men.

data.v: देवाः साध्यास्तथा विश्वे मरुतश्च महर्षिभिः । यामा धामाश्च मौद्गल्य गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा ।।
data.md: O Mudgala, there are established separately myriads of beautiful, shinning and respendent worlds bestowing every object of desire owned by those celestial beings, the gods, the Sadhyas, the Vishvadevas, the great sages, the Yamas, the Dhamas and the Gandharvas and the Apsaras.

data.v: एषां देवनिकायानां पृथक्पृथगनेकशः । भास्वन्तः कामसंपन्ना लोकास्तेजोमयाः शुभाः ।।
data.md: O Mudgala, there are established separately myriads of beautiful, shinning and respendent worlds bestowing every object of desire owned by those celestial beings, the gods, the Sadhyas, the Vishvadevas, the great sages, the Yamas, the Dhamas and the Gandharvas and the Apsaras.

data.v: त्रयस्त्रिंशत्सहस्राणि योजनानां हिरण्मयः । मेरुः पर्वतराड्यत्र देवोद्यानानि मुद्गल ।।
data.md: There is that foremost of mountains, the golden Meru extending thirty-three thousand Yojanas. O Mudgala, there are also the celestial gardens. With Nandan at their head here sport the persons of meritorious acts. Neither hunger nor thirst nor heat or cold nor fear.

data.v: नन्दनादीनि पुण्यानि विहाराः पुण्यकर्मणाम् । न क्षुत्पिपासे न ग्लानिर्न शीतोष्णभयं तथा ।।
data.md: There is that foremost of mountains, the golden Meru extending thirty-three thousand Yojanas. O Mudgala, there are also the celestial gardens. With Nandan at their head here sport the persons of meritorious acts. Neither hunger nor thirst nor heat or cold nor fear.

data.v: बीभत्समशुभं वापि रोगा वा तत्र केचन । मनोज्ञाः सर्वतो गन्धाः सुखस्पर्शाश्च सर्वशः ।।

data.md: Learning that his father has been thus promise-bound and considering that the king's truth ought to remain inviolable, the virtuous and powerful Rama went into the forests.

data.md: And, may you be blessed, he (Rama) was followed by the prosperous Lakshmana, the foremost of bowmen and his wife Sita, the princess of Videha and daughter of Janaka.

data.v: निवेश्योपवने सैन्यं तच्छूरः प्राज्ञवानरम् । प्रेषयामास दौत्येन रावणस्य ततोऽङ्गदम् ।।
data.md: Having placed his army in the pleasuregardens of that city, Rama sent that wise monkey, Angada, as his envoy to Ravana.

data.v: प्रभूतान्नोदके तस्मिन्बहुमूलफले वने । सेनां निवेश्य काकुत्स्थो विधिवत्पर्यरक्षत ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The descendant of Kakustha having encamped his troops in those woods and abounding with plenty of food and drink and various (sorts of) fruits and roots, began to watch over them carefully.

data.md: (On the other hand) Ravana set up, in Lanka, engines constructed in accordance with (the rules of the science on war). And the seven moats, (which encircled the city), protected by strong walls and gates, full of deep waters and abounding with fishes and alligators, though naturally unassailable, were rendered more so by being surrounded with pointed stakes of Khadira wood.

data.md: (On the other hand) Ravana set up, in Lanka, engines constructed in accordance with (the rules of the science on war). And the seven moats, (which encircled the city), protected by strong walls and gates, full of deep waters and abounding with fishes and alligators, though naturally unassailable, were rendered more so by being surrounded with pointed stakes of Khadira wood.

data.v: कर्णाट्टयन्त्रदुर्धर्षा बभूवुः सहुडोपलाः । साशीविषघटायोधाः ससर्जरसपांसवः ।।
data.md: And the ramparts furnished with rounded stones and iron clubs were made unassailable by means of ballistas. The warriors (who mounted guard on the gates) had with them earthen jars full of poisonous snakes, resinous powders.

data.v: मुसलालातनाराचतोमरासिपरश्वधैः । अन्विताश्च शतघ्नीभिः समधूच्छिष्टमुद्गराः ।।
data.md: And were armed with maces, fire-brands, Narichas, Tomaras, swords, axes, Shataghnis and clubs saturated with wax.

data.v: पुरद्वारेषु सर्वेषु गुल्माः स्थावरजङ्गमाः । बभूवुः पत्तिबहुलाः प्रभूतगजवाजिनः ।।
data.md: And all the city gates were guarded by permanent and temporary encampments containing large numbers of infantry and by innumerable elephants and horses.

data.v: अङ्गदस्त्वथ लङ्काया द्वारदेशमुपागतः । विदितो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य प्रविवेश गतव्यथः ।।
data.md: Angada having reached one of the gates of Lanka and being made known to the Rakshasa king entered (the city) fearlessly.

data.v: मध्ये राक्षसकोटीनां बह्वीनां सुमहाबलः । शुशुभे मेघमालाभिरादित्य इव संवृतः ।।
data.md: And that highly-powerful one surrounded by innumerable crores of Rakshasas shone like the sun in the midst of masses of clouds.

data.v: स समासाद्य पौलस्त्यममात्यैरभिसंवृतम् । रामसंदेशमामन्त्र्य वाग्मी वक्तुं प्रचक्रमे ।।
data.md: And that eloquent (monkey) having approached and saluted the descendant of Pulastya who was surrounded by (his) ministers, began to deliver Rama's message (in the following words).

data.v: आह त्वां राघवो राजन्कोसलेन्द्रो महायशाः । प्राप्तकालमिदं वाक्यं तदादत्स्व कुरुष्व च ।।
data.md: "O king, the highly-renowned lord of Kosala, the descendant of Raghu says to you (through me) these words appropriate to the occasion. Accept that (message) and act in obedience to it.

data.v: अकृतात्मानमासाद्य राजानमनये रतम् । विनश्यन्त्यनयाविष्टा देशाश्च नगराणि च ।।
data.md: (Those) countries and cities whose kings are addicted to immoral acts and are incapable of controlling their minds, are themselves covered with sin and destroyed.

data.v: त्वयैकेनापराद्धं मे सीतामाहरता बलात् । वधायानपराद्धानामन्येषां तद्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: You alone are guilty of forcibly carrying off Sita; but your guilt will lead many innocent persons to death.

data.v: ये त्वया बलदर्पाभ्यामाविष्टेन वनेचराः । ऋषयो हिंसिताः पूर्वं देवाश्चाप्यवमानिताः ।।
data.md: Elated with power and pride, you who formerly killed many Rishis living in the forests, insulted the gods, slew many royal sages and carried off weeping damsels, are about to be visited with retributive justice for your those vicious deeds.

data.v: राजर्षयश्च निहता रुदन्त्यश्चाहृताः स्त्रियः । तदिदं समनुप्राप्तं फलं तस्यानयस्य ते ।।
data.md: Elated with power and pride, you who formerly killed many Rishis living in the forests, insulted the gods, slew many royal sages and carried off weeping damsels, are about to be visited with retributive justice for your those vicious deeds.

data.v: हन्तास्मि त्वां सहामात्यं युध्यस्व पुरुषो भव । पश्य मे धनुषो वीर्यं मानुषस्य निशाचर ।।
data.md: I will kill you together with your advisers. Give battle and play the hero. O night-ranger, behold the strength of my bow though I ar only a mortal.

data.v: मुच्यतां जानकी सीता न मे मोक्ष्यसि कर्हिचित् । अराक्षसमिमं लोकं कर्तास्मि निशितैः शरैः ।।
data.md: Liberate Sita, the daughter of Janaka. But if you persist in not releasing her I will make this earth bare of all the Rakshasas with sharpened arrows."

data.v: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य दूतस्य परुषं वचः । श्रुत्वा न ममृषे राजा रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः ।।
data.md: Hearing these harsh words of the messenger, king Ravana could not brook them and became senseless with rage.

data.v: इङ्गितज्ञास्ततो भर्तुश्चत्वारो रजनीचराः । चतुर्ष्वङ्गेषु जगृहुः शार्दूलमिव पक्षिणः ।।
data.md: Thereupon four night-wanderers who understood (well) the signs of their lord seized Angada by his four limbs like birds seizing a tiger.

data.v: तांस्तथाङ्गेषु संसक्तानङ्गदो रजनीचरान् । आदायैव खमुत्पत्य प्रासादतलमाविशत् ।।
data.md: And along with those wanderers of the night who held him fast by his limbs Angada took a leap upwards and alighted on the roof of the palace.

data.v: वेगेनोत्पततस्तस्य पेतुस्ते रजनीचराः । भुवि संभिन्नहृदयाः प्रहारपरिपीडिताः ।।
data.md: Those Rakshasa raised up with great force fell down on the ground with their ribs shattered and sorely afflicted by the violence of the fall.

data.v: स मुक्तो हर्म्यशिखरात्तस्मात्पुनरवापतत् । लङ्घयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कां स्वबलस्य समीपतः ।।
data.md: And he again took a leap from the roof of the palace whereon he descended and clearing the city of Lanka, come down to his comrades.

data.v: कोसलेन्द्रमथाभ्येत्य सर्वमावेद्य चाङ्गदः । विशश्राम स तेजस्वी राघवेणाभिनन्दितः ।।
data.md: Then that monkey, approaching the lord of Kosala told him everything; and being highly praised by the descendant of Raghu, the energetic monkey went away to take rest.

data.v: ततः सर्वाभिसारेण हरीणां वातरंहसाम् । भेदयामास लङ्कायाः प्राकारं रघुनन्दनः ।।
data.md: Then the descendant of Raghu by the simultaneous exertions of all monkeys, fleet as the wind, caused the walls of Lanka to be broken down.

data.v: विभीषणर्क्षाधिपती पुरस्कृत्याथ लक्ष्मणः । दक्षिणं नगरद्वारमवामृद्नाद्दुरासदम् ।।
data.md: Then Lakshmana with Vibhishana and the lord of the bears (Jambuvana) marching ahead, demolished the impregnable southern gate of the city.

data.v: करभारुणगात्राणां हरीणां युद्धशालिनाम् । कोटीशतसहस्रेण लङ्कामभ्यपतत्तदा ।।
data.md: Rama then invaded Lanka with a hundred thousand crores of monkeys skilled in battle and resembling young camels in the reddish complexion which they had.

data.v: उत्पतद्भिः पतद्भिश्च निपतद्भिश्च वानरैः । नादृश्यत तदा सूर्यो रजसा नाशितप्रभः ।।
data.md: And the sun, with his rays shadowed by the dust raised by the monkeys leaping up an down and crosswise, could not be seen.

data.v: शालिप्रसूनसदृशैः शिरीषकुसुमप्रभैः । तरुणादित्यसदृशैः शरगौरैश्च वानरैः ।।
data.md: And the walls (of Lanka) covered all over with monkeys endued with complexions (yellow) as the ears of paddy, (grey) as shirisha flowers (crimson) as the morning sun and white as flax, assumed a tawny hue. And O king, the Rakshasas together with their wives and elders were wonder-struck (at this unusual sight).

data.v: प्राकारं ददृशुस्ते तु समन्तात्कपिलीकृतम् । राक्षसा विस्मिता राजन्सस्त्रीवृद्धाः समन्ततः ।।
data.md: And the walls (of Lanka) covered all over with monkeys endued with complexions (yellow) as the ears of paddy, (grey) as shirisha flowers (crimson) as the morning sun and white as flax, assumed a tawny hue. And O king, the Rakshasas together with their wives and elders were wonder-struck (at this unusual sight).

data.v: बिभिदुस्ते मणिस्तम्भान्कर्णाट्टशिखराणि च । भग्नोन्मथितवेगानि यन्त्राणि च विचिक्षिपुः ।।
data.md: And they (the monkeys and the bears) broke down pillars made of gems and the terraces of spires of the palaces. Pulling down and breaking to pieces the engines and their propellers they threw them away.

data.v: परिगृह्य शतघ्नीश्च सचक्राः सहुडोपलाः । चिक्षिपुर्भुजवेगेन लङ्कामध्ये महाबलाः ।।
data.md: And seizing the Shataghnis together with discs, clubs and stones, they threw them violently into Lanka uttering load yells.

data.v: प्राकारस्थाश्च ये केचिन्निशाचरगणास्तदा । प्रदुद्रुवुस्ते शतशः कपिभिः समभिद्रुताः ।।
data.md: The night-wanderers that were stationed on the walls, attacked by the monkeys fled hurriedly by hundreds.

data.v: ततस्तु राजवचनाद्राक्षसाः कामरूपिणः । निर्ययुर्विकृताकाराः सहस्रशतसंघशः ।।
data.md: Then, at the command of the king, hundreds and thousands of Rakshasas of unnatural shapes and who could assume any form they liked, issued out (of the city to meet the enemy).

data.v: शस्त्रवर्षाणि वर्षन्तो द्रावयन्तो वनौकसः । प्राकारं शोधयन्तस्ते परं विक्रममास्थिताः ।।
data.md: Discharging a (perfect) deluge of arrows and displaying great prowess, they graced the walls on driving away the dwellers of forests.

data.v: स माषराशिसदृशैर्बभूव क्षणदाचरैः । कृतो निर्वानरो भूयः प्राकारो भीमदर्शनैः ।।
data.md: And those terrible-looking night-rangers resembling heaps of flesh made the walls clear of monkeys.

data.v: पेतुः शूलविभिन्नाङ्गा बहवो वानरर्षभाः । स्तम्भतोरणभग्नाश्च पेतुस्तत्र निशाचराः ।।
data.md: And there with their bodies pierced by lances many foremost of monkeys fell (dead) and several night-rangers also crushed by pillars broken in the course of battle breathed their last.

data.v: केशाकेश्यभवद्युद्धं रक्षसां वानरैः सह । नखैर्दन्तैश्च वीराणां खादतां वै परस्परम् ।।
data.md: And the battle raged on between the heroic Rakshasas who fell to devouring (the monkeys) and the monkeys both parties dragging one another by the hair of the head and mangling one another with nails and teeth.

data.v: निष्टनन्तो ह्युभयतस्तत्र वानरराक्षसाः । हता निपतिता भूमौ न मुञ्चन्ति परस्परम् ।।
data.md: The Rakshasas and the monkeys with terrific yells and roars killed and struck down one another on the ground but (still) they did not give up the fight.

data.v: रामस्तु शरजालानि ववर्ष जलदो यथा । तानि लङ्कां समासाद्य जघ्नुस्तान्रजनीचरान् ।।
data.md: Rama too, then, poured down showers of arrows like the very clouds. And those arrows reaching Lanka killed many night-rangers.

data.v: सौमित्रिरपि नाराचैर्दृढधन्वा जितक्लमः । आदिश्यादिश्य दुर्गस्थान्पातयामास राक्षसान् ।।
data.md: And that mighty bowman, the indefatiguable son of Sumitra also, naming (particular) Rakshasas who were stationed in the forts killed them with Narachas.

data.v: ततः प्रत्यवहारोऽभूत्सैन्यानां राघवाज्ञया । कृते विमर्दे लङ्कायां लब्धलक्षो जयोत्तरः ।।
data.md: Then by order of Rama the forces retired (from the battle field) after having achieved success (in battle) and demolished (the defences of) Lanka and thereby making all the objects (of the city) easy of being aimed at.

data.v: ततो निविशमानांस्तान्सैनिकान्रावणानुगाः । अभिजग्मुर्गणानेके पिशाचक्षुद्ररक्षसाम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then, when those troops were in their quarters, Parvana Patana, Jambha, Khara, Krodhavasha, Hari, Praruja, Aruja, Praghasa and many other minor Rakshasas and Pishachas under the sway of Ravana entered amongst them.

data.v: पर्वणः पूतनो जम्भः खरः क्रोधवशो हरिः । प्ररुजश्चारुजश्चैव प्रघसश्चैवमादयः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then, when those troops were in their quarters, Parvana Patana, Jambha, Khara, Krodhavasha, Hari, Praruja, Aruja, Praghasa and many other minor Rakshasas and Pishachas under the sway of Ravana entered amongst them.

data.v: ततोऽभिपततां तेषामदृश्यानां दुरात्मनाम् । अन्तर्धानवधं तज्ज्ञश्चकार स विभीषणः ।।
data.md: And remaining invisible, as those wickedsouled creatures were thus stealthily entering, Vibhishana, knew all this and did away with their power of invisibility.

data.v: ते दृश्यमाना हरिभिर्बलिभिर्दूरपातिभिः । निहताः सर्वशो राजन्महीं जग्मुर्गतासवः ।।
data.md: O king, when disclosed to view, all of them being slain by the powerful and long-leaping monkeys fell dead on the ground.

data.v: अमृष्यमाणः सबलो रावणो निर्ययावथ । व्यूह्य चौशनसं व्यूहं हरीन्सर्वानहारयत् ।।
data.md: Unable to brook this, the mighty Ravana, skilled in the art of war like a second Ushana (Shukracharya), marched out, surrounded by his dreadful Rakshasa and Pishacha troops, and drawing up his army in that array known by the name of Ushana attacked all the monkeys.

data.v: राघवस्त्वभिनिर्याय व्यूढानीकं दशाननम् । बार्हस्पत्यं विधिं कृत्वा प्रत्यव्यूहन्निशाचरम् ।।
data.md: And the descendant of Raghu also, seeing the ten-headed advance, opposed the nightranger by drawing up his army after the manner recommended by Brihaspati.

data.v: समेत्य युयुधे तत्र ततो रामेण रावणः । युयुधे लक्ष्मणश्चैव तथैवेन्द्रजिता सह ।।
data.md: Then Ravana, coming up to Rama, began fighting with him. And Lakshmana fought with Indrajita.

data.v: विरूपाक्षेण सुग्रीवस्तारेण च निखर्वटः । तुण्डेन च नलस्तत्र पटुशः पनसेन च ।।
data.md: Sugriva with Virupaksha, Nikharvata with Tara, Nala with Tunda and Patusha with Panasa.

data.v: विषह्यं यं हि यो मेने स स तेन समेयिवान् । युयुधे युद्धवेलायां स्वबाहुबलमाश्रितः ।।
data.md: On that field of battle, he who considered another a match for him, advanced against and began fighting with him depending on his own prowess of arms.

data.v: स संप्रहारो ववृधे भीरूणां भयवर्धनः । लोमसंहर्षणो घोरः पुरा देवासुरे यथा ।।
data.md: And that battle so frightful to cowards and which makes one's hair stand erect, was as furious as that fought between the gods and the demons in days of yore.

data.v: रावणो राममानर्छच्छक्तिशूलासिवृष्टिभिः । निशितैरायसैस्तीक्ष्णै रावणं चापि राघवः ।।
data.md: Ravana afflicted Rama with a downpour of darts, lances and swords and the descendant of Raghu too oppressed Ravana with sharpened iron darts having keen points.

data.v: तथैवेन्द्रजितं यत्तं लक्ष्मणो मर्मभेदिभिः । इन्द्रजिच्चापि सौमित्रिं बिभेद बहुभिः शरैः ।।
data.md: Similarly, Lakshmana wounded the exerting Indrajita and Indrajita Lakshmana, by various darts capable of piercing the vital parts.

data.v: विभीषणः प्रहस्तं च प्रहस्तश्च विभीषणम् । खगपत्रैः शरैस्तीक्ष्णैरभ्यवर्षद्गतव्यथः ।।
data.md: And Vibhishana discharged at Prahasta and Prahasta at Vibhishana, showers of sharpened arrows furnished with plumes of birds.

data.v: तेषां बलवतामासीन्महास्त्राणां समागमः । विव्यथुः सकला येन त्रयो लोकाश्चराचराः ।।
data.md: (And thus) there ensued an encounter among those powerful warriors skilled in wielding mighty weapons, which (encounter) sorely afflicted the three worlds with their mobile and immobile creatures.

data.v: ततः प्रहस्तः सहसा समभ्येत्य विभीषणम् । गदया ताडयामास विनद्य रणकर्कशः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then Prahasta, harsh in battle, rushing against Vibhishana all on a sudden and sending forth a terrible yell, smote him with his mace.

data.v: स तयाभिहतो धीमान्गदया भीमवेगया । नाकम्पत महाबाहुर्हिमवानिव सुस्थिरः ।।
data.md: (But) the intellectual Vibhishana of mighty arms, although struck with that mace (hurled) with a terrible force, did not tremble in the least and stood firm as the Himavana mountains.

data.v: ततः प्रगृह्य विपुलां शतघण्टां विभीषणः । अभिमन्त्र्य महाशक्तिं चिक्षेपास्य शिरः प्रति ।।
data.md: Then Vibhishana, taking up a huge and mighty Javelin studded with a hundred bells and inspiring it with the mantras hurled it at the head of Prahasta.

data.v: पतन्त्या स तया वेगाद्राक्षसोऽशनिनादया । हृतोत्तमाङ्गो ददृशे वातरुग्ण इव द्रुमः ।।
data.md: (And that Javelin) falling with a (great) force like that of the thunderbolt cut off the head of Prahasta, who thereupon looked like a tree broken by the wind.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा निहतं संख्ये प्रहस्तं क्षणदाचरम् । अभिदुद्राव धूम्राक्षो वेगेन महता कपीन् ।।
data.md: Seeing that night-ranger (Prahasta) thus slain in the encounter, Dhumraksha rushed furiously against the monkeys.

data.v: तस्य मेघोपमं सैन्यमापतद्भीमदर्शनम् । दृष्ट्वैव सहसा दीर्णा रणे वानरपुंगवाः ।।
data.md: The monkey-chiefs, on beholding that his terrible-looking soldiers, resembling the clouds, were rushing against them, fled from (the field of) battle.

data.v: ततस्तान्सहसा दीर्णान्दृष्ट्वा वानरपुंगवान् । निर्याय कपिशार्दूलो हनूमान्पर्यवस्थितः ।।
data.md: Seeing those foremost of monkeys run away all on a sudden, Hanuman, the brave of monkeys rallied them and stood ready (for battle).

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वावस्थितं संख्ये हरयः पवनात्मजम् । वेगेन महता राजन्संन्यवर्तन्त सर्वशः ।।
data.md: (And), O king, beholding the son of Pavana remaining on the battlefield, all the monkeys rallied with great haste.

data.v: ततः शब्दो महानासीत्तुमुलो लोमहर्षणः । रामरावणसैन्यानामन्योन्यमभिधावताम् ।।
data.md: Then there arose a great and tumultuous uproar, causing the hair stand on end, as the soldiers of Rama and Ravana rushed against one another.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रवृत्ते संग्रामे घोरे रुधिरकर्दमे । धूम्राक्षः कपिसैन्यं तद्द्रावयामास पत्रिभिः ।।
data.md: (And) in that battle which raged hot and furious, making the field muddy with blood, Dhumraksha began to oppress the monkeyarmy with (showers of) arrows.

data.v: तं राक्षसमहामात्रमापतन्तं सपत्नजित् । तरसा प्रतिजग्राह हनूमान्पवनात्मजः ।।
data.md: Then the son of Pavana, Hanuman, the vanquisher of his foes, quickly seized that leader of the Rakshasas who was advancing (against the monkey host).

data.v: तयोर्युद्धमभूद्घोरं हरिराक्षसवीरयोः । जिगीषतोर्युधान्योन्यमिन्द्रप्रह्लादयोरिव ।।
data.md: And there took place, between the Rakshasa and the monkey warrior, each desirous of vanquishing the other, as dreadful a battle as that (fought) between Indra and Pralhada (in olden days).

data.v: गदाभिः परिघैश्चैव राक्षसो जघ्निवान्कपिम् । कपिश्च जघ्निवान्रक्षः सस्कन्धविटपैर्द्रुमैः ।।
data.md: The Rakshasa smote the monkey with clubs and pikes and the monkey struck the Rakshasas with trees furnished with branches and trunks.

data.v: ततस्तमतिकायेन साश्वं सरथसारथिम् । धूम्राक्षमवधीद्धीमान्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.md: Then the angry Hanuman the son of Pavana fired with a mighty rage, destroyed Dhumraksha together with his horses charioteer and car.

data.v: ततस्तं निहतं दृष्ट्वा धूम्राक्षं राक्षसोत्तमम् । हरयो जातविस्रम्भा जघ्नुरभ्येत्य सैनिकान् ।।
data.md: And seeing that foremost of Rakshasas, Dhumraksha, (thus) killed, the monkeys giving up their fear, slew many other soldiers.

data.v: ते वध्यमाना बलिभिर्हरिभिर्जितकाशिभिः । राक्षसा भग्नसंकल्पा लङ्कामभ्यपतन्भयात् ।।
data.md: Thus slain by the powerful and victorious monkeys the Rakshasas lost their hearts and fled to Lanka in (great) fear.

data.v: तेऽभिपत्य पुरं भग्ना हतशेषा निशाचराः । सर्वं राज्ञे यथावृत्तं रावणाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.md: And the surviving might-wanderers, who fled (from the battle-field), reaching the city, informed king Ravana of all that had happened.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु रावणस्तेभ्यः प्रहस्तं निहतं युधि । धूम्राक्षं च महेष्वासं ससैन्यं वानरर्षभैः ।।
data.md: Hearing from them that the valiant monkeys, had in battle, killed Prahasta and the mighty bowman Dhumraksha together with (all) their forces, Ravana drawing a heavy sigh and rising from his excellent throne said, "The time for Kumbhakarna to act, is come."

data.v: सुदीर्घमिव निःश्वस्य समुत्पत्य वरासनात् । उवाच कुम्भकर्णस्य कर्मकालोऽयमागतः ।।
data.md: Hearing from them that the valiant monkeys, had in battle, killed Prahasta and the mighty bowman Dhumraksha together with (all) their forces, Ravana drawing a heavy sigh and rising from his excellent throne said, "The time for Kumbhakarna to act, is come."

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा विविधैर्वादित्रैः सुमहास्वनैः । शयानमतिनिद्रालुं कुम्भकर्णमबोधयत् ।।
data.md: Saying this, he awakened Kumbhakarna by means of various instruments emitting loud sounds, from his deep and prolonged sleep.

data.v: प्रबोध्य महता चैनं यत्नेनागतसाध्वसः । स्वस्थमासीनमव्यग्रं विनिद्रं राक्षसाधिपः । ततोऽब्रवीद्दशग्रीवः कुम्भकर्णं महाबलम् ।।
data.md: And when Kumbhakarna, who was aroused by great exertions, was comfortably seated, recovered consciousness and self-possession, the terrified lord of the Rakshasas, the tenheaded (Ravana) addressed Kumbhakarna endued with a giant strength thus, "O Kumbhakarna, you are indeed happy who enjoy such a (prolonged) sleep.

data.v: धन्योऽसि यस्य ते निद्रा कुम्भकर्णेयमीदृशी । य इमं दारुणं कालं न जानीषे महाभयम् ।।
एष तीर्त्वार्णवं रामः सेतुना हरिभिः सह । अवमन्येह नः सर्वान्करोति कदनं महत् ।।
data.md: Unaware of this dreadful calamity (we have been visited with). This Rama together with the monkeys having crossed the sea by means of a bridge and disregarding us all is waging a terrible war. I have stealthily abducted his wife, named Sita, the daughter of Janaka.

data.v: मया ह्यपहृता भार्या सीता नामास्य जानकी । तां मोक्षयिषुरायातो बद्ध्वा सेतुं महार्णवे ।।
तेन चैव प्रहस्तादिर्महान्नः स्वजनो हतः । तस्य नान्यो निहन्तास्ति त्वदृते शत्रुकर्शन ।।
स दंशितोऽभिनिर्याय त्वमद्य बलिनां वर । रामादीन्समरे सर्वाञ्जहि शत्रूनरिंदम ।।
data.md: O scourage of your enemies, there is no other person capable of slaying him than you. O bravest of the brave, do you (therefore) march out this day donning your mail and O tormentor of foes, slay in battle all your enemies, Rama and others.

data.v: दूषणावरजौ चैव वज्रवेगप्रमाथिनौ । तौ त्वां बलेन महता सहितावनुयास्यतः ।।
data.md: The two younger brothers of Dushana, Vajravega and Pramathin, accompanied by a mighty army will follow you."

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा राक्षसपतिः कुम्भकर्णं तरस्विनम् । संदिदेशेतिकर्तव्ये वज्रवेगप्रमाथिनौ ।।
data.md: Thus addressing the mighty Kumbhakarna, the lord of the Rakshasas pointed out to Vajravega and Pramathin what they should do.

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु तौ वीरौ रावणं दूषणानुजौ । कुम्भकर्णं पुरस्कृत्य तूर्णं निर्ययतुः पुरात् ।।
data.md: And those two heroes, the younger brothers of Dushana saying to Ravana “It shall be so" (i.e. you orders shall be carried out) soon marched out of the city with Kumbhakarna at their head.

data.v: ततो विनिर्याय पुरात्कुम्भकर्णः सहानुगः । अपश्यत्कपिसैन्यं तज्जितकाश्यग्रतः स्थितम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then having marched out of the city with his followers, Kumbhakarna beheld the victorious monkey-army lying before him.

data.v: तमभ्येत्याशु हरयः परिवार्य समन्ततः । अभ्यघ्नंश्च महाकायैर्बहुभिर्जगतीरुहैः । करजैरतुदंश्चान्ये विहाय भयमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: The monkeys, (then), coming up to him completely surrounded him and began to smite him with numerous huge trees.

data.v: बहुधा युध्यमानास्ते युद्धमार्गैः प्लवंगमाः । नानाप्रहरणैर्भीमं राक्षसेन्द्रमताडयन् ।।
data.md: (And) giving up their fear some began to tear him with nails and several monkeys fought him by resorting to various ways (of battle). And they hurled at that foremost of Rakshasas various terrible weapons.

data.v: स ताड्यमानः प्रहसन्भक्षयामास वानरान् । पनसं च गवाक्षं च वज्रबाहुं च वानरम् ।।
data.md: Thus struck, he only laughed (at them) and fell to eating up the monkeys, named Bala, Chandabala and Vajrabahu.

data.v: तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यथनं कर्म कुम्भकर्णस्य रक्षसः । उदक्रोशन्परित्रस्तास्तारप्रभृतयस्तदा ।।
data.md: Seeing that terrible act of the Rakshasa Kumbhakarna, Tara and others were greatly alarıned and sent forth a loud wai).

data.v: तं तारमुच्चैः क्रोशन्तमन्यांश्च हरियूथपान् । अभिदुद्राव सुग्रीवः कुम्भकर्णमपेतभीः ।।
data.md: Hearing the loud cry of the monkey chiefs, Sugriva fearlessly rushed at Kumbhakarna.

data.v: ततोऽभिपत्य वेगेन कुम्भकर्णं महामनाः । शालेन जघ्निवान्मूर्ध्नि बलेन कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
data.md: Then that high-minded king of the monkeys, coming up to Kumbhakarna with great speed struck him furiously on the head with a Sala tree.

data.v: स महात्मा महावेगः कुम्भकर्णस्य मूर्धनि । बिभेद शालं सुग्रीवो न चैवाव्यथयत्कपिः ।।
data.md: And though that large-hearted monkey, Sugriva endued with a great speed, broke that Sala tree on the head of Kumbhakarna, yet he could not afflict him (in the least).

data.v: ततो विनद्य प्रहसञ्शालस्पर्शविबोधितः । दोर्भ्यामादाय सुग्रीवं कुम्भकर्णोऽहरद्बलात् ।।
data.md: Then suddenly awakening at the touch of the Sala tree, Kumbhakarna, with a terrible yell, stretching forth his arms, seized Sugriva by main force.

data.v: ह्रियमाणं तु सुग्रीवं कुम्भकर्णेन रक्षसा । अवेक्ष्याभ्यद्रवद्वीरः सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः ।।
data.md: Seeing Sugriva (thus) seized by the Rakshasa Kumbhakarna, the war-like son of Sumitra, the delighter of his friends, rushed (to his rescue).

data.v: सोऽभिपत्य महावेगं रुक्मपुङ्खं महाशरम् । प्राहिणोत्कुम्भकर्णाय लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा ।।
data.md: And coming up, that slayer of hostile warriors, Lakshmana, sent after him an impetuous and mighty dart furnished with golden wings.

data.v: स तस्य देहावरणं भित्त्वा देहं च सायकः । जगाम दारयन्भूमिं रुधिरेण समुक्षितः ।।
data.md: That arrow piercing through his armour and his body and covered with blood, penetrated into the earth.

data.v: तथा स भिन्नहृदयः समुत्सृज्य कपीश्वरम् । कुम्भकर्णो महेष्वासः प्रगृहीतशिलायुधः । अभिदुद्राव सौमित्रिमुद्यम्य महतीं शिलाम् ।।
data.md: His heart being (thus) riven, he let go the monkey king. (And then) that mighty bowman, Kumbhakarna, taking a stone as his arrow, rushed at the son of Sumitra, aiming that huge stone at him.

data.v: तस्याभिद्रवतस्तूर्णं क्षुराभ्यामुच्छ्रितौ करौ । चिच्छेद निशिताग्राभ्यां स बभूव चतुर्भुजः ।।
data.md: When he was (thus) advancing, (Lakshmana) quickly cut off his upraised arms with a pair keen-edged razors. He then became four-handed.

data.v: तानप्यस्य भुजान्सर्वान्प्रगृहीतशिलायुधान् । क्षुरैश्चिच्छेद लघ्वस्त्रं सौमित्रिः प्रतिदर्शयन् ।।
data.md: (But) the son of Sumitra, displaying his skill in arms cut off all those arms, holding stones as arrows, by razors.

data.v: स बभूवातिकायश्च बहुपादशिरोभुजः । तं ब्रह्मास्त्रेण सौमित्रिर्ददाहाद्रिचयोपमम् ।।
data.md: His body then assumed formidable proportions and his head and arms began to multiply in large numbers. The son of Sumitra, then, pierced Kumbhakarna, looking like heaps of rocks, by that weapon presided over by Brahma.

data.v: स पपात महावीर्यो दिव्यास्त्राभिहतो रणे । महाशनिविनिर्दग्धः पादपोऽङ्कुरवानिव ।।
data.md: And he, endued with a vast strength, struck by that celestials weapon, fell dead on the battle (field) like a gigantic tree having its spreading branches burnt up by the fire of) the thunderbolt.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा वृत्रसंकाशं कुम्भकर्णं तरस्विनम् । गतासुं पतितं भूमौ राक्षसाः प्राद्रवन्भयात् ।।
data.md: Seeing the mighty Kumbhakarna (powerful) as (the Asura) Vritra, lying dead on the ground, the Rakshasas ran away in (great) terror.

data.v: तथा तान्द्रवतो योधान्दृष्ट्वा तौ दूषणानुजौ । अवस्थाप्याथ सौमित्रिं संक्रुद्धावभ्यधावताम् ।।
data.md: Then, the two younger brothers of Dushana, seeing those warriors fly away, rallied them and rushed furiously against the son of Sumitra.

data.v: तावाद्रवन्तौ संक्रुद्धौ वज्रवेगप्रमाथिनौ । प्रतिजग्राह सौमित्रिर्विनद्योभौ पतत्रिभिः ।।
data.md: Seeing Vajravega and Pramathin advance against him in great wrath, the son of Sumitra with a loud shout assailed them both with shafts.

data.v: ततः सुतुमुलं युद्धमभवल्लोमहर्षणम् । दूषणानुजयोः पार्थ लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः ।।
data.md: Then, O Partha, there ensued an awfullyterrible encounter, making the hair stand erect, between the younger brothers of Dushana and the intelligent Lakshmana.

data.v: महता शरवर्षेण राक्षसौ सोऽभ्यवर्षत । तौ चापि वीरौ संक्रुद्धावुभौ तौ समवर्षताम् ।।
data.md: And he (Lakshmana) covered the Rakshasas with a heavy downpour of arrows and those two (Rakshasa) heroes also in great wrath overwhelmed Lakshmana with showers (of arrows).

data.v: मुहूर्तमेवमभवद्वज्रवेगप्रमाथिनोः । सौमित्रेश्च महाबाहोः संप्रहारः सुदारुणः ।।
data.md: That furious battle between Vajravega and Pramathin (on one hand) and the mighty-armed son of Sumitra (on the other) lasted for a moment only.

data.v: अथाद्रिशृङ्गमादाय हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । अभिद्रुत्याददे प्राणान्वज्रवेगस्य रक्षसः ।।
data.md: Then Hanuman, the son of Pavana, taking up a mountain-peak rushed at and took the life of, the Rakshasa Vajravega.

data.v: नीलश्च महता ग्राव्णा दूषणावरजं हरिः । प्रमाथिनमभिद्रुत्य प्रममाथ महाबलः ।।
data.md: (And) the monkey Nila, endued with a vast strength, rushing towards Pramathin, the younger brother of Dushana crushed him with a huge rock.

data.v: ततः प्रावर्तत पुनः संग्रामः कटुकोदयः । रामरावणसैन्यानामन्योन्यमभिधावताम् ।।

data.md: Now hear how Avindhya, seeing the evilminded one bent on this reprehensible act, softened down his wrath by showing these reasons.

data.v: महाराज्ये स्थितो दीप्ते न स्त्रियं हन्तुमर्हसि । हतैवैषा यदा स्त्री च बन्धनस्था च ते गृहे ।।
data.md: (He said) "Placed as you are on the throne of this renowned and mighty empire, you should not kill a woman. This woman (to all intents and purposes) is already slain in as much as she is a prisoner in your power.

data.v: न चैषा देहभेदेन हता स्यादिति मे मतिः । जहि भर्तारमेवास्या हते तस्मिन्हता भवेत् ।।
data.md: In my opinion, she would not be killed if her body were destroyed. Kill her husband and then she will be killed too.

data.v: न हि ते विक्रमे तुल्यः साक्षादपि शतक्रतुः । असकृद्धि त्वया सेन्द्रास्त्रासितास्त्रिदशा युधि ।।
data.md: Even the very lord of a hundred sacrifices is no match for you in prowess. You have several times struck terror into the hearts of Indra together with the celestials in battle."

data.v: एवं बहुविधैर्वाक्यैरविन्ध्यो रावणं तदा । क्रुद्धं संशमयामास जगृहे च स तद्वचः ।।
data.md: With these and similar other words, Avindhya pacified the wrath of Ravana who accepted his advice.

data.v: निर्याणे स मतिं कृत्वा निधायासिं क्षपाचरः । आज्ञापयामास तदा रथो मे कल्प्यतामिति ।।
data.md: Then resolving to set out (for the field of battle himself) that night-ranger put his sword into sheath and ordered his attendants) to prepare his car.

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धो दशग्रीवः प्रिये पुत्रे निपातिते । निर्ययौ रथमास्थाय हेमरत्नविभूषितम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then, angry at the death of his dear son, the ten-necked, ascending his car, studded with gems and gold set out (for the field of battle).

data.v: संवृतो राक्षसैर्घोरैर्विविधायुधपाणिभिः । अभिदुद्राव रामं स पोथयन्हरियूथपान् ।।
data.md: Surrounded by dreadful Rakshasas holding in their hands various weapons, he fighting with the monkey-chiefs rushed upon Rama.

data.v: तमाद्रवन्तं संक्रुद्धं मैन्दनीलनलाङ्गदाः । हनूमाञ्जाम्बवांश्चैव ससैन्याः पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.md: As he (Ravana) was furiously advancing, Mainda, Nala, Nila, Angada, Hanuman and Jambavan together with their forces surrounded him.

data.v: ते दशग्रीवसैन्यं तदृक्षवानरयूथपाः । द्रुमैर्विध्वंसयां चक्रुर्दशग्रीवस्य पश्यतः ।।
data.md: Those foremost of bears and monkeys destroyed, with trees, the forces of the tennecked in his (very) presence.

data.v: ततः स्वसैन्यमालोक्य वध्यमानमरातिभिः । मायावी व्यदधान्मायां रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः ।।
data.md: Then, seeing that his troops were being destroyed by the enemy, Ravana, the king of the Rakshasas began to create illusions with which he was gifted.

data.v: तस्य देहाद्विनिष्क्रान्ताः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । राक्षसाः प्रत्यदृश्यन्त शरशक्त्यृष्टिपाणयः ।।
data.md: (Thereupon) hundreds and thousands of Rakshasas, armed with arrows, lances and double-edged swords, issuing out of his body appeared (on the scene).

data.v: तान्रामो जघ्निवान्सर्वान्दिव्येनास्त्रेण राक्षसान् । अथ भूयोऽपि मायां स व्यदधाद्राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.md: (But) Rama destroyed all those Rakshasas with celestials weapons. There at the lord of the Rakshasas created (new) illusions again.

data.v: कृत्वा रामस्य रूपाणि लक्ष्मणस्य च भारत । अभिदुद्राव रामं च लक्ष्मणं च दशाननः ।।
data.md: (And) O Bharata, the ten-headed creating several Rakshasas wearing the shape of Rama and Lakshmana, rushed upon them.

data.v: ततस्ते राममर्छन्तो लक्ष्मणं च क्षपाचराः । अभिपेतुस्तदा राजन्प्रगृहीतोच्चकार्मुकाः ।।
data.md: Then those night-rangers adverse to Rama and Lakshmana, armed with bows rushed against Rama.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य मायामिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । उवाच रामं सौमित्रिरसंभ्रान्तो बृहद्वचः ।।
data.md: (Then) the dauntless son of Sumitra, the descendant of Ikshvaku said to Rama these heroic words.

data.v: जहीमान्राक्षसान्पापानात्मनः प्रतिरूपकान् । जघान रामस्तांश्चान्यानात्मनः प्रतिरूपकान् ।।
data.md: "Kill those wicked-souled Rakshasas wearing your shape.” (Thereupon) Rama destroyed those Rakshasas resembling him in shape and (various) others also.

data.v: ततो हर्यश्वयुक्तेन रथेनादित्यवर्चसा । उपतस्थे रणे रामं मातलिः शक्रसारथिः ।।
data.md: Then, Matali, the charioteer of Shakra, came to Rama with a car, of sun-like splendour and yoked with tawny-coloured horses.

data.v: अयं हर्यश्वयुग्जैत्रो मघोनः स्यन्दनोत्तमः । अनेन शक्रः काकुत्स्थ समरे दैत्यदानवान् । शतशः पुरुषव्याघ्र रथोदारेण जघ्निवान् ।।
data.md: Matali said: "This excellent and victorious car yoked with this team of tawny horses belongs to Maghavana (Indra). O descendant of Kakustha, O foremost of men, riding on this splendid car Shakra slew in battle numerous Daityas and Danavas. Therefore, O most valiant of men, ascending this car guided by me, do you soon kill Ravana in battle. Do not make any delay."

data.v: तदनेन नरव्याघ्र मया यत्तेन संयुगे । स्यन्दनेन जहि क्षिप्रं रावणं मा चिरं कृथाः ।।
इत्युक्तो राघवस्तथ्यं वचोऽशङ्कत मातलेः । मायेयं राक्षसस्येति तमुवाच विभीषणः ।।
data.md: Thus addressed, the descendant of Raghu, suspecting that this might be another illusion produced by the Rakshasas, doubted the truthful words of Matali. Vibhishana then said to him “O foremost of men, this is no illusion of the wicked-souled Ravana.

data.v: नेयं माया नरव्याघ्र रावणस्य दुरात्मनः । तदातिष्ठ रथं शीघ्रमिममैन्द्रं महाद्युते ।।
ततः प्रहृष्टः काकुत्स्थस्तथेत्युक्त्वा विभीषणम् । रथेनाभिपपाताशु दशग्रीवं रुषान्वितः ।।
data.md: O highly-resplendent one, therefore do you soon ascend this car of Indra." Thereupon the descendant of Kakustha gladly saying to Vibhishana “be it so,"

data.v: हाहाकृतानि भूतानि रावणे समभिद्रुते । सिंहनादाः सपटहा दिवि दिव्याश्च नानदन् ।।
स रामाय महाघोरं विससर्ज निशाचरः । शूलमिन्द्राशनिप्रख्यं ब्रह्मदण्डमिवोद्यतम् ।।
तच्छूलमन्तरा रामश्चिच्छेद निशितैः शरैः । तद्दृष्ट्वा दुष्करं कर्म रावणं भयमाविशत् ।।
ततः क्रुद्धः ससर्जाशु दशग्रीवः शिताञ्शरान् । सहस्रायुतशो रामे शस्त्राणि विविधानि च ।।
ततो भुशुण्डीः शूलांश्च मुसलानि परश्वधान् । शक्तीश्च विविधाकाराः शतघ्नीश्च शितक्षुराः ।।
तां मायां विकृतां दृष्ट्वा दशग्रीवस्य रक्षसः । भयात्प्रदुद्रुवुः सर्वे वानराः सर्वतोदिशम् ।।
data.md: Seeing the terrible illusions spread by the ten-necked Rakshasa, the monkeys got alarmed and ran away in all directions.

data.v: ततः सुपत्रं सुमुखं हेमपुङ्खं शरोत्तमम् । तूणादादाय काकुत्स्थो ब्रह्मास्त्रेण युयोज ह ।।
तं बाणवर्यं रामेण ब्रह्मास्त्रेणाभिमन्त्रितम् । जहृषुर्देवगन्धर्वा दृष्ट्वा शक्रपुरोगमाः ।।
अल्पावशेषमायुश्च ततोऽमन्यन्त रक्षसः । ब्रह्मास्त्रोदीरणाच्छत्रोर्देवगन्धर्वकिंनराः ।।
ततः ससर्ज तं रामः शरमप्रतिमौजसम् । रावणान्तकरं घोरं ब्रह्मदण्डमिवोद्यतम् ।।
data.md: Rama then discharged that of unrivalled splendour, dreadful, resembling the upraised Brahmadanda and destined to slay Ravana.

data.v: स तेन राक्षसश्रेष्ठः सरथः साश्वसारथिः । प्रजज्वाल महाज्वालेनाग्निनाभिपरिष्कृतः ।।
data.md: And O Bharata, soon as Rama discharged it by drawing to a great length (his bowstring), the lord of the Rakshasas together with his horses and charioteer, enveloped in a great and blazing fire was burnt up.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टास्त्रिदशाः सगन्धर्वाः सचारणाः । निहतं रावणं दृष्ट्वा रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।
data.md: Then the celestials accompanied by the Gandharvas and the Charanas, beholding Ravana slain by Rama. of untiring exertions were highly delighted.

data.v: तत्यजुस्तं महाभागं पञ्च भूतानि रावणम् । भ्रंशितः सर्वलोकेषु स हि ब्रह्मास्त्रतेजसा ।।
data.md: Then the five elements (i.e., earth water, air, fire and space) forsook Ravana; and he was deprived all of the worlds by the energy of the Brahma weapon.

data.v: शरीरधातवो ह्यस्य मांसं रुधिरमेव च । नेशुर्ब्रह्मास्त्रनिर्दग्धा न च भस्माप्यदृश्यत ।।
data.md: The ingredients of his body together with his flesh and blood were all so totally consumed by the Brahma weapon that the ashes even could not be seen.

data.v: स हत्वा रावणं क्षुद्रं राक्षसेन्द्रं सुरद्विषम् । बभूव हृष्टः ससुहृद्रामः सौमित्रिणा सह ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Having killed the mean-minded Ravana, the lord of the Rakshasas and the enemy of the gods, great indeed was the joy of Rama and the son of Sumitra.

data.v: ततो हते दशग्रीवे देवाः सर्षिपुरोगमाः । आशीर्भिर्जययुक्ताभिरानर्चुस्तं महाभुजम् ।।
data.md: The ten-necked being slain, the celestials with the Rishis at their head eulogised the mighty-armed one by uttering blessings indicative of victory,

data.v: रामं कमलपत्राक्षं तुष्टुवुः सर्वदेवताः । गन्धर्वाः पुष्पवर्षैश्च वाग्भिश्च त्रिदशालयाः ।।
data.md: All the gods together with the Gandharvas and the inhabitants of the celestials regions delighted Rama gifted with eyes resembling lotus-petals by (chanting) hymns (in his praise) and showering flowers (over his head).

data.v: पूजयित्वा यथा रामं प्रतिजग्मुर्यथागतम् । तन्महोत्सवसंकाशमासीदाकाशमच्युत ।।
data.md: Having thus worshipped Rama, they returned to their respective abodes. And O being of everlasting fame, it then appeared as if a great carnival was being held in the firmament.

data.v: ततो हत्वा दशग्रीवं लङ्कां रामो महायशाः । विभीषणाय प्रददौ प्रभुः परपुरंजयः ।।
data.md: Then the highly-renowned lord Rama, the destroyer of his enemy's cities, having slain Ravana, gave Lanka to Vibhishana.

data.v: ततः सीतां पुरस्कृत्य विभीषणपुरस्कृताम् । अविन्ध्यो नाम सुप्रज्ञो वृद्धामात्यो विनिर्ययौ ।।
data.md: Then Avindhya, the wise and old adviser of Ravana, preceded by Sita who was herself preceded by Vibhishana, set out from Lanka.

data.v: उवाच च महात्मानं काकुत्स्थं दैन्यमास्थितम् । प्रतीच्छ देवीं सद्वृत्तां महात्मञ्जानकीमिति ।।
data.md: And he (Avindhya) with great humility said to the high-souled descendant of Kakustha, “O high-souled one, accept this divine lady, the daughter of Janaka, of spotless character."

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्मादवतीर्य रथोत्तमात् । बाष्पेणापिहितां सीतां ददर्शेक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः ।।
data.md: Hearing these words, Rama, the descendant of Kakustha got down from that excellent car and saw Sita weeping profusely.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा चारुसर्वाङ्गीं यानस्थां शोककर्शिताम् । मलोपचितसर्वाङ्गीं जटिलां कृष्णवाससम् ।।
data.md: And beholding her of faultless proportions, seated in the vehicle weighed down with grief, covered all over with dirt, having matted locks and wearing a dirty cloth.

data.v: उवाच रामो वैदेहीं परामर्शविशङ्कितः । गच्छ वैदेहि मुक्ता त्वं यत्कार्यं तन्मया कृतम् ।।
data.md: Rama, suspecting the loss of her virtue, addressed the daughter of the king of Mithila thus, "O Princess of Videha, go (wheresoever you like)! You are now liberated (from your captivity). I have done my duty.

data.v: मामासाद्य पतिं भद्रे न त्वं राक्षसवेश्मनि । जरां व्रजेथा इति मे निहतोऽसौ निशाचरः ।।
data.md: O gentle creatures, I have killed that nightranger thinking that myself being your husband you should not grow old in the abode of the Rakshasa.

data.v: कथं ह्यस्मद्विधो जातु जानन्धर्मविनिश्चयम् । परहस्तगतां नारीं मुहूर्तमपि धारयेत् ।।
data.md: How can men like us, well acquainted with moral duty, accept for even a moment, a woman carried off by another?

data.v: सुवृत्तामसुवृत्तां वाप्यहं त्वामद्य मैथिलि । नोत्सहे परिभोगाय श्वावलीढं हविर्यथा ।।
data.md: O daughter of the king of Mithila, whether you are of pure or impure character, I dare not enjoy you, who are now like sanctified butter lapped by a dog?"

data.v: ततः सा सहसा बाला तच्छ्रुत्वा दारुणं वचः । पपात देवी व्यथिता निकृत्ता कदली यथा ।।
data.md: That divine lady, hearing these cruel words (of Rama) was sorely afflicted with grief and suddenly fell down (to the ground) like a plantain tree torn up by the roots.

data.v: यो ह्यस्या हर्षसंभूतो मुखरागस्तदाभवत् । क्षणेन स पुनर्भ्रष्टो निःश्वासादिव दर्पणे ।।
data.md: And the lively colour of her face sprung from her delight (at seeing Rama) as quickly disappeared as breath on a mirror.

data.v: ततस्ते हरयः सर्वे तच्छ्रुत्वा रामभाषितम् । गतासुकल्पा निश्चेष्टा बभूवुः सहलक्ष्मणाः ।।
data.md: Then, hearing these words of Rama all the monk ys together with Lakshmana became motionless as death itself.

data.v: ततो देवो विशुद्धात्मा विमानेन चतुर्मुखः । पितामहो जगत्स्रष्टा दर्शयामास राघवम् ।।
data.md: Then the pure-souled and the four-faced god (Brahma) the creator of the universe, who sprang from a lotus (on the nave of Vishnu), appeared before the descendant of Raghu on a chariot.

data.v: शक्रश्चाग्निश्च वायुश्च यमो वरुण एव च । यक्षाधिपश्च भगवांस्तथा सप्तर्षयोऽमलाः ।।
data.md: (Then) Shakra, Agni, Vayu, Yama, Varuna, the divine lord of the Yakshas, the seven holy sages (whom Brahma created first of all).

data.v: राजा दशरथश्चैव दिव्यभास्वरमूर्तिमान् । विमानेन महार्हेण हंसयुक्तेन भास्वता ।।
data.md: And king Dasharatha also in his celestials appearance and robes and mounted on a highly-resplendent and bright car (appeared on the scene).

data.v: ततोऽन्तरिक्षं तत्सर्वं देवगन्धर्वसंकुलम् । शुशुभे तारकाचित्रं शरदीव नभस्तलम् ।।
data.md: Then the firmament crowded with the gods and the Gandharvas shone like the autumnal sky studded with stars.

data.v: तत उत्थाय वैदेहि तेषां मध्ये यशस्विनी । उवाच वाक्यं कल्याणी रामं पृथुलवक्षसम् ।।
data.md: Then rising in the midst of them, the blessed and renowned princess of Videha spoke these words to the broad-chested Rama.

data.v: राजपुत्र न ते कोपं करोमि विदिता हि मे । गतिः स्त्रीणां नराणां च शृणु चेदं वचो मम ।।
data.md: "O prince, I do not blame you; (for) you are conversant with the ways of men and women. (Yet) listen to these my words.

data.md: Then a sacred and auspicious voice, joyful to the high-souled monkeys, was heard in the firmament which made the whole universe bear testimony to it.

data.v: भो भो राघव सत्यं वै वायुरस्मि सदागतिः । अपापा मैथिली राजन्संगच्छ सह भार्यया ।।
data.md: Vayu said: O descendant of Raghu, (what Sita has said) is true. I am the wind (god) and ever in motion. O king, the princess of Mithila is pure. Be united with your wife.

data.v: अहमन्तःशरीरस्थो भूतानां रघुनन्दन । सुसूक्ष्ममपि काकुत्स्थ मैथिली नापराध्यति ।।
data.md: Agni said: O scion of Raghu's race, I am in the body of every creature. O descendant of Kakustha, the princess of Videha is thoroughly guiltless.

data.v: रसा वै मत्प्रसूता हि भूतदेहेषु राघव । अहं वै त्वां प्रब्रवीमि मैथिली प्रतिगृह्यताम् ।।
data.md: Varuna said: O descendant of Raghu, the humours in animal bodies owe their existence to me. (Therefore) I ask you to accept the princess of Mithila.

data.v: पुत्र नैतदिहाश्चर्यं त्वयि राजर्षिधर्मिणि । साधो सद्वृत्तमार्गस्थे शृणु चेदं वचो मम ।।
data.md: Brahma said: O descendant of Kakustha, O son of good character, this (behaviour) is not surprising on your part, (because) you are honest and know the duties of the royal sages: (Now) hear these my words.

data.v: शत्रुरेष त्वया वीर देवगन्धर्वभोगिनाम् । यक्षाणां दानवानां च महर्षीणां च पातितः ।।
data.md: O hero, this enemy of the gods, the Gandharvas, the Uragas, the Yakshas, the Danavas and the Maharshis has been destroyed by yol.

data.v: अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां मत्प्रसादात्पुराभवत् । कस्माच्चित्कारणात्पापः कंचित्कालमुपेक्षितः ।।
data.md: Formerly, he was made, through my favour, indestructible of all the creatures. And for some reason I spared that sinful wretch for sometime.

data.md: It was for his own destruction that Sita was carried off by that wicked-souled (wretch). (But) I protected her (from being violated) through Nalakubera's curse.

data.v: यदि ह्यकामामासेवेत्स्त्रियमन्यामपि ध्रुवम् । शतधास्य फलेद्देह इत्युक्तः सोऽभवत्पुरा ।।
data.md: For, he (Ravana) was formerly cursed by that person (Nalakubera) to the effect that if he would enjoy any woman against her will, his head should surely be split into a hundred fragments.

data.v: नात्र शङ्का त्वया कार्या प्रतीच्छेमां महाद्युते । कृतं त्वया महत्कार्यं देवानाममरप्रभ ।।
data.md: O highly-resplendent one, O creature of divine effulgence, you need not entertain any doubt on this point. You have, (indeed) done a great service to the gods (by slaying Ravana).

data.v: प्रीतोऽस्मि वत्स भद्रं ते पिता दशरथोऽस्मि ते । अनुजानामि राज्यं च प्रशाधि पुरुषोत्तम ।।
data.md: Dasharatha said: My son, I am pleased with you. May you be blessed. I am your father Dasharatha. O foremost of men, I command you to govern your kingdom.

data.v: अभिवादये त्वां राजेन्द्र यदि त्वं जनको मम । गमिष्यामि पुरीं रम्यामयोध्यां शासनात्तव ।।
data.md: Rama said : O king of kings, if you are my father I bow down to you. I will repair to the beautiful city of Ayodhya at your command.

data.v: तमुवाच पिता भूयः प्रहृष्टो मनुजाधिप । गच्छायोध्यां प्रशाधि त्वं राम रक्तान्तलोचन ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O best of the Bharatas, well pleased with Rama, the corners of whose eyes were red, his father again said to him "O highly resplendent one, now that the fourteen years (of your exile) are complete, repair to Ayodhya and reign there."

data.v: ततो देवान्नमस्कृत्य सुहृद्भिरभिनन्दितः । महेन्द्र इव पौलोम्या भार्यया स समेयिवान् ।।
data.md: Then, bowing down to the gods and congratulated by his friends, he was united with his wife like Mahendra with the daughter Pauloma.

data.v: ततो वरं ददौ तस्मै अविन्ध्याय परंतपः । त्रिजटां चार्थमानाभ्यां योजयामास राक्षसीम् ।।
data.md: That tormentor of foes then conferred a boon on Avindhya. He then honoured and gave riches to the Rakshasa woman Trijata.

data.md: Then Brahma together with (all) the celestials headed by Shakra said to him, “O son of Kausalya, what desirable boons shall we bestow on you today"?

data.md: (Thereupon) Rama asked for these boons viz., devotion to virtue, victory over his enemies and the revival of those monkeys killed by the Rakshasas.

data.v: ततस्ते ब्रह्मणा प्रोक्ते तथेति वचने तदा । समुत्तस्थुर्महाराज वानरा लब्धचेतसः ।।
data.md: And when Brahma had said "be it so," O mighty monarch, the monkeys brought back to life, rose up.

data.md: And the highly fortunate Sita also, conferred on Hanuman this boon, saying “My son, you will live as long as Rama's achievements.

data.md: And through my favour, O yellow-eyed Hanuman, celestials dishes and drinks will over be within your reach.

data.md: Then the charioteer of Shakra seeing Rama united with the daughter of Janaka was well pleased and addressed him, in the midst of friends, these words. “O truly-powerful one, as you have done away with this distress of the gods, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the mortals, the Asuras and the serpents.

data.md: Saying these words to Rama, the foremost of the wielders of weapons and taking leave of and paying his respects to him (matali) set out (for the celestials regions) on that car of sunlike splendour.

data.md: Then that virtuous lord of the earth together with all the monkeys took up his (temporary) quarter son that portion of the sea-shore where had lain down before (on a bed of Kusha grass to invoke the aid of the ocean).

data.md: Then the descendant of Raghu bringing all those (monkeys) together at the due time worshipped them all. He then dismissed them all after having satisfied them with gifts of gems.

data.md: (And on his way from the sea-shore to Kishkindha) Rama in company with Vibhishana and Sugriva, riding on the car Pushpaka showed the princess of Videha all the woods. Having reached Kishkindha, Rama, the most efficient of all smiters, made the successful Angada prince-regent.

data.md: (And on his way from the sea-shore to Kishkindha) Rama in company with Vibhishana and Sugriva, riding on the car Pushpaka showed the princess of Videha all the woods. Having reached Kishkindha, Rama, the most efficient of all smiters, made the successful Angada prince-regent.

data.md: (He) then, together with all these and accompanied by the son of Sumitra, set out for his capital by the same route by which he had come.

data.md: (Hanuman) then communicated to him the happy news on having observed his external signs and (gestures). And the son of the windgod having come back, (Rama himself) went to Nandigrama.

data.md: He there saw Bharata covered with dirt, attired in barks of trees and seated on the throne with (Rama's) shoes before him.

data.md: Then, O best of the Bharatas, the mighty descendant of Raghu together with the son of Sumitra experienced a great delight on being joined with Bharata and Shatrughna.

data.v: तथा भरतशत्रुघ्नौ समेतौ गुरुणा तदा । वैदेह्या दर्शनेनोभौ प्रहर्षं समवापतुः ।।
data.md: And Bharata and Shatrughna too being united with their eldest brother and beholding the princess of Mithila rejoiced exceedingly.

data.md: Having paid his respects to Rama who had returned (from exile) Bharata with great pleasure made over the kingdom, to him, which he governed as a trustee (for Rama).

data.md: Then Vasishtha together with Vamadeva installed that hero, at the eighth muhurta (a muhurta is equal to two dandas that is 4 minutes), of day under the constellation Shravana.

data.md: Being installed (on the throne) Rama gave his permission to that foremost of monkeys, Sugriva together with his friends and also to Vibhishana, the son of Pulastya to return to their homes.

data.md: Having entertained those two (friends) Sugriva and Vibhishana who were well pleased and exceedingly glad, with various sorts of foods and drinks and having done his duty suitable to the occasion he dismissed them with a heavy heart.

data.md: And having worshipped the car Pushpaka, the descendant of Raghu, gladly gave it back to Kubera.

data.md: Then assisted by that divine sage (Vasishtha) he safely celebrated ten horse sacrifices on the banks of the (river) Gomati by offering to the Brahmanas presents thrice (as much as usual).

data.md: Markandeya said: O mighty-armed one, thus, in days of old Rama of unrivalled energy had experienced such a terrible disaster owing to his being exiled in the forests.

data.md: O most valiant of men, do not (therefore) lament (over your misfortune); for, O tormentor of foes, you are a Kshatriya. You are journeying along the path which calls forth the prowess of arms and which is calculated to lead to sure success.
