data.v: तस्य पुत्रः पुरे जातः संवृद्धश्च तपोवने । सत्यवाननुरूपो मे भर्तेति मनसा वृतः ।।
data.md: His son, Satyavana (by name), born in the city and brought up in the hermitage, is my fit husband and I have wedded him in my mind.

data.v: अहो बत महत्पापं सावित्र्या नृपते कृतम् । अजानन्त्या यदनया गुणवान्सत्यवान्वृतः ।।
data.md: Narada said: Alas, O king, Savitri has done a very foolish act in as much as she, has through ignorance, chosen for her husband, Satyavana endued with (high) qualities.

data.v: सत्यं वदत्यस्य पिता सत्यं माता प्रभाषते । ततोऽस्य ब्राह्मणाश्चक्रुर्नामैतत्सत्यवानिति ।।
data.md: It is because his father is (ever) truthful and his mother speaks the truth, that the Brahmanas have named him Satyavana (i.e. truthful).

data.v: बालस्याश्वाः प्रियाश्चास्य करोत्यश्वांश्च मृन्मयान् । चित्रेऽपि च लिखत्यश्वांश्चित्राश्व इति चोच्यते ।।
data.md: In his boyhood he was very fond of horses, made horses of clay and painted them. Therefore he is (sometimes) called Chitrashva (i.e. one who paints horses)

data.v: अपीदानीं स तेजस्वी बुद्धिमान्वा नृपात्मजः । क्षमावानपि वा शूरः सत्यवान्पितृनन्दनः ।।
data.md: The King said: Is now the prince Satyavana, who is attached to his father, energetic, intelligent, forgiving and brave?

data.v: विवस्वानिव तेजस्वी बृहस्पतिसमो मतौ । महेन्द्र इव शूरश्च वसुधेव क्षमान्वितः ।।
data.md: Narada said: He is energetic as Vibhavasu (the sun), wise as Brihaspati, heroic as Mahendra and forgiving as the earth.

data.v: अपि राजात्मजो दाता ब्रह्मण्यो वापि सत्यवान् । रूपवानप्युदारो वाप्यथ वा प्रियदर्शनः ।।
data.md: Ashvapati said : Is the king's son, Satyavana, charitable, devoted to the Brahmanas, handsome, largehearted and of amiable appearance?

data.v: साङ्कृते रन्तिदेवस्य स शक्त्या दानतः समः । ब्रह्मण्यः सत्यवादी च शिबिरौशीनरो यथा ।।
data.md: Narada said : With regard to charity commensurate with his means, he is equal to Rantideva, the son of Sankriti and he is as devoted to the Brahmanas and as truthful as Shibi, the son of Ushinara.

data.v: ययातिरिव चोदारः सोमवत्प्रियदर्शनः । रूपेणान्यतमोऽश्विभ्यां द्युमत्सेनसुतो बली ।।
data.md: The heroic Satyavana is equal to Yayati in magnanimity, is as lovely to look at as the moon and is as beautiful as either of the twin Ashvinis.

data.v: स दान्तः स मृदुः शूरः स सत्यः स जितेन्द्रियः । स मैत्रः सोऽनसूयश्च स ह्रीमान्धृतिमांश्च सः ।।
data.md: He is (moreover) possessed of self-restraint, is meek, heroic, truthful, of subdued senses, faithful to his friends, free from malice, modest and patient.

data.v: नित्यशश्चार्जवं तस्मिन्स्थितिस्तस्यैव च ध्रुवा । संक्षेपतस्तपोवृद्धैः शीलवृद्धैश्च कथ्यते ।।
data.md: To be brief, men of great asceticism and of high character say that he (Satyavana) is ever plain and firm in honour.

data.v: गुणैरुपेतं सर्वैस्तं भगवन्प्रब्रवीषि मे । दोषानप्यस्य मे ब्रूहि यदि सन्तीह केचन ।।
data.md: Ashvapati said: O adorable one, you have described him as possessed of all noble qualities. Now tell me of his defects, if there be any.

data.v: एको दोषोऽस्य नान्योऽस्ति सोऽद्य प्रभृति सत्यवान् । संवत्सरेण क्षीणायुर्देहन्यासं करिष्यति ।।
data.md: He has only one defect and no other. Satyavana who has a little of life in store for him, will, within a year from this day, breathe his last.

data.v: एहि सावित्रि गच्छ त्वमन्यं वरय शोभने । तस्य दोषो महानेको गुणानाक्रम्य तिष्ठति ।।
data.md: The King said: O beautiful Savitri, go and seek another for your husband. He has a great defect which lies surpassing all his merits.

data.v: यथा मे भगवानाह नारदो देवसत्कृतः । संवत्सरेण सोऽल्पायुर्देहन्यासं करिष्यति ।।
data.md: The divine Narada, who is honoured by the celestials, tells me that within a year, he, of short life, will give up the ghost.

data.v: सकृदंशो निपतति सकृत्कन्या प्रदीयते । सकृदाह ददानीति त्रीण्येतानि सकृत्सकृत् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: The die falls but once and the daughter can once be bestowed. The words "I bestow" are uttered but once and once only these three things occur.

data.v: दीर्घायुरथ वाल्पायुः सगुणो निर्गुणोऽपि वा । सकृद्वृतो मया भर्ता न द्वितीयं वृणोम्यहम् ।।
data.md: Whether his life be long or short, whether he be gifted with (noble) qualities or destitute of them, I have for once, chosen him for my husband and will not select any other a second time.

data.v: मनसा निश्चयं कृत्वा ततो वाचाभिधीयते । क्रियते कर्मणा पश्चात्प्रमाणं मे मनस्ततः ।।
data.md: Having (first) settled a thing in mind, it is then expressed in words and is ultimately given effect to by (external) acts. My (own) mind is a proof of this.

data.v: स्थिरा बुद्धिर्नरश्रेष्ठ सावित्र्या दुहितुस्तव । नैषा चालयितुं शक्या धर्मादस्मात्कथंचन ।।
data.md: Narada said: O best of men, your daughter is firm in her resolve. It is impossible to wean her away from virtue.

data.v: नान्यस्मिन्पुरुषे सन्ति ये सत्यवति वै गुणाः । प्रदानमेव तस्मान्मे रोचते दुहितुस्तव ।।
data.md: The qualities that are present in Satyavana are wanting in any other person. Therefore I command the bestowal of your daughter (on Satyavana).

data.v: अविचार्यमेतदुक्तं हि तथ्यं भगवता वचः । करिष्याम्येतदेवं च गुरुर्हि भगवान्मम ।।
data.md: The King said: The words of your respectable self are true and should never be dishonoured. Since O adorable one, you are my preceptor I will do as directed by you.

data.v: अविघ्नमस्तु सावित्र्याः प्रदाने दुहितुस्तव । साधयिष्यामहे तावत्सर्वेषां भद्रमस्तु वः ।।
data.md: Narada said: May your daughter Savitri, be given away without any obstruction. I shall now go away. May you be all happy.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा खमुत्पत्य नारदस्त्रिदिवं गतः । राजापि दुहितुः सर्वं वैवाहिकमकारयत् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Saying this, Narada, soaring upwards, returned to heaven. And the king too began to ..jake preparations for the marriage of his daughter.

data.v: अथ कन्याप्रदाने स तमेवार्थं विचिन्तयन् । समानिन्ये च तत्सर्वं भाण्डं वैवाहिकं नृपः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The monarch, reflecting on the words (of Narada) with regard to his daughter's marriage, began to make preparations for the wedding.

data.v: ततो वृद्धान्द्विजान्सर्वानृत्विजः सपुरोहितान् । समाहूय तिथौ पुण्ये प्रययौ सह कन्यया ।।
data.md: Then, inviting all the old Brahmanas and the Ritvijas together with the priests, the king accompanied by his daughter set out on an auspicious day.

data.v: मेध्यारण्यं स गत्वा च द्युमत्सेनाश्रमं नृपः । पद्भ्यामेव द्विजैः सार्धं राजर्षिं तमुपागमत् ।।
data.md: Having reached the hermitage of Dyumatsena (situate) in the sacred forest, the king (Ashvapati) accompanied by the Brahmanas advanced on foot to meet that royal sage.

data.v: तत्रापश्यन्महाभागं शालवृक्षमुपाश्रितम् । कौश्यां बृस्यां समासीनं चक्षुर्हीनं नृपं तदा ।।
data.md: And there (in the hermitage) he saw that highly wise and old king seated on a mat of Kusha grass under a Sala tree.

data.v: स राजा तस्य राजर्षेः कृत्वा पूजां यथार्हतः । वाचा सुनियतो भूत्वा चकारात्मनिवेदनम् ।।
data.md: The King (Ashvapati) having in conformity with usage, paid his respects to that royal sage, introduced himself (to him) by an appropriate speech and the king (Dyumatsena) versed in religion, having offered to the monarch (Ashvapati) a seat, (the oblation called) Arghya and a cow asked him what brought him there,

data.v: तस्यार्घ्यमासनं चैव गां चावेद्य स धर्मवित् । किमागमनमित्येवं राजा राजानमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: The King (Ashvapati) having in conformity with usage, paid his respects to that royal sage, introduced himself (to him) by an appropriate speech and the king (Dyumatsena) versed in religion, having offered to the monarch (Ashvapati) a seat, (the oblation called) Arghya and a cow asked him what brought him there,

data.v: तस्य सर्वमभिप्रायमितिकर्तव्यतां च ताम् । सत्यवन्तं समुद्दिश्य सर्वमेव न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.md: He (Ashvapati) then expressed all his intentions and purposes in detail with regard to Satyavana.

data.v: सावित्री नाम राजर्षे कन्येयं मम शोभना । तां स्वधर्मेण धर्मज्ञ स्नुषार्थे त्वं गृहाण मे ।।
data.md: Ashvapati said : O royal sage, this fair damsel, named Savitri, is my daughter. O virtuous one, do you accept her for your daughter-in-law in conformity with the usage of your order.

data.v: च्युताः स्म राज्याद्वनवासमाश्रिता;श्चराम धर्मं नियतास्तपस्विनः । कथं त्वनर्हा वनवासमाश्रमे; सहिष्यते क्लेशमिमं सुता तव ।।
data.md: Dyumatsena said : Exiled from my kingdom we have taken refuge in the woods and have been, like ascetics, practising virtue with subdued passions. How will (therefore), your daughter, unworyour of a forest life, put up with (its) hardships living in the forest?

data.v: सुखं च दुःखं च भवाभवात्मकं; यदा विजानाति सुताहमेव च । न मद्विधे युज्यति वाक्यमीदृशं; विनिश्चयेनाभिगतोऽस्मि ते नृप ।।
data.md: Ashvapati said : Neither happiness nor misery has any permanence. My daughter and myself are aware of this. Therefore, O king, you should not use such words towards me. Having (previously) made up my mind. I have come here.

data.v: आशां नार्हसि मे हन्तुं सौहृदात्प्रणयेन च । अभितश्चागतं प्रेम्णा प्रत्याख्यातुं न मार्हसि ।।
data.md: You should not dishearten me since I have saluted you through friendship. As I have come here actuated by love, you ought not to refuse me.

data.v: अनुरूपो हि संयोगे त्वं ममाहं तवापि च । स्नुषां प्रतीच्छ मे कन्यां भार्यां सत्यवतः सुताम् ।।
data.md: You are my and I am your equal; and we are suitable to each other. Be pleased, (therefore) to accept my daughter as your daughter-in-law and wife of good Satyavana.

data.v: पूर्वमेवाभिलषितः संबन्धो मे त्वया सह । भ्रष्टराज्यस्त्वहमिति तत एतद्विचारितम् ।।
data.md: Dyumatsena said: Formerly, I cherished a desire of forming an alliance with you. (But) deprived of my kingdom (afterwards) I hesitated (to do it).

data.v: अभिप्रायस्त्वयं यो मे पूर्वमेवाभिकाङ्क्षितः । स निर्वर्ततु मेऽद्यैव काङ्क्षितो ह्यसि मेऽतिथिः ।।
data.md: Let, what I desired before, be accomplished this very day. You are a welcome guest to me.

data.v: ततः सर्वान्समानीय द्विजानाश्रमवासिनः । यथाविधि समुद्वाहं कारयामासतुर्नृपौ ।।
data.md: Then, those two monarchs, inviting all the Brahmanas dwelling in the hermitages, caused the wedding to be celebrated agreeably to the usage.

data.v: दत्त्वा त्वश्वपतिः कन्यां यथार्हं च परिच्छदम् । ययौ स्वमेव भवनं युक्तः परमया मुदा ।।
data.md: Having given away his daughter with suitable robes, Ashvapati with a merry heart left for his own abode.

data.v: सत्यवानपि भार्यां तां लब्ध्वा सर्वगुणान्विताम् । मुमुदे सा च तं लब्ध्वा भर्तारं मनसेप्सितम् ।।
data.md: Satyavana having obtained a wife graced with all the (noble) qualities and she (Savitri) too having got a husband after her own heart, rejoiced exceedingly.

data.v: गते पितरि सर्वाणि संन्यस्याभरणानि सा । जगृहे वल्कलान्येव वस्त्रं काषायमेव च ।।
data.md: Her father having departed, she cast off all her ornaments and put on barks of trees and cloths dyed red.

data.v: परिचारैर्गुणैश्चैव प्रश्रयेण दमेन च । सर्वकामक्रियाभिश्च सर्वेषां तुष्टिमावहत् ।।
data.md: By her ministrations, good qualities, affections, self-control and good services to all, she pleased every one.

data.v: श्वश्रूं शरीरसत्कारैः सर्वैराच्छादनादिभिः । श्वशुरं देवकार्यैश्च वाचः संयमनेन च ।।
data.md: By ministering to her physical comforts and by (covering her with) all sorts of robes, she delighted her mother-in-law. And she pleased her father-in-law by worshipping him as a god and by controlling her words.

data.v: तथैव प्रियवादेन नैपुणेन शमेन च । रहश्चैवोपचारेण भर्तारं पर्यतोषयत् ।।
data.md: Similarly, by agreeable words, by skillfulness, by sweet disposition and by ministering to him in private she delighted her husband.

data.v: एवं तत्राश्रमे तेषां तदा निवसतां सताम् । कालस्तपस्यतां कश्चिदतिचक्राम भारत ।।
data.md: Thus, O Bharata, these good people engaged in asceticism continued to dwell for some time in that hermitage.

data.v: सावित्र्यास्तु शयानायास्तिष्ठन्त्याश्च दिवानिशम् । नारदेन यदुक्तं तद्वाक्यं मनसि वर्तते ।।
data.md: And Savitri too, whether asleep or awake, could not forget the words of Narada which were present in her mind day and night.

data.v: ततः काले बहुतिथे व्यतिक्रान्ते कदाचन । प्राप्तः स कालो मर्तव्यं यत्र सत्यवता नृप ।।
data.md: Markandeya aid : After the lapse of a long while, O king, the time for Satyavana's death at last arrived.

data.v: गणयन्त्याश्च सावित्र्या दिवसे दिवसे गते । तद्वाक्यं नारदेनोक्तं वर्तते हृदि नित्यशः ।।
data.md: Savitri counted each days it passed away, (for) the words of Narada were always present in her mind.

data.v: चतुर्थेऽहनि मर्तव्यमिति संचिन्त्य भामिनी । व्रतं त्रिरात्रमुद्दिश्य दिवारात्रं स्थिताभवत् ।।
data.md: Having ascertained (by calculation) that her husband's death would take place on the fourth day (thence), that observant of the Triratra vow, fasted day and night.

data.v: तं श्रुत्वा नियमं दुःखं वध्वा दुःखान्वितो नृपः । उत्थाय वाक्यं सावित्रीमब्रवीत्परिसान्त्वयन् ।।
data.md: Aware of her vow, the king (Dyumatsena) became very sorry and rising up consoled Savitri with these words.

data.v: अतितीव्रोऽयमारम्भस्त्वयारब्धो नृपात्मजे । तिसृणां वसतीनां हि स्थानं परमदुष्करम् ।।
data.md: Dyumatsena said : Princess, the vow you have taken is very difficult to observe, for, it is extremely hard to fast continuously for three nights.

data.v: न कार्यस्तात संतापः पारयिष्याम्यहं व्रतम् । व्यवसायकृतं हीदं व्यवसायश्च कारणम् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: O sire, you need not be sorry. I will be able to complete the vow. I have undertaken this vow with a firm resolve; and determination is the (sole) cause of success (in every undertaking).

data.v: व्रतं भिन्धीति वक्तुं त्वां नास्मि शक्तः कथंचन । पारयस्वेति वचनं युक्तमस्मद्विधो वदेत् ।।
data.md: Dyumatsena said : I can, by no means tell you to give up your vow. Men like us should rather encourage you to complete it.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा द्युमत्सेनो विरराम महामनाः । तिष्ठन्ती चापि सावित्री काष्ठभूतेव लक्ष्यते ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Saying this, the high-minded Dyumatsena ceased; and Savitri thus remaining (without food) looked like a wooden doll.

data.v: श्वोभूते भर्तृमरणे सावित्र्या भरतर्षभ । दुःखान्वितायास्तिष्ठन्त्याः सा रात्रिर्व्यत्यवर्तत ।।
data.md: O best of the Bharatas, thinking that her husband would die tomorrow, Savitri, stricken with grief and observing fasts, passed the night in great sorrow.

data.v: अद्य तद्दिवसं चेति हुत्वा दीप्तं हुताशनम् । युगमात्रोदिते सूर्ये कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकीः क्रियाः ।।
data.md: Then, when the sun rose a couple of hands (on the horizon), Savitri performed her morning devotions and offered oblation to the blazing fire.

data.v: ततः सर्वान्द्विजान्वृद्धाञ्श्वश्रूं श्वशुरमेव च । अभिवाद्यानुपूर्व्येण प्राञ्जलिर्नियता स्थिता ।।
data.md: She then bowed down to all the aged Brahmanas, her father-in-law and mother-inlaw, one after the other and stood humbly before them with joined hands.

data.v: अवैधव्याशिषस्ते तु सावित्र्यर्थं हिताः शुभाः । ऊचुस्तपस्विनः सर्वे तपोवननिवासिनः ।।
data.md: And all the ascetics living in the hermitage pronounced, for the welfare of Savitri, the benediction that she might never be a widow.

data.v: एवमस्त्विति सावित्री ध्यानयोगपरायणा । मनसा ता गिरः सर्वाः प्रत्यगृह्णात्तपस्विनाम् ।।
data.md: Savitri, who was buried in contemplation, saying in her mind “be it so" bowed down to the words of the ascetics,

data.v: तं कालं च मुहूर्तं च प्रतीक्षन्ती नृपात्मजा । यथोक्तं नारदवचश्चिन्तयन्ती सुदुःखिता ।।
data.md: And with a heavy heart, the princess, pondering on the words of Narada (anxiously) awaited the hour and the moment of her husband's death).

data.v: ततस्तु श्वश्रूश्वशुरावूचतुस्तां नृपात्मजाम् । एकान्तस्थामिदं वाक्यं प्रीत्या भरतसत्तम ।।
data.md: Then, O best of the Bharatas, her father-in-law and mother-in-law gladly told the king's daughter who was seated alone, these words.

data.v: व्रतो यथोपदिष्टोऽयं यथावत्पारितस्त्वया । आहारकालः संप्राप्तः क्रियतां यदनन्तरम् ।।
data.md: The Father-in-law said : You have performed the vow as directed. It is now the time to eat. Do what you think proper.

data.v: अस्तं गते मयादित्ये भोक्तव्यं कृतकामया । एष मे हृदि संकल्पः समयश्च कृतो मया ।।
data.md: Savitri said : Having observed the desired vow I appointed the time when the sun would go down for my meals. (Even now) this is the determination of my heart.

data.v: एवं संभाषमाणायाः सावित्र्या भोजनं प्रति । स्कन्धे परशुमादाय सत्यवान्प्रस्थितो वनम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : When Savitri was saying this about her meals. Satyavana, taking his hatchet on his shoulders, left for the woods.

data.v: सावित्री त्वाह भर्तारं नैकस्त्वं गन्तुमर्हसि । सह त्वयागमिष्यामि न हि त्वां हातुमुत्सहे ।।
data.md: (Thereupon) Savitri said to her husband "you should not go alone. I will go with you. I do not feel inclined to be separated from you.

data.v: वनं न गतपूर्वं ते दुःखः पन्थाश्च भामिनि । व्रतोपवासक्षामा च कथं पद्भ्यां गमिष्यसि ।।
data.md: Satyavana said: Dearest, you have never visited the woods before. The path is very rugged (Moreover), lean and weak as you have been by the observance of fasts and vow how will you be able to walk?

data.v: उपवासान्न मे ग्लानिर्नास्ति चापि परिश्रमः । गमने च कृतोत्साहां प्रतिषेद्धुं न मार्हसि ।।
data.md: Savitri said : Neither do I feel exhaustion nor lassitude on account of the fast. (Moreover) I am very eager to go. Do not (therefore) prevent me.

data.v: यदि ते गमनोत्साहः करिष्यामि तव प्रियम् । मम त्वामन्त्रय गुरून्न मां दोषः स्पृशेदयम् ।।
data.md: Satyavana said: Since you are so eager to go, I will fulfill your desire. (But) take leave of my parents (first) so that no blame can be attached to me.

data.v: साभिगम्याब्रवीच्छ्वश्रूं श्वशुरं च महाव्रता । अयं गच्छति मे भर्ता फलाहारो महावनम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : (Then) bowing down to her mother-in-law and father-in-law, she of great vows said (to them) "my husband is going to the great forest for gathering fruits.

data.v: इच्छेयमभ्यनुज्ञातुमार्यया श्वशुरेण च । अनेन सह निर्गन्तुं न हि मे विरहः क्षमः ।।
data.md: It is my desire that your worshipful self and my father-in-law will (kindly) permit me to accompany him. I cannot bear to be separated (from him) this day.

data.v: गुर्वग्निहोत्रार्थकृते प्रस्थितश्च सुतस्तव । न निवार्यो निवार्यः स्यादन्यथा प्रस्थितो वनम् ।।
data.md: As your son is going to the forest for the sacrificial fire and for his superiors, you ought not to prevent him. Had it been for any other (business) he should have been prevented.

data.v: संवत्सरः किंचिदूनो न निष्क्रान्ताहमाश्रमात् । वनं कुसुमितं द्रष्टुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे ।।
data.md: I have not walked out for a little less than a year. Great indeed is my desire to witness the woods.

data.v: यतः प्रभृति सावित्री पित्रा दत्ता स्नुषा मम । नानयाभ्यर्थनायुक्तमुक्तपूर्वं स्मराम्यहम् ।।
data.md: Dyumatsena said : From the very time that Savitri was made my daughter-in-law by her father, I do not remember her to have ever made any request to me.

data.v: तदेषा लभतां कामं यथाभिलषितं वधूः । अप्रमादश्च कर्तव्यः पुत्रि सत्यवतः पथि ।।
data.md: So, let what my daughter-in-law desires be fulfilled. Daughter, act in such a manner that Satyavana does not neglect his business on the way.

data.v: उभाभ्यामभ्यनुज्ञाता सा जगाम यशस्विनी । सह भर्त्रा हसन्तीव हृदयेन विदूयता ।।
data.md: Thus permitted by both, the renowned (Savitri) with a smiling (countenance) though with a sorrowful heart accompanied her husband (to the woods).

data.v: सा वनानि विचित्राणि रमणीयानि सर्वशः । मयूररवघुष्टानि ददर्श विपुलेक्षणा ।।
data.md: And that large-eyed lady beheld, on all sides romantic and charming forests frequented by swarms of peacocks.

data.v: नदीः पुण्यवहाश्चैव पुष्पितांश्च नगोत्तमान् । सत्यवानाह पश्येति सावित्रीं मधुराक्षरम् ।।
data.md: And Satyavana said these sweet words to Savitri "behold these streams of sacred waters and these excellent blossoming trees.”

data.v: निरीक्षमाणा भर्तारं सर्वावस्थमनिन्दिता । मृतमेव हि तं मेने काले मुनिवचः स्मरन् ।।
data.md: That blameless girl, however, began to watch all the movements of her husband; but remembering what the sage (Narada) had said, she considered him as already dead.

data.v: अनुवर्तती तु भर्तारं जगाम मृदुगामिनी । द्विधेव हृदयं कृत्वा तं च कालमवेक्षती ।।
data.md: With her heart divided into two parts, she (with one of these) replying to her husband and (with the other) awaiting the (fatal) hour, followed him slowly.

data.v: अथ भार्यासहायः स फलान्यादाय वीर्यवान् । कठिनं पूरयामास ततः काष्ठान्यपाटयत् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Accompanied by his wife the powerful Satyavana (first) gathered fruits and filled his bag; he then began to cut down the trees.

data.v: तस्य पाटयतः काष्ठं स्वेदो वै समजायत । व्यायामेन च तेनास्य जज्ञे शिरसि वेदना ।।
data.md: As he was felling the branches he began to sweat and had an headache in consequence of the labour. Oppressed with toil, he came to his dear wife and said to her thus.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य प्रियां भार्यामुवाच श्रमपीडितः । व्यायामेन ममानेन जाता शिरसि वेदना ।।
अङ्गानि चैव सावित्रि हृदयं दूयतीव च । अस्वस्थमिव चात्मानं लक्षये मितभाषिणि ।।
data.md: Satyavana said : I have a headache on account of this exercise. And, O Savitri, my limbs and heart are aching. O lady of restrained speech, I feel unwell. It seems (to me) that my head is being pierced by arrows. Therefore, O blessed lady, I feel inclined to sleep; for I am quite unable to stand.

data.v: शूलैरिव शिरो विद्धमिदं संलक्षयाम्यहम् । तत्स्वप्तुमिच्छे कल्याणि न स्थातुं शक्तिरस्ति मे ।।
data.md: Satyavana said : I have a headache on account of this exercise. And, O Savitri, my limbs and heart are aching. O lady of restrained speech, I feel unwell. It seems (to me) that my head is being pierced by arrows. Therefore, O blessed lady, I feel inclined to sleep; for I am quite unable to stand.

data.v: समासाद्याथ सावित्री भर्तारमुपगूह्य च । उत्सङ्गेऽस्य शिरः कृत्वा निषसाद महीतले ।।
data.md: (Thereupon), Savitri coming up to her husband, sat down on the ground with his head on her lap.

data.v: ततः सा नारदवचो विमृशन्ती तपस्विनी । तं मुहूर्तं क्षणं वेलां दिवसं च युयोज ह ।।
data.md: Then that devout lady, remembering the words of Narada, began to calculate the moment, the hour, the time and the day.

data.v: मुहूर्तादिव चापश्यत्पुरुषं पीतवाससम् । बद्धमौलिं वपुष्मन्तमादित्यसमतेजसम् ।।
data.md: And in a moment she saw a person attired in red garments, wearing a diadem, of an enormous structure, having the splendour of the sun of a dark and yellow complexion, endued with red eyes, with a noose in his hands, dreadful to look at, standing beside Satyavana and gazing at him.

data.v: श्यामावदातं रक्ताक्षं पाशहस्तं भयावहम् । स्थितं सत्यवतः पार्श्वे निरीक्षन्तं तमेव च ।।
data.md: And in a moment she saw a person attired in red garments, wearing a diadem, of an enormous structure, having the splendour of the sun of a dark and yellow complexion, endued with red eyes, with a noose in his hands, dreadful to look at, standing beside Satyavana and gazing at him.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा सहसोत्थाय भर्तुर्न्यस्य शनैः शिरः । कृताञ्जलिरुवाचार्ता हृदयेन प्रवेपता ।।
data.md: Beholding him she gently placed her husband's head on the ground. Then rising suddenly she, with a trembling heart and joined palms, said these words in a great sorrow.

data.v: दैवतं त्वाभिजानामि वपुरेतद्ध्यमानुषम् । कामया ब्रूहि मे देव कस्त्वं किं च चिकीर्षसि ।।
data.md: Savitri said: From your superhuman appearance I know you to be a god. Kindly tell me, O god of gods, who you are and what is your desire.

data.v: पतिव्रतासि सावित्रि तथैव च तपोन्विता । अतस्त्वामभिभाषामि विद्धि मां त्वं शुभे यमम् ।।
data.md: Yama said: O Savitri, you are devotedly attached to your husband and are of ascetic virtue. And it for this reason that I address you. Know me, O auspicious girl, to be Yana.

data.v: अयं ते सत्यवान्भर्ता क्षीणायुः पार्थिवात्मजः । नेष्याम्येनमहं बद्ध्वा विद्ध्येतन्मे चिकीर्षितम् ।।
data.md: The years of this prince, your husband, being numbered, I will bind (him with this noose) and take him hence. Know this to be my। intention.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा पितृराजस्तां भगवान्स्वं चिकीर्षितम् । यथावत्सर्वमाख्यातुं तत्प्रियार्थं प्रचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thus addressed by her, the divine lord of the Pitris, in order to please her, began faithfully to relate everything about his intentions.

data.v: अयं हि धर्मसंयुक्तो रूपवान्गुणसागरः । नार्हो मत्पुरुषैर्नेतुमतोऽस्मि स्वयमागतः ।।
data.md: And he said, I have come here personally considering that my emissaries are not fit to bring such a devotional and handsome person, endued with qualities, vast as a sea."

data.v: ततः सत्यवतः कायात्पाशबद्धं वशं गतम् । अङ्गुष्ठमात्रं पुरुषं निश्चकर्ष यमो बलात् ।।
data.md: Then Yama powerfully drew out of the body of Satyavana a person of the measure of the thumb, bound him with the noose and brought him under control.

data.v: ततः समुद्धृतप्राणं गतश्वासं हतप्रभम् । निर्विचेष्टं शरीरं तद्बभूवाप्रियदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: The life being taken out, the body deprived of breath, destitute of lustre and devoid of motion, became disagreeable to the eye.

data.v: यमस्तु तं तथा बद्ध्वा प्रयातो दक्षिणामुखः । सावित्री चापि दुःखार्ता यममेवान्वगच्छत । नियमव्रतसंसिद्धा महाभागा पतिव्रता ।।
data.md: Binding it thus, Yama proceeded towards the south; and weighed down with grief, the exalted Savitri also, devotedly attached to her husband and successful in her vow, followed him.

data.v: निवर्त गच्छ सावित्रि कुरुष्वास्यौर्ध्वदेहिकम् । कृतं भर्तुस्त्वयानृण्यं यावद्गम्यं गतं त्वया ।।
data.md: Yama said: Go back, O Savitri and perform the last rites of your husband. Your debt to your husband is discharged. You have come as far as is possible (for you) to do.

data.v: यत्र मे नीयते भर्ता स्वयं वा यत्र गच्छति । मयापि तत्र गन्तव्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः ।।
data.md: Savitri said: I ought to follow my husband thither where he is being carried to or whither he goes of his own accord. (Because) this is the eternal duty.

data.v: तपसा गुरुवृत्त्या च भर्तुः स्नेहाद्व्रतेन च । तव चैव प्रसादेन न मे प्रतिहता गतिः ।।
data.md: There shall be no obstacle to my course on account of my asceticism, my devotion to superiors, my affection for my husband, my observance of vows and your grace.

data.v: प्राहुः सप्तपदं मित्रं बुधास्तत्त्वार्थदर्शिनः । मित्रतां च पुरस्कृत्य किंचिद्वक्ष्यामि तच्छृणु ।।
data.md: It is asserted by the wise, versed in true knowledge, that one contracts a friendship with another by going only seven paces with him. I will tell you something keeping this friendship in view. Pray listen to it.

data.v: नानात्मवन्तस्तु वने चरन्ति; धर्मं च वासं च परिश्रमं च । विज्ञानतो धर्ममुदाहरन्ति; तस्मात्सन्तो धर्ममाहुः प्रधानम् ।।
data.md: Men, wanting in self-control do not observe (the proper rites and sacrifices) even in the forest. Nor do they go through and discharge the necessary duties of these three modes of life, namely conjugal or domestic life, life of celebacy and study in the house of the preceptor and thirdly a life of the total renunciation of the world. Conjugal life or domesticity leads to true religious merit. It is for this reason that the wise assert that domestic (which leads to righteousness) is the best of all (other modes of life).

data.v: एकस्य धर्मेण सतां मतेन; सर्वे स्म तं मार्गमनुप्रपन्नाः । मा वै द्वितीयं मा तृतीयं च वाञ्छे; तस्मात्सन्तो धर्ममाहुः प्रधानम् ।।
data.md: By discharging faithfully the necessary duties of this one mode of life (i.e. conjugal life) we have all attained to the path (of righteousness) and therefore we do not covet the second and the third modes of life (i.e. celebacy and renunciation of the world). It is therefore that domesticity with its necessary duties is considered by the wise as the foremost of all (other lives).

data.v: निवर्त तुष्टोऽस्मि तवानया गिरा; स्वराक्षरव्यञ्जनहेतुयुक्तया । वरं वृणीष्वेह विनास्य जीवितं; ददानि ते सर्वमनिन्दिते वरम् ।।
data.md: Yama said: Do go back. I have been delighted with your words couched in (proper) letters and accents and resting on reason. Do you ask for a boon with the exception of your husband's life. O lady of faultless proportions, I will give any boon (you desire).

data.v: च्युतः स्वराज्याद्वनवासमाश्रितो; विनष्टचक्षुः श्वशुरो ममाश्रमे । स लब्धचक्षुर्बलवान्भवेन्नृप;स्तव प्रसादाज्ज्वलनार्कसंनिभः ।।
data.md: Savitri said: My father-in-law has been driven away from this kingdom and has lost his eyes. He now leads a forest life in our hermitage. Let that king, through your grace, be restored to his sight and be as powerful as the sun or fire.

data.v: ददानि ते सर्वमनिन्दिते वरं; यथा त्वयोक्तं भविता च तत्तथा । तवाध्वना ग्लानिमिवोपलक्षये; निवर्त गच्छस्व न ते श्रमो भवेत् ।।
data.md: Yama said: O blameless girl, I give you this boon, that, what you have asked of me, will take place. I see you are wearied with your journey. Do not proceed further. Go back. Do not take any more trouble.

data.v: कुतः श्रमो भर्तृसमीपतो हि मे; यतो हि भर्ता मम सा गतिर्ध्रुवा । यतः पतिं नेष्यसि तत्र मे गतिः; सुरेश भूयश्च वचो निबोध मे ।।
data.md: Savitri said : I do not feel fatigue as I am with my husband. I will surely follow the same path as my husband does. I will surely go thither where you are taking my lord to. O best of the celestials, listen again to what I say.

data.v: सतां सकृत्संगतमीप्सितं परं; ततः परं मित्रमिति प्रचक्षते । न चाफलं सत्पुरुषेण संगतं; ततः सतां संनिवसेत्समागमे ।।
data.md: (It is asserted by the wise) that even a single interview with the virtuous is highly desirable. Friendship with them is much more so. Communion with the righteous is never without fruit. So one should always associate with the virtuous.

data.v: मनोनुकूलं बुधबुद्धिवर्धनं; त्वयाहमुक्तो वचनं हिताश्रयम् । विना पुनः सत्यवतोऽस्य जीवितं; वरं द्वितीयं वरयस्व भामिनि ।।
data.md: Yama said: The words spoken by you are pregnant with great import. They augment the wisdom of even the learned and are delightful to the mind. Therefore, O damsel, with the exception of Satyavana's life to you ask for a second boon.

data.v: हृतं पुरा मे श्वशुरस्य धीमतः; स्वमेव राज्यं स लभेत पार्थिवः । जह्यात्स्वधर्मं न च मे गुरुर्यथा; द्वितीयमेतं वरयामि ते वरम् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: Let that king, my intellectual father-in-law, regain his kingdom that he lost before. And may that worshipful one never fail to properly discharge his duties. This is the second boon that I pray for.

data.v: स्वमेव राज्यं प्रतिपत्स्यतेऽचिरा;न्न च स्वधर्मात्परिहास्यते नृपः । कृतेन कामेन मया नृपात्मजे; निवर्त गच्छस्व न ते श्रमो भवेत् ।।
data.md: Yama said: That monarch will be soon restored to his kingdom and be ever firm in his duties Princess, I have now gratified your wish. Do not proceed further; go back; do not allow yourself to be any more weary.

data.v: प्रजास्त्वयेमा नियमेन संयता; नियम्य चैता नयसे न कामया । अतो यमत्वं तव देव विश्रुतं; निबोध चेमां गिरमीरितां मया ।।
data.md: Savitri said: You have controlled all the creatures by your ordinances and you carry them away not according to your caprice but those regulations. Therefore, O god, you are styled Yama (i.e. one who governs by ordinances). Hear (again) these my words.

data.v: अद्रोहः सर्वभूतेषु कर्मणा मनसा गिरा । अनुग्रहश्च दानं च सतां धर्मः सनातनः ।।
data.md: Abstention froin injury to all creatures in thought, word, and deed, and kindness, and gift, are the permanent duties of the good. one

data.v: एवंप्रायश्च लोकोऽयं मनुष्याः शक्तिपेशलाः । सन्तस्त्वेवाप्यमित्रेषु दयां प्राप्तेषु कुर्वते ।।
data.md: In this world, it is generally the case that men here are destitute of energy and skill. (But) the righteous show mercy even to their enemies when the latter throw themselves into the protection.

data.v: पिपासितस्येव यथा भवेत्पय;स्तथा त्वया वाक्यमिदं समीरितम् । विना पुनः सत्यवतोऽस्य जीवितं; वरं वृणीष्वेह शुभे यदिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Yama said: The words uttered by you appear (to me) as delicious as water to a thirsty person. (Therefore), O auspicious girl, do you ask again for any other boon that you like than the life of Satyavana.

data.v: ममानपत्यः पृथिवीपतिः पिता; भवेत्पितुः पुत्रशतं ममौरसम् । कुलस्य संतानकरं च यद्भवे;त्तृतीयमेतं वरयामि ते वरम् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: My royal father is childless. Let him have one hundred sons, begotten by him, who will perpetuate his family. This is the third boon that I ask of you.

data.v: कुलस्य संतानकरं सुवर्चसं; शतं सुतानां पितुरस्तु ते शुभे । कृतेन कामेन नराधिपात्मजे; निवर्त दूरं हि पथस्त्वमागता ।।
data.md: Yama said: O auspicious girl, your father shall have one hundred highly-energetic sons, the perpetuators of his race. Princess, your desire is now gratified. Do retrace your steps. You have come too far.

data.v: न दूरमेतन्मम भर्तृसंनिधौ; मनो हि मे दूरतरं प्रधावति । तथा व्रजन्नेव गिरं समुद्यतां; मयोच्यमानां शृणु भूय एव च ।।
data.md: Savitri said : It appears no distance to me since I am beside my husband. My mind travels a greater distance. (Now) listen, as you proceed on, to the words that I will presently utter.

data.v: विवस्वतस्त्वं तनयः प्रतापवां;स्ततो हि वैवस्वत उच्यसे बुधैः । शमेन धर्मेण च रञ्जिताः प्रजा;स्ततस्तवेहेश्वर धर्मराजता ।।
data.md: You are the powerful son of Vivasavata and are therefore called by the wise Vaivasvata. You judge all the creatures impartially and rightfully and for this reason, O lord, you are styled the lord of justice.

data.v: आत्मन्यपि न विश्वासस्तावान्भवति सत्सु यः । तस्मात्सत्सु विशेषेण सर्वः प्रणयमिच्छति ।।
data.md: People do not place so inuch reliance on their own selves as on the virtuous. Therefore everybody wishes particularly to cultivate intimacy with the righteous.

data.v: सौहृदात्सर्वभूतानां विश्वासो नाम जायते । तस्मात्सत्सु विशेषेण विश्वासं कुरुते जनः ।।
data.md: And friendship alone generates the confidence among all creatures. It is therefore that people repose confidence specially in the virtuous.

data.v: उदाहृतं ते वचनं यदङ्गने; शुभे न तादृक्त्वदृते मया श्रुतम् । अनेन तुष्टोऽस्मि विनास्य जीवितं; वरं चतुर्थं वरयस्व गच्छ च ।।
data.md: Yama said: O auspicious and fair damsel. I never before heard such words as you have (just now) spoken from any other person than you. I am pleased with these. Do you ask for a fourth boon with the exception of Satyavana's life and then retrace your steps.

data.v: ममात्मजं सत्यवतस्तथौरसं; भवेदुभाभ्यामिह यत्कुलोद्वहम् । शतं सुतानां बलवीर्यशालिना;मिदं चतुर्थं वरयामि ते वरम् ।।
data.md: Savitri said : Let me have one hundred strong and powerful sons, born of Satyavana's loins and begotten of both of us, who will perpetuate our line. This is the fourth boon I pray for.

data.v: शतं सुतानां बलवीर्यशालिनां; भविष्यति प्रीतिकरं तवाबले । परिश्रमस्ते न भवेन्नृपात्मजे; निवर्त दूरं हि पथस्त्वमागता ।।
data.md: Yama said : Lady, you shall have one hundred strong and powerful sons who will cause your delight. Princess, do not take any further trouble; go back; indeed you have come a great way.

data.v: सतां सदा शाश्वती धर्मवृत्तिः; सन्तो न सीदन्ति न च व्यथन्ति । सतां सद्भिर्नाफलः संगमोऽस्ति; सद्भ्यो भयं नानुवर्तन्ति सन्तः ।।
data.md: Savitri said : The pious are ever unceasingly devoted to religion. They do neither fecl lassitude nor affliction. The intercourse of the pious with the virtuous is (ever) productive of good. And the righteous apprehend no fear from the virtuous.

data.v: सन्तो हि सत्येन नयन्ति सूर्यं; सन्तो भूमिं तपसा धारयन्ति । सन्तो गतिर्भूतभव्यस्य राज;न्सतां मध्ये नावसीदन्ति सन्तः ।।
data.md: Indeed, the righteous by their truthfulness make the sun move and it is the pious who by asceticism support the earth. O king, it is the righteous that are the cause of the past and the future. And the pious remaining in the midst of the righteous do never feel languor.

data.v: आर्यजुष्टमिदं वृत्तमिति विज्ञाय शाश्वतम् । सन्तः परार्थं कुर्वाणा नावेक्षन्ते प्रतिक्रियाम् ।।
data.md: Knowing that this is the eternal custom of the good and the virtuous, pious people devote themselves to acts of self-sacrifice for others without expecting any return.

data.v: न च प्रसादः सत्पुरुषेषु मोघो; न चाप्यर्थो नश्यति नापि मानः । यस्मादेतन्नियतं सत्सु नित्यं; तस्मात्सन्तो रक्षितारो भवन्ति ।।
data.md: Good acts done to the virtuous are never fruitless. Such acts never destroy our honour or interest. Since the righteous are characterised by such (noble) conduct they become protectors (of all creatures).

data.v: यथा यथा भाषसि धर्मसंहितं; मनोनुकूलं सुपदं महार्थवत् । तथा तथा मे त्वयि भक्तिरुत्तमा; वरं वृणीष्वाप्रतिमं यतव्रते ।।
data.md: Yama said: The more you address me in words pregnant with religious meaning, delightful to the mind, full of sweet phrases and of grave import, the more I am inclined to respect you. O lady, devotedly attached to your husband, crave an incomparable boon.

data.v: न तेऽपवर्गः सुकृताद्विनाकृत;स्तथा यथान्येषु वरेषु मानद । वरं वृणे जीवतु सत्यवानयं; यथा मृता ह्येवमहं विना पतिम् ।।
data.md: Savitri said : The boon that you have (just) given me cannot bear fruit (without my union with my husband). Therefore, O bestower of honour, among other boons (that you have already granted me) I crave this boon that Satyavana may be brought back to life. I am as good as dead without my husband.

data.v: न कामये भर्तृविनाकृता सुखं; न कामये भर्तृविनाकृता दिवम् । न कामये भर्तृविनाकृता श्रियं; न भर्तृहीना व्यवसामि जीवितुम् ।।
data.md: I do not want happiness bereft of my husband. Without my lord I do not crave heaven itself. Deprived of my husband I do not long for prosperity. And bereft of my husband I am unable to bear life.

data.v: वरातिसर्गः शतपुत्रता मम; त्वयैव दत्तो ह्रियते च मे पतिः । वरं वृणे जीवतु सत्यवानयं; तवैव सत्यं वचनं भविष्यति ।।
data.md: You have granted me the boon that I shall have one hundred sons and yet you are carrying away my husband. Now I pray for this boon that Satyavana may be alive again and then your words will prove true.

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु तान्पाशान्मुक्त्वा वैवस्वतो यमः । धर्मराजः प्रहृष्टात्मा सावित्रीमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thereupon, Yama, the son of Vivasvata and the lord of justice saying "be it so" and unloosing his noose, cheerfully spoke to Savitri thus,

data.v: एष भद्रे मया मुक्तो भर्ता ते कुलनन्दिनि । अरोगस्तव नेयश्च सिद्धार्थश्च भविष्यति ।।
data.md: "O chaste and gentle lady, I release your husband. You will be able to take him back. He will be free from disease and (ever) successful (in his undertakings).

data.v: चतुर्वर्षशतं चायुस्त्वया सार्धमवाप्स्यति । इष्ट्वा यज्ञैश्च धर्मेण ख्यातिं लोके गमिष्यति ।।
data.md: He as well as you will live four hundred years. By his devoutness and by celebrating many sacrifices he will win a great renown in the world.

data.v: त्वयि पुत्रशतं चैव सत्यवाञ्जनयिष्यति । ते चापि सर्वे राजानः क्षत्रियाः पुत्रपौत्रिणः । ख्यातास्त्वन्नामधेयाश्च भविष्यन्तीह शाश्वताः ।।
data.md: And Satyavana will beget on you one hundred sons. And those Kshatriya sons (of you) together with their sons and grandsons will be kings;

data.v: पितुश्च ते पुत्रशतं भविता तव मातरि । मालव्यां मालवा नाम शाश्वताः पुत्रपौत्रिणः । भ्रातरस्ते भविष्यन्ति क्षत्रियास्त्रिदशोपमाः ।।
data.md: And bearing your name will ever be renowned. Your father also will beget a hundred sons on your mother Malavi and those Kshatriya brothers of you resembling the celestials, together with their sons and grandsons will be celebrated under the name of the Malavas."

data.v: एवं तस्यै वरं दत्त्वा धर्मराजः प्रतापवान् । निवर्तयित्वा सावित्रीं स्वमेव भवनं ययौ ।।
data.md: Having conferred these boons on her and having thus made her retrace her steps, the lord of justice (Yama) returned to his own abode.

data.v: सावित्र्यपि यमे याते भर्तारं प्रतिलभ्य च । जगाम तत्र यत्रास्या भर्तुः शावं कलेवरम् ।।
data.md: Then Savitri having regained her husband, returned to the place where her husband's ashy pale corpse lay.

data.v: सा भूमौ प्रेक्ष्य भर्तारमुपसृत्योपगूह्य च । उत्सङ्गे शिर आरोप्य भूमावुपविवेश ह ।।
data.md: Beholding her husband on the ground she approached and took hold of him. She then sat down placing his head on her lap.

data.v: संज्ञां च सत्यवाँल्लब्ध्वा सावित्रीमभ्यभाषत । प्रोष्यागत इव प्रेम्णा पुनः पुनरुदीक्ष्य वै ।।
data.md: Having regained his consciousness, he looked at her again and again like one returned from a distant clime (after a long time) and (then) endearingly addressed her thus.

data.v: सुचिरं बत सुप्तोऽस्मि किमर्थं नावबोधितः । क्व चासौ पुरुषः श्यामो योऽसौ मां संचकर्ष ह ।।
data.md: Satyavana said : Oh, I have slept for a long time. Why did you not awaken me? Where is that darkcomplexioned person who was dragging me away?

data.v: सुचिरं बत सुप्तोऽसि ममाङ्के पुरुषर्षभ । गतः स भगवान्देवः प्रजासंयमनो यमः ।।
data.md: Savitri said: O best of men, you have (indeed) slept long on my lap. That god, the divine Yama, who governs all creatures, has departed.

data.v: विश्रान्तोऽसि महाभाग विनिद्रश्च नृपात्मज । यदि शक्यं समुत्तिष्ठ विगाढां पश्य शर्वरीम् ।।
data.md: O blessed one, you are (now) soothed and O prince, you have awakened from sleep. If you are able, rise up. Look, the night is far advanced.

data.v: उपलभ्य ततः संज्ञां सुखसुप्त इवोत्थितः । दिशः सर्वा वनान्तांश्च निरीक्ष्योवाच सत्यवान् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Having regained his consciousness, Satyavana got up like one who had enjoyed an undisturbed sleep; and seeing all the sides covered with woods he said:

data.v: फलाहारोऽस्मि निष्क्रान्तस्त्वया सह सुमध्यमे । ततः पाटयतः काष्ठं शिरसो मे रुजाभवत् ।।
data.md: "O slender-waisted damsel, I set out with you for gathering fruits. And when I was hewing down the woods my headached.

data.v: शिरोभितापसंतप्तः स्थातुं चिरमशक्नुवन् । तवोत्सङ्गे प्रसुप्तोऽहमिति सर्वं स्मरे शुभे ।।
data.md: Sorely distressed with headache I could not stand up long and (therefore) lay down on your lap. O auspicious girl, I remember all this.

data.v: त्वयोपगूढस्य च मे निद्रयापहृतं मनः । ततोऽपश्यं तमो घोरं पुरुषं च महौजसम् ।।
data.md: Embraced by you, sleep gently came upon me. I then saw it was intensenly dark and also a highly effulgent person.

data.v: तद्यदि त्वं विजानासि किं तद्ब्रूहि सुमध्यमे । स्वप्नो मे यदि वा दृष्टो यदि वा सत्यमेव तत् ।।
data.md: O slender-waisted lady, tell me, if you are aware of all that happened whether what I saw was a dream or a reality."

data.v: तमुवाचाथ सावित्री रजनी व्यवगाहते । श्वस्ते सर्वं यथावृत्तमाख्यास्यामि नृपात्मज ।।
data.md: Thereupon Savitri replied to him "prince, the night is deepening tomorrow, I will disciose to you faithfully all that occurred.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भद्रं ते पितरौ पश्य सुव्रत । विगाढा रजनी चेयं निवृत्तश्च दिवाकरः ।।
data.md: Get up, get up, may you be all hale, O you of good devotion, come and see your parents. The sun has long gone down and the night is deepening.

data.v: नक्तंचराश्चरन्त्येते हृष्टाः क्रूराभिभाषिणः । श्रूयन्ते पर्णशब्दाश्च मृगाणां चरतां वने ।।
data.md: The night-wandering creatures of harsh voices are joyfully roving about. And the rustling of leaves consequent on the footsteps of beasts are heard.

data.v: एताः शिवा घोरनादा दिशं दक्षिणपश्चिमाम् । आस्थाय विरुवन्त्युग्राः कम्पयन्त्यो मनो मम ।।
data.md: Jackals of frightful appearance stationed in the south and east have set up terrible howls which make my heart tremble.

data.v: वनं प्रतिभयाकारं घनेन तमसा वृतम् । न विज्ञास्यसि पन्थानं गन्तुं चैव न शक्ष्यसि ।।
data.md: Satyavana said : The forest, enveloped with a dense darkness, has worn a dreadful appearance. You will therefore neither be able to discern the paths nor to go.

data.v: अस्मिन्नद्य वने दग्धे शुष्कवृक्षः स्थितो ज्वलन् । वायुना धम्यमानोऽग्निर्दृश्यतेऽत्र क्वचित्क्वचित् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: There is a withered tree in a burning state in this forest which caught fire today. And the flames stirred up by the wind are seen now and then.

data.v: ततोऽग्निमानयित्वेह ज्वालयिष्यामि सर्वतः । काष्ठानीमानि सन्तीह जहि संतापमात्मनः ।।
data.md: Fetching some fire (from that tree) I will kindle a fire all around. There are plenty of logs here. (So) give up your uneasiness.

data.v: शैब्या च सत्यवांश्चैव सावित्री चैकतः स्थिताः । सर्वैस्तैरभ्यनुज्ञाता विशोकाः समुपाविशन् ।।
data.md: Shaivya, Satyavana and Savitri who all stood on one side, gladly sat down with the permission of them all.

data.v: ततो राज्ञा सहासीनाः सर्वे ते वनवासिनः । जातकौतूहलाः पार्थ पप्रच्छुर्नृपतेः सुतम् ।।
data.md: Then O Partha all those inhabitants of forest, who were seated with the king, actuated by curiosity asked the kings son.

data.v: प्रागेव नागतं कस्मात्सभार्येण त्वया विभो । विरात्रे चागतं कस्मात्कोऽनुबन्धश्च तेऽभवत् ।।
data.md: The Rishis said : O renowned prince, why did you not make your appearance with your wife earlier? Why did you come so late at night? What obstacle stood in your way?

data.v: संतापितः पिता माता वयं चैव नृपात्मज । नाकस्मादिति जानीमस्तत्सर्वं वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: O Prince, we can not make out why you have given so much pain to your father, mother and ourselves also. You ought to relate all this.

data.v: पित्राहमभ्यनुज्ञातः सावित्रीसहितो गतः । अथ मेऽभूच्छिरोदुःखं वने काष्ठानि भिन्दतः ।।
data.md: Satyavana said: Taking leave of my father I went out with Savitri. While cutting down the woods in the forest my head began to ache.

data.v: सुप्तश्चाहं वेदनया चिरमित्युपलक्षये । तावत्कालं च न मया सुप्तपूर्वं कदाचन ।।
data.md: Afflicted with the pain I slept a long while. Thus far only do I remember. Never before did I sleep for so long a time.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव भवतां संतापो मा भवेदिति । अतो विरात्रागमनं नान्यदस्तीह कारणम् ।।
data.md: Considering that you all should not be troubled on my account, I came so late at night. There is no other reason (for my late arrival).

data.v: अकस्माच्चक्षुषः प्राप्तिर्द्युमत्सेनस्य ते पितुः । नास्य त्वं कारणं वेत्थ सावित्री वक्तुमर्हति ।।
data.md: Gautama said: You, then, do not know how your father Dyumatsena has suddenly recovered his eyes. Let, therefore, Savitri relate it.

data.v: श्रोतुमिच्छामि सावित्रि त्वं हि वेत्थ परावरम् । त्वां हि जानामि सावित्रि सावित्रीमिव तेजसा ।।
data.md: We are desirous of learning all this from you who are surely acquainted with the mysteries of good and evil. For, O Savitri, we know you are as resplendent as Savitri herself (the wife of Brahma).

data.v: त्वमत्र हेतुं जानीषे तस्मात्सत्यं निरुच्यताम् । रहस्यं यदि ते नास्ति किंचिदत्र वदस्व नः ।।
data.md: You are (undoubtedly) aware of the cause of this. Therefore speak truly. If you have nothing to conceal, then relate it to us.

data.v: एवमेतद्यथा वेत्थ संकल्पो नान्यथा हि वः । न च किंचिद्रहस्यं मे श्रूयतां तथ्यमत्र यत् ।।
data.md: Savitri said: It is as you know it to be. Your desire can never prove fruitless. I have nothing to conceal from you. Now hear the true cause of this.

data.v: मृत्युर्मे भर्तुराख्यातो नारदेन महात्मना । स चाद्य दिवसः प्राप्तस्ततो नैनं जहाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: The high-souled Narada had fore told the death of my husband. Today being the appointed time, I did not leave his company.

data.v: सुप्तं चैनं यमः साक्षादुपागच्छत्सकिंकरः । स एनमनयद्बद्ध्वा दिशं पितृनिषेविताम् ।।
data.md: When he fell asleep Yama in person together with his attendants approached him and tying him (with the noose) proceeded towards the region inhabited by the Pitris.

data.v: अस्तौषं तमहं देवं सत्येन वचसा विभुम् । पञ्च वै तेन मे दत्ता वराः शृणुत तान्मम ।।
data.md: I then began to eulogise that lord god, with truthful words, who conferred on me five boons. Hear of these (boons) from me.

data.v: चक्षुषी च स्वराज्यं च द्वौ वरौ श्वशुरस्य मे । लब्धं पितुः पुत्रशतं पुत्राणामात्मनः शतम् ।।
data.md: I have obtained two boons for my father-inlaw viz. recovery of his sight and kingdom. I have (further), obtained for my father a hundred sons and an equal number of sons for myself.

data.v: चतुर्वर्षशतायुर्मे भर्ता लब्धश्च सत्यवान् । भर्तुर्हि जीवितार्थं तु मया चीर्णं स्थिरं व्रतम् ।।
data.md: (Again) my husband Satyavana has been blessed with a life of four hundred years. I observed the vow for the sake of my husband's life.

data.v: एतत्सत्यं मयाख्यातं कारणं विस्तरेण वः । यथा वृत्तं सुखोदर्कमिदं दुःखं महन्मम ।।
data.md: I have now faithfully described to you in detail the cause which ultimately turned my great sorrow into a crowing bliss.

data.v: निमज्जमानं व्यसनैरभिद्रुतं; कुलं नरेन्द्रस्य तमोमये ह्रदे । त्वया सुशीले धृतधर्मपुण्यया; समुद्धृतं साध्वि पुनः कुलीनया ।।
data.md: The Rishis said: O chaste girl, you are of gentle disposition, observant of vows, possessed of virtue and have sprung from a noble line. And it is by you that the line of this best of kings, overwhelmed with calamities and drowned in a deep gulf (of obscurity) has, (at last), been rescued.

data.v: तथा प्रशस्य ह्यभिपूज्य चैव ते; वरस्त्रियं तामृषयः समागताः । नरेन्द्रमामन्त्र्य सपुत्रमञ्जसा; शिवेन जग्मुर्मुदिताः स्वमालयम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The assembled sages, then, having eulogised and paid their adorations to that most exalted lady and having taken leave of that most excellent of kings together with his son, soon left for their respective asylums in peace and with merry hearts.

data.v: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामुदिते सूर्यमण्डले । कृतपूर्वाह्णिकाः सर्वे समेयुस्ते तपोधनाः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The night having come to a close, when the sun's disc had appeared (on the horizon), all th 'se ascetius, whose only wealth devotion, having performed their mations, congregated (at the asylum of Dyumatsena).

data.v: तदेव सर्वं सावित्र्या महाभाग्यं महर्षयः । द्युमत्सेनाय नातृप्यन्कथयन्तः पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: was Those great sages were never satisfied in relating again and again of the high fortune of Savitri, to Dyumatsena.

data.v: ततः प्रकृतयः सर्वाः शाल्वेभ्योऽभ्यागता नृप । आचख्युर्निहतं चैव स्वेनामात्येन तं नृपम् ।।
data.md: Then, O king, it so chanced that all the subjects came from Shalva and informed Dyumatsena of the death of his enemy at the hands of his own minister.

data.v: तं मन्त्रिणा हतं श्रुत्वा ससहायं सबान्धवम् । न्यवेदयन्यथातत्त्वं विद्रुतं च द्विषद्बलम् ।।
data.md: And they related to him all that had taken place saying "hearing the death of the usurper together with his friends and allies at the hands of his own minister and of the dispersion of his troops, all the subjects have in one voice declared for you, their legitimate king and they have also said whether you are blind or not you shall be (their) king.

data.v: ऐकमत्यं च सर्वस्य जनस्याथ नृपं प्रति । सचक्षुर्वाप्यचक्षुर्वा स नो राजा भवत्विति ।।
data.md: And they related to him all that had taken place saying "hearing the death of the usurper together with his friends and allies at the hands of his own minister and of the dispersion of his troops, all the subjects have in one voice declared for you, their legitimate king and they have also said whether you are blind or not you shall be (their) king.

data.v: अनेन निश्चयेनेह वयं प्रस्थापिता नृप । प्राप्तानीमानि यानानि चतुरङ्गं च ते बलम् ।।
data.md: O king, we have been dispatched to you on the strength of this determination (on the part of your subjects to install you king). These cars and these four kinds of troops have arrived for you.

data.v: प्रयाहि राजन्भद्रं ते घुष्टस्ते नगरे जयः । अध्यास्स्व चिररात्राय पितृपैतामहं पदम् ।।
data.md: (Therefore), O monarch, do set out. May you prosper. Your restoration has been proclaimed in the city. May you for ever occupy the portion filled by your sire and grandsire."

data.v: चक्षुष्मन्तं च तं दृष्ट्वा राजानं वपुषान्वितम् । मूर्धभिः पतिताः सर्वे विस्मयोत्फुल्ललोचनाः ।।
data.md: And seeing the king restored to sight and healthy, they with their eyes expanded in wonder, bowed down their heads to him.

data.v: ततोऽभिवाद्य तान्वृद्धान्द्विजानाश्रमवासिनः । तैश्चाभिपूजितः सर्वैः प्रययौ नगरं प्रति ।।
data.md: Then the king having greeted all the aged Brahmanas inhabiting the hermitage and in his turn being greeted by them, set out for his capital.

data.v: शैब्या च सह सावित्र्या स्वास्तीर्णेन सुवर्चसा । नरयुक्तेन यानेन प्रययौ सेनया वृता ।।
data.md: And Shaivya together with Savitri surrounded by troops, went in a palanquin, adorned with splendid sheets and carried by men.

data.v: ततोऽभिषिषिचुः प्रीत्या द्युमत्सेनं पुरोहिताः । पुत्रं चास्य महात्मानं यौवराज्येऽभ्यषेचयन् ।।
data.md: Then the priests joyfully installed Dyumatsena as king and his high-souled son as prince regent.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता सावित्र्याः कीर्तिवर्धनम् । तद्वै पुत्रशतं जज्ञे शूराणामनिवर्तिनाम् ।।
data.md: After a long time Savitri was deliver of a hundred heroic and illustrious sons who never retreated from battle.

data.v: भ्रातॄणां सोदराणां च तथैवास्याभवच्छतम् । मद्राधिपस्याश्वपतेर्मालव्यां सुमहाबलम् ।।
data.md: She had also one hundred highly powerful uterine brothers begotten by Ashvapati, the king of Madra, on Malavi.

data.v: एवमात्मा पिता माता श्वश्रूः श्वशुर एव च । भर्तुः कुलं च सावित्र्या सर्वं कृच्छ्रात्समुद्धृतम् ।।
data.md: Thus Savitri rescued from misfortune, her own self, her father, mother-in law, father-inlaw and her husband's line.

data.v: तथैवैषापि कल्याणी द्रौपदी शीलसंमता । तारयिष्यति वः सर्वान्सावित्रीव कुलाङ्गना ।।
data.md: Similarly, the auspicious Draupadi of excellent character, will deliver you all from your misfortune as the virtuous Savitri did.

data.v: एवं स पाण्डवस्तेन अनुनीतो महात्मना । विशोको विज्वरो राजन्काम्यके न्यवसत्तदा ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thus, O monarch, instructed by that highsouled one ((Markandeya), the Pandava (Yudhishthira) devoid of grief and affliction continued to dwell in Kamyaka.

data.v: यत्तत्तदा महाब्रह्मँल्लोमशो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । इन्द्रस्य वचनादेत्य पाण्डुपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम् ।।
यच्चापि ते भयं तीव्रं न च कीर्तयसे क्वचित् । तच्चाप्यपहरिष्यामि सव्यसाचाविहागते ।।
किं नु तद्विदुषां श्रेष्ठ कर्णं प्रति महद्भयम् । आसीन्न च स धर्मात्मा कथयामास कस्यचित् ।।
अहं ते राजशार्दूल कथयामि कथामिमाम् । पृच्छते भरतश्रेष्ठ शुश्रूषस्व गिरं मम ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O best of kings, I will relate that history to you, as asked by you. O best of the Bharatas, listen to my words.

data.v: द्वादशे समतिक्रान्ते वर्षे प्राप्ते त्रयोदशे । पाण्डूनां हितकृच्छक्रः कर्णं भिक्षितुमुद्यतः ।।
data.md: On the expiration of the twelfth year of their forest life when the thirteenth had set in, Shakra, the well-wisher of the Pandavas, resolved to ask Karna for his ear-rings.

data.v: अभिप्रायमथो ज्ञात्वा महेन्द्रस्य विभावसुः । कुण्डलार्थे महाराज सूर्यः कर्णमुपागमत् ।।
data.md: But Vibhavasu (the sun) aware of the intentions of Mahendra about the ear-rings, O mighty Monarch, appeared before Karna.

data.v: महार्हे शयने वीरं स्पर्ध्यास्तरणसंवृते । शयानमभिविश्वस्तं ब्रह्मण्यं सत्यवादिनम् ।।
data.md: And when that truthful hero, devoted to the Brahmanas, was comfortably lying down on a costly bed furnished with a rich sheet.

data.v: स्वप्नान्ते निशि राजेन्द्र दर्शयामास रश्मिवान् । कृपया परयाविष्टः पुत्रस्नेहाच्च भारत ।।
data.md: The resplendent god, the sun, O king of kings, moved with great kindness consequent on paternal affection, showed himself, at night, in a dream, O Bharata.

data.v: ब्राह्मणो वेदविद्भूत्वा सूर्यो योगाद्धि रूपवान् । हितार्थमब्रवीत्कर्णं सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वचः ।।
data.md: And by his devotional power, wearing the shape of a handsome Brahmana, well read in the Vedas, the Sun addressed Karna for his welfare, these sweet words.

data.v: कर्ण मद्वचनं तात शृणु सत्यभृतां वर । ब्रुवतोऽद्य महाबाहो सौहृदात्परमं हितम् ।।
data.md: "O son, O Karna, O foremost of the truthful, O mighty-armed one, listen to these highly beneficial words of mine that I tell you today out of affection for you.

data.v: उपायास्यति शक्रस्त्वां पाण्डवानां हितेप्सया । ब्राह्मणच्छद्मना कर्ण कुण्डलापजिहीर्षया ।।
data.md: O Karna, Shakra with the desire of doing good to the Pandavas will come to you in the disguise of a Brahmana in order to have your ear-rings.

data.v: विदितं तेन शीलं ते सर्वस्य जगतस्तथा । यथा त्वं भिक्षितः सद्भिर्ददास्येव न याचसे ।।
data.md: This noble conduct on your part that when asked by the pious you give away to them whatsoever they ask but never beg, is known to Shakra himself and the world at large.

data.v: त्वं हि तात ददास्येव ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रयाचितः । वित्तं यच्चान्यदप्याहुर्न प्रत्याख्यासि कर्हिचित् ।।
data.md: O son, you bestow on the Brahmanas wealth or any other thing asked by them and never refuses anything to any one.

data.v: तं त्वामेवंविधं ज्ञात्वा स्वयं वै पाकशासनः । आगन्ता कुण्डलार्थाय कवचं चैव भिक्षितुम् ।।
data.md: The vanquisher (of the Asura) Paka, who is well aware of this, will come to you in person, in order to beg your ear-rings and armour.

data.v: तस्मै प्रयाचमानाय न देये कुण्डले त्वया । अनुनेयः परं शक्त्या श्रेय एतद्धि ते परम् ।।
data.md: When he will ask for the ear-rings, you must not part with them but entreat him to the best of your power to make him desist; because that will tend to your greatest good.

data.v: कुण्डलार्थे ब्रुवंस्तात कारणैर्बहुभिस्त्वया । अन्यैर्बहुविधैर्वित्तैः स निवार्यः पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: O son, when he will tell you about the earrings, you will, by showing various reasons, refuse him over and over again and offer him various other sorts of riches.

data.v: रत्नैः स्त्रीभिस्तथा भोगैर्धनैर्बहुविधैरपि । निदर्शनैश्च बहुभिः कुण्डलेप्सुः पुरंदरः ।।
data.md: And you will try to appease Purandara, desirous of getting the ear-rings, by offering gems, women, cows, various sorts of riches and by citing precedents.

data.v: यदि दास्यसि कर्ण त्वं सहजे कुण्डले शुभे । आयुषः प्रक्षयं गत्वा मृत्योर्वशमुपेष्यसि ।।
data.md: If, O Karna, you part with those auspicious ear-rings with which you were born, your life will be shortened and you will be subject to death.

data.v: कवचेन च संयुक्तः कुण्डलाभ्यां च मानद । अवध्यस्त्वं रणेऽरीणामिति विद्धि वचो मम ।।
data.md: O bestower of honours, arrayed in your armour and ear-rings you will be unslayable by your enemies in battle. Know these my words to be certain.

data.v: अमृतादुत्थितं ह्येतदुभयं रत्नसंभवम् । तस्माद्रक्ष्यं त्वया कर्ण जीवितं चेत्प्रियं तव ।।
data.md: These two jewelled ear-rings have derived their origin from ambrosia. Therefore, they should be carefully preserved by you, if you have any love for your life.

data.v: को मामेवं भवान्प्राह दर्शयन्सौहृदं परम् । कामया भगवन्ब्रूहि को भवान्द्विजवेषधृक् ।।
data.md: Karna said: Who are you, that, showing so great an affection for me, are addressing me thus? Tell me, O god, if you desire, who you are in the shape of a Brahmana.

data.v: अहं तात सहस्रांशुः सौहृदात्त्वां निदर्शये । कुरुष्वैतद्वचो मे त्वमेतच्छ्रेयः परं हि ते ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said : O child, I am the god of hundred rays (sun). Out of affection I give you this advice. Act in obedience to my advice as it is highly beneficial to you.

data.v: श्रेय एव ममात्यन्तं यस्य मे गोपतिः प्रभुः । प्रवक्ताद्य हितान्वेषी शृणु चेदं वचो मम ।।
data.md: Karna said : It is (no doubt) highly fortunate for me that the lord god of splendour, desirous of my welfare, speaks to me today. Listen to my words.

data.v: प्रसादये त्वां वरदं प्रणयाच्च ब्रवीम्यहम् । न निवार्यो व्रतादस्मादहं यद्यस्मि ते प्रियः ।।
data.md: I am adoring you, who are the giver of boons and out of love am saying to you this. If I am at all dear to you, I should not be prevented (by you) from observing this vow.

data.v: व्रतं वै मम लोकोऽयं वेत्ति कृत्स्नो विभावसो । यथाहं द्विजमुख्येभ्यो दद्यां प्राणानपि ध्रुवम् ।।
data.md: O Vibhavasu, all the world is aware of this vow on my part that I am surely ever ready to give my very life to the best of Brahmanas.

data.v: यद्यागच्छति शक्रो मां ब्राह्मणच्छद्मनावृतः । हितार्थं पाण्डुपुत्राणां खेचरोत्तम भिक्षितुम् ।।
data.md: If, O best of sky-rangers, Shakra disguised as a Brahmana comes to me to beg (the earrings) for the good of the sons of Pandu, then, O best of the celestials, I will give the car-rings and the excellent armour. In that case my renown which has spread over the three worlds, will not be at a discount.

data.v: दास्यामि विबुधश्रेष्ठ कुण्डले वर्म चोत्तमम् । न मे कीर्तिः प्रणश्येत त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुता ।।
data.md: If, O best of sky-rangers, Shakra disguised as a Brahmana comes to me to beg (the earrings) for the good of the sons of Pandu, then, O best of the celestials, I will give the car-rings and the excellent armour. In that case my renown which has spread over the three worlds, will not be at a discount.

data.v: मद्विधस्यायशस्यं हि न युक्तं प्राणरक्षणम् । युक्तं हि यशसा युक्तं मरणं लोकसंमतम् ।।
data.md: It is not at all proper for men like us to save life by a degrading act. Death coupled with honour and meeting with the approbation of the world is preferable.

data.v: सोऽहमिन्द्राय दास्यामि कुण्डले सह वर्मणा । यदि मां बलवृत्रघ्नो भिक्षार्थमुपयास्यति ।।
data.md: Therefore I will give the ear-rings together with the armour to Indra. If the slayer of Bala and Vritra comes to me to beg.

data.v: हितार्थं पाण्डुपुत्राणां कुण्डले मे प्रयाचितुम् । तन्मे कीर्तिकरं लोके तस्याकीर्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: The ear-rings for the good of the sons of Pandu, then the whole world will be redolent of my fame and will proclaim his infamy.

data.v: वृणोमि कीर्तिं लोके हि जीवितेनापि भानुमन् । कीर्तिमानश्नुते स्वर्गं हीनकीर्तिस्तु नश्यति ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, I long for renown in this world even at the sacrifice of my life. Men having renown attain to heaven while those having none are lost.

data.v: कीर्तिर्हि पुरुषं लोके संजीवयति मातृवत् । अकीर्तिर्जीवितं हन्ति जीवतोऽपि शरीरिणः ।।
data.md: Even like a mother fame keeps people alive; but a man given to in famy is as good as dead even though his frame be not destroyed.

data.v: अयं पुराणः श्लोको हि स्वयं गीतो विभावसो । धात्रा लोकेश्वर यथा कीर्तिरायुर्नरस्य वै ।।
data.md: O Vibhavasu, O lord of the worlds, that fame is the very life of man is evident from the (following) ancient sloka (verse) sung by the creator himself.

data.v: पुरुषस्य परे लोके कीर्तिरेव परायणम् । इह लोके विशुद्धा च कीर्तिरायुर्विवर्धनी ।।
data.md: "In the next world fame leads men to supreme bliss while in this pure fame prolongs life."

data.v: सोऽहं शरीरजे दत्त्वा कीर्तिं प्राप्स्यामि शाश्वतीम् । दत्त्वा च विधिवद्दानं ब्राह्मणेभ्यो यथाविधि ।।
data.md: So, I will win an everlasting renown by giving (my car-rings) born with my body. By duly bestowing on the Brahmanas (gifts) sanctioned by ordinances, by sacrificing my life in battle on performing unachievable feats and by conquering my enemies I will win nothing but fame.

data.v: हुत्वा शरीरं संग्रामे कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । विजित्य वा परानाजौ यशः प्राप्स्यामि केवलम् ।।
भीतानामभयं दत्त्वा संग्रामे जीवितार्थिनाम् । वृद्धान्बालान्द्विजातींश्च मोक्षयित्वा महाभयात् ।।
data.md: By sparing the affrighted in battle who crave their lives and delivering old men, children and the twicc-born ones, from great danger, I will win a great renown in this world and have access to the highest heaven (in the next).

data.v: प्राप्स्यामि परमं लोके यशः स्वर्भानुसूदन । जीवितेनापि मे रक्ष्या कीर्तिस्तद्विद्धि मे व्रतम् ।।
data.md: By sparing the affrighted in battle who crave their lives and delivering old men, children and the twicc-born ones, from great danger, I will win a great renown in this world and have access to the highest heaven (in the next).

data.v: सोऽहं दत्त्वा मघवते भिक्षामेतामनुत्तमाम् । ब्राह्मणच्छद्मिने देव लोके गन्ता परां गतिम् ।।
data.md: Know this to be my solemn determination that I will preserve my fame even at the sacrifice of my very life.

data.v: माहितं कर्ण कार्षीस्त्वमात्मनः सुहृदां तथा । पुत्राणामथ भार्याणामथो मातुरथो पितुः ।।
data.md: Surya said : O Karna, never do such acts as will lead to the injury of your own self, your friends, your sons, your wives, your mother and your father.

data.v: शरीरस्याविरोधेन प्राणिनां प्राणभृद्वर । इष्यते यशसः प्राप्तिः कीर्तिश्च त्रिदिवे स्थिरा ।।
data.md: O best of those that bear life, creatures do not wish to sacrifice their bodies for renown in this world and everlasting fame in heaven.

data.v: यस्त्वं प्राणविरोधेन कीर्तिमिच्छसि शाश्वतीम् । सा ते प्राणान्समादाय गमिष्यति न संशयः ।।
data.md: There is no doubt that the everlasting renown which you long for at the cost of your life, will deprive you of it.

data.v: जीवतां कुरुते कार्यं पिता माता सुतास्तथा । ये चान्ये बान्धवाः केचिल्लोकेऽस्मिन्पुरुषर्षभ । राजानश्च नरव्याघ्र पौरुषेण निबोध तत् ।।
data.md: O most exalted of men, so long as a person is alive, his father, mother, son and other relations in this world are useful to him.

data.v: कीर्तिश्च जीवतः साध्वी पुरुषस्य महाद्युते । मृतस्य कीर्त्या किं कार्यं भस्मीभूतस्य देहिनः । मृतः कीर्तिं न जानाति जीवन्कीर्तिं समश्नुते ।।
data.md: As regards a dead person whose frame has been reduced to ashes, what necessity is there for fame? It is not the dead but living persons that can enjoy fame.

data.v: मृतस्य कीर्तिर्मर्त्यस्य यथा माला गतायुषः । अहं तु त्वां ब्रवीम्येतद्भक्तोऽसीति हितेप्सया ।।
data.md: The fame of a dead person is like a garland (round the neck) of a man whose life is extinct. For the reason that you are a worshipper of mine I am telling you all this for your good,

data.v: भक्तिमन्तो हि मे रक्ष्या इत्येतेनापि हेतुना । भक्तोऽयं परया भक्त्या मामित्येव महाभुज । ममापि भक्तिरुत्पन्ना स त्वं कुरु वचो मम ।।
data.md: And for this further reason that all my devotees should be protected protected by me. Considering, O mighty-amed one, that this person is a great devotee to me, I have been inclined to revere you. Therefore accept my advice.

data.v: अस्ति चात्र परं किंचिदध्यात्मं देवनिर्मितम् । अतश्च त्वां ब्रवीम्येतत्क्रियतामविशङ्कया ।।
data.md: A deep mystery ordained by fate, underlies all this. It is on this account that I am addressing you thus. Act (according to my words) and let no doubts cross your mind.

data.v: देवगुह्यं त्वया ज्ञातुं न शक्यं पुरुषर्षभ । तस्मान्नाख्यामि ते गुह्यं काले वेत्स्यति तद्भवान् ।।
data.md: O best of men, you are not fit to learn this which even the gods do not know. It is why I do not reveal it to you. You will, however know it in time.

data.v: पुनरुक्तं च वक्ष्यामि त्वं राधेय निबोध तत् । मास्मै ते कुण्डले दद्या भिक्षवे वज्रपाणये ।।
data.md: O Radha's son, I am telling you again what I have already said. Pay attention to it. You will by no means give the ear-rings to the wielder of the thunderbolt when he will beg them (of you).

data.v: शोभसे कुण्डलाभ्यां हि रुचिराभ्यां महाद्युते । विशाखयोर्मध्यगतः शशीव विमलो दिवि ।।
data.md: Adorned with your beautiful ear-rings you shine like the moon in the azure sky between the Vishakha constellations, O highly effulgent creature.

data.v: कीर्तिश्च जीवतः साध्वी पुरुषस्येति विद्धि तत् । प्रत्याख्येयस्त्वया तात कुण्डलार्थे पुरंदरः ।।
data.md: Know that fame is useful to a person so long as he is alive. Therefore, O son, you must refuse the lord of the celestials when he will beg the ear-rings.

data.v: शक्या बहुविधैर्वाक्यैः कुण्डलेप्सा त्वयानघ । विहन्तुं देवराजस्य हेतुयुक्तैः पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: O sinless one, you will be able to do away with the eager desire of the lord of the gods for the ear-rings by repeatedly addressing him in various words coupled with reason.

data.v: उपपत्त्युपपन्नार्थैर्माधुर्यकृतभूषणैः । पुरंदरस्य कर्ण त्वं बुद्धिमेतामपानुद ।।
data.md: O Karna, remove the desire of Purandara by sweet and reasonable words consequence. of great

data.v: त्वं हि नित्यं नरव्याघ्र स्पर्धसे सव्यसाचिना । सव्यसाची त्वया चैव युधि शूरः समेष्यति ।।
data.md: O most valiant of men, you always challenge Savyasachi (i.e. Arjuna who can draw the bow with his left hand) and the warlike Savyasachi too, will no doubt, encounter you in battle.

data.v: न तु त्वामर्जुनः शक्तः कुण्डलाभ्यां समन्वितम् । विजेतुं युधि यद्यस्य स्वयमिन्द्रः शरो भवेत् ।।
data.md: But arrayed in your ear-rings Arjuna, even with the assistance of Indra himself shall not be able to defeat you in battle.

data.v: तस्मान्न देये शक्राय त्वयैते कुण्डले शुभे । संग्रामे यदि निर्जेतुं कर्ण कामयसेऽर्जुनम् ।।
data.md: Therefore, O Karna, if you are at all desirous of defeating. Arjuna in battle, do not give your auspicious ear-rings to Shakra.

data.v: भगवन्तमहं भक्तो यथा मां वेत्थ गोपते । तथा परमतिग्मांशो नान्यं देवं कथंचन ।।
data.md: Karna said: O god, O lord of splendour and scorching rays, you are as much aware of my being a worshipper of yours, (as of the fact) that there is nothing which I can not part with.

data.v: न मे दारा न मे पुत्रा न चात्मा सुहृदो न च । तथेष्टा वै सदा भक्त्या यथा त्वं गोपते मम ।।
data.md: By virtue of the reverence that I always feel for you, you are. O lord of splendour, dearer (to me) then my wife, my sons, my own self and my friends.

data.v: इष्टानां च महात्मानो भक्तानां च न संशयः । कुर्वन्ति भक्तिमिष्टां च जानीषे त्वं च भास्कर ।।
data.md: O author of light, you are no doubt aware that high-souled persons cherish a high regard for their devoted worshipper.

data.v: इष्टो भक्तश्च मे कर्णो न चान्यद्दैवतं दिवि । जानीत इति वै कृत्वा भगवानाह मद्धितम् ।।
data.md: Considering that Karna is your devoted worshipper and that he known no other god in heavens, you have given me these instructions.

data.v: भूयश्च शिरसा याचे प्रसाद्य च पुनः पुनः । इति ब्रवीमि तिग्मांशो त्वं तु मे क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: Again with bended head and repeated prayers do I implore you and tell you this. O lord of searching rays, that you will (graciously) pardon me.

data.v: बिभेमि न तथा मृत्योर्यथा बिभ्येऽनृतादहम् । विशेषेण द्विजातीनां सर्वेषां सर्वदा सताम् । प्रदाने जीवितस्यापि न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ।।
data.md: I do not fear death so much as falsehood. Especially for the sake of all the righteous twice-born ones ever, I am ready to sacrifice my life without (the least) hesitation.

data.v: यच्च मामात्थ देव त्वं पाण्डवं फल्गुनं प्रति । व्येतु संतापजं दुःखं तव भास्कर मानसम् । अर्जुनं प्रति मां चैव विजेष्यामि रणेऽर्जुनम् ।।
data.md: As to what you have said to me about the Pandava Falguna. O author light, (I ask you) to dispel your caused by mental uneasiness regarding Arjuna and myself. (Because) I will surely defeat Arjuna in battle.

data.v: तवापि विदितं देव ममाप्यस्त्रबलं महत् । जामदग्न्यादुपात्तं यत्तथा द्रोणान्महात्मनः ।।
data.md: O god, you are no doubt aware of the great strength of my weapons which I have obtained from the son of Jamadagni (i.e. Parashuram) and from the high-souled Drona.

data.v: इदं त्वमनुजानीहि सुरश्रेष्ठ व्रतं मम । भिक्षते वज्रिणे दद्यामपि जीवितमात्मनः ।।
data.md: O best of the gods, permit me now to observe the vow on my part that I may bestow my very life upon the begging wielder of the thunderbolt.

data.v: यदि तात ददास्येते वज्रिणे कुण्डले शुभे । त्वमप्येनमथो ब्रूया विजयार्थं महाबल ।।
data.md: Surya said: O highly-powerful son, if you bestow your beautiful car-rings to the wielder of the sorrow thunderbolt, you should, in order to secure victory, say to him, “O lord of hundred sacrifices, I can only part with my ear-rings under a condition."

data.v: नियमेन प्रदद्यास्त्वं कुण्डले वै शतक्रतोः । अवध्यो ह्यसि भूतानां कुण्डलाभ्यां समन्वितः ।।
अर्जुनेन विनाशं हि तव दानवसूदनः । प्रार्थयानो रणे वत्स कुण्डले ते जिहीर्षति ।।
data.md: As you cannot surely be slain by any creature when furnished with your earrings, so the destroyer of the Danavas, O son, wishing your death at the hands of Arjuna in battle, wants to rob you of your ear-rings.

data.v: स त्वमप्येनमाराध्य सूनृताभिः पुनः पुनः । अभ्यर्थयेथा देवेशममोघार्थं पुरंदरम् ।।
data.md: Worshipping again and again with agreeable and truthful speeches the lord of the celestials, Purandara, the possessor of infallible weapons.

data.v: अमोघां देहि मे शक्तिममित्रविनिबर्हिणीम् । दास्यामि ते सहस्राक्ष कुण्डले वर्म चोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: You will say to him, “O thousand-eyed lord, I will give you the two ear-rings and the excellent armour, if you will bestow on me an infallible dart destructive of enemies."

data.v: इत्येवं नियमेन त्वं दद्याः शक्राय कुण्डले । तया त्वं कर्ण संग्रामे हनिष्यसि रणे रिपून् ।।
data.md: It is under this condition only, O Karna, that you will give your ear-rings to Shakra. Then you will be able to destroy your enemies in battle.

data.v: नाहत्वा हि महाबाहो शत्रूनेति करं पुनः । सा शक्तिर्देवराजस्य शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।।
data.md: O mighty-armed one, that arrow of the lord of the gods does not return to the hand of the person who discharges it, without destroying hundreds and thousands of enemies.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा सहस्रांशुः सहसान्तरधीयत । ततः सूर्याय जप्यान्ते कर्णः स्वप्नं न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Saying this, the lord of thousand rays suddenly became invisible. (The next day) Karna after having performed his devotions told the sun of the dreara.

data.md: And Vrisha (Karna) faithfully related to him everything in detail, viz. his meeting with the sun and the conversation that took place between them during the nighi.

data.md: O daughter, I am aware, that since your very infancy you have been ever attentive to the Brahmanas, all your superiors, all the servants, friends, relations, your mothers and myself. You have a proper regard for every one.

data.md: Surya said: O beautiful damsel of sweet smiles, neither your father, nor your mother nor your superiors are competent to bestow you. May you be happy. Hear what I say.

data.md: O damsel, the term Kanya, derived from the root Kama (to desire) is applied to a maiden, because she desires (in have intercourse with) every body. Therefore, fair-hipped girl of excellent complexion, she is free (to act as she chooses) in this world.

data.v: नाधर्मश्चरितः कश्चित्त्वया भवति भामिनि । अधर्मं कुत एवाहं चरेयं लोककाम्यया ।।
data.md: You will, O beauteous girl, on no account fall away from virtue (by satisfying my desire). How can I, who seek the welfare of everybody commit an act of sin?

data.v: अनावृताः स्त्रियः सर्वा नराश्च वरवर्णिनि । स्वभाव एष लोकानां विकारोऽन्य इति स्मृतः ।।
data.md: O fair complexioned girl, it is the human nature that all men and women should be without restraint. And it is asserted that the contrary (condition) is (its) perversion.

data.v: सा मया सह संगम्य पुनः कन्या भविष्यसि । पुत्रश्च ते महाबाहुर्भविष्यति महायशाः ।।
data.md: You will also remain a virgin even after having held intercourse with me and your son will be of mighty arms and high renown.

data.v: यदि पुत्रो मम भवेत्त्वत्तः सर्वतमोपह । कुण्डली कवची शूरो महाबाहुर्महाबलः ।।
data.md: Kunti said : O dispeller of all darkness, if I have a son by powerful and furnished with a coat-of-mail and ear-rings.

data.v: भविष्यति महाबाहुः कुण्डली दिव्यवर्मभृत् । उभयं चामृतमयं तस्य भद्रे भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Surya said : Gentle maiden, your (son) will be mightyarmed, furnished with ear-rings and an impenetrable and celestials armour made of Amrita.

data.v: यद्येतदमृतादस्ति कुण्डले वर्म चोत्तमम् । मम पुत्रस्य यं वै त्वं मत्त उत्पादयिष्यसि ।।
data.md: Kunti said: If both the ear-rings and the armour of the son you will beget on me, be made of Amrita, then, O god, you may enjoy me, as your worshipful self has said. And may he (the son) be powerful, beautiful, strong energetic and virtuous like you.

data.v: अस्तु मे संगमो देव यथोक्तं भगवंस्त्वया । त्वद्वीर्यरूपसत्त्वौजा धर्मयुक्तो भवेत्स च ।।
data.md: Kunti said: If both the ear-rings and the armour of the son you will beget on me, be made of Amrita, then, O god, you may enjoy me, as your worshipful self has said. And may he (the son) be powerful, beautiful, strong energetic and virtuous like you.

data.v: अदित्या कुण्डले राज्ञि दत्ते मे मत्तकाशिनि । तेऽस्य दास्यामि वै भीरु वर्म चैवेदमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Surya said: O queen, O beauteous and timid damsel, I will bestow on him these ear-rings which were given to me by Aditi and also this excellent armour.

data.v: परमं भगवन्देव संगमिष्ये त्वया सह । यदि पुत्रो भवेदेवं यथा वदसि गोपते ।।
data.md: Kunti said: O adorable one, it is very well. O lord of rays, if I have such a son as you say, then I snall giatify your desire.

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु तां कुन्तीमाविवेश विहंगमः । स्वर्भानुशत्रुर्योगात्मा नाभ्यां पस्पर्श चैव ताम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having said to her "be it so” that ranger of sky, the enemy of Svarbhanu, with his soul absorbed in yoga entered into Kunti and touched her on the naval.

data.v: ततः सा विह्वलेवासीत्कन्या सूर्यस्य तेजसा । पपाताथ च सा देवी शयने मूढचेतना ।।
data.md: Thereupon, that damsel became stupefied by the energy of the sun and fell down on her bed insensible.

data.v: साधयिष्यामि सुश्रोणि पुत्रं वै जनयिष्यसि । सर्वशस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठं कन्या चैव भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: Surya said : O fair-hipped maiden, I shall now disappear. You will give birth to a son who will be the foremost of all wielders of arms.

data.v: ततः सा व्रीडिता बाला तदा सूर्यमथाब्रवीत् । एवमस्त्विति राजेन्द्र प्रस्थितं भूरिवर्चसम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then, O king of kings, that maiden said bashfully to the highly resplendent Surya who was about to go away “may it be so."

data.v: इति स्मोक्ता कुन्तिराजात्मजा सा; विवस्वन्तं याचमाना सलज्जा । तस्मिन्पुण्ये शयनीये पपात; मोहाविष्टा भज्यमाना लतेव ।।
data.md: Thus the daughter of Kuntiraja, having bashfully asked for a son from Vivasvata fell down unconscious on her auspicious bed like a broken creeper.

data.v: तां तिग्मांशुस्तेजसा मोहयित्वा; योगेनाविश्यात्मसंस्थां चकार । न चैवैनां दूषयामास भानुः; संज्ञां लेभे भूय एवाथ बाला ।।
data.md: And that deity of hot rays making her insensible by his energy placed himself within her by his yoga power. But Bhanu did not corrupt her. The girl, then (i.e. when the sun had departed) recovered her senses.

data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then, O lord of the earth, like the lord of the stars in the heavens, Pritha conceived a son on the first day of the lighted fortnight during the tenth month.

data.v: सा बान्धवभयाद्बाला तं गर्भं विनिगूहती । धारयामास सुश्रोणी न चैनां बुबुधे जनः ।।
data.md: That fair-hipped damsel afraid of the censure of her friends concealed her pregnancy, so that no body was aware of her real state.

data.v: न हि तां वेद नार्यन्या काचिद्धात्रेयिकामृते । कन्यापुरगतां बालां निपुणां परिरक्षणे ।।
data.md: And as that girl lived in the apartments of maidens, no other women knew her condition except her nurse's daughter who was wellskilled in ministrations.

data.v: ततः कालेन सा गर्भं सुषुवे वरवर्णिनी । कन्यैव तस्य देवस्य प्रसादादमरप्रभम् ।।
data.md: (And) in time that damsel of excellent complexion by the favour of that god, Surya, was delivered of a son beautiful as a celestials.

data.v: तथैव बद्धकवचं कनकोज्ज्वलकुण्डलम् । हर्यक्षं वृषभस्कन्धं यथास्य पितरं तथा ।।
data.md: And like his father he was clad in armour, adorned with brilliant golden ear-rings, endued with leonine eyes and bovine shoulders.

data.md: And as soon as her delivery took place that girl, in consultation with her nurse, placed her child in a water-proof basket, covered all over with sheets, made of wicker work, smooth, comfortable and furnished with a beautiful pillow. data.md: And as soon as her delivery took place that girl, in consultation with her nurse, placed her child in a water-proof basket, covered all over with sheets, made of wicker work, smooth, comfortable and furnished with a beautiful pillow. data.md: And hear the words which Kunti uttered while she, weeping bitterly, consigned the basket to the waters of the river Ashva.

data.v: स्वस्ति तेऽस्त्वान्तरिक्षेभ्यः पार्थिवेभ्यश्च पुत्रक । दिव्येभ्यश्चैव भूतेभ्यस्तथा तोयचराश्च ये ।।
data.md: "O son, may all the creatures inhabiting the firmament, the earth, the celestials regions and the water contribute to your welfare.

data.md: May all your ways be auspicious and unobstructed. And, O son, may the minds of those that may meet with you, be not inclined to enmity towards you.

data.v: पातु त्वां वरुणो राजा सलिले सलिलेश्वरः । अन्तरिक्षेऽन्तरिक्षस्थः पवनः सर्वगस्तथा ।।
data.md: On the waters may king Varuna, the lord of waters, protect you. And similarly may Pavana (the wind-god) who ranges in the sky and wanders everywhere protect you in the sky.

data.v: पिता त्वां पातु सर्वत्र तपनस्तपतां वरः । येन दत्तोऽसि मे पुत्र दिव्येन विधिना किल ।।
data.md: O son, may your father, the foremost of those that shed heat and by whom you have been begotten on me by the ordinance of Destiny preserve you everywhere.

data.v: आदित्या वसवो रुद्राः साध्या विश्वे च देवताः । मरुतश्च सहेन्द्रेण दिशश्च सदिगीश्वराः ।।
data.md: And may you be protected by the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Sadhyas the Vishvadevas, the Marutas and the cardinal points together with their guardians and Indra.

data.v: रक्षन्तु त्वां सुराः सर्वे समेषु विषमेषु च । वेत्स्यामि त्वां विदेशेऽपि कवचेनोपसूचितम् ।।
data.md: And may all the gods protect you in every state whether favourable or adverse. Even in foreign countries I shall be able to recognise you on account of your coat-of-mail.

data.md: Blessed is indeed your divine father, Bhanu, having effulgence for his wealth, who by means of his celestials sight, beholds you going down the stream.

data.md: And O son of a deity, that lady is also blessed who will adopt you as her son and feed you from her breast when you are thirsty.
