data.md: What a dream she has dreamed who will adopt for her son you who are resplendent as the sun, clad in a celestials armour, adorned with celestials ear-rings, endued with broad and expansive eyes like lotuses, possessed of a complexion bright as the copper-coloured lotus-leaves, graced with a beautiful forehead and beautiful hair.

data.md: What a dream she has dreamed who will adopt for her son you who are resplendent as the sun, clad in a celestials armour, adorned with celestials ear-rings, endued with broad and expansive eyes like lotuses, possessed of a complexion bright as the copper-coloured lotus-leaves, graced with a beautiful forehead and beautiful hair.

data.md: They are also blessed, O son, who will behold you crawl on the ground covered with dust and who will hear your sweet inarticulate speech.

data.md: And, O monarch, accompanied by her nurse the lotus-eyed Pritha desirous of beholding her son again and again and overpowered with grief for her son and weeping piteously, at night.

data.md: Laid the basket (on the waters of the Ashva) and entered into the palace with a heavy heart lest her father might know (the secret).

data.md: Vaishampayana said : At this time one Adhiratha of the Suta tribe and a friend of Dhritarashthra's accompanied by his wife came to the Jahnavi (Ganga).

data.md: O monarch, his wife named Radha was peerless in beauty on earth. That highly fortunate lady had no son.

data.md: And that lady, impelled by curiosity had it seized. She then told all to Adhiratha of the Suta caste.

data.v: वसुवर्मधरं दृष्ट्वा तं बालं हेमकुण्डलम् । नामास्य वसुषेणेति ततश्चक्रुर्द्विजातयः ।।
data.md: The twice-born ones seeing the boy ciad in a golden armour and adorned with golden earrings called him Vasusena.

data.v: एवं स सूतपुत्रत्वं जगामामितविक्रमः । वसुषेण इति ख्यातो वृष इत्येव च प्रभुः ।।
data.md: Thus did the boy of immeasurable strength and splendour come to be known as the son of a charioteer and was styled Vasusena and Vrisha.

data.v: स ज्येष्ठपुत्रः सूतस्य ववृधेऽङ्गेषु वीर्यवान् । चारेण विदितश्चासीत्पृथाया दिव्यवर्मभृत् ।।
data.md: That the powerful child, clad in celestials armour (known as) the eldest son of the charioteer (Adhiratha) was growing up in the country of the Angas, was known to Pritha through her spies.

data.v: सूतस्त्वधिरथः पुत्रं विवृद्धं समये ततः । दृष्ट्वा प्रस्थापयामास पुरं वारणसाह्वयम् ।।
data.md: When the charioteer saw that his son in course of time had grown up, he sent him to the city of Hastina.

data.v: तत्रोपसदनं चक्रे द्रोणस्येष्वस्त्रकर्मणि । सख्यं दुर्योधनेनैवमगच्छत्स च वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: There the powerful youth lived with Drona in order to learn weapons and made friends with Duryodhana.

data.v: द्रोणात्कृपाच्च रामाच्च सोऽस्त्रग्रामं चतुर्विधम् । लब्ध्वा लोकेऽभवत्ख्यातः परमेष्वासतां गतः ।।
data.md: Having obtained from Drona, Kripa and Rama (i.e. Parashurama), all the four kinds of weapons, he (Karna) became celebrated in the world as a great bowman.

data.v: संधाय धार्तराष्ट्रेण पार्थानां विप्रिये स्थितः । योद्धुमाशंसते नित्यं फल्गुनेन महात्मना ।।
data.md: Having contracted a friendship with the son of Dhritarashtra, he became hostile to the Parthas and was always desirous of fighting with the high-souled Falguna.

data.v: सदा हि तस्य स्पर्धासीदर्जुनेन विशां पते । अर्जुनस्य च कर्णेन यतो दृष्टो बभूव सः ।।
data.md: And O lord of the earth, since they first saw each other, he (Karna) challenged Arjuna and Arjuna too challenged him.

data.v: तं तु कुण्डलिनं दृष्ट्वा वर्मणा च समन्वितम् । अवध्यं समरे मत्वा पर्यतप्यद्युधिष्ठिरः ।।
data.md: Seeing that he was furnished with armour and ear-rings, Yudhishthira was much pained thinking that he was unslayable in battle.

data.v: यदा तु कर्णो राजेन्द्र भानुमन्तं दिवाकरम् । स्तौति मध्यंदिने प्राप्ते प्राञ्जलिः सलिले स्थितः ।।
data.md: O king of kings, when at noon Karna rose from the water and worshipped the author of the day possessed of rays with joined palms, the Brahmanas prayed to him for riches. And at that time there was nothing that he would not bestow on the twice-born ones.

data.v: तत्रैनमुपतिष्ठन्ति ब्राह्मणा धनहेतवः । नादेयं तस्य तत्काले किंचिदस्ति द्विजातिषु ।।
data.md: O king of kings, when at noon Karna rose from the water and worshipped the author of the day possessed of rays with joined palms, the Brahmanas prayed to him for riches. And at that time there was nothing that he would not bestow on the twice-born ones.

data.v: तमिन्द्रो ब्राह्मणो भूत्वा भिक्षां देहीत्युपस्थितः । स्वागतं चेति राधेयस्तमथ प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.md: (For this reason) disguised as a Brahmana Indra came to him and said "give me alms." And the son of Radha replied to him "you are welcome."

data.v: देवराजमनुप्राप्तं ब्राह्मणच्छद्मना वृषः । दृष्ट्वा स्वागतमित्याह न बुबोधास्य मानसम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Beholding the king of the celestials disguised as a Brahmana come (to him), (Karna) said "you are right welcome.” But he could not divine his intentions.

data.v: हिरण्यकण्ठीः प्रमदा ग्रामान्वा बहुगोकुलान् । किं ददानीति तं विप्रमुवाचाधिरथिस्ततः ।।
data.md: Then the (adopted) son of Adhiratha said to that Brahmana "Between beautiful damsels adorned with golden necklaces and villages full of cows which shall I give you?”

data.v: हिरण्यकण्ठ्यः प्रमदा यच्चान्यत्प्रीतिवर्धनम् । नाहं दत्तमिहेच्छामि तदर्थिभ्यः प्रदीयताम् ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said : I do not wish to have beauteous damsels with gold necklaces or other agreeable things. Give these (things) to those that beg them.

data.v: यदेतत्सहजं वर्म कुण्डले च तवानघ । एतदुत्कृत्य मे देहि यदि सत्यव्रतो भवान् ।।
data.md: O sinless one, if you truly observe your vow then cut off (from your body) this armour and these ear-rings born with you and bestow them on me.

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं क्षिप्रं त्वया दत्तं परंतप । एष मे सर्वलाभानां लाभः परमको मतः ।।
data.md: O tormentor of foes, I wish you will very soon give them to me, as I consider this one gain to be the best of all others.

data.v: अवनिं प्रमदा गाश्च निर्वापं बहुवार्षिकम् । तत्ते विप्र प्रदास्यामि न तु वर्म न कुण्डले ।।
data.md: Karna said: O Brahmana, I will bestow on you homestead lands, beauteous women, cows and (sufficient) plots of land which will enable you to maintain yourself as long as you live.

data.v: एवं बहुविधैर्वाक्यैर्याच्यमानः स तु द्विजः । कर्णेन भरतश्रेष्ठ नान्यं वरमयाचत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: O best of the Bharatas, though Karna thus entreated that twice-born one with various words, yet he (the Brahmana) did not crave any other boon.

data.v: सान्त्वितश्च यथाशक्ति पूजितश्च यथाविधि । नैवान्यं स द्विजश्रेष्ठः कामयामास वै वरम् ।।
data.md: Though he tried his very best to propitiate him and though he worshipped him duly, yet that best of the twice-born ones did not beg any other boon.

data.v: यदा नान्यं प्रवृणुते वरं वै द्विजसत्तमः । तदैनमब्रवीद्भूयो राधेयः प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.md: When that most exalted of the twice-born ones did not ask for any other boon, the son of Radha then addressed him again with a smile,

data.v: सहजं वर्म मे विप्र कुण्डले चामृतोद्भवे । तेनावध्योऽस्मि लोकेषु ततो नैतद्ददाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: “O Brahmana, by virtue of my coat-of-mail, which I have been born with and of the two ear-rings which have sprung from Amrita, I am indestructible by (all) the worlds. I will not, therefore, part with them.

data.v: विशालं पृथिवीराज्यं क्षेमं निहतकण्टकम् । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व मत्तस्त्वं साधु ब्राह्मणपुंगव ।।
data.md: O most exalted of the Brahmanas, may you be in peace. Accept from me the extensive and peaceful empire of the world with its thorns (enemies) weeded out.

data.v: कुण्डलाभ्यां विमुक्तोऽहं वर्मणा सहजेन च । गमनीयो भविष्यामि शत्रूणां द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: Divested of my ear-rings and the armour with which I was born, Obest of the Brahmanas, I shall be liable to be killed by my enemies.

data.v: यदा नान्यं वरं वव्रे भगवान्पाकशासनः । ततः प्रहस्य कर्णस्तं पुनरित्यब्रवीद्वचः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When the exalted chastiser of the (Asura) Paka did not ask for any other boon, then Karna smilingly said to him again these words.

data.v: विदितो देवदेवेश प्रागेवासि मम प्रभो । न तु न्याय्यं मया दातुं तव शक्र वृथा वरम् ।।
data.md: "O lord, O god of gods, I knew before that you (would come). O Shakra, it is not proper for me to bestow on you a boon uselessly.

data.v: त्वं हि देवेश्वरः साक्षात्त्वया देयो वरो मम । अन्येषां चैव भूतानामीश्वरो ह्यसि भूतकृत् ।।
data.md: (Because) you are the very lord of the celestials. It is for you to confer boons on me as you are the creator and lord of all other creators.

data.v: यदि दास्यामि ते देव कुण्डले कवचं तथा । वध्यतामुपयास्यामि त्वं च शक्रावहास्यताम् ।।
data.md: If, O god, I give you my ear-rings and armour, I shall be liable to be killed and you, too will be an object of ridicule.

data.v: तस्माद्विनिमयं कृत्वा कुण्डले वर्म चोत्तमम् । हरस्व शक्र कामं मे न दद्यामहमन्यथा ।।
data.md: Therefore, O Shakra, take my ear-rings and excellent armour in exchange (for boons to be conferred on me by you). Else I will in no way, give (them to you).

data.v: विदितोऽहं रवेः पूर्वमायन्नेव तवान्तिकम् । तेन ते सर्वमाख्यातमेवमेतन्न संशयः ।।
data.md: Shakra said: Before I came to you, Ravi (the sun) was aware of my intentions. There is no doubt that he has told you all.

data.v: काममस्तु तथा तात तव कर्ण यथेच्छसि । वर्जयित्वा तु मे वज्रं प्रवृणीष्व यदिच्छसि ।।
data.md: O son, O Karna, let it be what you desire, With the exception of my Vajra (thunderbolt) tell me what you desire.

data.v: ततः कर्णः प्रहृष्टस्तु उपसंगम्य वासवम् । अमोघां शक्तिमभ्येत्य वव्रे संपूर्णमानसः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Thereupon, Karna gladly approached Vasava. And desirous of obtaining an infallible dart, he, with his purposes (nearly) gratified spoke.

data.v: वर्मणा कुण्डलाभ्यां च शक्तिं मे देहि वासव । अमोघां शत्रुसंघानां घातनीं पृतनामुखे ।।
data.md: Karna said: In exchange for my armour and ear-rings, O Vasava, bestow on me an infallible dart, destructive of hostile forces when drawn up in battle-array.

data.v: ततः संचिन्त्य मनसा मुहूर्तमिव वासवः । शक्त्यर्थं पृथिवीपाल कर्णं वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon, O lord of the earth, Vasava reflecting a moment with in his mind for the dart, spoke to Karna these words.

data.v: कुण्डले मे प्रयच्छस्व वर्म चैव शरीरजम् । गृहाण कर्ण शक्तिं त्वमनेन समयेन मे ।।
data.md: Bestow on me your ear-rings and the armour born with your body and (then) O Karna, take the dart under the (following) condition.

data.v: अमोघा हन्ति शतशः शत्रून्मम करच्युता । पुनश्च पाणिमभ्येति मम दैत्यान्विनिघ्नतः ।।
data.md: This infallible dart, when I am engaged in slaughtering the Daityas, hurled by my hand kills hundreds of enemies and then returns to my hand.

data.v: सेयं तव करं प्राप्य हत्वैकं रिपुमूर्जितम् । गर्जन्तं प्रतपन्तं च मामेवैष्यति सूतज ।।
data.md: But, O charioteer's son, hurled by your hand, it shall kill one powerful enemy (of yours), roaring and hot as fire and shall then return to me.

data.v: एकमेवाहमिच्छामि रिपुं हन्तुं महाहवे । गर्जन्तं प्रतपन्तं च यतो मम भयं भवेत् ।।
data.md: Karna said: I am desirous of killing in mighty encounter (only) one enemy, roaring and furious, who may strike terror into me.

data.v: एकं हनिष्यसि रिपुं गर्जन्तं बलिनं रणे । त्वं तु यं प्रार्थयस्येकं रक्ष्यते स महात्मना ।।
data.md: Indra said: You will kill one powerful and roaring enemy in battle. But he whom you seek (to kill) is protected by a high-souled being.

data.v: यमाहुर्वेदविद्वांसो वराहमजितं हरिम् । नारायणमचिन्त्यं च तेन कृष्णेन रक्ष्यते ।।
data.md: He is protected by Krishna who is styled by those learned in the Vedas, the unvanquished Boar and the inconceivable Narayana.

data.v: एवमप्यस्तु भगवन्नेकवीरवधे मम । अमोघा प्रवरा शक्तिर्येन हन्यां प्रतापिनम् ।।
data.md: Karna said: Notwithstanding it is so, O adorable one, give me an infallible dart, destructive of a heroic person, wherewith I can kill a mighty (foe).

data.v: उत्कृत्य तु प्रदास्यामि कुण्डले कवचं च ते । निकृत्तेषु च गात्रेषु न मे बीभत्सता भवेत् ।।
data.md: Cutting the ear-rings and the mail from my body, I will give them to you. But let not my limbs, thus wounded, look ugly.

data.v: न ते बीभत्सता कर्ण भविष्यति कथंचन । व्रणश्चापि न गात्रेषु यस्त्वं नानृतमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Indra said: O Karna, since you are are desirous of observing the truth, you will not look ugly nor will there be any scars on your body.

data.v: यादृशस्ते पितुर्वर्णस्तेजश्च वदतां वर । तादृशेनैव वर्णेन त्वं कर्ण भविता पुनः ।।
data.md: O best of speakers, O Karna, you will be again endued with the complexion and energy of your father.

data.v: विद्यमानेषु शस्त्रेषु यद्यमोघामसंशये । प्रमत्तो मोक्ष्यसे चापि त्वय्येवैषा पतिष्यति ।।
data.md: If you hurl this infallible dart maddened with rage when your life is not in danger and when you have other weapons with you, then it shall fall upon yourself.

data.v: संशयं परमं प्राप्य विमोक्ष्ये वासवीमिमाम् । यथा मामात्थ शक्र त्वं सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: Karna said : I tell you truly, O Shakra, that according to your directions I will hurl this Vasavi weapon only when my life is in great jeopardy.

data.v: ततः शक्तिं प्रज्वलितां प्रतिगृह्य विशां पते । शस्त्रं गृहीत्वा निशितं सर्वगात्राण्यकृन्तत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then, O lord of the earth, accepting that blazing dart, Karna began to cut off his body with sharp weapons.

data.v: ततो देवा मानवा दानवाश्च; निकृन्तन्तं कर्णमात्मानमेवम् । दृष्ट्वा सर्वे सिद्धसंघाश्च नेदु;र्न ह्यस्यासीद्दुःखजो वै विकारः ।।
data.md: The gods, the mortals and the Danavas, seeing Karna cut off his own body, began to roar like lions, because no signs of contortions were visible on his face.

data.v: ततो दिव्या दुन्दुभयः प्रणेदुः; पपातोच्चैः पुष्पवर्षं च दिव्यम् । दृष्ट्वा कर्णं शस्त्रसंकृत्तगात्रं; मुहुश्चापि स्मयमानं नृवीरम् ।।
data.md: Seeing that hero among men, Karna, smile again and again even while cutting off his body, the celestials drums began to sound and celestials flowers were showered (upon his head).

data.v: ततश्छित्त्वा कवचं दिव्यमङ्गा;त्तथैवार्द्रं प्रददौ वासवाय । तथोत्कृत्य प्रददौ कुण्डले ते; वैकर्तनः कर्मणा तेन कर्णः ।।
data.md: Then Karna cutting off his excellent mail from his body, when it was still wet, gave it to Vasava, And he also cut off his ear-rings from his ear and give them to him. It is on this account that he was styled Karna.

data.v: ततः शक्रः प्रहसन्वञ्चयित्वा; कर्णं लोके यशसा योजयित्वा । कृतं कार्यं पाण्डवानां हि मेने; ततः पश्चाद्दिवमेवोत्पपात ।।
data.md: Thus deceiving Karna but making him famous in the world, Shakra smilingly considered that he had accomplished the purpose of the Pandavas. He then soared to the heavens.

data.v: श्रुत्वा कर्णं मुषितं धार्तराष्ट्रा; दीनाः सर्वे भग्नदर्पा इवासन् । तां चावस्थां गमितं सूतपुत्रं; श्रुत्वा पार्था जहृषुः काननस्थाः ।।
data.md: Hearing that Karna was thus deceived, all the sons of Dhritarashtra were dejected and became (as dispirited) as if their pride was wounded. The Parthas, (on the other hand) hearing that the son of Suta was reduced to such a state rejoiced (greatly).

data.v: क्वस्था वीराः पाण्डवास्ते बभूवुः; कुतश्चैतच्छ्रुतवन्तः प्रियं ते । किं वाकार्षुर्द्वादशेऽब्दे व्यतीते; तन्मे सर्वं भगवान्व्याकरोतु ।।
data.md: Janamejaya said : Where did the heroic Pandavas dwell (at that time) and from whom did they receive this joyful news and what did they do after the twelve years of their exile? O adorable one, relate all this to me.

data.v: लब्ध्वा कृष्णां सैन्धवं द्रावयित्वा; विप्रैः सार्धं काम्यकादाश्रमात्ते । मार्कण्डेयाच्छ्रुतवन्तः पुराणं; देवर्षीणां चरितं विस्तरेण ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Those heroic men having rescued Krishna, chastised the chief of the Sindhus, heard from Markandeya the old storied about the celestials and the Rishis and passed the entire period of their painful forest life, returned from their hermitage in Kamyaka to the sacred Dvaiytavana together with the Brahmanas, their cars, followers, charioteers, the citizens (who had followed them to the forest) and their COWS.

data.md: The Yaksha asked What is the crowning refuge of religion? What of renown? What is the highest refuge of heaven and what of happiness?

data.v: किं स्विदात्मा मनुष्यस्य किं स्विद्दैवकृतः सखा । उपजीवनं किं स्विदस्य किं स्विदस्य परायणम् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha asked What is the soul of a man? Who is that friend given to him by Destiny? What is his chief support and what is his best refuge?

data.v: पुत्र आत्मा मनुष्यस्य भार्या दैवकृतः सखा । उपजीवनं च पर्जन्यो दानमस्य परायणम् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha asked What is the soul of a man? Who is that friend given to him by Destiny? What is his chief support and what is his best refuge?

data.v: धन्यानामुत्तमं किं स्विद्धनानां किं स्विदुत्तमम् । लाभानामुत्तमं किं स्वित्किं सुखानां तथोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha asked What is the best of all praise-worthy objects? What is the best of all sorts of wealth? What is the most important of all gains? And what is the best of all kinds of happiness?

data.v: धन्यानामुत्तमं दाक्ष्यं धनानामुत्तमं श्रुतम् । लाभानां श्रेष्ठमारोग्यं सुखानां तुष्टिरुत्तमा ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira replied Skillfulness is the best of all praise-worthy objects. Knowledge (of the (Vedas) is the best of all (sorts of) wealth. Of all gain health is the most important one. And of all (sorts of) happiness contentment is the best.

data.v: कश्च धर्मः परो लोके कश्च धर्मः सदाफलः । किं नियम्य न शोचन्ति कैश्च संधिर्न जीर्यते ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: What is the greatest virtue in the world? What religion always bears fruits? What is that controlling which (men) never experience misery? With whom does friendship never break:

data.v: आनृशंस्यं परो धर्मस्त्रयीधर्मः सदाफलः । मनो यम्य न शोचन्ति सद्भिः संधिर्न जीर्यते ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: What is the greatest virtue in the world? What religion always bears fruits? What is that controlling which (men) never experience misery? With whom does friendship never break:

data.v: किं नु हित्वा प्रियो भवति किं नु हित्वा न शोचति । किं नु हित्वार्थवान्भवति किं नु हित्वा सुखी भवेत् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha asked What is it, the renunciation of which makes one dear? What is that which if given up, does not lead to misery? What is that renouncing which one become wealthy? And what is it the renunciation of which makes one happy?

data.v: मानं हित्वा प्रियो भवति क्रोधं हित्वा न शोचति । कामं हित्वार्थवान्भवति लोभं हित्वा सुखी भवेत् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha asked What is it, the renunciation of which makes one dear? What is that which if given up, does not lead to misery? What is that renouncing which one become wealthy? And what is it the renunciation of which makes one happy?

data.v: मृतः कथं स्यात्पुरुषः कथं राष्ट्रं मृतं भवेत् । श्राद्धं मृतं कथं च स्यात्कथं यज्ञो मृतो भवेत् ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said : Why is a person regarded as dead? Is it for what that a kingdom becomes dead? And for what does a sacrifice become dead?

data.v: मृतो दरिद्रः पुरुषो मृतं राष्ट्रमराजकम् । मृतमश्रोत्रियं श्राद्धं मृतो यज्ञस्त्वदक्षिणः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira replied A poor person (though alive) is (considered as) dead. A kingdom without the king becomes dead. A Shraddha celebrated by an ignorant priest becomes dead. And a sacrifice in which nothing is given away is (as good as) dead.

data.v: का दिक्किमुदकं प्रोक्तं किमन्नं पार्थ किं विषम् । श्राद्धस्य कालमाख्याहि ततः पिब हरस्व च ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: What is the direction (i.e. the path one should follow)? What is spoken of as water, what, as food and what, as poison? Relate what is the (proper) time of a Shraddha and then drink and carry away water,

data.v: सन्तो दिग्जलमाकाशं गौरन्नं प्रार्थना विषम् । श्राद्धस्य ब्राह्मणः कालः कथं वा यक्ष मन्यसे ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : It is the righteous that are the direction (i.e. one should follow in the foot steps of the virtuous). The firmament is spoken of as water, the cow as food and request as poison. A Brahmana is the (proper) time for a Shraddha as (i.e. there is no special time for a Shraddha. It may be celebrated whenever an able priest can be secured). O Yaksha, what is your opinion?

data.v: व्याख्याता मे त्वया प्रश्ना याथातथ्यं परंतप । पुरुषं त्विदानीमाख्याहि यश्च सर्वधनी नरः ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: O tormentor of foes, you have rightly answered all my questions. Now relate to me who can be called a man and what man is enriched with all sorts of wealth.

data.v: दिवं स्पृशति भूमिं च शब्दः पुण्यस्य कर्मणः । यावत्स शब्दो भवति तावत्पुरुष उच्यते ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : The report of a man's meritorious deeds reaches both heaven and earth. And so long as that report continues, he is called a man.

data.v: तुल्ये प्रियाप्रिये यस्य सुखदुःखे तथैव च । अतीतानागते चोभे स वै सर्वधनी नरः ।।
data.md: The man to whom the agreeable and the disagreeable, happiness and misery the past and the future are all alike, is enriched with all sorts of wealth.

data.v: व्याख्यातः पुरुषो राजन्यश्च सर्वधनी नरः । तस्मात्तवैको भ्रातॄणां यमिच्छसि स जीवतु ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: O king, you have (truly) related as to what erson is possessed of all sorts of wealth. Therefore, one of your brothers whomever you wish, be restored to life.

data.v: श्यामो य एष रक्ताक्षो बृहच्छाल इवोद्गतः । व्यूढोरस्को महाबाहुर्नकुलो यक्ष जीवतु ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : O Yaksha, let this Nakula, having dark complexion, red eyes, towering as a sala tree, endued with broad chest and long arms, be brought back to life.

data.v: प्रियस्ते भीमसेनोऽयमर्जुनो वः परायणम् । स कस्मान्नकुलं राजन्सापत्नं जीवमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said : This Bhimasena is (very) dear to you and this Arjuna is your chief support. Why then, O king, do you desire for the life of Nakula, who is only a step brother of yours?

data.v: यस्य नागसहस्रेण दशसंख्येन वै बलम् । तुल्यं तं भीममुत्सृज्य नकुलं जीवमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Why do you, leaving out of consideration Bhima, endued with the strength of ten thousand elephants, desire Nakula to be restored to life?

data.v: तथैनं मनुजाः प्राहुर्भीमसेनं प्रियं तव । अथ केनानुभावेन सापत्नं जीवमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: They say that Bhimasena is very dear to you. On what consideration, then do you desire for the life of a step brother?

data.v: यस्य बाहुबलं सर्वे पाण्डवाः समुपाश्रिताः । अर्जुनं तमपाहाय नकुलं जीवमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Why do you, forsaking Arjuna the strength of whose arms is worshipped by all the Pandavas, wish Nakula to revive?

data.v: आनृशंस्यं परो धर्मः परमार्थाच्च मे मतम् । आनृशंस्यं चिकीर्षामि नकुलो यक्ष जीवतु ।।
data.md: Refraining from cruelty is the greater virtue and in my opinion greater than the greatest desirable object. I prefer that virtue, viz., refraining from cruelty. Let, O Yaksha, therefore, Nakula be alive.

data.v: धर्मशीलः सदा राजा इति मां मानवा विदुः । स्वधर्मान्न चलिष्यामि नकुलो यक्ष जीवतु ।।
data.md: People know that, king (Yudhishthira) is always given to virtue. I will never swerve from my duty. Therefore, O Yaksha, let Nakula revive.

data.v: यथा कुन्ती तथा माद्री विशेषो नास्ति मे तयोः । मातृभ्यां सममिच्छामि नकुलो यक्ष जीवतु ।।
data.md: As Kunti is to me, so also is Madri. I do not make any distinction between them. I desire to behave equally towards my two mothers, Therefore, O Yaksha, let Nakula be brought back to life.

data.v: यस्य तेऽर्थाच्च कामाच्च आनृशंस्यं परं मतम् । तस्मात्ते भ्रातरः सर्वे जीवन्तु भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: O best of the Bharatas, since abstention from cruelty is, in your opinion, superior to both profit and desire, let, therefore all your brothers be restored to life.

data.v: ततस्ते यक्षवचनादुदतिष्ठन्त पाण्डवाः । क्षुत्पिपासे च सर्वेषां क्षणे तस्मिन्व्यगच्छताम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then, at the words of the Yaksha the Pandavas rose up and their hunger and thirst forsook them in a short time.

data.v: सरस्येकेन पादेन तिष्ठन्तमपराजितम् । पृच्छामि को भवान्देवो न मे यक्षो मतो भवान् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: I ask you, who stand on one leg in the lake and who are unconquerable, what god you are. I can not believe that you are a Yaksha.

data.v: वसूनां वा भवानेको रुद्राणामथ वा भवान् । अथ वा मरुतां श्रेष्ठो वज्री वा त्रिदशेश्वरः ।।
data.md: Are you the best of the Marutas or the Rudras or the lord of the celestials, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

data.v: मम हि भ्रातर इमे सहस्रशतयोधिनः । न तं योगं प्रपश्यामि येन स्युर्विनिपातिताः ।।
data.md: Each of these my brothers is able to fight a thousand warriors and I do not find any warrior capable of destroying them all.

data.v: सुखं प्रतिविबुद्धानामिन्द्रियाण्युपलक्षये । स भवान्सुहृदस्माकमथ वा नः पिता भवान् ।।
data.md: Their organs of sense indicate as if they have awakened from an agreeable slumber. Are you a friend of ours or are you our father himself?

data.v: अहं ते जनकस्तात धर्मो मृदुपराक्रम । त्वां दिदृक्षुरनुप्राप्तो विद्धि मां भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: O child, I am your father Dharma of great strength. Know, O best of the Bharatas, that I have come with the intention on seeing you.

data.v: यशः सत्यं दमः शौचमार्जवं ह्रीरचापलम् । दानं तपो ब्रह्मचर्यमित्येतास्तनवो मम ।।
data.md: Fame, truth, self-control, purity, simplicity, modesty steadiness, charity, asceticism and Brahmacharya are my limbs.

data.v: अहिंसा समता शान्तिस्तपः शौचममत्सरः । द्वाराण्येतानि मे विद्धि प्रियो ह्यसि सदा मम ।।
data.md: Know that absence of cruelty, impartiality, peacefulness, asceticism, purity and want of pride are the (so many) avenues (of attaining to me). You are always (very) dear to me.

data.v: दिष्ट्या पञ्चसु रक्तोऽसि दिष्ट्या ते षट्पदी जिता । द्वे पूर्वे मध्यमे द्वे च द्वे चान्ते सांपरायिके ।।
data.md: It is by good fortune that you are given to the (practice of the) five (virtues namely, equanimity of the mind, self-control, abstenance from sensual indulgence, forgiveness and Yoga). You have by good luck conquered the six (i.e. hunger and thirst, sorrow, delusion, decrepitude and death). (Of these six the first) two show themselves in the first stage of life; the second two in the middle stage and the third two in the last part in order to make creatures go to the next world.

data.v: धर्मोऽहमस्मि भद्रं ते जिज्ञासुस्त्वामिहागतः । आनृशंस्येन तुष्टोऽस्मि वरं दास्यामि तेऽनघ ।।
data.md: I am Dharma, May you be in bliss. I came here to test you and have been pleased with your spirit of mercy. O sinless one, I will give you boons.

data.v: वरं वृणीष्व राजेन्द्र दाता ह्यस्मि तवानघ । ये हि मे पुरुषा भक्ता न तेषामस्ति दुर्गतिः ।।
data.md: O foremost of kings, crave boons, O sinless one, I will bestow them on you. Those persons that are devoted to me never experience misfortune.

data.v: अरणीसहितं यस्य मृग आदाय गच्छति । तस्याग्नयो न लुप्येरन्प्रथमोऽस्तु वरो मम ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: May the Agni of the Brahmana whose firesticks are being carried away by that deer, be not destroyed. This the first boon that I crave.

data.v: अरणीसहितं तस्य ब्राह्मणस्य हृतं मया । मृगवेषेण कौन्तेय जिज्ञासार्थं तव प्रभो ।।
data.md: The Yaksha said: O effulgent son of Kunti, it was in order to test you that I, in the shape of a deer, carried off the fire sticks of that Brahmana.

data.v: ददानीत्येव भगवानुत्तरं प्रत्यपद्यत । अन्यं वरय भद्रं ते वरं त्वममरोपम ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon, that exalted one replied “ I give (you this boon). Be blessed. Do you who are like an immortal ask for another boon.

data.v: वर्षाणि द्वादशारण्ये त्रयोदशमुपस्थितम् । तत्र नो नाभिजानीयुर्वसतो मनुजाः क्वचित् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: The twelve years O our forest life have passed away and the thirteenth is come. May no man recognise us in the course of this year wherever we may live.

data.v: ददानीत्येव भगवानुत्तरं प्रत्यपद्यत । भूयश्चाश्वासयामास कौन्तेयं सत्यविक्रमम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon, that exalted one replied “ I give (you this boon). Be blessed. Do you who are like an immortal ask for another boon.

data.v: यद्यपि स्वेन रूपेण चरिष्यथ महीमिमाम् । न वो विज्ञास्यते कश्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत ।।
data.md: "O Bharata, even if you wander in the world in your own proper shapes, no one in the three worlds shall be able to recognize you.

data.v: वर्षं त्रयोदशं चेदं मत्प्रसादात्कुरूद्वहाः । विराटनगरे गूढा अविज्ञाताश्चरिष्यथ ।।
data.md: Through my favour, O perpetuator of the Kuru race, you will lead a secret and incognito life in the city of Virata during this thirteenth year.

data.v: यद्वः संकल्पितं रूपं मनसा यस्य यादृशम् । तादृशं तादृशं सर्वे छन्दतो धारयिष्यथ ।।
data.md: And whatever shape every one of you desires in his mind to assume, he will be able to wear (that form) at will.

data.v: अरणीसहितं चेदं ब्राह्मणाय प्रयच्छत । जिज्ञासार्थं मया ह्येतदाहृतं मृगरूपिणा ।।
data.md: Now give to that Brahmana these fire-sticks which I carried away in the shape of a deer in order to test you.

data.v: तृतीयं गृह्यतां पुत्र वरमप्रतिमं महत् । त्वं हि मत्प्रभवो राजन्विदुरश्च ममांशभाक् ।।
data.md: O son, accept a third great and unparalleled boon. O king, you have been begotten by me and Vidura is born of a portion of mine.

data.v: देवदेवो मया दृष्टो भवान्साक्षात्सनातनः । यं ददासि वरं तुष्टस्तं ग्रहीष्याम्यहं पितः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : You are the god of gods. It is enough that I have seen you in our own shape. I will, O father, accept whatsoever boon you may be pleased to grant me.

data.v: जयेयं लोभमोहौ च क्रोधं चाहं सदा विभो । दाने तपसि सत्ये च मनो मे सततं भवेत् ।।
data.md: O adorable one, may I always get the better of avarice, folly and anger and may my mind be always inclined towards charity, asceticism and truth.

data.v: उपपन्नो गुणैः सर्वैः स्वभावेनासि पाण्डव । भवान्धर्मः पुनश्चैव यथोक्तं ते भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Dharma said: You are by nature gifted with all those virtues, O Pandava. You are (the very embodiment of) Virtue (itself) However, may you again have what you desire.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वान्तर्दधे धर्मो भगवाँल्लोकभावनः । समेताः पाण्डवाश्चैव सुखसुप्ता मनस्विनः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Saying this, the adorable Dharma, whom all the worlds pay homage to, disappeared. And the magnanimous sons of Pandu were joined together after they had enjoyed and agreeable sleep.

data.v: अभ्येत्य चाश्रमं वीराः सर्व एव गतक्लमाः । आरणेयं ददुस्तस्मै ब्राह्मणाय तपस्विने ।।
data.md: All those heroes, free from fatigue, arriving. at the hermitage gave to that ascetic Brahmana his fire-sticks.

data.v: इदं समुत्थानसमागमं मह;त्पितुश्च पुत्रस्य च कीर्तिवर्धनम् । पठन्नरः स्याद्विजितेन्द्रियो वशी; सपुत्रपौत्रः शतवर्षभाग्भवेत् ।।
data.md: The man who reads this great and fameenhancing story of the restoration to life (of the Pandavas) and the meeting of the father and the son (i.e. Dharma and Yudhishthira) becomes self controlled, obtains masters over the passions, is blessed with sons and grandsons and lives to a hundred years.

data.v: न चाप्यधर्मे न सुहृद्विभेदने; परस्वहारे परदारमर्शने । कदर्यभावे न रमेन्मनः सदा; नृणां सदाख्यानमिदं विजानताम् ।।
data.md: Those men that thoroughly apprehend this story are never inclined towards unrighteousness, breaking friendships, misappropriating other peoples property or violating other peoples wives and they never indulge in vile thoughts.

data.v: धर्मेण तेऽभ्यनुज्ञाताः पाण्डवाः सत्यविक्रमाः । अज्ञातवासं वत्स्यन्तश्छन्ना वर्षं त्रयोदशम् । उपोपविश्य विद्वांसः सहिताः संशितव्रताः ।।

data.md: Bhima said O Bharata, I shall present myself before the king Virata, calling myself a cook, named Ballava. This is my intention.

data.v: सूपानस्य करिष्यामि कुशलोऽस्मि महानसे । कृतपूर्वाणि यैरस्य व्यञ्जनानि सुशिक्षितैः । तानप्यभिभविष्यामि प्रीतिं संजनयन्नहम् ।।
आहरिष्यामि दारूणां निचयान्महतोऽपि च । तत्प्रेक्ष्य विपुलं कर्म राजा प्रीतो भविष्यति ।।
द्विपा वा बलिनो राजन्वृषभा वा महाबलाः । विनिग्राह्या यदि मया निग्रहीष्यामि तानपि ।।
ये च केचिन्नियोत्स्यन्ति समाजेषु नियोधकाः । तानहं निहनिष्यामि प्रीतिं तस्य विवर्धयन् ।।
न त्वेतान्युध्यमानान्वै हनिष्यामि कथंचन । तथैतान्पातयिष्यामि यथा यास्यन्ति न क्षयम् ।।
आरालिको गोविकर्ता सूपकर्ता नियोधकः । आसं युधिष्ठिरस्याहमिति वक्ष्यामि पृच्छतः ।।
data.md: On being asked, I shall say, “Formerly I was the cook, subduer of animals, maker of curries and wrestler of Yudhishthira. O lord of me, in whatever direction I shall went my way I shall take care of my own person. This much I promise.

data.v: आत्मानमात्मना रक्षंश्चरिष्यामि विशां पते । इत्येतत्प्रतिजानामि विहरिष्याम्यहं यथा ।।
data.md: On being asked, I shall say, “Formerly I was the cook, subduer of animals, maker of curries and wrestler of Yudhishthira. O lord of me, in whatever direction I shall went my way I shall take care of my own person. This much I promise.

data.v: यमग्निर्ब्राह्मणो भूत्वा समागच्छन्नृणां वरम् । दिधक्षुः खाण्डवं दावं दाशार्हसहितं पुरा ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said What work will Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, perform, who is mighty, long armed, invincible, the foremost of men, and the joy of Kurus, and before whom formerly the fire-god, desirous of consuming the Khandava forest, appeared in the guise of a Brahmana.

data.v: महाबलं महाबाहुमजितं कुरुनन्दनम् । सोऽयं किं कर्म कौन्तेयः करिष्यति धनंजयः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said What work will Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, perform, who is mighty, long armed, invincible, the foremost of men, and the joy of Kurus, and before whom formerly the fire-god, desirous of consuming the Khandava forest, appeared in the guise of a Brahmana.

data.v: योऽयमासाद्य तं दावं तर्पयामास पावकम् । विजित्यैकरथेनेन्द्रं हत्वा पन्नगराक्षसान् । श्रेष्ठः प्रतियुधां नाम सोऽर्जुनः किं करिष्यति ।।
data.md: What work will be performed by the best of dualists Arjuna, who having ascended the single chariot with Krishna, repaired to the forest and gratified the fire god after defeating and destroying the Pannagas and Rakshasas and who carried off the sister of the serpentking named Vasuki.

data.v: सूर्यः प्रतपतां श्रेष्ठो द्विपदां ब्राह्मणो वरः । आशीविषश्च सर्पाणामग्निस्तेजस्विनां वरः ।।
आयुधानां वरो वज्रः ककुद्मी च गवां वरः । ह्रदानामुदधिः श्रेष्ठः पर्जन्यो वर्षतां वरः ।।
धृतराष्ट्रश्च नागानां हस्तिष्वैरावतो वरः । पुत्रः प्रियाणामधिको भार्या च सुहृदां वरा ।।
यथैतानि विशिष्टानि जात्यां जात्यां वृकोदर । एवं युवा गुडाकेशः श्रेष्ठः सर्वधनुष्मताम् ।।
सोऽयमिन्द्रादनवरो वासुदेवाच्च भारत । गाण्डीवधन्वा श्वेताश्वो बीभत्सुः किं करिष्यति ।।
data.md: What office will be performed by Bibhatsu of great splendour, whose bow is Gandiva, and whose chariot is drawn by white horses and who is in no way inferior to Indra or Vasudeva himself?

data.v: उषित्वा पञ्च वर्षाणि सहस्राक्षस्य वेश्मनि । दिव्यान्यस्त्राण्यवाप्तानि देवरूपेण भास्वता ।।
यं मन्ये द्वादशं रुद्रमादित्यानां त्रयोदशम् । यस्य बाहू समौ दीर्घौ ज्याघातकठिनत्वचौ । दक्षिणे चैव सव्ये च गवामिव वहः कृतः ।।
हिमवानिव शैलानां समुद्रः सरितामिव । त्रिदशानां यथा शक्रो वसूनामिव हव्यवाट् ।।
मृगाणामिव शार्दूलो गरुडः पततामिव । वरः संनह्यमानानामर्जुनः किं करिष्यति ।।
प्रतिज्ञां षण्ढकोऽस्मीति करिष्यामि महीपते । ज्याघातौ हि महान्तौ मे संवर्तुं नृप दुष्करौ ।।
data.md: Arjuna said O ruler of the earth, I shall declare myself to be one of the neuter sex, but O king, it is very difficult to conceal the big strokes of the bow-string on my arms.

data.v: कर्णयोः प्रतिमुच्याहं कुण्डले ज्वलनोपमे । वेणीकृतशिरा राजन्नाम्ना चैव बृहन्नडा ।।
पठन्नाख्यायिकां नाम स्त्रीभावेन पुनः पुनः । रमयिष्ये महीपालमन्यांश्चान्तःपुरे जनान् ।।
data.md: Having worn rings shining as fire on my ears and conch-bangles on my wrist, and dressing my hair in a bread on my head and taking the name of Brihannala I shall, O king, appear as one of the third sex, and please the king and others in the seraglio by reciting stories often and often as becomes a female.

data.v: गीतं नृत्तं विचित्रं च वादित्रं विविधं तथा । शिक्षयिष्याम्यहं राजन्विराटभवने स्त्रियः ।।
data.md: O king, I shall instruct the ladies of Virata's house in singing, delightful dancing and also in musical performances of sundry sorts.

data.v: प्रजानां समुदाचारं बहु कर्मकृतं वदन् । छादयिष्यामि कौन्तेय माययात्मानमात्मना ।।
data.md: And in reciting various good deeds and customs of people, I shall, O son of Kunti, conceal myself in disguise.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य गेहेऽस्मि द्रौपद्याः परिचारिका । उषितास्मीति वक्ष्यामि पृष्टो राज्ञा च भारत ।।
data.md: O Pandava, on being asked by the king I shall say “I lived as a waiting maid of Draupadi in the palace of Yudhishthira.

data.v: एतेन विधिना छन्नः कृतकेन यथा नलः । विहरिष्यामि राजेन्द्र विराटभवने सुखम् ।।
data.md: O great king, hiding myself by this counterfeiting means as fire is concealed by ashes, I shall happily pass my days in the palace of Virata.

data.v: किं त्वं नकुल कुर्वाणस्तत्र तात चरिष्यसि । सुकुमारश्च शूरश्च दर्शनीयः सुखोचितः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said O Nakula, tender, heroic, graceful and accustomed to pleasurable pursuits as you are, what work will you do in the dominion of Virata, tell me that.

data.v: अश्वबन्धो भविष्यामि विराटनृपतेरहम् । ग्रन्थिको नाम नाम्नाहं कर्मैतत्सुप्रियं मम ।।
data.md: Nakula said I shall be the keeper of the horses of king Virata; I possess thorough knowledge of the business, and am expert in the tending of them,

data.v: कुशलोऽस्म्यश्वशिक्षायां तथैवाश्वचिकित्सिते । प्रियाश्च सततं मेऽश्वाः कुरुराज यथा तव ।।
ये मामामन्त्रयिष्यन्ति विराटनगरे जनाः । तेभ्य एवं प्रवक्ष्यामि विहरिष्याम्यहं यथा ।।
data.md: O king of the Kurus, horses are even dear to me as they are to you. Those who will question me in the city of the Virat will be thus told by me. "Formerly I was placed by Yudhishthira in charge of his horses. O ruler of the earth, I shall thus disguised go about in the city of Virata.

data.v: सहदेव कथं तस्य समीपे विहरिष्यसि । किं वा त्वं तात कुर्वाणः प्रच्छन्नो विचरिष्यसि ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said O Sahadeva, how will you appear before him or what work will you do so that you may walk about undiscovered.

data.v: गोसंख्याता भविष्यामि विराटस्य महीपतेः । प्रतिषेद्धा च दोग्धा च संख्याने कुशलो गवाम् ।।
data.md: Sahadeva said I shall be the counter of the cows of the king Virata; I am skilled in taming, milking and counting them.

data.v: तन्तिपाल इति ख्यातो नाम्ना विदितमस्तु ते । निपुणं च चरिष्यामि व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ।।
data.md: Denominated as Tantipala and by that name I shall clearly do my duty. Let your mental anxiety be dispelled.

data.v: अहं हि भवता गोषु सततं प्रकृतः पुरा । तत्र मे कौशलं कर्म अवबुद्धं विशां पते ।।
data.md: Very often was I formerly employed by you in looking after your cows. O Lord of the earth, all the arts that the business involves are known to me.

data.v: लक्षणं चरितं चापि गवां यच्चापि मङ्गलम् । तत्सर्वं मे सुविदितमन्यच्चापि महीपते ।।
data.md: 0 ruler of the earth, the nature, the characteristics and the favorable marks and other points regarding cows are well known to me.

data.v: वृषभानपि जानामि राजन्पूजितलक्षणान् । येषां मूत्रमुपाघ्राय अपि वन्ध्या प्रसूयते ।।
data.md: I also know the bulls bearing favourable marks whose urine on being smelt makes even the barren productive.

data.v: सोऽहमेवं चरिष्यामि प्रीतिरत्र हि मे सदा । न च मां वेत्स्यति परस्तत्ते रोचतु पार्थिव ।।
data.md: Thus shall I pass my days; there is always a delight for me in this work, and no one shall recognize me and moreover I will entertain the monarch.

data.v: इयं तु नः प्रिया भार्या प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसी । मातेव परिपाल्या च पूज्या ज्येष्ठेव च स्वसा ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said This is our beloved wife dearer even than life. Like a mother she is to be cherished and like an elder sister she is to be respected.

data.v: केन स्म कर्मणा कृष्णा द्रौपदी विचरिष्यति । न हि किंचिद्विजानाति कर्म कर्तुं यथा स्त्रियः ।।
data.md: In what capacity will Krishna the daughter of Drupada, appear; like other women she does not know how to do any work.

data.v: सुकुमारी च बाला च राजपुत्री यशस्विनी । पतिव्रता महाभागा कथं नु विचरिष्यति ।।
data.md: Tender and young is the king's daughter, endowed with eminence, devoted to her lords and highly virtuous; how will she pass her days?

data.v: माल्यगन्धानलंकारान्वस्त्राणि विविधानि च । एतान्येवाभिजानाति यतो जाता हि भामिनी ।।
data.md: Since her very birth the handsome lady has only been accustomed to garlands, perfumes, ornaments and diverse kinds of robes.

data.v: सैरन्ध्र्योऽरक्षिता लोके भुजिष्याः सन्ति भारत । नैवमन्याः स्त्रियो यान्ति इति लोकस्य निश्चयः ।।
data.md: Draupadi said O Bharata, there is a class of maid-servants called Sairandhri employed in the service of others and it is the conviction of people that no (respectable) ladies will enter it.

data.v: साहं ब्रुवाणा सैरन्ध्री कुशला केशकर्मणि । आत्मगुप्ता चरिष्यामि यन्मां त्वमनुपृच्छसि ।।
सुदेष्णां प्रत्युपस्थास्ये राजभार्यां यशस्विनीम् । सा रक्षिष्यति मां प्राप्तां मा ते भूद्दुःखमीदृशम् ।।
data.md: I shall serve Shudeshna the reputed wife, of the king, and getting me, she will keep me. Let this anxiety of yours be set at rest.

data.v: कल्याणं भाषसे कृष्णे कुले जाता यथा वदेत् । न पापमभिजानासि साधु साध्वीव्रते स्थिता ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said O Krishna, you have spoken well, O fair one, you are born in a noble family; chaste as you are and engaged in pursuit of pious vows you are a stranger to sin.

data.v: कर्माण्युक्तानि युष्माभिर्यानि तानि करिष्यथ । मम चापि यथाबुद्धि रुचितानि विनिश्चयात् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said In consonance with the ordinance, the works which you will perform have been already described by you, and I have also said according to my discretion the office which I shall perform.

data.v: पुरोहितोऽयमस्माकमग्निहोत्राणि रक्षतु । सूदपौरोगवैः सार्धं द्रुपदस्य निवेशने ।।
data.md: Let this our priest go back to the house of Drupada with our charioteer and cooks, and preserve our Agnihotra fires.

data.v: इन्द्रसेनमुखाश्चेमे रथानादाय केवलान् । यान्तु द्वारवतीं शीघ्रमिति मे वर्तते मतिः ।।
data.md: Let these people with Indrasena as their head repair speedily with empty cars to the city of Amaravati. This is my wish.

data.v: इमाश्च नार्यो द्रौपद्याः सर्वशः परिचारिकाः । पाञ्चालानेव गच्छन्तु सूदपौरोगवैः सह ।।
data.md: Let all these attending maids of Draupadi go to the Panchalas with our charioteers and cooks.

data.v: सर्वैरपि च वक्तव्यं न प्रज्ञायन्त पाण्डवाः । गता ह्यस्मानपाकीर्य सर्वे द्वैतवनादिति ।।
data.md: All of them also must say this "we do not know the Pandavas, they have all departed from Dvaitavana leaving us alone here."

data.v: विदिते चापि वक्तव्यं सुहृद्भिरनुरागतः । अतोऽहमपि वक्ष्यामि हेतुमात्रं निबोधत ।।
data.md: You and Falguna (Arjuna) are to protect। Krishna. O kings, the characters of men are properly known to you all. Inspite of your knowledge, it behoves the friends to describe them out of their regard for you and that is reckoned as the everlasting virtue, pleasure and profit. Therefore I shall say something-you should attend.

data.v: हन्तेमां राजवसतिं राजपुत्रा ब्रवीमि वः । यथा राजकुलं प्राप्य चरन्प्रेष्यो न रिष्यति ।।
दुर्वसं त्वेव कौरव्या जानता राजवेश्मनि । अमानितैः सुमानार्हा अज्ञातैः परिवत्सरम् ।।
दिष्टद्वारो लभेद्द्वारं न च राजसु विश्वसेत् । तदेवासनमन्विच्छेद्यत्र नाभिषजेत्परः ।।
data.md: One ought to obtain previous permission should he want to appear before the king. As regards royal secrets one should not give credit when they are mentioned; one should rather court that seat where no one can defeat him.

data.v: नास्य यानं न पर्यङ्कं न पीठं न गजं रथम् । आरोहेत्संमतोऽस्मीति स राजवसतिं वसेत् ।।
data.md: He alone can live in a royal residence who does not, with the confidence that he is a favorite, make use of the king's car, vehicle, or bedstead, or seat, or elephant or chariot.

data.v: अथ यत्रैनमासीनं शङ्केरन्दुष्टचारिणः । न तत्रोपविशेज्जातु स राजवसतिं वसेत् ।।
data.md: He alone can live in a royal house who sits on a seat the occupation of which cannot create any suspicion in the minds of the wicked.

data.v: न चानुशिष्येद्राजानमपृच्छन्तं कदाचन । तूष्णीं त्वेनमुपासीत काले समभिपूजयन् ।।
data.md: Unasked no one should even offer a counsel to the king; one should pay respect to never him with reticence and homage in time. Kings wish to have those who babble and hate counsellors who tell lies.

data.v: असूयन्ति हि राजानो जनाननृतवादिनः । तथैव चावमन्यन्ते मन्त्रिणं वादिनं मृषा ।।
data.md: Unasked no one should even offer a counsel to the king; one should pay respect to never him with reticence and homage in time. Kings wish to have those who babble and hate counsellors who tell lies.

data.v: नैषां दारेषु कुर्वीत मैत्रीं प्राज्ञः कथंचन । अन्तःपुरचरा ये च द्वेष्टि यानहिताश्च ये ।।

data.md: Vaishampayana said Then there was seen another mighty son of Pandu approaching king Virata in haste; the common people thereof saw him coming like solar orb freed from the clouds.

data.v: स वै हयानैक्षत तांस्ततस्ततः; समीक्षमाणं च ददर्श मत्स्यराट् । ततोऽब्रवीत्ताननुगानमित्रहा; कुतोऽयमायाति नरोऽमरप्रभः ।।
data.md: He began to observe the horses around; the king of the Matsya's, the lord of people, seeing him observing his horses minutely asked his followers "whence is this man lustrous like a celestials, coming"?

data.v: अयं हयान्वीक्षति मामकान्दृढं; ध्रुवं हयज्ञो भविता विचक्षणः । प्रवेश्यतामेष समीपमाशु मे; विभाति वीरो हि यथामरस्तथा ।।
data.md: This person looks closely at my horses. Must he be proficient in horse-lore. Let him quickly enter into my presence. This heroic one seems to me as much as a celestials.

data.v: अभ्येत्य राजानममित्रहाब्रवी;ज्जयोऽस्तु ते पार्थिव भद्रमस्तु च । हयेषु युक्तो नृप संमतः सदा; तवाश्वसूतो निपुणो भवाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: That slaughterer of enemies, having approached the king addressed him thus "O king, let victory be to you and good betide you all. I am always esteemed by kings for my ability as a horse-painter. I will be an expert keeper of your horses.

data.v: ददामि यानानि धनं निवेशनं; ममाश्वसूतो भवितुं त्वमर्हसि । कुतोऽसि कस्यासि कथं त्वमागतः; प्रब्रूहि शिल्पं तव विद्यते च यत् ।।
data.md: Virata said I give you vehicles, wealth and quarters; you deserve to be the keeper of my horses. But tell me whence you are come, whose you are, and how you came here, also tell me of the arts you are versed with.

data.v: पञ्चानां पाण्डुपुत्राणां ज्येष्ठो राजा युधिष्ठिरः । तेनाहमश्वेषु पुरा प्रकृतः शत्रुकर्शन ।।
data.md: Nakula said O repressor of foes, of the five sons of Pandu, Yudhishthira is the eldest brother, by him I was formerly employed as a keeper of his horses.

data.v: अश्वानां प्रकृतिं वेद्मि विनयं चापि सर्वशः । दुष्टानां प्रतिपत्तिं च कृत्स्नं चैव चिकित्सितम् ।।
data.md: I know the temper of horses, and the art of breaking them completely. I know how to correct the wicked steeds and the treatment of all kinds.

data.v: न कातरं स्यान्मम जातु वाहनं; न मेऽस्ति दुष्टा वडवा कुतो हयाः । जनस्तु मामाह स चापि पाण्डवो; युधिष्ठिरो ग्रन्थिकमेव नामतः ।।
data.md: Under my care hardly does any animal fall ill. What to speak of horses even mares in my hands are not to be found wicked. People called me by name, Granthika so also Yudhishthira the son of Pandu.

data.v: यदस्ति किंचिन्मम वाजिवाहनं; तदस्तु सर्वं त्वदधीनमद्य वै । ये चापि केचिन्मम वाजियोजका;स्त्वदाश्रयाः सारथयश्च सन्तु मे ।।
data.md: Virata said Let all my horses that belong to me be entrusted to your care from today. Let all my charioteers and those to yoke my horses, be henceforth subordinate to you.

data.v: इदं तवेष्टं यदि वै सुरोपम; ब्रवीहि यत्ते प्रसमीक्षितं वसु । न तेऽनुरूपं हयकर्म विद्यते; प्रभासि राजेव हि संमतो मम ।।
data.md: If this be your desire, O god-like one, tell me what remuneration is sought by you. This office of horse-training does not become you, because you look like a king and you are agreeable to me.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्येव हि दर्शनेन मे; समं तवेदं प्रियदर्श दर्शनम् । कथं तु भृत्यैः स विनाकृतो वने; वसत्यनिन्द्यो रमते च पाण्डवः ।।
data.md: Here, the very sight of you is as much pleasing to me as that of Yudhishthira himself. Oh how does that faultless son of Pandu, dwell and divert himself in the forest without his servants.

data.v: तथा स गन्धर्ववरोपमो युवा; विराटराज्ञा मुदितेन पूजितः । न चैनमन्येऽपि विदुः कथंचन; प्रियाभिरामं विचरन्तमन्तरा ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said That youthful one resembling the chief of the Gandharvas was thus honoured by the delighted king of Virata, and no one recognized him conducting himself agreeably in the city.

data.v: एवं हि मत्स्ये न्यवसन्त पाण्डवा; यथाप्रतिज्ञाभिरमोघदर्शनाः । अज्ञातचर्यां व्यचरन्समाहिताः; समुद्रनेमीपतयोऽतिदुःखिताः ।।
data.md: Thus the son of Pandu, whose very sight never proved abortive, began to live in the kingdom of Matsya; and in conformity with their pledge, the lords of the earth surrounded by seas although stricken with woe began to pass their days of non-discovery with composure.

data.v: एवं मत्स्यस्य नगरे वसन्तस्तत्र पाण्डवाः । अत ऊर्ध्वं महावीर्याः किमकुर्वन्त वै द्विज ।।
data.md: Janamejaya said O twice-born one, living thus disguised in the city of the Matsyas what did the Kuru's sons of exceeding might do.

data.v: एवं ते न्यवसंस्तत्र प्रच्छन्नाः कुरुनन्दनाः । आराधयन्तो राजानं यदकुर्वन्त तच्छृणु ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hear, what the descendants of Kuru did living thus disguised in the city of the Matsyas and serving the king thereof.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरः सभास्तारः सभ्यानामभवत्प्रियः । तथैव च विराटस्य सपुत्रस्य विशां पते ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira as a courtier made himself a favorite to Virata and his son, as well as to all the Matsyas, O lord of people.

data.v: स ह्यक्षहृदयज्ञस्तान्क्रीडयामास पाण्डवः । अक्षवत्यां यथाकामं सूत्रबद्धानिव द्विजान् ।।
data.md: Well versed in the mysteries of the dice he caused him to play at dice in the dice-hall in accordance with his pleasure like the birds bound by the string.

data.v: अज्ञातं च विराटस्य विजित्य वसु धर्मराट् । भ्रातृभ्यः पुरुषव्याघ्रो यथार्हं स्म प्रयच्छति ।।
data.md: That best of men, the king of justice (Yudhishthira) having won the wealth of Virata duly distributed it without the knowledge of the monarch among his brothers.

data.v: भीमसेनोऽपि मांसानि भक्ष्याणि विविधानि च । अतिसृष्टानि मत्स्येन विक्रीणाति युधिष्ठिरे ।।
data.md: Bhimsena also sold to Yudhishthira, the meat and the viands of various sorts which were given by the king of the Matsyas.

data.v: वासांसि परिजीर्णानि लब्धान्यन्तःपुरेऽर्जुनः । विक्रीणानश्च सर्वेभ्यः पाण्डवेभ्यः प्रयच्छति ।।
data.md: Arjuna parted with the worn out clothes by sale, which he obtained from women's quarters, to the other sons of Pandu.

data.v: सहदेवोऽपि गोपानां वेषमास्थाय पाण्डवः । दधि क्षीरं घृतं चैव पाण्डवेभ्यः प्रयच्छति ।।
data.md: Sahadeva also, who had assumed the dress of a cow-herd, distributed to them curds, milk and clarified butter.

data.v: नकुलोऽपि धनं लब्ध्वा कृते कर्मणि वाजिनाम् । तुष्टे तस्मिन्नरपतौ पाण्डवेभ्यः प्रयच्छति ।।
data.md: Nakula also gave the wealth to his brothers which he acquired from the king who was satisfied with him for his tending the horses.

data.v: कृष्णापि सर्वान्भ्रातॄंस्तान्निरीक्षन्ती तपस्विनी । यथा पुनरविज्ञाता तथा चरति भामिनी ।।
data.md: In the form of ascetic and very charmful draupadi served their husband, so nobody can identify their reality.

data.v: एवं संपादयन्तस्ते तथान्योन्यं महारथाः । प्रेक्षमाणास्तदा कृष्णामूषुश्छन्ना नराधिप ।।
data.md: They, the mighty warriors, then looking after the interest of one another, lived in the city of Virata in such a manner, as if they were once more in the house of their mother.

data.v: अथ मासे चतुर्थे तु ब्रह्मणः सुमहोत्सवः । आसीत्समृद्धो मत्स्येषु पुरुषाणां सुसंमतः ।।
data.md: Then in the fourth month there happened a great festival, in honor of the divine Brahma, slender in form and highly valued by people, in the city of the Matsya's.

data.v: तत्र मल्लाः समापेतुर्दिग्भ्यो राजन्सहस्रशः । महाकाया महावीर्याः कालखञ्जा इवासुराः ।।
data.md: 0 king, there came, by thousands, wrestlers from all quarters in that field of festivity in honour of the divine Brahma, as also on the occasion of a festival held in honor of Shiva.

data.v: वीर्योन्नद्धा बलोदग्रा राज्ञा समभिपूजिताः । सिंहस्कन्धकटिग्रीवाः स्ववदाता मनस्विनः । असकृल्लब्धलक्षास्ते रङ्गे पार्थिवसंनिधौ ।।
data.md: Their shoulders, waists and necks were like those of lions, their bodies were free from dirt, and their hearts were large. Many times before they achieved success in the lists in the very august presence of the king.

data.v: तेषामेको महानासीत्सर्वमल्लान्समाह्वयत् । आवल्गमानं तं रङ्गे नोपतिष्ठति कश्चन ।।
data.md: Amongst them there was one who was the greatest of all and challenged all other combatants to a wrestle; there was none that ventured to encounter him as he strided over in the arena.

data.v: यदा सर्वे विमनसस्ते मल्ला हतचेतसः । अथ सूदेन तं मल्लं योधयामास मत्स्यराट् ।।
data.md: When all the wrestlers stood stupefied and dejected in spirit then the king of the Matsyas made him fight with his cook.

data.v: चोद्यमानस्ततो भीमो दुःखेनैवाकरोन्मतिम् । न हि शक्नोति विवृते प्रत्याख्यातुं नराधिपम् ।।
data.md: Impelled by the king, Bhima made up his mind with reluctance, for it was not in his power to openly disobey the royal mandate.

data.v: ततः स पुरुषव्याघ्रः शार्दूलशिथिलं चरन् । प्रविवेश महारङ्गं विराटमभिहर्षयन् ।।
data.md: Then that the best of men, having worshipped the king Virata, entered the spacious arena with listless steps like those of a lion.

data.v: बबन्ध कक्ष्यां कौन्तेयस्ततस्तं हर्षयञ्जनम् । ततस्तं वृत्रसंकाशं भीमो मल्लं समाह्वयत् ।।
data.md: Then Bhima, the son of Kunti, girded up his lions and caused the delight of the spectators. There he summoned the wrestler of distinguished prowess named Jimuta resembling Vritra himself. were

data.v: तावुभौ सुमहोत्साहावुभौ तीव्रपराक्रमौ । मत्ताविव महाकायौ वारणौ षष्टिहायनौ ।।
data.md: Both of them were of exceeding energy and of terrible prowess, and they both were like a couple of infuriated elephants of gigantic form each being sixty years old. Then those two best of men became engaged in hand-tohand fight.

data.v: चकर्ष दोर्भ्यामुत्पाट्य भीमो मल्लममित्रहा । विनदन्तमभिक्रोशञ्शार्दूल इव वारणम् ।।
data.md: Bhima, the slayer of enemies, seized, with a big seized, his vociferous rival wrestler by the arms and drew him near even as the lion seizes the elephant.

data.v: तमुद्यम्य महाबाहुर्भ्रामयामास वीर्यवान् । ततो मल्लाश्च मत्स्याश्च विस्मयं चक्रिरे परम् ।।
data.md: Then the mighty-armed Bhima of great prowess raised him up and began to whirl him round; then all the athlete and the people of the Matsya's, who had assembled on the occasion, were greatly astonished.

data.v: भ्रामयित्वा शतगुणं गतसत्त्वमचेतनम् । प्रत्यपिंषन्महाबाहुर्मल्लं भुवि वृकोदरः ।।
data.md: Then having whirled him round and round a hundred times, the mighty armed Vrikodara inade him utterly insensible and threw him down lifeless on the ground.

data.v: तस्मिन्विनिहते मल्ले जीमूते लोकविश्रुते । विराटः परमं हर्षमगच्छद्बान्धवैः सह ।।
data.md: That distinguished athlete Jimuta being slain, Virata and his friends were exceedingly delighted.

data.v: संहर्षात्प्रददौ वित्तं बहु राजा महामनाः । बल्लवाय महारङ्गे यथा वैश्रवणस्तथा ।।
data.md: In his great joy the high-minded king gave away to Ballava plenty of riches in the shape of a reward on the very field of combat with as much liberality as that of Kubera.

data.v: एवं स सुबहून्मल्लान्पुरुषांश्च महाबलान् । विनिघ्नन्मत्स्यराजस्य प्रीतिमावहदुत्तमाम् ।।
data.md: Having thus slain numerous athletes and many other persons of great strength he received the great favour of the king of the Matsya's.

data.v: यदास्य तुल्यः पुरुषो न कश्चित्तत्र विद्यते । ततो व्याघ्रैश्च सिंहैश्च द्विरदैश्चाप्ययोधयत् ।।
data.md: When there was found no one such as to stand equal to him the king made him fight with tigers and lions and elephants.

data.v: पुनरन्तःपुरगतः स्त्रीणां मध्ये वृकोदरः । योध्यते स्म विराटेन सिंहैर्मत्तैर्महाबलैः ।।
data.md: Again the king made Vrikodara fight with furious lions of exceeding strength in the assembly of the ladies of the harem.

data.v: बीभत्सुरपि गीतेन सुनृत्तेन च पाण्डवः । विराटं तोषयामास सर्वाश्चान्तःपुरस्त्रियः ।।
data.md: Bibhatsu, the son of Pandu, pleased Virata and all the ladies of the harem by singing and dancing.

data.v: अश्वैर्विनीतैर्जवनैस्तत्र तत्र समागतैः । तोषयामास नकुलो राजानं राजसत्तम ।।
data.md: Nakula pleased the king, the best of kings by showing him the fast-going and well-trained horses and the king, pleased gave him a plenty of money as a reward.

data.v: तस्मै प्रदेयं प्रायच्छत्प्रीतो राजा धनं बहु । विनीतान्वृषभान्दृष्ट्वा सहदेवस्य चाभिभो ।।
एवं ते न्यवसंस्तत्र प्रच्छन्नाः पुरुषर्षभाः । कर्माणि तस्य कुर्वाणा विराटनृपतेस्तदा ।।
data.md: Those best among men began to live there in disguise rendering services to the king Virata.

data.v: वसमानेषु पार्थेषु मत्स्यस्य नगरे तदा । महारथेषु छन्नेषु मासा दश समत्ययुः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Those mighty warriors, the sons of Pritha, spent ten months living thus in disguise in Matsya's city.

data.v: याज्ञसेनी सुदेष्णां तु शुश्रूषन्ती विशां पते । अवसत्परिचारार्हा सुदुःखं जनमेजय ।।
data.md: O lord of people, Yajnaseni, although herself worthy of being served by others, began to live, O Janamejaya, in great misery by waiting upon Sudeshna.

data.v: तथा चरन्तीं पाञ्चालीं सुदेष्णाया निवेशने । सेनापतिर्विराटस्य ददर्श जलजाननाम् ।।
data.md: Conducting herself in this way in Sudeshna's apartments the daughter of Panchala pleased that lady as well as the other women of the harem.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा देवगर्भाभां चरन्तीं देवतामिव । कीचकः कामयामास कामबाणप्रपीडितः ।।
data.md: Beholding her having effulgence like that of a divine girl and waiting on the earth like a goddess, Kichaka, struck hard with the shafts of Cupid, desired to obtain her.

data.v: स तु कामाग्निसंतप्तः सुदेष्णामभिगम्य वै । प्रहसन्निव सेनानीरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Burning with the flame of lust, the leader of Virata's forces went to Sudeshna (his sister) and smilingly spoke to her in the following words.

data.v: नेयं पुरा जातु मयेह दृष्टा; राज्ञो विराटस्य निवेशने शुभा । रूपेण चोन्मादयतीव मां भृशं; गन्धेन जाता मदिरेव भामिनी ।।
data.md: This damsel was never seen by me before in Virata palace. This beautiful lady maddenis me very much with her beauty as wine does with its odour.

data.v: का देवरूपा हृदयंगमा शुभे; आचक्ष्व मे का च कुतश्च शोभना । चित्तं हि निर्मथ्य करोति मां वशे; न चान्यदत्रौषधमद्य मे मतम् ।।
data.md: Tell me, O lady, who is this be-witching girl of fine beauty, endued with the grace of a goddess and whose she is and where she comes from. She has brought me to subjection by grinding my heart. I think there is no other medicine to heal me (except her).

data.v: अहो तवेयं परिचारिका शुभा; प्रत्यग्ररूपा प्रतिभाति मामियम् । अयुक्तरूपं हि करोति कर्म ते; प्रशास्तु मां यच्च ममास्ति किंचन ।।
data.md: This fine and maid of yours appears to me as one possessed of the blooming beauty of a goddess. The service which she renders to you is quite unsuitable to her.

data.v: प्रभूतनागाश्वरथं महाधनं; समृद्धियुक्तं बहुपानभोजनम् । मनोहरं काञ्चनचित्रभूषणं; गृहं महच्छोभयतामियं मम ।।
data.md: Let her grace my splendid and beautiful residence adorned with various ornaments of gold, furnished with viands and drinks in plenty, decked with excellent plates and containing everything signifying prosperity, besides elephants and cars in lots.

data.v: तानवेक्ष्य हतोत्साहानुत्पातानपि चाद्भुतान् । गुरुः शस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठो भारद्वाजोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.md: Seeing them dispirited and many wonderful omens, the preceptor Drona, the foremost of wielders of weapon, Bharadvaja's son, said.

data.v: चलाश्च वाताः संवान्ति रूक्षाः परुषनिःस्वनाः । भस्मवर्णप्रकाशेन तमसा संवृतं नभः ।।
data.md: Violent and dreadful winds are blowing, showering profuse gravels. The sky is also enshrouded with darkness of ashy colour.

data.v: रूक्षवर्णाश्च जलदा दृश्यन्तेऽद्भुतदर्शनाः । निःसरन्ति च कोशेभ्यः शस्त्राणि विविधानि च ।।
data.md: The wonderful clouds are looking dry and divine weapons are as if coming out of their cases.

data.v: शिवाश्च विनदन्त्येता दीप्तायां दिशि दारुणाः । हयाश्चाश्रूणि मुञ्चन्ति ध्वजाः कम्पन्त्यकम्पिताः ।।
data.md: Frightened by the conflagration on all sides the jackals are yelling hideously, the horses are shedding tears and flags are being shaken although moved by none.

data.v: यादृशान्यत्र रूपाणि संदृश्यन्ते बहून्यपि । यत्ता भवन्तस्तिष्ठन्तु स्याद्युद्धं समुपस्थितम् ।।
data.md: Since many such dreadful omens are being seen, a mighty calamity is at hand.

data.v: रक्षध्वमपि चात्मानं व्यूहध्वं वाहिनीमपि । वैशसं च प्रतीक्षध्वं रक्षध्वं चापि गोधनम् ।।
data.md: Protect yourselves and arrange the army, Expect a slaughter and guard well the kine.

data.v: एष वीरो महेष्वासः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः । आगतः क्लीबवेषेण पार्थो नास्त्यत्र संशयः ।।
data.md: This great bowman, this best of heroes, who has come in the guise of a person of the ncuter sex is undoubtedly the son of Pritha.

data.v: स एष पार्थो विक्रान्तः सव्यसाची परंतपः । नायुद्धेन निवर्तेत सर्वैरपि मरुद्गणैः ।।
data.md: He is the powerful Partha, Savyasachin, the repressor of enemies he does no desist even in the encounter with all the celestials.

data.v: क्लेशितश्च वने शूरो वासवेन च शिक्षितः । अमर्षवशमापन्नो योत्स्यते नात्र संशयः ।।
data.md: The hero suffered hardships in the forest and was instructed by Indra. Indignant (as he is) he is equal to Vasava in battle.

data.v: नेहास्य प्रतियोद्धारमहं पश्यामि कौरवाः । महादेवोऽपि पार्थेन श्रूयते युधि तोषितः ।।
सदा भवान्फल्गुनस्य गुणैरस्मान्विकत्थसे । न चार्जुनः कला पूर्णा मम दुर्योधनस्य वा ।।
data.md: Karna said You always make light of us by speaking of Phalguni's accomplishments. He is not even one sixteenth of either myself or Duryodhana.

data.v: यद्येष पार्थो राधेय कृतं कार्यं भवेन्मम । ज्ञाताः पुनश्चरिष्यन्ति द्वादशान्यान्हि वत्सरान् ।।
data.md: Duryodhana said If he be Partha, O son of Radha, then my work is fulfilled. If found out the Pandavas shall have to live in the forest for twelve yeas again.

data.v: अथैष कश्चिदेवान्यः क्लीबवेषेण मानवः । शरैरेनं सुनिशितैः पातयिष्यामि भूतले ।।
data.md: If he be any one else in a eunuch's guise I shall soon place him on the ground with sharp arrows.

data.v: तस्मिन्ब्रुवति तद्वाक्यं धार्तराष्ट्रे परंतपे । भीष्मो द्रोणः कृपो द्रौणिः पौरुषं तदपूजयन् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Oslayer of foes, on Duryodhana saying this, Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, and Drona's son all spoke highly of his manliness.

data.v: तां शमीमुपसंगम्य पार्थो वैराटिमब्रवीत् । सुकुमारं समाज्ञातं संग्रामे नातिकोविदम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having approached the Shami tree and found out that the son of Virata was highly delicate and inexperienced in battle Partha said to him.

data.v: समादिष्टो मया क्षिप्रं धनूंष्यवहरोत्तर । नेमानि हि त्वदीयानि सोढुं शक्ष्यन्ति मे बलम् ।।
data.md: Commanded by me, O Uttara, bring down some arrows that are on the tree. These your shafts cannot stand my strength.

data.v: भारं वापि गुरुं हर्तुं कुञ्जरं वा प्रमर्दितुम् । मम वा बाहुविक्षेपं शत्रूनिह विजेष्यतः ।।
तस्माद्भूमिंजयारोह शमीमेतां पलाशिनीम् । अस्यां हि पाण्डुपुत्राणां धनूंषि निहितान्युत ।।
युधिष्ठिरस्य भीमस्य बीभत्सोर्यमयोस्तथा । ध्वजाः शराश्च शूराणां दिव्यानि कवचानि च ।।
data.md: Therefore, O prince, climb this tree full of fruits for in it are tied the bows, shafts, banners and beautiful armours of the heroic sons of Pandu, Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna and the twins.

data.v: अत्र चैतन्महावीर्यं धनुः पार्थस्य गाण्डिवम् । एकं शतसहस्रेण संमितं राष्ट्रवर्धनम् ।।
data.md: There is also the mighty bow, Gandiva, of Partha, which alone is equal to hundred thousand of others and is capable of extending kingdom.

data.v: व्यायामसहमत्यर्थं तृणराजसमं महत् । सर्वायुधमहामात्रं शत्रुसंबाधकारकम् ।।
data.md: Capable of standing the greatest exercise, huge like a palmyra tree, the largest of all weapons, capable of withstanding the enemy, embellished with gold, celestials, smooth broad without a knot, beautiful and straight and capable of bearing a heavy weight.

data.v: सुवर्णविकृतं दिव्यं श्लक्ष्णमायतमव्रणम् । अलं भारं गुरुं वोढुं दारुणं चारुदर्शनम् । तादृशान्येव सर्वाणि बलवन्ति दृढानि च ।।
data.md: Capable of standing the greatest exercise, huge like a palmyra tree, the largest of all weapons, capable of withstanding the enemy, embellished with gold, celestials, smooth broad without a knot, beautiful and straight and capable of bearing a heavy weight.

data.v: अस्मिन्वृक्षे किलोद्बद्धं शरीरमिति नः श्रुतम् । तदहं राजपुत्रः सन्स्पृशेयं पाणिना कथम् ।।
data.md: Uttara said It is heard that a corpse is tie to the tree. How can I, being a prince, touch it with my own hands.

data.v: नैवंविधं मया युक्तमालब्धुं क्षत्रयोनिना । महता राजपुत्रेण मन्त्रयज्ञविदा सता ।।
data.md: To touch it does not become me who am born in the Kshatriya race, a mighty prince and observant of Mantras and vows.

data.v: स्पृष्टवन्तं शरीरं मां शववाहमिवाशुचिम् । कथं वा व्यवहार्यं वै कुर्वीथास्त्वं बृहन्नडे ।।
data.md: Why should you, O Brihannala, make my body sullied and unclean by making me touch this corpse?

data.v: व्यवहार्यश्च राजेन्द्र शुचिश्चैव भविष्यसि । धनूंष्येतानि मा भैस्त्वं शरीरं नात्र विद्यते ।।
data.md: Brihannala said You shall remain clean and unpolluted, O foremost of kings. Fear not, there are only bows on this tree and not a corpse.

data.v: दायादं मत्स्यराजस्य कुले जातं मनस्विनम् । कथं त्वा निन्दितं कर्म कारयेयं नृपात्मज ।।
data.md: O prince, why should I make you do a cursed deed, born as you are of a noble family and a heir to the king of Matsya's.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स पार्थेन रथात्प्रस्कन्द्य कुण्डली । आरुरोह शमीवृक्षं वैराटिरवशस्तदा ।।
data.md: Thus addressed by Partha, Virata's son, adorned with ear-rings, got down from the car and climbed up the Shami tree unwillingly.

data.v: तमन्वशासच्छत्रुघ्नो रथे तिष्ठन्धनंजयः । परिवेष्टनमेतेषां क्षिप्रं चैव व्यपानुद ।।
data.md: Dhananjaya, the slayer of enemies, waiting on the car, ordered him:-“Quickly bring down those bows from the top of the tree."

data.v: तथा संनहनान्येषां परिमुच्य समन्ततः । अपश्यद्गाण्डिवं तत्र चतुर्भिरपरैः सह ।।
तेषां विमुच्यमानानां धनुषामर्कवर्चसाम् । विनिश्चेरुः प्रभा दिव्या ग्रहाणामुदयेष्विव ।।
स तेषां रूपमालोक्य भोगिनामिव जृम्भताम् । हृष्टरोमा भयोद्विग्नः क्षणेन समपद्यत ।।
संस्पृश्य तानि चापानि भानुमन्ति बृहन्ति च । वैराटिरर्जुनं राजन्निदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
बिन्दवो जातरूपस्य शतं यस्मिन्निपातिताः । सहस्रकोटि सौवर्णाः कस्यैतद्धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Uttara said To what illustrious hero does this excellent bow belong, having a hundred golden bosses and shining ends?

data.v: वारणा यस्य सौवर्णाः पृष्ठे भासन्ति दंशिताः । सुपार्श्वं सुग्रहं चैव कस्यैतद्धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Whose is this most excellent bow of good sides and easy hold, on the staff of which shine golden elephants with such a brilliance?

data.v: तपनीयस्य शुद्धस्य षष्टिर्यस्येन्द्रगोपकाः । पृष्ठे विभक्ताः शोभन्ते कस्यैतद्धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Whose is this excellent bow embellished with three scores of golden insects placed with proper divisions on its back?

data.v: सूर्या यत्र च सौवर्णास्त्रयो भासन्ति दंशिताः । तेजसा प्रज्वलन्तो हि कस्यैतद्धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Whose is this most excellent bow of good sides and easy hold, on the staff of which shine golden elephants with such a brilliance?

data.v: शालभा यत्र सौवर्णास्तपनीयविचित्रिताः । सुवर्णमणिचित्रं च कस्यैतद्धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Whose is this most excellent bow of good sides and easy hold, on the staff of which shine golden elephants with such a brilliance?

data.v: इमे च कस्य नाराचाः सहस्रा लोमवाहिनः । समन्तात्कलधौताग्रा उपासङ्गे हिरण्मये ।।
data.md: Whose are these thousand winged arrows having golden points and put in golden quivers?

data.v: विपाठाः पृथवः कस्य गार्ध्रपत्राः शिलाशिताः । हारिद्रवर्णाः सुनसाः पीताः सर्वायसाः शराः ।।
data.md: Whose are these huge shafts, thick-winged like vultures, whetted, of yellow hue entirely made of iron, and sharp?

data.v: कस्यायमसितावापः पञ्चशार्दूललक्षणः । वराहकर्णव्यामिश्रः शरान्धारयते दश ।।
data.md: Whose is this sable bow having the emblem of five tigers, with boar-eared arrows numbering ten?.

data.v: कस्येमे पृथवो दीर्घाः सर्वपारशवाः शराः । शतानि सप्त तिष्ठन्ति नाराचा रुधिराशनाः ।।
data.md: Whose are these long and thick five hundred arrows like the crescent shaped moon, capable of drinking blood?

data.v: कस्येमे शुकपत्राभैः पूर्वैरर्धैः सुवाससः । उत्तरैरायसैः पीतैर्हेमपुङ्खैः शिलाशितैः ।।
data.md: Whose are these gold feathered arrows whetted on stone, the lower halves of which are embellished with wings of the colour of a parrot's feathers and the upper halves of which are made of well-tempered steel?

data.v: कस्यायं सायको दीर्घः शिलीपृष्ठः शिलीमुखः । वैयाघ्रकोशे निहितो हेमचित्रत्सरुर्महान् ।।
data.md: This long sword, with the emblem of a bee on its back and sharp as the sting of a bee, firm and capable of bearing heavy weight in battle, belongs to Arjuna.

data.v: सुफलश्चित्रकोशश्च किङ्किणीसायको महान् । कस्य हेमत्सरुर्दिव्यः खड्गः परमनिर्व्रणः ।।
कस्यायं विमलः खड्गो गव्ये कोशे समर्पितः । हेमत्सरुरनाधृष्यो नैषध्यो भारसाधनः ।।
data.md: This huge, strong and dreadful sword, capable of bearing heavy weight and put in a sheath of cow-skin, belongs to Sahadeva.

data.v: कस्य पाञ्चनखे कोशे सायको हेमविग्रहः । प्रमाणरूपसंपन्नः पीत आकाशसंनिभः ।।
कस्य हेममये कोशे सुतप्ते पावकप्रभे । निस्त्रिंशोऽयं गुरुः पीतः सैक्यः परमनिर्व्रणः ।।
निर्दिशस्व यथातत्त्वं मया पृष्टा बृहन्नडे । विस्मयो मे परो जातो दृष्ट्वा सर्वमिदं महत् ।।
यन्मां पूर्वमिहापृच्छः शत्रुसेनानिबर्हणम् । गाण्डीवमेतत्पार्थस्य लोकेषु विदितं धनुः ।।
सर्वायुधमहामात्रं शातकुम्भपरिष्कृतम् । एतत्तदर्जुनस्यासीद्गाण्डीवं परमायुधम् ।।
यत्तच्छतसहस्रेण संमितं राष्ट्रवर्धनम् । येन देवान्मनुष्यांश्च पार्थो विषहते मृधे ।।
देवदानवगन्धर्वैः पूजितं शाश्वतीः समाः । एतद्वर्षसहस्रं तु ब्रह्मा पूर्वमधारयत् ।।
ततोऽनन्तरमेवाथ प्रजापतिरधारयत् । त्रीणि पञ्चशतं चैव शक्रोऽशीति च पञ्च च ।।
सोमः पञ्चशतं राजा तथैव वरुणः शतम् । पार्थः पञ्च च षष्टिं च वर्षाणि श्वेतवाहनः ।।
महावीर्यं महद्दिव्यमेतत्तद्धनुरुत्तमम् । पूजितं सुरमर्त्येषु बिभर्ति परमं वपुः ।।
सुपार्श्वं भीमसेनस्य जातरूपग्रहं धनुः । येन पार्थोऽजयत्कृत्स्नां दिशं प्राचीं परंतपः ।।
इन्द्रगोपकचित्रं च यदेतच्चारुविग्रहम् । राज्ञो युधिष्ठिरस्यैतद्वैराटे धनुरुत्तमम् ।।
सूर्या यस्मिंस्तु सौवर्णाः प्रभासन्ते प्रभासिनः । तेजसा प्रज्वलन्तो वै नकुलस्यैतदायुधम् ।।
शलभा यत्र सौवर्णास्तपनीयविचित्रिताः । एतन्माद्रीसुतस्यापि सहदेवस्य कार्मुकम् ।।
ये त्विमे क्षुरसंकाशाः सहस्रा लोमवाहिनः । एतेऽर्जुनस्य वैराटे शराः सर्पविषोपमाः ।।
एते ज्वलन्तः संग्रामे तेजसा शीघ्रगामिनः । भवन्ति वीरस्याक्षय्या व्यूहतः समरे रिपून् ।।
data.md: These swift arrows, of the hero burning in energy in battle when discharged against the enemies, become inexhaustible.

data.v: ये चेमे पृथवो दीर्घाश्चन्द्रबिम्बार्धदर्शनाः । एते भीमस्य निशिता रिपुक्षयकराः शराः ।।
data.md: These sharp, long and heavy arrows, resembling the crescent of the moon in shape and capable of destroying the enemies, belong to Bhima.

data.v: हारिद्रवर्णा ये त्वेते हेमपुङ्खाः शिलाशिताः । नकुलस्य कलापोऽयं पञ्चशार्दूललक्षणः ।।
