data.md: Having come to Upaplavya and entered the camp, Shalya saw all the sons of Pandu there.

data.v: समेत्य तु महाबाहुः शल्यः पाण्डुसुतैस्तदा । पाद्यमर्घ्यं च गां चैव प्रत्यगृह्णाद्यथाविधि ।।
data.md: And having come there, he, the long armed one accepted the customary water for washing his feet and other gifts including a cow.

data.v: ततः कुशलपूर्वं स मद्रराजोऽरिसूदनः । प्रीत्या परमया युक्तः समाश्लिष्य युधिष्ठिरम् ।।
data.md: And then that slayer of his enemies, the king of the Madras, having asked them about their health, embraced Yudhishthira, with great cheerfulness.

data.v: तथा भीमार्जुनौ हृष्टौ स्वस्रीयौ च यमावुभौ । आसने चोपविष्टस्तु शल्यः पार्थमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: And having done the same to Bhima and Arjuna and both the twin brothers, the sons of his sister, Shalya, who had seated himself, said to the son of Pritha:

data.v: कुशलं राजशार्दूल कच्चित्ते कुरुनन्दन । अरण्यवासाद्दिष्ट्यासि विमुक्तो जयतां वर ।।
data.md: O best among kings, O son of Kuru, is it all right with you? O you victorious one! you have now passed the prescribed period of residence in the forest.

data.v: सुदुष्करं कृतं राजन्निर्जने वसता वने । भ्रातृभिः सह राजेन्द्र कृष्णया चानया सह ।।
data.md: 0 king, great difficulties have been overcome by yourself residing in the forest, in the company, O chief of kings, of your brothers and this lady.

data.v: अज्ञातवासं घोरं च वसता दुष्करं कृतम् । दुःखमेव कुतः सौख्यं राज्यभ्रष्टस्य भारत ।।
data.md: Residence unknown and unrecognised was another great difficulty overcome by you. O son of Bharata, naught but misery attends him who has lost a kingdom. Where is happiness for him?

data.v: दुःखस्यैतस्य महतो धार्तराष्ट्रकृतस्य वै । अवाप्स्यसि सुखं राजन्हत्वा शत्रून्परंतप ।।
data.md: After all this great trouble and misery brought on by the son of Dhritarashtra, O king, you will get happiness after having slain your enemies, O great devotee.

data.v: विदितं ते महाराज लोकतत्त्वं नराधिप । तस्माल्लोभकृतं किंचित्तव तात न विद्यते ।।
data.md: The ways and habits of men are known to you, O great king, O lord of men and therefore, O son, never has the slightest avarice been present in you.

data.v: ततोऽस्याकथयद्राजा दुर्योधनसमागमम् । तच्च शुश्रूषितं सर्वं वरदानं च भारत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then, O descendant of Bharata, did the king (Shalya) tell (the Pandavas) all about his meeting with Duryodhana, his promise and his boon.

data.v: सुकृतं ते कृतं राजन्प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना । दुर्योधनस्य यद्वीर त्वया वाचा प्रतिश्रुतम् । एकं त्विच्छामि भद्रं ते क्रियमाणं महीपते ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said "O king, a good act has been done by you in that you have fulfilled a promise made when you were well pleased in the recesses of your heart.

data.v: भवानिह महाराज वासुदेवसमो युधि । कर्णार्जुनाभ्यां संप्राप्ते द्वैरथे राजसत्तम । कर्णस्य भवता कार्यं सारथ्यं नात्र संशयः ।।
data.md: O you best among kings, when the two, Karna and Arjuna meet in two chariots (in battle) I have no doubt that the office of charioteer of Karna will be filled by you.

data.v: तत्र पाल्योऽर्जुनो राजन्यदि मत्प्रियमिच्छसि । तेजोवधश्च ते कार्यः सौतेरस्मज्जयावहः । अकर्तव्यमपि ह्येतत्कर्तुमर्हसि मातुल ।।
data.md: O king, if you wish well to me, Arjuna must be protected by you and you should do what kills the energy of the son of Suta and what is calculated to bring him defeat. Though this is improper, yet must you do it, maternal uncle of mine.

data.v: शृणु पाण्डव भद्रं ते यद्ब्रवीषि दुरात्मनः । तेजोवधनिमित्तं मां सूतपुत्रस्य संयुगे ।।
data.md: Shalya said Hear me, O son of Pandu, I wish you well O noble-minded one, what you are telling me is to kill the energy of the son of Suta, when I am with him.

data.v: अहं तस्य भविष्यामि संग्रामे सारथिर्ध्रुवम् । वासुदेवेन हि समं नित्यं मां स हि मन्यते ।।
data.md: I shall most certainly be his charioteer in the battle. He has always regarded me as the equal of the son of Vasudeva.

data.v: तस्याहं कुरुशार्दूल प्रतीपमहितं वचः । ध्रुवं संकथयिष्यामि योद्धुकामस्य संयुगे ।।
data.md: O you best among the race of Kuru, I shall most certainly, when with him who is desirous of battle, speak what will do him harm and go against him.

data.v: यथा स हृतदर्पश्च हृततेजाश्च पाण्डव । भविष्यति सुखं हन्तुं सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: (I shall do this) so that his energy will be killed and his pride gone, O son of Pandu and then it will be easy to kill him. I speak with all sincerity.

data.v: एवमेतत्करिष्यामि यथा तात त्वमात्थ माम् । यच्चान्यदपि शक्ष्यामि तत्करिष्यामि ते प्रियम् ।।
data.md: O son, I shall do what you have told me and I shall do any thing more can I which is for your good.

data.v: यच्च दुःखं त्वया प्राप्तं द्यूते वै कृष्णया सह । परुषाणि च वाक्यानि सूतपुत्रकृतानि वै ।।
जटासुरात्परिक्लेशः कीचकाच्च महाद्युते । द्रौपद्याधिगतं सर्वं दमयन्त्या यथाशुभम् ।।
सर्वं दुःखमिदं वीर सुखोदर्कं भविष्यति । नात्र मन्युस्त्वया कार्यो विधिर्हि बलवत्तरः ।।
दुःखानि हि महात्मानः प्राप्नुवन्ति युधिष्ठिर । देवैरपि हि दुःखानि प्राप्तानि जगतीपते ।।
data.md: 0 Yudhishthira, great minded persons, meet with difficulties. O Lord of the world, difficulties have been met with by the gods too.

data.v: इन्द्रेण श्रूयते राजन्सभार्येण महात्मना । अनुभूतं महद्दुःखं देवराजेन भारत ।।
data.md: We are told O king, O son of Bharata that the large minded Indra, the chief among the gods, had to endure great misery with his queen.

data.v: कथमिन्द्रेण राजेन्द्र सभार्येण महात्मना । दुःखं प्राप्तं परं घोरमेतदिच्छामि वेदितुम् ।।
data.md: We are told O king, O son of Bharata that the large minded Indra, the chief among the gods, had to endure great misery with his queen.

data.v: शृणु राजन्पुरा वृत्तमितिहासं पुरातनम् । सभार्येण यथा प्राप्तं दुःखमिन्द्रेण भारत ।।
data.md: Shalya said O king, listen to this old story as related in ancient history, of how Indra with his queen met with difficulties, O son of Bharata.

data.v: त्वष्टा प्रजापतिर्ह्यासीद्देवश्रेष्ठो महातपाः । स पुत्रं वै त्रिशिरसमिन्द्रद्रोहात्किलासृजत् ।।
data.md: There was a great devotee named Tvashtri who was the lord of all beings and the chief among gods. Out of pure wrath towards Indra, he created a son with three heads.

data.v: ऐन्द्रं स प्रार्थयत्स्थानं विश्वरूपो महाद्युतिः । तैस्त्रिभिर्वदनैर्घोरैः सूर्येन्दुज्वलनोपमैः ।।
data.md: The place, occupied by Indra, was desired by this mysterious personage, who was as it were the image of the universe and had three awful faces comparable to the sun, the moon and fire.

data.v: वेदानेकेन सोऽधीते सुरामेकेन चापिबत् । एकेन च दिशः सर्वाः पिबन्निव निरीक्षते ।।
data.md: With one mouth be read the Veda, with the second he drank wine and with the other he looked as if he would absorb the cardinal points.

data.v: स तपस्वी मृदुर्दान्तो धर्मे तपसि चोद्यतः । तपोऽतप्यन्महत्तीव्रं सुदुश्चरमरिंदम ।।
data.md: He was a devotee, mild, having powers of self-control and engaged in religious worship and devotion. And O subduer of foes, the austerities practised by him could not be practised by others, for they were very hard and very difficult to be practised.

data.v: तस्य दृष्ट्वा तपोवीर्यं सत्त्वं चामिततेजसः । विषादमगमच्छक्र इन्द्रोऽयं मा भवेदिति ।।
data.md: Shakra was depressed in spirits, at seeing the strength in devotion and truthfulness of the one with unrivaled power, for fear lest he be the chief among gods.

data.v: कथं सज्जेत भोगेषु न च तप्येन्महत्तपः । विवर्धमानस्त्रिशिराः सर्वं त्रिभुवनं ग्रसेत् ।।
data.md: O best among the race of Bharata, the skillful Indra through of many ways by which the one with three heads, whose strength was ever increasing and who threatened to absorb the entire universe, could be made to engage himself in the enjoyment of sensual pleasures and not in that hard devotion.

data.v: इति संचिन्त्य बहुधा बुद्धिमान्भरतर्षभ । आज्ञापयत्सोऽप्सरसस्त्वष्टृपुत्रप्रलोभने ।।
data.md: O best among the race of Bharata, the skillful Indra through of many ways by which the one with three heads, whose strength was ever increasing and who threatened to absorb the entire universe, could be made to engage himself in the enjoyment of sensual pleasures and not in that hard devotion.

data.v: यथा स सज्जेत्त्रिशिराः कामभोगेषु वै भृशम् । क्षिप्रं कुरुत गच्छध्वं प्रलोभयत माचिरम् ।।
data.md: He ordered fairies (to engage themselves) in decoying the son of Tvashtri, so that the three-headed one might, for certain, engage himself in the enjoyment of sensual pleasure saying them

data.v: शृङ्गारवेषाः सुश्रोण्यो भावैर्युक्ता मनोहरैः । प्रलोभयत भद्रं वः शमयध्वं भयं मम ।।
data.md: Be quick, go and delay not in decoying him, (yourself) having beautiful hips, deck yourself in necklaces and beautiful pearls in such a way that his desires may be excited. I wish you well, decoy him with all the gestures of lust marked with every sort of fascination and thus allay my fear. O beautiful damsels, I feel restless in my heart. O ladies, destroy quickly this great fear of mine.

data.v: अस्वस्थं ह्यात्मनात्मानं लक्षयामि वराङ्गनाः । भयमेतन्महाघोरं क्षिप्रं नाशयताबलाः ।।
तथा यत्नं करिष्यामः शक्र तस्य प्रलोभने । यथा नावाप्स्यसि भयं तस्माद्बलनिषूदन ।।
data.md: The Nymphs said O Shakra, we shall try to decoy him so that, O you slayer of Bala, you may not experience any dread from him

data.v: निर्दहन्निव चक्षुर्भ्यां योऽसावास्ते तपोनिधिः । तं प्रलोभयितुं देव गच्छामः सहिता वयम् । यतिष्यामो वशे कर्तुं व्यपनेतुं च ते भयम् ।।
data.md: The great devotee who now sits, as if scorching with his eyes, O lord and whom we are going together to decoy. We shall try to get him under our control and thus destroy your fears.

data.v: इन्द्रेण तास्त्वनुज्ञाता जग्मुस्त्रिशिरसोऽन्तिकम् । तत्र ता विविधैर्भावैर्लोभयन्त्यो वराङ्गनाः । नृत्यं संदर्शयन्त्यश्च तथैवाङ्गेषु सौष्ठवम् ।।
data.md: Shalya said Being commanded by Indra they went to the three-headed one and the lovely damsels tempted him there with various gestures of lust.

data.v: विचेरुः संप्रहर्षं च नाभ्यगच्छन्महातपाः । इन्द्रियाणि वशे कृत्वा पूर्णसागरसंनिभः ।।
तास्तु यत्नं परं कृत्वा पुनः शक्रमुपस्थिताः । कृताञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वा देवराजमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Having brought his senses under his control, he was in point of gravity as the full ocean. The damsels too, having tried their best, came back of Shakra.

data.v: न स शक्यः सुदुर्धर्षो धैर्याच्चालयितुं प्रभो । यत्ते कार्यं महाभाग क्रियतां तदनन्तरम् ।।
data.md: Then, with the palms their hands elapsed they all said to the chief among the gods. O Lord, he, whom it is very difficult to subdue, cannot be influenced away from his purpose.

data.v: संपूज्याप्सरसः शक्रो विसृज्य च महामतिः । चिन्तयामास तस्यैव वधोपायं महात्मनः ।।
स तूष्णीं चिन्तयन्वीरो देवराजः प्रतापवान् । विनिश्चितमतिर्धीमान्वधे त्रिशिरसोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, he thought of some means to slay him. And the chief among the gods who was valiant, famous as a gifted being of unfailing judgment and intelligent, fixed on a plan for slaying the three-headed one.

data.v: वज्रमस्य क्षिपाम्यद्य स क्षिप्रं न भविष्यति । शत्रुः प्रवृद्धो नोपेक्ष्यो दुर्बलोऽपि बलीयसा ।।
data.md: (Thought he) I shall this soon cease to exist. A foe who has already grown up must not be made light of by even the powerful, a weak foe though he might be.

data.v: शास्त्रबुद्ध्या विनिश्चित्य कृत्वा बुद्धिं वधे दृढाम् । अथ वैश्वानरनिभं घोररूपं भयावहम् । मुमोच वज्रं संक्रुद्धः शक्रस्त्रिशिरसं प्रति ।।
data.md: Deciding on this course of action laid down in the books, he firmly resolved on slaying him. Shakra, wrathful, flung his fearful and dress-inspiring thunderbolt, which could be compared to the fire, on the head of the three-headed one. Being severely struck by the thunderbolt he fell down to the earth, like the loosened summit of a mountain.

data.v: स पपात हतस्तेन वज्रेण दृढमाहतः । पर्वतस्येव शिखरं प्रणुन्नं मेदिनीतले ।।
तं तु वज्रहतं दृष्ट्वा शयानमचलोपमम् । न शर्म लेभे देवेन्द्रो दीपितस्तस्य तेजसा । हतोऽपि दीप्ततेजाः स जीवन्निव च दृश्यते ।।
data.md: Seeing him struck by the thunderbolt and lying like a mountain, the chief among the gods got no peace of mind, owing to his luster which still retained its effulgence.

data.v: अभितस्तत्र तक्षाणं घटमानं शचीपतिः । अपश्यदब्रवीच्चैनं सत्वरं पाकशासनः । क्षिप्रं छिन्धि शिरांस्यस्य कुरुष्व वचनं मम ।।
data.md: O great king, where he was lying felled down. The Lord of Sachi, who still had fears, saw that wood cutter coming there by chance and the subduer of Paka soon said to him "quickly cut down the heads of this being; do what I tell you."

data.v: महास्कन्धो भृशं ह्येष परशुर्न तरिष्यति । कर्तुं चाहं न शक्ष्यामि कर्म सद्भिर्विगर्हितम् ।।
data.md: The wood cutter said This man has large shoulders; the axe cannot cut down the heads) nor shall I be able to do the deed which is regarded to be wrong by honest people.

data.v: मा भैस्त्वं क्षिप्रमेतद्वै कुरुष्व वचनं मम । मत्प्रसादाद्धि ते शस्त्रं वज्रकल्पं भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Shakra said You need not have any fears, do quickly what I tell you; through my favour shall your weapon be equal to the thunderbolt.

data.v: कं भवन्तमहं विद्यां घोरकर्माणमद्य वै । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं तत्त्वेन कथयस्व मे ।।
data.md: The wood cutter said I must know who you are and I want to hear why you have done this cruel deed today. Tell me the truth.

data.v: अहमिन्द्रो देवराजस्तक्षन्विदितमस्तु ते । कुरुष्वैतद्यथोक्तं मे तक्षन्मा त्वं विचारय ।।
data.md: Indra said I am Indra, the chief among the gods, let it be known to you O wood cutter. Do as I have told you. O wood cutter, do not ponder.

data.v: क्रूरेण नापत्रपसे कथं शक्रेह कर्मणा । ऋषिपुत्रमिमं हत्वा ब्रह्महत्याभयं न ते ।।
data.md: The wood cutter said O Shakra, how is it that you are not ashamed at this cruel deed? Having killed this son of a Rishi, have you no fear of the sin of killing a Brahmana?

data.v: पश्चाद्धर्मं चरिष्यामि पावनार्थं सुदुश्चरम् । शत्रुरेष महावीर्यो वज्रेण निहतो मया ।।
data.md: Shakra said For the purification of my soul I shall thereafter precise some severe penance. He was my enemy, possessed of great strength and has been killed by my thunderbolt.

data.v: अद्यापि चाहमुद्विग्नस्तक्षन्नस्माद्बिभेमि वै । क्षिप्रं छिन्धि शिरांसि त्वं करिष्येऽनुग्रहं तव ।।
data.md: To this day, O wood cutter, am I anxious and dread this. Quickly cut off his heads. I shall bestow a favour on you.

data.v: शिरः पशोस्ते दास्यन्ति भागं यज्ञेषु मानवाः । एष तेऽनुग्रहस्तक्षन्क्षिप्रं कुरु मम प्रियम् ।।
data.md: In sacrificial rites, men will give the heads of the beasts. This is the favour I great you. Quickly do what I desire.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु तक्षा स महेन्द्रवचनं तदा । शिरांस्यथ त्रिशिरसः कुठारेणाच्छिनत्तदा ।।
data.md: Shalya said Having heard this, the wood cutter, after the speech of Indra, cut down the heads of the three-headed one with his axe.

data.v: निकृत्तेषु ततस्तेषु निष्क्रामंस्त्रिशिरास्त्वथ । कपिञ्जलास्तित्तिराश्च कलविङ्काश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.md: The heads, being cut off, came out from them a good many birds of the Kapinjala, (doves) Titara (sparrows) and Kalavinka (parrots) species.

data.v: येन वेदानधीते स्म पिबते सोममेव च । तस्माद्वक्त्रान्विनिष्पेतुः क्षिप्रं तस्य कपिञ्जलाः ।।
data.md: From the mouth by which he used to read the Veda and drink Soma juice, came forth quickly birds of the Kapinjala species,

data.v: येन सर्वा दिशो राजन्पिबन्निव निरीक्षते । तस्माद्वक्त्राद्विनिष्पेतुस्तित्तिरास्तस्य पाण्डव ।।
data.md: From the one by which, o king, he looked as if he would absorb (the cardinal points) came forth, O son of Pandu, birds of the Titara species.

data.v: यत्सुरापं तु तस्यासीद्वक्त्रं त्रिशिरसस्तदा । कलविङ्का विनिष्पेतुस्तेनास्य भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: And from the mouth of the three-headed one which used to drink wine, came out birds of the Kalavinka species and birds of prey, O best among the race of Bharata.

data.v: ततस्तेषु निकृत्तेषु विज्वरो मघवानभूत् । जगाम त्रिदिवं हृष्टस्तक्षापि स्वगृहान्ययौ ।।
data.md: They having come out, Indra became tranquilized and went to heaven and the wood cutter too, well pleased, went home.

data.v: त्वष्टा प्रजापतिः श्रुत्वा शक्रेणाथ हतं सुतम् । क्रोधसंरक्तनयन इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: This chief among the gods, having killed his enemy, thought himself gratified. Tvashtri, the lord of all beings, having heard of the slaying of his son by Shakra, said these words with eyes red with wrath.

data.v: तप्यमानं तपो नित्यं क्षान्तं दान्तं जितेन्द्रियम् । अनापराधिनं यस्मात्पुत्रं हिंसितवान्मम ।।
data.md: Tvashtri said due to my My son who was ever devoted to devotion, of a forgiving nature, endowed with selfcontrol and who had brought his passions under his control, has been killed by you without any fault.

data.v: तस्माच्छक्रवधार्थाय वृत्रमुत्पादयाम्यहम् । लोकाः पश्यन्तु मे वीर्यं तपसश्च बलं महत् । स च पश्यतु देवेन्द्रो दुरात्मा पापचेतनः ।।
data.md: For this reason shall I create Vritra with a view to destroy Shakra. Let the worlds see my influence and power as also the great strength devotion.

data.v: उपस्पृश्य ततः क्रुद्धस्तपस्वी सुमहायशाः । अग्निं हुत्वा समुत्पाद्य घोरं वृत्रमुवाच ह । इन्द्रशत्रो विवर्धस्व प्रभावात्तपसो मम ।।
data.md: And having made his offerings to fire and having created the hero Vritra said-"O you foe of Indra, grow up through the strength due to my devotions."

data.v: सोऽवर्धत दिवं स्तब्ध्वा सूर्यवैश्वानरोपमः । किं करोमीति चोवाच कालसूर्य इवोदितः । शक्रं जहीति चाप्युक्तो जगाम त्रिदिवं ततः ।।
data.md: He grew up and the height of his figure reached beyond the sky and could be compared with the sun or fire. Like the sun that rises at the time of the annihilation of the universe, he said-"What shall I do?"

data.v: ततो युद्धं समभवद्वृत्रवासवयोस्तदा । संक्रुद्धयोर्महाघोरं प्रसक्तं कुरुसत्तम ।।
ततो जग्राह देवेन्द्रं वृत्रो वीरः शतक्रतुम् । अपावृत्य स जग्रास वृत्रः क्रोधसमन्वितः ।।
ग्रस्ते वृत्रेण शक्रे तु संभ्रान्तास्त्रिदशास्तदा । असृजंस्ते महासत्त्वा जृम्भिकां वृत्रनाशिनीम् ।।
विजृम्भमाणस्य ततो वृत्रस्यास्यादपावृतात् । स्वान्यङ्गान्यभिसंक्षिप्य निष्क्रान्तो बलसूदनः । ततः प्रभृति लोकेषु जृम्भिका प्राणिसंश्रिता ।।
data.md: They highly powerful then created the Yawn which was to destroy Vritra and then the slayer of Bala contracted his limbs and came out of the open mouth of the yawning Vritra. Since that day has the yawn remained in the breath of men.

data.v: जहृषुश्च सुराः सर्वे दृष्ट्वा शक्रं विनिःसृतम् । ततः प्रववृते युद्धं वृत्रवासवयोः पुनः । संरब्धयोस्तदा घोरं सुचिरं भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: And seeing Shakra come out the gods all became joyful and then Vritra and Vasava again engaged themselves is fight.

data.v: यदा व्यवर्धत रणे वृत्रो बलसमन्वितः । त्वष्टुस्तपोबलाद्विद्वांस्तदा शक्रो न्यवर्तत ।।
data.md: 0 best among the race of Bharata, the fierce contest between the two, fired with ire, lasted for a long time, when in battle Vritra, possessed of power, got the victory through the strength due to the inner spirit of Tvashtri. Shakra turned his back and he turning his back the gods were very much depressed.

data.v: निवृत्ते तु तदा देवा विषादमगमन्परम् । समेत्य शक्रेण च ते त्वष्टुस्तेजोविमोहिताः । अमन्त्रयन्त ते सर्वे मुनिभिः सह भारत ।।
data.md: Being pierced with the spirit of Tvashtri they untied with Shakra and all held a consultation with the Rishis, O son of Bharata.

data.v: किं कार्यमिति ते राजन्विचिन्त्य भयमोहिताः । जग्मुः सर्वे महात्मानं मनोभिर्विष्णुमव्ययम् । उपविष्टा मन्दराग्रे सर्वे वृत्रवधेप्सवः ।।
data.md: Filled with dread they thought, O king, on what could best be done. Seated at the summit of Mandara, they all desirous of the destruction of Vritra, went in imagination of Vishnu, who was never to be destroyed.

data.v: सर्वं व्याप्तमिदं देवा वृत्रेण जगदव्ययम् । न ह्यस्य सदृशं किंचित्प्रतिघाताय यद्भवेत् ।।
data.md: Shakra said The whole of this indestructible universe has been pervaded, O gods, by Vritra. There is nothing equal to opposing him.

data.v: समर्थो ह्यभवं पूर्वमसमर्थोऽस्मि सांप्रतम् । कथं कुर्यां नु भद्रं वो दुष्प्रधर्षः स मे मतः ।।
data.md: I was before this capable of (doing this) but at present I am incapable. I wish you well. What can I do? I think he is hard to vanquish.

data.v: तेजस्वी च महात्मा च युद्धे चामितविक्रमः । ग्रसेत्त्रिभुवनं सर्वं सदेवासुरमानुषम् ।।
data.md: He is spirited large minded and of unparalleled prowess in battle and he will absorb all the three worlds with all their gods, Asuras and men.

data.v: तस्माद्विनिश्चयमिमं शृणुध्वं मे दिवौकसः । विष्णोः क्षयमुपागम्य समेत्य च महात्मना । तेन संमन्त्र्य वेत्स्यामो वधोपायं दुरात्मनः ।।
data.md: Therefore O you denizens of the heaven, this is certain that by going to the abode of Vishnu and joining with that large-minded one and consulting with him we shall know the means of slaying the vicious one.

data.v: एवमुक्ते मघवता देवाः सर्षिगणास्तदा । शरण्यं शरणं देवं जग्मुर्विष्णुं महाबलम् ।।
data.md: Shalya said The gods being thus spoken to by Maghavan the group of Rishis placed themselves under the protection of the god Vishnu of great influence and competent to be a protector.

data.v: ऊचुश्च सर्वे देवेशं विष्णुं वृत्रभयार्दिताः । त्वया लोकास्त्रयः क्रान्तास्त्रिभिर्विक्रमणैः प्रभो ।।
data.md: And they, distressed with the fear of Vritra, spoke thus to Vishnu the lord of all gods-In days of yore did you cover the three worlds with three steps.

data.v: अमृतं चाहृतं विष्णो दैत्याश्च निहता रणे । बलिं बद्ध्वा महादैत्यं शक्रो देवाधिपः कृतः ।।
data.md: And O Vishnu, robbed it of nectar and killed in battle all the Daityas and after slaying Vali the great Daityas appointed Shakra, as the lord of the gods.

data.v: त्वं प्रभुः सर्वलोकानां त्वया सर्वमिदं ततम् । त्वं हि देव महादेवः सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः ।।
data.md: You are the Supreme Lord of all the gods and the whole (of this world) is pervaded by you; you, O Lord, are the supreme Lord revered by all the worlds.

data.v: गतिर्भव त्वं देवानां सेन्द्राणाममरोत्तम । जगद्व्याप्तमिदं सर्वं वृत्रेणासुरसूदन ।।
data.md: O you best among the immortals, be the means of salvation of the gods including Indra. O you slayer of Asuras, the entire world is pervaded by Vritra.

data.v: अवश्यं करणीयं मे भवतां हितमुत्तमम् । तस्मादुपायं वक्ष्यामि यथासौ न भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Vishnu said Doing your good is my imperative duty; therefore am I speaking of the means by which he shall cease to exist.

data.v: गच्छध्वं सर्षिगन्धर्वा यत्रासौ विश्वरूपधृक् । साम तस्य प्रयुञ्जध्वं तत एनं विजेष्यथ ।।
data.md: In company with the Rishis and the Gandharvas you go to the place where that holder of the universal from is staying; make use of conciliatory policy towards him; then shall you win victory over him.

data.v: भविष्यति गतिर्देवाः शक्रस्य मम तेजसा । अदृश्यश्च प्रवेक्ष्यामि वज्रमस्यायुधोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: O gods, through my influence, victory will be on the side of Shakra. Being invisible shall I enter the thunder bolt-that excellent weapons of his.

data.v: गच्छध्वमृषिभिः सार्धं गन्धर्वैश्च सुरोत्तमाः । वृत्रस्य सह शक्रेण संधिं कुरुत माचिरम् ।।
data.md: O you best among the gods, go in company with the Rishis and the Gandharvas. Effect a truce without delay between Shakra and Vritra.

data.v: एवमुक्तास्तु देवेन ऋषयस्त्रिदशास्तथा । ययुः समेत्य सहिताः शक्रं कृत्वा पुरःसरम् ।।
data.md: Shalya said The Rishis and the dwellers, of the third heaven being thus spoken to by that god, went together, with Shakra at their head.

data.v: समीपमेत्य च तदा सर्व एव महौजसः । तं तेजसा प्रज्वलितं प्रतपन्तं दिशो दश ।।
data.md: Then all those mighty ones came near him, through whose influence the ten cardinal points were on fire and being scorched.

data.v: ग्रसन्तमिव लोकांस्त्रीन्सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ यथा । ददृशुस्तत्र ते वृत्रं शक्रेण सह देवताः ।।
data.md: Those gods, with Indra, then saw Vritra who seemed as if swallowing the three worlds and looking as the sun or the moon.

data.v: ऋषयोऽथ ततोऽभ्येत्य वृत्रमूचुः प्रियं वचः । व्याप्तं जगदिदं सर्वं तेजसा तव दुर्जय ।।
data.md: Then the Rishis came there and said these conciliatory words of Vritra. O you hard to conquer, this world is pervaded by your energy.

data.v: न च शक्नोषि निर्जेतुं वासवं भूरिविक्रमम् । युध्यतोश्चापि वां कालो व्यतीतः सुमहानिह ।।
data.md: O you best of powerful beings, you will not be able to conquer Vasava and a very long period has elapsed since you commenced fighting.

data.v: पीड्यन्ते च प्रजाः सर्वाः सदेवासुरमानवाः । सख्यं भवतु ते वृत्र शक्रेण सह नित्यदा । अवाप्स्यसि सुखं त्वं च शक्रलोकांश्च शाश्वतान् ।।
data.md: All beings including the gods, the Asuras and the human beings, are enduring misery. Let there always exit, O Vritra, friendship between you and Shakra.

data.v: ऋषिवाक्यं निशम्याथ स वृत्रः सुमहाबलः । उवाच तांस्तदा सर्वान्प्रणम्य शिरसासुरः ।।
सर्वे यूयं महाभागा गन्धर्वाश्चैव सर्वशः । यद्ब्रूत तच्छ्रुतं सर्वं ममापि शृणुतानघाः ।।
संधिः कथं वै भविता मम शक्रस्य चोभयोः । तेजसोर्हि द्वयोर्देवाः सख्यं वै भविता कथम् ।।
data.md: The Asura bowed unto all those Rishis with his head and said to them-O you endowed with good qualities and you Gandharvas, what you all have said, I have listened to. O you stainless beings, hear now what I say. How can there be peace between us two-myself and Shakra? How can there be friendship between two gods who are both powerful?

data.v: सकृत्सतां संगतं लिप्सितव्यं; ततः परं भविता भव्यमेव । नातिक्रमेत्सत्पुरुषेण संगतं; तस्मात्सतां संगतं लिप्सितव्यम् ।।
data.md: The Rishis said The company of virtuous ones is desirable (even for a time); thereafter what is fated will come to pass. The opportunity of friendship with virtuous men should not be lost; therefore is the company of virtuous men desirable.

data.v: दृढं सतां संगतं चापि नित्यं; ब्रूयाच्चार्थं ह्यर्थकृच्छ्रेषु धीरः । महार्थवत्सत्पुरुषेण संगतं; तस्मात्सन्तं न जिघांसेत धीरः ।।
data.md: Wise men ever speak of firm friendship with virtuous men as wealth is times of pecuniary difficulties. The company of virtuous men is vast wealth indeed; therefore wise men should not injure virtuous ones.

data.v: इन्द्रः सतां संमतश्च निवासश्च महात्मनाम् । सत्यवादी ह्यदीनश्च धर्मवित्सुविनिश्चितः ।।
data.md: Indra is honoured by virtuous men and the refuse of the large-minded. He is also truth speaking, blameless, understands virtue and has refined judgment.

data.v: तेन ते सह शक्रेण संधिर्भवतु शाश्वतः । एवं विश्वासमागच्छ मा ते भूद्बुद्धिरन्यथा ।।
data.md: Let there be peace, to eternity, with Indra; come to entertain faith in him; let not your opinion be otherwise.

data.v: महर्षिवचनं श्रुत्वा तानुवाच महाद्युतिः । अवश्यं भगवन्तो मे माननीयास्तपस्विनः ।।
data.md: Shalya said The being with great luster, having heard the speech of the great Rishis, said to them! O devotees, O lord, you are, of course, to be honoured by me.

data.v: ब्रवीमि यदहं देवास्तत्सर्वं क्रियतामिह । ततः सर्वं करिष्यामि यदूचुर्मां द्विजर्षभाः ।।
data.md: O gods, if you do all that I am going to say then shall I do all that you have said to me, O foremost among the twice born.

data.v: न शुष्केण न चार्द्रेण नाश्मना न च दारुणा । न शस्त्रेण न वज्रेण न दिवा न तथा निशि ।।
data.md: Not by dry thing nor be a wet one, not by stone, nor by wood, nor by a weapon fit for use from a distance, nor by one fit for hand to hand fight, not during the day time nor during the night,

data.v: वध्यो भवेयं विप्रेन्द्राः शक्रस्य सह दैवतैः । एवं मे रोचते संधिः शक्रेण सह नित्यदा ।।
data.md: Shall I be capable of being slain, O chief among the Brahmanas, by Shakra, assisted by the gods. If you ordain this then shall there ever be peace with Shakra.

data.v: बाढमित्येव ऋषयस्तमूचुर्भरतर्षभ । एवं कृते तु संधाने वृत्रः प्रमुदितोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: O best among the race of Bharata the Rishis said-"very well" and Vritra too became pleased with having peace under these conditions.

data.v: यत्तः सदाभवच्चापि शक्रोऽमर्षसमन्वितः । वृत्रस्य वधसंयुक्तानुपायाननुचिन्तयन् । रन्ध्रान्वेषी समुद्विग्नः सदाभूद्बलवृत्रहा ।।
data.md: Shakra too became delighted and became constantly engaged in the thought of finding out some means of killing Vritra.

data.v: स कदाचित्समुद्रान्ते तमपश्यन्महासुरम् । संध्याकाल उपावृत्ते मुहूर्ते रम्यदारुणे ।।
ततः संचिन्त्य भगवान्वरदानं महात्मनः । संध्येयं वर्तते रौद्रा न रात्रिर्दिवसं न च । वृत्रश्चावश्यवध्योऽयं मम सर्वहरो रिपुः ।।
data.md: This is evening, it is not in the sun; it is neither the night nor the day. And Vritra, the enemy who has robbed me of all must be slain.

data.v: यदि वृत्रं न हन्म्यद्य वञ्चयित्वा महासुरम् । महाबलं महाकायं न मे श्रेयो भविष्यति ।।
data.md: If I do not this day slay the great Asura, Vritra of great strength and of a huge body by an artifice, it will not be well with me.

data.v: एवं संचिन्तयन्नेव शक्रो विष्णुमनुस्मरन् । अथ फेनं तदापश्यत्समुद्रे पर्वतोपमम् ।।
data.md: Thus thinking Shakra invoked Vishnu and then saw coming out of the sea, foam high as a mountain.

data.v: नायं शुष्को न चार्द्रोऽयं न च शस्त्रमिदं तथा । एनं क्षेप्स्यामि वृत्रस्य क्षणादेव नशिष्यति ।।
data.md: This is not wet nor dry nor is this a weapon. I shall fling this which will destroy Vritra is moment.

data.v: सवज्रमथ फेनं तं क्षिप्रं वृत्रे निसृष्टवान् । प्रविश्य फेनं तं विष्णुरथ वृत्रं व्यनाशयत् ।।
data.md: Quickly did he fling the foam with the thunderbolt at Vritra and Vishnu having entered the foam destroyed Vritra.

data.v: निहते तु ततो वृत्रे दिशो वितिमिराभवन् । प्रववौ च शिवो वायुः प्रजाश्च जहृषुस्तदा ।।
data.md: And Vritra being slain, the cardinal points became divested of darkness and a pleasant wind blew and the beings of the earth rejoiced.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वा यक्षराक्षसपन्नगाः । ऋषयश्च महेन्द्रं तमस्तुवन्विविधैः स्तवैः ।।
data.md: And then the gods along with the Gandharvas, Yakshas, Rakshasas and Pannagas and the Rishis propitiated the great Indra with diverse hymns.

data.v: नमस्कृतः सर्वभूतैः सर्वभूतानि सान्त्वयन् । हतशत्रुः प्रहृष्टात्मा वासवः सह दैवतैः । विष्णुं त्रिभुवनश्रेष्ठं पूजयामास धर्मवित् ।।
data.md: Being bowed down to by all beings, he encouraged all the beings in his turn. Slaying the enemy, the mind of Vasava became delighted with the gods.

data.v: ततो हते महावीर्ये वृत्रे देवभयंकरे । अनृतेनाभिभूतोऽभूच्छक्रः परमदुर्मनाः । त्रैशीर्षयाभिभूतश्च स पूर्वं ब्रह्महत्यया ।।
data.md: Now, Shakra became overpowered by false-hood and exceedingly depressed in spirits and also overpowered by the sin of slaying the Brahmana (the three headed one).

data.v: सोऽन्तमाश्रित्य लोकानां नष्टसंज्ञो विचेतनः । न प्राज्ञायत देवेन्द्रस्त्वभिभूतः स्वकल्मषैः । प्रतिच्छन्नो वसत्यप्सु चेष्टमान इवोरगः ।।
data.md: Staying at the end of the worlds, he became deprived of his senses and consciousness and the chief of the gods overpowered with the weight of his own sins could not be recognised.

data.v: ततः प्रनष्टे देवेन्द्रे ब्रह्महत्याभयार्दिते । भूमिः प्रध्वस्तसंकाशा निर्वृक्षा शुष्ककानना । विच्छिन्नस्रोतसो नद्यः सरांस्यनुदकानि च ।।
data.md: The earth became desolate and went to ruins and became treeless and the forests became dry. And the currents of the rivers became stopped and the lakes lost all their water.

data.v: संक्षोभश्चापि सत्त्वानामनावृष्टिकृतोऽभवत् । देवाश्चापि भृशं त्रस्तास्तथा सर्वे महर्षयः ।।
data.md: And there came distress among the beings of the earth, owing to death of rain and the gods and the great Rishis remained struck with intense fear.

data.v: अराजकं जगत्सर्वमभिभूतमुपद्रवैः । ततो भीताभवन्देवाः को नो राजा भवेदिति ।।
data.md: And the entire world oppressed with anarchy became overpowered with all sorts of disasters and the gods became frightened for no hody would be their king.

data.v: दिवि देवर्षयश्चापि देवराजविनाकृताः । न च स्म कश्चिद्देवानां राज्याय कुरुते मनः ।।
data.md: And the divine saints in heaven also being deprived of the protection of the king of the gods became fearful. No body was inclined to be the king of the gods.

data.v: ऋषयोऽथाब्रुवन्सर्वे देवाश्च त्रिदशेश्वराः । अयं वै नहुषः श्रीमान्देवराज्येऽभिषिच्यताम् । ते गत्वाथाब्रुवन्सर्वे राजा नो भव पार्थिव ।।
data.md: Shalya said Then did all the gods and Yakshas with the Kinnaras say 'Anoint this handsome Nahusha in the kingship of the gods.'

data.v: स तानुवाच नहुषो देवानृषिगणांस्तथा । पितृभिः सहितान्राजन्परीप्सन्हितमात्मनः ।।
data.md: Thus, O king, did Nahusha, who wished their welfare, address the gods and the Rishis who were accompanied by our ancestors.

data.v: दुर्बलोऽहं न मे शक्तिर्भवतां परिपालने । बलवाञ्जायते राजा बलं शक्रे हि नित्यदा ।।
data.md: I am weak; it is not in my power to protect you. The powerful should make kings, (and) power ever graced Shakra.

data.v: तमब्रुवन्पुनः सर्वे देवाः सर्षिपुरोगमाः । अस्माकं तपसा युक्तः पाहि राज्यं त्रिविष्टपे ।।
data.md: All the gods and the foremost among the Rishis said to him, Endued with the virtue of devotion, protect our kingdom in heaven.

data.v: परस्परभयं घोरमस्माकं हि न संशयः । अभिषिच्यस्व राजेन्द्र भव राजा त्रिविष्टपे ।।
data.md: All of us doubtless have grave fears; be anointed our king, foremost among monarchs, be the king of heaven.

data.v: देवदानवयक्षाणामृषीणां रक्षसां तथा । पितृगन्धर्वभूतानां चक्षुर्विषयवर्तिनाम् । तेज आदास्यसे पश्यन्बलवांश्च भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: You will absorb the power, of the gods, the Danavas, the Yakshas. Rishis the Rakshasas, the Pitris, the Gandharvas and all other beings within the range of your sight as soon as you see them. Setting virtue always above all other considerations be the lord of all worlds.

data.v: धर्मं पुरस्कृत्य सदा सर्वलोकाधिपो भव । ब्रह्मर्षींश्चापि देवांश्च गोपायस्व त्रिविष्टपे ।।
data.md: Protect also the Brahmarshis and the gods in heaven. And that chief among the kings being anointed the king in heaven.

data.v: सुदुर्लभं वरं लब्ध्वा प्राप्य राज्यं त्रिविष्टपे । धर्मात्मा सततं भूत्वा कामात्मा समपद्यत ।।
data.md: And placing virtue above everything else became the protector of the worlds. Being granted a rare boon and obtaining the kingdom in heaven, he gave himself up to gratifying every wish of his, though before this he had ever been a virtuous being.

data.v: देवोद्यानेषु सर्वेषु नन्दनोपवनेषु च । कैलासे हिमवत्पृष्ठे मन्दरे श्वेतपर्वते । सह्ये महेन्द्रे मलये समुद्रेषु सरित्सु च ।।
data.md: In all the gardens of the gods and in the pleasure gardens, on the Kailasa and on the brow of the Himavat, on the Mandara and on the white mountains, on the Shalya, on the Mahendra and on the Malaya in the seas and in the lakes surrounded by fairies and nymphs. Nahusha, the king of the gods, spent his time in many sorts of sports and hearing many sorts of। stories relating to the gods, which were sweet to listen to. (He spent his time also) with all sorts of musical instruments and sweet sounding songs.

data.v: अप्सरोभिः परिवृतो देवकन्यासमावृतः । नहुषो देवराजः सन्क्रीडन्बहुविधं तदा ।।
शृण्वन्दिव्या बहुविधाः कथाः श्रुतिमनोहराः । वादित्राणि च सर्वाणि गीतं च मधुरस्वरम् ।।
विश्वावसुर्नारदश्च गन्धर्वाप्सरसां गणाः । ऋतवः षट्च देवेन्द्रं मूर्तिमन्त उपस्थिताः । मारुतः सुरभिर्वाति मनोज्ञः सुखशीतलः ।।
data.md: Vishvavasu, Narada, Gandharvas and celestial nymphs and the six personified, attended on him. seasons

data.v: एवं हि क्रीडतस्तस्य नहुषस्य महात्मनः । संप्राप्ता दर्शनं देवी शक्रस्य महिषी प्रिया ।।
data.md: Breezes, fragrant, cooling and charming too blew on him. The goddess, the dearly beloved Queen of Shakra, caught the gaze of the high-minded Nahusha, given thus to sporting.

data.v: स तां संदृश्य दुष्टात्मा प्राह सर्वान्सभासदः । इन्द्रस्य महिषी देवी कस्मान्मां नोपतिष्ठति ।।
data.md: Seeing her the evil minded one thus addressed his courtiers-"Why does not the goddess, the queen of Indra, attend on me. As the lord of the gods and the worlds, I am Indra. Let Sachi come to my palace this day at once."

data.v: अहमिन्द्रोऽस्मि देवानां लोकानां च तथेश्वरः । आगच्छतु शची मह्यं क्षिप्रमद्य निवेशनम् ।।
data.md: Seeing her the evil minded one thus addressed his courtiers-"Why does not the goddess, the queen of Indra, attend on me. As the lord of the gods and the worlds, I am Indra. Let Sachi come to my palace this day at once."

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा दुर्मना देवी बृहस्पतिमुवाच ह । रक्ष मां नहुषाद्ब्रह्मंस्तवास्मि शरणं गता ।।
सर्वलक्षणसंपन्नां ब्रह्मंस्त्वं मां प्रभाषसे । देवराजस्य दयितामत्यन्तसुखभागिनीम् ।।
अवैधव्येन संयुक्तामेकपत्नीं पतिव्रताम् । उक्तवानसि मां पूर्वमृतां तां कुरु वै गिरम् ।।
नोक्तपूर्वं च भगवन्मृषा ते किंचिदीश्वर । तस्मादेतद्भवेत्सत्यं त्वयोक्तं द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: O god, let this speech of your be made true. O lord, what you have said has never before proved false, therefore, O you foremost among the twice-born, let this said by you be true.

data.v: बृहस्पतिरथोवाच इन्द्राणीं भयमोहिताम् । यदुक्तासि मया देवि सत्यं तद्भविता ध्रुवम् ।।
द्रक्ष्यसे देवराजानमिन्द्रं शीघ्रमिहागतम् । न भेतव्यं च नहुषात्सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते । समानयिष्ये शक्रेण नचिराद्भवतीमहम् ।।
data.md: Then did Brihaspati address the panicstricken queen of Indra-"What has been said by me, O goddess, will most certainly prove true. You will soon see the king of the gods, Indra, come here. Nahusha need not be feared by you. I speak this truly. I shall without delay bring Indra near you.

data.v: अथ शुश्राव नहुष इन्द्राणीं शरणं गताम् । बृहस्पतेरङ्गिरसश्चुक्रोध स नृपस्तदा ।।
data.md: Nahusha heard that the queen of Indra had placed herself under the protection of Brihaspati the son of Angirasa and the king became very angry.

data.v: क्रुद्धं तु नहुषं ज्ञात्वा देवाः सर्षिपुरोगमाः । अब्रुवन्देवराजानं नहुषं घोरदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: Shalya said The gods and the foremost among the Rishis seeing Nahusha enraged said to the (now) terrible looking king of the gods.

data.v: देवराज जहि क्रोधं त्वयि क्रुद्धे जगद्विभो । त्रस्तं सासुरगन्धर्वं सकिंनरमहोरगम् ।।
data.md: O king of the gods, put aside this anger. At your anger the world, with its Asuras and Gandharyas and Kinnaras and the great serpents, is stricken with panic.

data.v: जहि क्रोधमिमं साधो न क्रुध्यन्ति भवद्विधाः । परस्य पत्नी सा देवी प्रसीदस्व सुरेश्वर ।।
data.md: 0 virtuous one, put aside this anger. Beings like you never get angry. That goddess is the wife of another. O lord of the gods, be propitious.

data.v: निवर्तय मनः पापात्परदाराभिमर्शनात् । देवराजोऽसि भद्रं ते प्रजा धर्मेण पालय ।।
data.md: Turn back your mind from the wish of ravishing the wife of another. You are the king of the gods, we wish you well, protect your subjects by virtuous means.

data.v: एवमुक्तो न जग्राह तद्वचः काममोहितः । अथ देवानुवाचेदमिन्द्रं प्रति सुराधिपः ।।
data.md: Being thus addressed, he, struck with passion, listened not to those words. The protector of the gods then said to the gods regarding Indra.

data.v: अहल्या धर्षिता पूर्वमृषिपत्नी यशस्विनी । जीवतो भर्तुरिन्द्रेण स वः किं न निवारितः ।।
data.md: Ahalya, the wife of a Rishi (herself) of good reputation, was ravished by Indra while her husband was alive. Why was he not then prevented by you.

data.v: बहूनि च नृशंसानि कृतानीन्द्रेण वै पुरा । वैधर्म्याण्युपधाश्चैव स वः किं न निवारितः ।।
data.md: In bygone days, many were the deeds of cruelty done by Indra, as also vicious deeds and deceitful ones. Why was he not prevented by you.

data.v: उपतिष्ठतु मां देवी एतदस्या हितं परम् । युष्माकं च सदा देवाः शिवमेवं भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Let the goddess attend on me; this will be of great benefit to her and it will also prove to be your means of safety.

data.v: इन्द्राणीमानयिष्यामो यथेच्छसि दिवस्पते । जहि क्रोधमिमं वीर प्रीतो भव सुरेश्वर ।।
data.md: The gods said We shall bring here the wife of Indra as you wish, O lord of the heaven; O hero put aside this anger and be propitious, o lord of the gods.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा ते तदा देवा ऋषिभिः सह भारत । जग्मुर्बृहस्पतिं वक्तुमिन्द्राणीं चाशुभं वचः ।।
data.md: Shalya said Saying this, the gods accompanied by the Rishis, O on of Bharata, went to tell this unwelcome news to Brihaspati and the wife of Indra.

data.v: जानीमः शरणं प्राप्तमिन्द्राणीं तव वेश्मनि । दत्ताभयां च विप्रेन्द्र त्वया देवर्षिसत्तम ।।
data.md: And they said we are aware that the queen of Indra has placed herself under your protection at your abode, O chief among the Brahmanas and that she has been accorded (your) protection, 0 chief among the Devarshis.

data.v: ते त्वां देवाः सगन्धर्वा ऋषयश्च महाद्युते । प्रसादयन्ति चेन्द्राणी नहुषाय प्रदीयताम् ।।
data.md: They, the gods with the Gandharvas and Rishis, pray you, O you of great luster, to make over the Queen of Indra to Nahusha.

data.v: इन्द्राद्विशिष्टो नहुषो देवराजो महाद्युतिः । वृणोत्वियं वरारोहा भर्तृत्वे वरवर्णिनी ।।
data.md: The king of the gods Nahusha of great luster is superior to Indra. Let this lady with slender waist and bright complexion, choose him as her husband.

data.v: एवमुक्ते तु सा देवी बाष्पमुत्सृज्य सस्वरम् । उवाच रुदती दीना बृहस्पतिमिदं वचः ।।
data.md: The goddess being thus spoken to, became depressed and sobbed aloud with tears in her eyes and then crying said these words to Brihaspati.

data.v: नाहमिच्छामि नहुषं पतिमन्वास्य तं प्रभुम् । शरणागतास्मि ते ब्रह्मंस्त्राहि मां महतो भयात् ।।
data.md: O you best among the Devarshis, I have no inclination for Nahusha; I have thrown myself under your protection, O Brahmanas, save me from this great calamity.

data.v: शरणागतां न त्यजेयमिन्द्राणि मम निश्चितम् । धर्मज्ञां धर्मशीलां च न त्यजे त्वामनिन्दिते ।।
data.md: Brihaspati said It is settled that the queen of Indra, who has thrown herself under my protection, will not be turned out by me. I shall not turn out, O you who know what virtue is, the truthful and blameless.

data.v: नाकार्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि ब्राह्मणः सन्विशेषतः । श्रुतधर्मा सत्यशीलो जानन्धर्मानुशासनम् ।।
data.md: I do not wish to do a wrong thing, especially as I am a Brahmanas, who have heard what virtue is and know the rules of virtue and am truthful.

data.v: नाहमेतत्करिष्यामि गच्छध्वं वै सुरोत्तमाः । अस्मिंश्चार्थे पुरा गीतं ब्रह्मणा श्रूयतामिदम् ।।
data.md: I shall not do this; go, you best among the gods; listen to what has before been sung by Brahma, with regard to this matter, in days of old.

data.md: You should not be (merely) equal to the Asuras or the gods. By your own strength do you absorb that of all beings the moment you set your eyes on them. No one can stand face to face with you, O you powerful being.

data.md: The one who makes the Rishis his bearers cannot be of little strength. I am a devotee, strong and lord of what has been, what is to be and what is.

data.md: O you receiver of offerings, having created the three worlds in due time you again in due time consume them in an enkindled form; you are, O god of fire, the progenitor of the entire world and you again annihilate it.

data.md: Wise people called you, O Agni, the giver of water and lightning and flames coming out from you support all beings.

data.md: O you performer of a hundred sacrifices, gain in strength and slay all enemies; rise up Shakra and see the Devarshis come to you.

data.md: O Great Indra, having slain the Danavas, you have saved the worlds. O Lord, having got the foam of the waters and with the assistance of the strength of Vishnu, you have killed Vritra before this; o you king of the gods, 0 you lord of the universe.

data.v: त्वं सर्वभूतेषु वरेण्य ईड्य;स्त्वया समं विद्यते नेह भूतम् । त्वया धार्यन्ते सर्वभूतानि शक्र; त्वं देवानां महिमानं चकर्थ ।।
data.md: You are the saviour of all beings and worthy of beings and worthy of being propitiated by them. There is no being is this world equal to you. All the beings and support by you, O Shakra and you created the greatness of the gods.

data.md: What is there still remaining to be done. The great Asura, the son of Tvashtri, has been killed and so has been Vritra of large stature who destroyed the three worlds.

data.md: Brihaspati said The human being Nahusha, through the influence of the Devarshis, having gained the kingdom of gods, is very much inflecting us.

data.md: Indra said How did Nahusha obtain the kingdom of the gods, which is hard to gain; with what strength of devotion is he endued, what is his power, O Brihaspati.

data.md: Brihaspati said Yourself having left the celebrated position of Indra, the gods became anxious and wished for a Shakra; and at that time the gods, the Pitris, the Rishis and the chief among the Gandharvas all united together.

data.md: The gods being thus spoken to, infused strength into Nahusha (now) of great strength and, he became the king; having got the kingdom of the three worlds, he has made the great Rishis his bears and the wicked-minded one is now roaming about the worlds.

data.md: Never do you look at Nahusha who absorbs all energy and whose gaze is as very subtle as poison. The gods too, being very much afraid of Nahusha, do not look at him and roam about in concealment.

data.md: Shalya said While Brihaspati, that best among the race of Angira, was yet speaking, Kubera, the ruler of the world and Yama, the son of Vivasvata and the aged god Soma and Varuna came there.

data.md: Coming together, shall we this day, with the aid of the gods, win victory over our enemy, Nahusha, of terrific gaze. data.md: Shalya said Thus thinking, the god, the great Indra, the chastiser of the Paka, the giver of boons, with due deliberation, gave to Kubera the lordship of all the Yakshas and treasures and to the son of Vivasvata that over the Pitris and to Varuna that over the waters.

data.md: Indra said Welcome to you, O great Rishi; I am pleased at seeing you; be so good as to accept from me water for washing your feet and your face and also the things suitable for your worship and a cow.

data.v: पूजितं चोपविष्टं तमासने मुनिसत्तमम् । पर्यपृच्छत देवेशः प्रहृष्टो ब्राह्मणर्षभम् ।।
data.md: Shalya said That best among the Rishis being duly worshipped and seated on a seat, the chief of the gods, well pleased, asked that best among the Brahmanas.

data.md: O you best among the twice born, having the six attributes, narrate how Nahusha of vicious purpose came to be ousted from heaven. I want to hear that.

data.md: Agastya said Listen, O Shakra, to this story as to how the vicious-souled Nahusha, of bad habits, vain of his strength, has been ousted from heaven.

data.md: The Devarshis of great attributes and the Brahmarshis of spotless fame wearied with bearing Nahusha, the doer of vicious deeds, asked him (Nahusha), O best of victors, if the hymns prescribed to be chanted by Brahma, at the time of sprinkling the cows, were authentic. And also if he believed in their authenticity, told them that it was not authentic.

data.v: अधर्मे संप्रवृत्तस्त्वं धर्मं न प्रतिपद्यसे । प्रमाणमेतदस्माकं पूर्वं प्रोक्तं महर्षिभिः ।।
data.md: The Rishis said You are going along the path of vice; you do not act virtuously. “That they are authentic" has before been said by our great Rishis.

data.md: For ten thousand years, assuming the form of a large snake, shall you roam about and at the completion of that period shall you again get into heaven.

data.md: This story of the victory of Shakra is of the same rank, as the Veda, with regard to its sanctity and it ought to be listened to by a king who is desirous of a victory and who has his army ready for battle.

data.md: Seven Akshauhinis have been collected for the son of Dharma (Yudhishthira), they all desirous of fighting with the sons of Kuru, are waiting for his permission.

data.v: अपरे पुरुषव्याघ्राः सहस्राक्षौहिणीसमाः । सात्यकिर्भीमसेनश्च यमौ च सुमहाबलौ ।।
data.md: There are others, best among men, who are, each of them equal to thousand Akshauhinis-for instance, the son of Satyaki, Bhimasena and the twin brothers of very great strength.

data.v: एकादशैताः पृतना एकतश्च समागताः । एकतश्च महाबाहुर्बहुरूपो धनंजयः ।।
data.md: On one side are united those eleven (Akshauhinis) and on the other, Dhananjaya of great strength and of many forms.

data.v: यथा किरीटी सेनाभ्यः सर्वाभ्यो व्यतिरिच्यते । एवमेव महाबाहुर्वासुदेवो महाद्युतिः ।।
data.md: An Kiritin suppress the entire army, so does Vasudeva of long arms and of great luster.

data.v: बहुलत्वं च सेनानां विक्रमं च किरीटिनः । बुद्धिमत्तां च कृष्णस्य बुद्ध्वा युध्येत को नरः ।।
data.md: What man will fight against an army superior in number, the prowess of Kiritin and the wisdom of Krishna.

data.v: ते भवन्तो यथाधर्मं यथासमयमेव च । प्रयच्छन्तु प्रदातव्यं मा वः कालोऽत्यगादयम् ।।
data.md: Therefore do you, as dictated by virtue and as agreed to in the stipulation, give back that which should be returned. Don't you let this opportunity.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रज्ञावृद्धो महाद्युतिः । संपूज्यैनं यथाकालं भीष्मो वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having heard these words of his, Bhishma, of great luster and old in wisdom, did him due honours and spoke these words to him as suited the occasion.

data.v: दिष्ट्या कुशलिनः सर्वे पाण्डवाः सह बान्धवैः । दिष्ट्या सहायवन्तश्च दिष्ट्या धर्मे च ते रताः ।।
data.md: It is lucky that they all along with Damodara are doing well; it is lucky that have secured aid and it is lucky that they are intent on acting virtuously.

data.v: दिष्ट्या च संधिकामास्ते भ्रातरः कुरुनन्दनाः । दिष्ट्या न युद्धमनसः सह दामोदरेण ते ।।
data.md: And it is lucky that our cousins, the sons of Kuru, desire peace, it is lucky that the sons of Pandu are not desirous of war with their relations.

data.v: भवता सत्यमुक्तं च सर्वमेतन्न संशयः । अतितीक्ष्णं तु ते वाक्यं ब्राह्मण्यादिति मे मतिः ।।
data.md: Truth has been spoken by you; it is so; no doubt your words are very sharp; in my opinion that is so because you are a Brahmana.

data.v: असंशयं क्लेशितास्ते वने चेह च पाण्डवाः । प्राप्ताश्च धर्मतः सर्वं पितुर्धनमसंशयम् ।।
data.md: Kiritin the son of Pritha is strong, well coached in handling weapons and of mighty prowess; who is there to stand against Dhananjaya the son of Pandu?

data.v: किरीटी बलवान्पार्थः कृतास्त्रश्च महाबलः । को हि पाण्डुसुतं युद्धे विषहेत धनंजयम् ।।
data.md: These sons, of Pandu, have doubtless borne much troubles here and in the forest and rightly speaking they are doubtless entitled to the wealth of their fathers.

data.v: अपि वज्रधरः साक्षात्किमुतान्ये धनुर्भृतः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां समर्थ इति मे मतिः ।।
data.md: Even the holder of the thunderbolt himself (cannot withstand him) how can others bearing the bow? He is capable of standing against the three worlds; this is my opinion.

data.v: भीष्मे ब्रुवति तद्वाक्यं धृष्टमाक्षिप्य मन्युमान् । दुर्योधनं समालोक्य कर्णो वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: While Bhishma was speaking Karna, having interrupted his words in anger and insolence and looking at Duryodhana, said-

data.v: न तन्न विदितं ब्रह्मँल्लोके भूतेन केनचित् । पुनरुक्तेन किं तेन भाषितेन पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: Brahmana, what you say is not unknown in this world nor by any being; why do you repeat it again and again?

data.v: दुर्योधनार्थे शकुनिर्द्यूते निर्जितवान्पुरा । समयेन गतोऽरण्यं पाण्डुपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ।।
data.md: In days of old, Shakuni on behalf of Duryodhana defeated (Yudhishthira) at a game of dice and it was according to a stipulation that Yudhishthira the son of Pandu went to the forest.

data.v: न तं समयमादृत्य राज्यमिच्छति पैतृकम् । बलमाश्रित्य मत्स्यानां पाञ्चालानां च पार्थिवः ।।
data.md: He now, like a fool disregarding that stipulation, wants his paternal wealth depending on the armies supplied him by the Matsyas and by the king of Panchala.

data.v: दुर्योधनो भयाद्विद्वन्न दद्यात्पदमन्ततः । धर्मतस्तु महीं कृत्स्नां प्रदद्याच्छत्रवेऽपि च ।।
data.md: O learned one, Duryodhana will not yield even one foot of ground through fear, but responding to the call of virtue he will yield even the entire world to his enemy.

data.v: यदि काङ्क्षन्ति ते राज्यं पितृपैतामहं पुनः । यथाप्रतिज्ञं कालं तं चरन्तु वनमाश्रिताः ।।
data.md: If they want back the kingdom of their forefathers let them, as stipulated, reside in the forest to the end of the period (agreed on).

data.v: ततो दुर्योधनस्याङ्के वर्तन्तामकुतोभयाः । अधार्मिकामिमां बुद्धिं कुर्युर्मौर्ख्याद्धि केवलम् ।।
data.md: Then may they come to seek refuse with Duryodhana without any fear; let them not through folly adopt an unrighteous course,

data.v: अथ ते धर्ममुत्सृज्य युद्धमिच्छन्ति पाण्डवाः । आसाद्येमान्कुरुश्रेष्ठान्स्मरिष्यन्ति वचो मम ।।
data.md: If the sons of Pandu, bidding adieu to a righteous course, desire war, then will they, after coming face to face with these foremost among the race of Kurus, have occasion to remember my words.

data.v: किं नु राधेय वाचा ते कर्म तत्स्मर्तुमर्हसि । एक एव यदा पार्थः षड्रथाञ्जितवान्युधि ।।
data.md: Bhishma said O son of Radha, why do you talk so much? It is fitting that you should remember his deeds; alone the son of Pritha vanquished in battle six charioteers.

data.v: न चेदेवं करिष्यामो यदयं ब्राह्मणोऽब्रवीत् । ध्रुवं युधि हतास्तेन भक्षयिष्याम पांसुकान् ।।
data.md: You have seen the deeds of him who had been victories on many occasions; if we do not do what this Brahmana has said most certainly shall we be killed by him.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रस्ततो भीष्ममनुमान्य प्रसाद्य च । अवभर्त्स्य च राधेयमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then Dhritarashtra, having pleased Bhishma by approving of his words and having rebuked the son of Radha, said these words.

data.v: अस्मद्धितमिदं वाक्यं भीष्मः शांतनवोऽब्रवीत् । पाण्डवानां हितं चैव सर्वस्य जगतस्तथा ।।
data.md: What Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, has said is calculated to promote sur interests and those of the entire world.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा तु पार्थेभ्यः प्रेषयिष्यामि संजयम् । स भवान्प्रतियात्वद्य पाण्डवानेव माचिरम् ।।
data.md: After mature deliberation, shall I send Sanjaya to the sons of Pritha, therefore do you go back at once this day to the sons of Pandu.

data.v: स तं सत्कृत्य कौरव्यः प्रेषयामास पाण्डवान् । सभामध्ये समाहूय संजयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: And the son of Kuru, having done him honours, sent him to the sons of Pandu and having summoned Sanjaya to the council, said these words.

data.v: प्राप्तानाहुः संजय पाण्डुपुत्रा;नुपप्लव्ये तान्विजानीहि गत्वा । अजातशत्रुं च सभाजयेथा; दिष्ट्यानघ ग्राममुपस्थितस्त्वम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said It is said, O Sanjaya, that the sons of Pandu have reached Upaplavya; going out do you find out (if) this (is true), do due honours to the one who has created no enemies (Yudhishthira); it is fortunate that you are present here.

data.v: सर्वान्वदेः संजय स्वस्तिमन्तः; कृच्छ्रं वासमतदर्हा निरुष्य । तेषां शान्तिर्विद्यतेऽस्मासु शीघ्रं; मिथ्योपेतानामुपकारिणां सताम् ।।
data.md: To all do you, O Sanjaya, communicate our well being. Having resided in the forest and met with troubles, they who are inclined to do good to others without deceit and honest still entertain friendly feeling towards us.

data.v: नाहं क्वचित्संजय पाण्डवानां; मिथ्यावृत्तिं कांचन जात्वपश्यम् । सर्वां श्रियं ह्यात्मवीर्येण लब्ध्वा; पर्याकार्षुः पाण्डवा मह्यमेव ।।
data.md: Never did I, O Sanjaya, observe any falsehood in the sons of Pandu. Having gained all their wealth through sheer strength of their own, have they made over the same to me.

data.v: दोषं ह्येषां नाधिगच्छे परीक्ष;न्नित्यं कंचिद्येन गर्हेय पार्थान् । धर्मार्थाभ्यां कर्म कुर्वन्ति नित्यं; सुखप्रिया नानुरुध्यन्ति कामान् ।।
data.md: Never did I observe any questionable act in them. Though I was always on the look-out, yet never did I find anything done by these sons of Pritha for which we could blame them. They always work for the sake of virtue and their own interests and never request others for : their own well being.

data.v: घर्मं शीतं क्षुत्पिपासे तथैव; निद्रां तन्द्रीं क्रोधहर्षौ प्रमादम् । धृत्या चैव प्रज्ञया चाभिभूय; धर्मार्थयोगान्प्रयतन्ति पार्थाः ।।
data.md: Having by their patience and wisdom subjugated heat, cold, hunger, thirst, sleep, laziness anger, pleasure and folly, the sons of Pritha always try for virtue and their own interests.

data.v: त्यजन्ति मित्रेषु धनानि काले; न संवासाज्जीर्यति मैत्रमेषाम् । यथार्हमानार्थकरा हि पार्था;स्तेषां द्वेष्टा नास्त्याजमीढस्य पक्षे ।।
data.md: On suitable occasions, do they give away wealth to their friends and friendship with them does not decrease through long residence together. The sons of Pritha honour others and promote their interest according to their deserts. They have no haters in the side of Ajmida.

data.v: अन्यत्र पापाद्विषमान्मन्दबुद्धे;र्दुर्योधनात्क्षुद्रतराच्च कर्णात् । तेषां हीमे हीनसुखप्रियाणां; महात्मनां संजनयन्ति तेजः ।।
data.md: Except the great weak-minded fool, Duryodhana and the still meaner Karna. These two alone are increasing the energy of these large-minded souls who do not desire for their own happiness.

data.v: उत्थानवीर्यः सुखमेधमानो; दुर्योधनः सुकृतं मन्यते तत् । तेषां भागं यच्च मन्येत बालः; शक्यं हर्तुं जीवतां पाण्डवानाम् ।।
data.md: Duryodhana who is strong in the beginning only and who is accustomed to every sort of indulgence thinks that he does well (increasing their energy). The boy thinks too that he is capable of robbing the living son of Pandu, of their share.

data.v: यस्यार्जुनः पदवीं केशवश्च; वृकोदरः सात्यकोऽजातशत्रोः । माद्रीपुत्रौ सृञ्जयाश्चापि सर्वे; पुरा युद्धात्साधु तस्य प्रदानम् ।।
data.md: He who is followed by Arjuna, Keshava, Vrikodara, Satyaki, the two sons of Madri (Nakula and Sahadeva) and Sanjaya; it is best to give up his share before the war.

data.v: स ह्येवैकः पृथिवीं सव्यसाची; गाण्डीवधन्वा प्रणुदेद्रथस्थः । तथा विष्णुः केशवोऽप्यप्रधृष्यो; लोकत्रयस्याधिपतिर्महात्मा ।।
data.md: Savyasachin, holding the Gandiva bow is alone capable of subjugating the ear from his chariot and in the same way is the nobleminded Keshava, accustomed to got victories and unapproachable, the ruler of the three worlds.

data.v: तिष्ठेत कस्तस्य मर्त्यः पुरस्ता;द्यः सर्वदेवेषु वरेण्य ईड्यः । पर्जन्यघोषान्प्रवपञ्शरौघा;न्पतंगसंघानिव शीघ्रवेगान् ।।
data.md: In all the worlds, he is the only worthy man. What man could stand against his flight of arrows which roar like the clouds and which fly with the swiftness of locusts.

data.v: दिशं ह्युदीचीमपि चोत्तरान्कुरू;न्गाण्डीवधन्वैकरथो जिगाय । धनं चैषामाहरत्सव्यसाची; सेनानुगान्बलिदांश्चैव चक्रे ।।
data.md: Seated on one car, with the help of the Gandiva bow, Savyasachin, having subjugated the Kauravas of the north and the northern country as well, took away their wealth and turned the people of Dravida into his soldier followers.

data.v: यश्चैव देवान्खाण्डवे सव्यसाची; गाण्डीवधन्वा प्रजिगाय सेन्द्रान् । उपाहरत्फल्गुनो जातवेदसे; यशो मानं वर्धयन्पाण्डवानाम् ।।
data.md: Savyasachin, with the help of the Govinda bow, having subjugated the gods with Indra at their head, in the Agni and thus enhanced the honour and redwing of the sons of Pandu.

data.v: गदाभृतां नाद्य समोऽस्ति भीमा;द्धस्त्यारोहो नास्ति समश्च तस्य । रथेऽर्जुनादाहुरहीनमेनं; बाह्वोर्बले चायुतनागवीर्यम् ।।
data.md: There is none equal to Bhima in wielding the mace, none too equal to him in riding elephants and it is said that as a car-warrior he is not inferior to Arjuna and in strength of arms he has the prowess of ten thousand elephants.

data.v: सुशिक्षितः कृतवैरस्तरस्वी; दहेत्क्रुद्धस्तरसा धार्तराष्ट्रान् । सदात्यमर्षी बलवान्न शक्यो; युद्धे जेतुं वासवेनापि साक्षात् ।।
data.md: Well-trained and strong, being rendered an enemy and inspired with worth he would burn down the sons of Dhritarashtra. Being always very wrathful and strong he is incapable of being defeated even by Vasava (Indra) himself.

data.v: सुचेतसौ बलिनौ शीघ्रहस्तौ; सुशिक्षितौ भ्रातरौ फल्गुनेन । श्येनौ यथा पक्षिपूगान्रुजन्तौ; माद्रीपुत्रौ नेह कुरून्विशेताम् ।।
data.md: The two brothers, the sons of the king of Madri, of good heart, strong quick-handed and well trained by the sons of Falguna, will leave no vestige of the enemies as a pair of birds of prey destroy a flight of birds.

data.v: तेषां मध्ये वर्तमानस्तरस्वी; धृष्टद्युम्नः पाण्डवानामिहैकः । सहामात्यः सोमकानां प्रबर्हः; संत्यक्तात्मा पाण्डवानां जयाय ।।
सहोषितश्चरितार्थो वयःस्थः; शाल्वेयानामधिपो वै विराटः । सह पुत्रैः पाण्डवार्थे च शश्व;द्युधिष्ठिरं भक्त इति श्रुतं मे ।।
data.md: Virata, the lord of the people of Matsya, who is of mature age, who has lived with the Pandavas and whose desires have been fulfilled by them, with his sons is there ever increased in the cause of the sons of Pandu and a staunch adherent of Yudhishthira.

data.v: अवरुद्धा बलिनः केकयेभ्यो; महेष्वासा भ्रातरः पञ्च सन्ति । केकयेभ्यो राज्यमाकाङ्क्षमाणा; युद्धार्थिनश्चानुवसन्ति पार्थान् ।।
data.md: And the five brothers, the eminent and mighty princes of Kaikeya, have been deprived of their kingdom (by us) and they follow the sons of Pritha, desirous of the kingdom of the Kaikeyas and waiting for an opportunity of fighting (with us).

data.v: सर्वे च वीराः पृथिवीपतीनां; समानीताः पाण्डवार्थे निविष्टाः । शूरानहं भक्तिमतः शृणोमि; प्रीत्या युक्तान्संश्रितान्धर्मराजम् ।।
data.md: And all the heroes among the lords of the Earth have been brought together and are interested in the cause of the sons of Pandu. I hear that these heroes worthy of respect have become followers of the virtuous king out of love.

data.v: गिर्याश्रया दुर्गनिवासिनश्च; योधाः पृथिव्यां कुलजा विशुद्धाः । म्लेच्छाश्च नानायुधवीर्यवन्तः; समागताः पाण्डवार्थे निविष्टाः ।।
data.md: Heroes who live in the hills and in fortresses, who are of good lineage in the world and aged and many Mlechas who are adepts in handling various weapons have been brought together and made interested in the cause of the sons of Pandu.

data.v: पाण्ड्यश्च राजामित इन्द्रकल्पो; युधि प्रवीरैर्बहुभिः समेतः । समागतः पाण्डवार्थे महात्मा; लोकप्रवीरोऽप्रतिवीर्यतेजाः ।।
data.md: And king Pandya too, in battle an equal of Indra, who is noble-minded, a hero energy, accompanied by many heroes, has come, espousing the cause of the sons of Pandu.

data.md: With that precedent in their mind, the sons of Dhritarashtra think that they are capable of depriving the sons of Pandu of what is their own through they are aware having been present there, of the deportment of Arjuna in a battle when the only weapon he had was a bow.

data.md: You know what troubles have overtaken us. For my respect for you, I would forgive them, (you know as well) that which has taken place between ourselves and the sons of Kuru and what our treatment towards the son of Dhritarashtra was at the time.

data.md: Sanjaya said That you are attached to virtue, O Pandava, is known in this word and I see also that it is so, O son of Pritha. The life that is full of great deeds, also is unstable; considering this, you should not destroy (the Kurus).

data.md: Desires adhere to a man and they are the source of all impediments to virtue, O king of men. A wise man, having killed them beforehand, gained unspeakable praise in the world.

data.md: Thirst for wealth is a bond in this world, O son of Pritha. Those, who desire it, go against virtue as it were. He who chooses virtue is wise. The man, who desires pleasure, becomes degraded for the sake of pleasure.

data.md: A man, who makes virtue his prime duty, gains great fame and shines like the sun, and the man, of vicious intellect, devoid of virtue, is ruined even if he obtains the earth.

data.md: The Vedas have been read by you; the hard austerities of Brahmacharya have been practised by you and in sacrificial ceremonies the desires of Brahmanas have been fulfilled by you and with the other world before your mind, your soul has been devoted to happiness for a series of years.

data.v: सुखप्रिये सेवमानोऽतिवेलं; योगाभ्यासे यो न करोति कर्म । वित्तक्षये हीनसुखोऽतिवेलं; दुःखं शेते कामवेगप्रणुन्नः ।।
data.md: He, who having having devoted himself excessively to pleasures, does not to any deed leading to religious meditation, becomes extremely devoid of happiness after his wealth is gone and remains liable to be led by the force of his desires.

data.md: During this life deeds are done, O son of Pritha and after death, no act whatever is done. And virtuous deeds that are valuable in the next world and so be-lauded by the great and the honest, have been done by you.

data.md: Your instinct does not urge you to an unrighteous act, O son of Pritha and never did you, out of wrath, do a sinful act. Tell me, therefore, what the reason is which makes you desirous of doing this sinful act, which is against the dictates wisdom.

data.md: Wrath is a bitter remedy for evils, it causes malady in the head, destroys fame and is a source of sinful acts. It ought to be controlled by a good man and those that do not control it are bad men. O great king, control your wrath. Incline to peace.

data.md: Having gained even this earth bounded by the sea, you will not get rid of descripitude or death, desirable results or undesirable, happiness or misery. O king knowing this, do not wage war.

data.v: अमात्यानां यदि कामस्य हेतो;रेवंयुक्तं कर्म चिकीर्षसि त्वम् । अपाक्रमेः संप्रदाय स्वमेभ्यो; मा गास्त्वं वै देवयानात्पथोऽद्य ।।
data.md: If you are desirous of doing this deed, attended with such results, simply because your advisers wish it, then abdicate everything to them and go away. You should not now forsake the path leading to the region of the gods.

data.v: असंशयं संजय सत्यमेत;द्धर्मो वरः कर्मणां यत्त्वमात्थ । ज्ञात्वा तु मां संजय गर्हयेस्त्वं; यदि धर्मं यद्यधर्मं चरामि ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said Undoubtedly, O Sanjaya, it is as you say namely that virtuous acts are the best among deeds; and knowing, O Sanjaya, whether it is Qur virtue or vice that I follow should you blame me.

data.v: यत्राधर्मो धर्मरूपाणि बिभ्र;द्धर्मः कृत्स्नो दृश्यतेऽधर्मरूपः । तथा धर्मो धारयन्धर्मरूपं; विद्वांसस्तं संप्रपश्यन्ति बुद्ध्या ।।
data.md: Where vice assumes the appearance of virtue and virtue appears completely as vice and virtue appears in its own form wise men should distinguish it from virtue by their intelligence.

data.v: एवमेतावापदि लिङ्गमेत;द्धर्माधर्मौ वृत्तिनित्यौ भजेताम् । आद्यं लिङ्गं यस्य तस्य प्रमाण;मापद्धर्मं संजय तं निबोध ।।
data.md: A man should follow the profession of the order among which he is born, but similarly in tirnes of distress these occupations which are fixed, follow the rule of virtue and vice. Hear now, O Sanjaya, what constitutes profession in times of distress.

data.v: लुप्तायां तु प्रकृतौ येन कर्म; निष्पादयेत्तत्परीप्सेद्विहीनः । प्रकृतिस्थश्चापदि वर्तमान; उभौ गर्ह्यौ भवतः संजयैतौ ।।
data.md: With his means of livelihood gone, a destitute man ought to desire for such means as may enable him to perform such duties as are laid down for him. O Sanjaya; both the man whose means of livelihood is not gone and the one who is in distress, are culpable (if they act as if they are not what they are)O Sanjaya,

data.v: अविलोपमिच्छतां ब्राह्मणानां; प्रायश्चित्तं विहितं यद्विधात्रा । आपद्यथाकर्मसु वर्तमाना;न्विकर्मस्थान्संजय गर्हयेत ।।
data.md: Since expiation has been prescribed by the creator, for those Brahmanas who without wishing for ruin to themselves (do actions sinful for them to do). With due regard to this fact, O Sanjaya, should you find fault with those whose means of livelihood is gone and those who are not in that position.

data.v: मनीषिणां तत्त्वविच्छेदनाय; विधीयते सत्सु वृत्तिः सदैव । अब्राह्मणाः सन्ति तु ये न वैद्याः; सर्वोच्छेदं साधु मन्येत तेभ्यः ।।
data.md: For the acquirement of the knowledge of our inner self and for bringing the mind under control is always prescribed accepting alms from good men. For those that are not Brahmanas and do not want to know about the inner self, the practices prescribed for their respective orders are considered to be the best.

data.v: तदर्था नः पितरो ये च पूर्वे; पितामहा ये च तेभ्यः परेऽन्ये । प्रज्ञैषिणो ये च हि कर्म चक्रु;र्नास्त्यन्ततो नास्ति नास्तीति मन्ये ।।
data.md: That path has been followed by our fathers and grandfathers and also by others and all those who are wise adopt the same path. For this I do not consider that they were not orthodox.

data.v: यत्किंचिदेतद्वित्तमस्यां पृथिव्यां; यद्देवानां त्रिदशानां परत्र । प्राजापत्यं त्रिदिवं ब्रह्मलोकं; नाधर्मतः संजय कामये तत् ।।
data.md: What little wealth there is in this world, what in the possessions of the gods and what is beyond them or the region of the Prajapatis, the heaven or the region of Brahma. I do not desire even unrighteously, O Sanjaya.

data.v: धर्मेश्वरः कुशलो नीतिमांश्चा;प्युपासिता ब्राह्मणानां मनीषी । नानाविधांश्चैव महाबलांश्च; राजन्यभोजाननुशास्ति कृष्णः ।।
data.md: Krishna, is the lord (as it were) of virtue, well versed in every science, politic, wise and has been attended by Brahmanas and by him are instructed many kings of great prowess.

data.v: यदि ह्यहं विसृजन्स्यामगर्ह्यो; युध्यमानो यदि जह्यां स्वधर्मम् । महायशाः केशवस्तद्ब्रवीतु; वासुदेवस्तूभयोरर्थकामः ।।
data.md: If I am to blame by not making peace and if I swerve from the duties of my order, let Keshava, the son of Vasudeva, of great fame, who desires the welfare of both parties, say.

data.v: शैनेया हि चैत्रकाश्चान्धकाश्च; वार्ष्णेयभोजाः कौकुराः सृञ्जयाश्च । उपासीना वासुदेवस्य बुद्धिं; निगृह्य शत्रून्सुहृदो नन्दयन्ति ।।
data.md: This Shini and the king of the Chedis and the king of the Andhakas and of the Vrishnis, of the Bhojas, of the Kukuras and of the Srinjayas, all by following the counsels of the son of Vasudeva slay their enemies and thus please their friends.

data.v: वृष्ण्यन्धका ह्युग्रसेनादयो वै; कृष्णप्रणीताः सर्व एवेन्द्रकल्पाः । मनस्विनः सत्यपराक्रमाश्च; महाबला यादवा भोगवन्तः ।।
data.md: The kings of Vrishni and Andhaka and Ugrasena and others, led by Krishna, are all the equals of Indra and are spirited, attached to truth, of great prowess and happy.

data.v: काश्यो बभ्रुः श्रियमुत्तमां गतो; लब्ध्वा कृष्णं भ्रातरमीशितारम् । यस्मै कामान्वर्षति वासुदेवो; ग्रीष्मात्यये मेघ इव प्रजाभ्यः ।।
data.md: The king, of Kashi having obtained Krishna, the giver of boons, as his brother, has attained to great prosperity; on him the son of Vasudeva, showers blessings as the cloud on earthly beings at the close of summer.

data.v: ईदृशोऽयं केशवस्तात भूयो; विद्मो ह्येनं कर्मणां निश्चयज्ञम् । प्रियश्च नः साधुतमश्च कृष्णो; नातिक्रमे वचनं केशवस्य ।।
data.md: Such is this learned Keshava. Know him to be aware of the ethics of actions. The good Krishna is moreover our friend and I shall not act against the advice of Keshava.

data.v: अविनाशं संजय पाण्डवाना;मिच्छाम्यहं भूतिमेषां प्रियं च । तथा राज्ञो धृतराष्ट्रस्य सूत; सदाशंसे बहुपुत्रस्य वृद्धिम् ।।
data.md: Vasudeva said I desire, O Sanjaya, the continuance of the existence of the sons of Pandu-their prosperity and their good and in the same way, O Suta, do I desire the prosperity of king Dhritarashtra who has many sons.

data.v: कामो हि मे संजय नित्यमेव; नान्यद्ब्रूयां तान्प्रति शाम्यतेति । राज्ञश्च हि प्रियमेतच्छृणोमि; मन्ये चैतत्पाण्डवानां समर्थम् ।।
data.md: It has ever been my desire, O Sanjaya, to say to them, “Be peaceful” nothing else. I hear that this is also the wish of the king (Dhritarashtra) and I consider this to be equally to the good of the sons of Pandu.

data.v: सुदुष्करश्चात्र शमो हि नूनं; प्रदर्शितः संजय पाण्डवेन । यस्मिन्गृद्धो धृतराष्ट्रः सपुत्रः; कस्मादेषां कलहो नात्र मूर्च्छेत् ।।
data.md: Peace, of a rare sort, indeed, has been shown, O Sanjaya, by the son of Pandu, when Dhritarashtra with his sons is avaricious; why should the quarrel between these two parties rise to good proportions.

data.v: तत्त्वं धर्मं विचरन्संजयेह; मत्तश्च जानासि युधिष्ठिराच्च । अथो कस्मात्संजय पाण्डवस्य; उत्साहिनः पूरयतः स्वकर्म । यथाख्यातमावसतः कुटुम्बं; पुराकल्पात्साधु विलोपमात्थ ।।
data.md: or You do know, O Sanjaya, the nature of right wrong better than myself or Yudhishthira; then for what reason, O Sanjaya, do you find fault with the son of Pandu, who is energetic, mindful of his own duties, whose duties towards his relations have been such as have been laid down from the days of yore. Why do you say that their goodness is vanished? With regard to the matter at present under discussion the opinions of the Brahmanas differ.

data.v: अस्मिन्विधौ वर्तमाने यथाव;दुच्चावचा मतयो ब्राह्मणानाम् । कर्मणाहुः सिद्धिमेके परत्र; हित्वा कर्म विद्यया सिद्धिमेके । नाभुञ्जानो भक्ष्यभोज्यस्य तृप्ये;द्विद्वानपीह विदितं ब्राह्मणानाम् ।।
data.md: One school say that it is by work that we obtain salvation and again another school say that it is by putting aside work and through knowledge, that we attain to salvation. It has been so laid down by the superior beings that a man, even knowledge all the properties of good, will not be satisfied without eating.

data.v: या वै विद्याः साधयन्तीह कर्म; तासां फलं विद्यते नेतरासाम् । तत्रेह वै दृष्टफलं तु कर्म; पीत्वोदकं शाम्यति तृष्णयार्तः ।।
data.md: That knowledge alone bears fruit, which does work, not others. In this world the result of action admits of ocular proof; one oppressed by thirst is satisfied by drinking water.

data.v: सोऽयं विधिर्विहितः कर्मणैव; तद्वर्तते संजय तत्र कर्म । तत्र योऽन्यत्कर्मणः साधु मन्ये;न्मोघं तस्य लपितं दुर्बलस्य ।।
data.md: Therefore it has been ordained by the creator that through work results, O Sanjaya, work. Therefore the opinion that anything other than work is good, is nothing but the uttering of a fool and of a weak man.

data.v: कर्मणामी भान्ति देवाः परत्र; कर्मणैवेह प्लवते मातरिश्वा । अहोरात्रे विदधत्कर्मणैव; अतन्द्रितो नित्यमुदेति सूर्यः ।।
data.md: Elsewhere (i.e. in the other world) the gods are resplendent through work, the wind blows through work. Causing day and night, through work, the sleepless sun rises every day.

data.v: मासार्धमासानथ नक्षत्रयोगा;नतन्द्रितश्चन्द्रमा अभ्युपैति । अतन्द्रितो दहते जातवेदाः; समिध्यमानः कर्म कुर्वन्प्रजाभ्यः ।।
data.md: The sleepless moon, too, goes through half months and months and certain peculiar positions of the moon (through work) burns, doing good to the creatures of the Earth.

data.v: अतन्द्रिता भारमिमं महान्तं; बिभर्ति देवी पृथिवी बलेन । अतन्द्रिताः शीघ्रमपो वहन्ति; संतर्पयन्त्यः सर्वभूतानि नद्यः ।।
data.md: The goddess Earth, sleepless, carries this great load through her strength and the sleepless rivers carry their waters with speed, satisfying the desire of all beings.

data.v: अतन्द्रितो वर्षति भूरितेजाः; संनादयन्नन्तरिक्षं दिवं च । अतन्द्रितो ब्रह्मचर्यं चचार; श्रेष्ठत्वमिच्छन्बलभिद्देवतानाम् ।।
data.md: The sleepless one of mighty strength (Indra) showers rain, resounding every corner and the cardinal points; and desiring kingship among the gods he practised the austerities of a Brahmacharya life, being sleepless.

data.v: हित्वा सुखं मनसश्च प्रियाणि; तेन शक्रः कर्मणा श्रैष्ठ्यमाप । सत्यं धर्मं पालयन्नप्रमत्तो; दमं तितिक्षां समतां प्रियं च । एतानि सर्वाण्युपसेवमानो; देवराज्यं मघवान्प्राप मुख्यम् ।।
data.md: Giving up pleasure and the satisfaction of his desires, the position of a chief was obtained by Shakra by means of work. He strictly observed truth, virtue, self-control, forbearance, impartially and amiability.

data.v: बृहस्पतिर्ब्रह्मचर्यं चचार; समाहितः संशितात्मा यथावत् । हित्वा सुखं प्रतिरुध्येन्द्रियाणि; तेन देवानामगमद्गौरवं सः ।।
नक्षत्राणि कर्मणामुत्र भान्ति; रुद्रादित्या वसवोऽथापि विश्वे । यमो राजा वैश्रवणः कुबेरो; गन्धर्वयक्षाप्सरसश्च शुभ्राः । ब्रह्मचर्यं वेदविद्याः क्रियाश्च; निषेवमाणा मुनयोऽमुत्र भान्ति ।।
data.md: King Yama, the son of Vishravana, Karna, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas and the celestial nymphs, O Suta and the Rishis in the other world shine resplendent practicing the austerities of a Brahmacharya life and seeking the knowledge of self.

data.v: जानन्निमं सर्वलोकस्य धर्मं; ब्राह्मणानां क्षत्रियाणां विशां च । स कस्मात्त्वं जानतां ज्ञानवान्स;न्व्यायच्छसे संजय कौरवार्थे ।।
data.md: Knowing all these truths regarding this world and knowing the duties of the best among Brahmanas and the Kshatriyas and the Vaishyas, why do you, who are wise, plead on behalf of the sons of Kurus.

data.v: आम्नायेषु नित्यसंयोगमस्य; तथाश्वमेधे राजसूये च विद्धि । संयुज्यते धनुषा वर्मणा च; हस्तत्राणै रथशस्त्रैश्च भूयः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira is ever attached to the study of the Vedas and know him also to be attached to Ashvamedha and Rajasuya sacrificial ceremonies and again riding on cars and on horses and elephants; he also acts with the bow and weapons and puts on armour.

data.v: ते चेदिमे कौरवाणामुपाय;मधिगच्छेयुरवधेनैव पार्थाः । धर्मत्राणं पुण्यमेषां कृतं स्या;दार्ये वृत्ते भीमसेनं निगृह्य ।।
data.md: If the son of Pritha can see some means, not involving the slaughter of the sons of Kuru, their virtue would be saved and a virtuous deed would be done by them by forcing Bhimasena to adopt a more honorable course of life.

data.v: ते चेत्पित्र्ये कर्मणि वर्तमाना; आपद्येरन्दिष्टवशेन मृत्युम् । यथाशक्त्या पूरयन्तः स्वकर्म; तदप्येषां निधनं स्यात्प्रशस्तम् ।।
data.md: And if by the ordination of fate they should meet with death, while engaged in the work which their ancestors did, then too doing all that lies in their power towards the fulfillment of their duty their death would be praiseworthy.

data.v: उताहो त्वं मन्यसे सर्वमेव; राज्ञां युद्धे वर्तते धर्मतन्त्रम् । अयुद्धे वा वर्तते धर्मतन्त्रं; तथैव ते वाचमिमां शृणोमि ।।
data.md: If you approve of peace, I want to hear your answer to this question-Does the duty of kings lie in fighting or does it lie in not fighting.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य प्रथमं विभाग;मवेक्ष्य त्वं संजय स्वं च कर्म । निशम्याथो पाण्डवानां स्वकर्म; प्रशंस वा निन्द वा या मतिस्ते ।।
data.md: Having considered the principle on which the four divisions were originally based and the duties of each, O Sanjaya and having fully ascertained the proposed line of action of the Pandavas, praise or blame it, as you may think fit.

data.v: अधीयीत ब्राह्मणोऽथो यजेत; दद्यादियात्तीर्थमुख्यानि चैव । अध्यापयेद्याजयेच्चापि याज्या;न्प्रतिग्रहान्वा विदितान्प्रतीच्छेत् ।।
data.md: A Brahmana should be steady, perform sacrificial ceremonies, give alms and go to the principal places of pilgrimage; he should also teach and officiate as priest in the ceremonies performed by others who need his help and should accept donations from well known persons.

data.v: तथा राजन्यो रक्षणं वै प्रजानां; कृत्वा धर्मेणाप्रमत्तोऽथ दत्त्वा । यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा सर्ववेदानधीत्य; दारान्कृत्वा पुण्यकृदावसेद्गृहान् ।।
data.md: In the same way, having protected his kingdom and his subjects, making donations to persons leading a holy life and performing sacrificial ceremonies and studied all the Vedas and taken a wife (a Kshatriya) should become a house holder continuing to do virtuous deeds.

data.v: वैश्योऽधीत्य कृषिगोरक्षपण्यै;र्वित्तं चिन्वन्पालयन्नप्रमत्तः । प्रियं कुर्वन्ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियाणां; धर्मशीलः पुण्यकृदावसेद्गृहान् ।।
परिचर्या वन्दनं ब्राह्मणानां; नाधीयीत प्रतिषिद्धोऽस्य यज्ञः । नित्योत्थितो भूतयेऽतन्द्रितः स्या;देष स्मृतः शूद्रधर्मः पुराणः ।।
data.md: And pleasing the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, of virtuous habits, he should become a house-holder, doing virtuous deeds. He should serve the Brahmanas and worship them; he should not study; sacrifice is forbidden to him; he should ever be wakeful and sleepless in doing good to beings, such are the duties of a Shudra as laid down in the ancient religious books.

data.v: एतान्राजा पालयन्नप्रमत्तो; नियोजयन्सर्ववर्णान्स्वधर्मे । अकामात्मा समवृत्तिः प्रजासु; नाधार्मिकाननुरुध्येत कामान् ।।
data.md: The king, protecting all these intently and employing all these orders in their respective spheres should himself be without any service, impartial to all his subjects and should never give himself to the prompting of his unholy desires.

data.md: After being greeted, our grandsire should thus be addressed-By you was the race, of Shantanu when about to be involved in ruin, was extricated.
