data.md: You, who have done this, now do what according to your own opinion, O Grandsire, will enable your grandsons to live in peace and amity with each other.

data.v: तथैव विदुरं ब्रूयाः कुरूणां मन्त्रधारिणम् । अयुद्धं सौम्य भाषस्व हितकामो युधिष्ठिरः ।।
data.md: In the same way should you thus speak to Vidura, the adviser of the Kurus, "O you peaceful one, advice peace, O you well wisher of Yudhishthira."

data.v: अथो सुयोधनं ब्रूया राजपुत्रममर्षणम् । मध्ये कुरूणामासीनमनुनीय पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: And then speak to the wrathful prince Duryodhana seated in the midst of the Kurus entreating him again and again.

data.v: अपश्यन्मामुपेक्षन्तं कृष्णामेकां सभागताम् । तद्दुःखमतितिक्षाम मा वधीष्म कुरूनिति ।।
data.md: "The insults you have offered to the blameless Krishna who had been brought to this council hall, we will quietly endure so that the Kurus may not be slaughtered.

data.v: एवं पूर्वापरान्क्लेशानतितिक्षन्त पाण्डवाः । यथा बलीयसः सन्तस्तत्सर्वं कुरवो विदुः ।।
data.md: The Pandavas will quietly bear similar insults offered before and after that though they are strong enough. All this the Kauravas know.

data.v: यन्नः प्राव्राजयः सौम्य अजिनैः प्रतिवासितान् । तद्दुःखमतितिक्षाम मा वधीष्म कुरूनिति ।।
data.md: "The insults you have offered to the blameless Krishna who had been brought to this council hall, we will quietly endure so that the Kurus may not be slaughtered.

data.v: यत्तत्सभायामाक्रम्य कृष्णां केशेष्वधर्षयत् । दुःशासनस्तेऽनुमते तच्चास्माभिरुपेक्षितम् ।।
data.md: O Dushasana, it was at your bidding that Krishna was dragged here by the hair setting at naught the protest of Kunti. That too is forgiven by us.

data.v: यथोचितं स्वकं भागं लभेमहि परंतप । निवर्तय परद्रव्ये बुद्धिं गृद्धां नरर्षभ ।।
data.md: But o repressor of enemies, we want our due share; O best among men, turn away your avaricious inclination from what belongs to others.

data.v: शान्तिरेवं भवेद्राजन्प्रीतिश्चैव परस्परम् । राज्यैकदेशमपि नः प्रयच्छ शममिच्छताम् ।।
data.md: By this means, O king, there shall be peace and good will among each other; give back to us, who are desirous of peace, even one province out of the kingdom.

data.v: कुशस्थलं वृकस्थलमासन्दी वारणावतम् । अवसानं भवेदत्र किंचिदेव तु पञ्चमम् ।।
data.md: Give us Avisthala, Vrikasthala, Makandi and Varanavata, with any other village for a fifth and let there be an end of our quarrel over this matter.

data.v: भ्रातॄणां देहि पञ्चानां ग्रामान्पञ्च सुयोधन । शान्तिर्नोऽस्तु महाप्राज्ञ ज्ञातिभिः सह संजय ।।
data.md: O Suyodhana, give but five villages to your five cousins and let there be peace among ourselves and our cousins, O Sanjaya of great wisdom.

data.v: भ्राता भ्रातरमन्वेतु पिता पुत्रेण युज्यताम् । स्मयमानाः समायान्तु पाञ्चालाः कुरुभिः सह ।।
data.md: Let brother follow brother and let father unite with son. Let the Panchala join the Kurus with a smiling face.

data.v: अक्षतान्कुरुपाञ्चालान्पश्येम इति कामये । सर्वे सुमनसस्तात शाम्याम भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: I desire that I shall see the Kauravas and the Panchalas, without any wounds and we shall all establish peace with cheerful hearts, O you best among the race of Bharata.

data.v: अलमेव शमायास्मि तथा युद्धाय संजय । धर्मार्थयोरलं चाहं मृदवे दारुणाय च ।।
data.md: I am surely ready for peace and to war as well, O Sanjaya. For the acquirement of wealth, am I surely prepared to mild measures and harsh ones.

data.v: अनुज्ञातः पाण्डवेन प्रययौ संजयस्तदा । शासनं धृतराष्ट्रस्य सर्वं कृत्वा महात्मनः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then did Sanjaya, permitted by the son of Pandu, depart, doing all the behest's of the great-souled Dhritarashtra.

data.v: संप्राप्य हास्तिनपुरं शीघ्रं च प्रविवेश ह । अन्तःपुरमुपस्थाय द्वाःस्थं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Having reached Hastinapura, he entered it quickly and standing at the gate (entrance of the) inner apartments of the palace said these words to the gate-keeper.

data.v: आचक्ष्व मां धृतराष्ट्राय द्वाःस्थ; उपागतं पाण्डवानां सकाशात् । जागर्ति चेदभिवदेस्त्वं हि क्षत्तः; प्रविशेयं विदितो भूमिपस्य ।।
संजयोऽयं भूमिपते नमस्ते; दिदृक्षया द्वारमुपागतस्ते । प्राप्तो दूतः पाण्डवानां सकाशा;त्प्रशाधि राजन्किमयं करोतु ।।
data.md: The gate-keeper said O you lord of the earth, I bow down to you. Sanjaya is come to your door, desirous of an audience. He is arrived here as an envoy from the presence of the sons of Pandu. Command, O king, as to what he should do.

data.v: आचक्ष्व मां सुखिनं काल्यमस्मै; प्रवेश्यतां स्वागतं संजयाय । न चाहमेतस्य भवाम्यकाल्यः; स मे कस्माद्द्वारि तिष्ठेत क्षत्तः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Inform him of my well-being. Let him enter. Welcome to Sanjaya. I am never unwilling to receive him, why does he, who can enter at any moment, stand at my door.

data.v: ततः प्रविश्यानुमते नृपस्य; महद्वेश्म प्राज्ञशूरार्यगुप्तम् । सिंहासनस्थं पार्थिवमाससाद; वैचित्रवीर्यं प्राञ्जलिः सूतपुत्रः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then with the king's permission, the son of Suta having entered that large hall with clasped hands, approached the royal so Vichitravirya, seated on the throne and protected by wise men, heroes and honorable men.

data.v: संजयोऽहं भूमिपते नमस्ते; प्राप्तोऽस्मि गत्वा नरदेव पाण्डवान् । अभिवाद्य त्वां पाण्डुपुत्रो मनस्वी; युधिष्ठिरः कुशलं चान्वपृच्छत् ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said I am Sanjaya, I bow down to the lord of the earth. Setting out from here, I reached the sons of Pandu, O god among men. The spirited Yudhishthira having sent his greetings to you, afterwards asked me about your health.

data.v: स ते पुत्रान्पृच्छति प्रीयमाणः; कच्चित्पुत्रैः प्रीयसे नप्तृभिश्च । तथा सुहृद्भिः सचिवैश्च राज;न्ये चापि त्वामुपजीवन्ति तैश्च ।।
data.md: And he gladly enquired about the health of your sons and asks you if you are pleased with your sons and son's sons and friends and ministers and all those who live dependent on you.

data.v: अभ्येत्य त्वां तात वदामि संजय; अजातशत्रुं च सुखेन पार्थम् । कच्चित्स राजा कुशली सपुत्रः; सहामात्यः सानुजः कौरवाणाम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Blessing you, I say, O Sanjaya, is the son of Pritha he who creates no enemies, in happiness? Is that king of the Kauravas well with his sons, ministers and younger brothers.

data.v: सहामात्यः कुशली पाण्डुपुत्रो; भूयश्चातो यच्च तेऽग्रे मनोऽभूत् । निर्णिक्तधर्मार्थकरो मनस्वी; बहुश्रुतो दृष्टिमाञ्शीलवांश्च ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said With his ministers, the son of Pandu is in health; he desires that which was formerly his own, he who acquires virtue and wealth and commits no wrong deed, who is spirited, of great learning, of great fore-sight and of good behaviour.

data.v: परं धर्मात्पाण्डवस्यानृशंस्यं; धर्मः परो वित्तचयान्मतोऽस्य । सुखप्रिये धर्महीने न पार्थो;ऽनुरुध्यते भारत तस्य विद्धि ।।
data.md: With the sons of Pandu humanity is superior to virtue and in his opinion virtue is superior to the accumulation of wealth. He is inclined to the through, O son of Bharata, that happiness and joy are essential to virtue.

data.v: परप्रयुक्तः पुरुषो विचेष्टते; सूत्रप्रोता दारुमयीव योषा । इमं दृष्ट्वा नियमं पाण्डवस्य; मन्ये परं कर्म दैवं मनुष्यात् ।।
data.md: Led by the will of God, a man acts like a wooden doll moved about by a thread. Seeing the sufferings of the son of Pandu I think that the ordinations of the gods have greater force than the exertions of man.

data.v: इमं च दृष्ट्वा तव कर्मदोषं; पादोदर्कं घोरमवर्णरूपम् । यावन्नरः कामयतेऽतिकाल्यं; तावन्नरोऽयं लभते प्रशंसाम् ।।
data.md: Seeing again your sinful deeds which will give rise to misery and which are eminently indescribable, (I am of opinion) that so long as a mighty foe waits for an opportunity, the other obtains praise.

data.v: अजातशत्रुस्तु विहाय पापं; जीर्णां त्वचं सर्प इवासमर्थाम् । विरोचतेऽहार्यवृत्तेन धीरो; युधिष्ठिरस्त्वयि पापं विसृज्य ।।
data.md: The hero Yudhishthira, who has created no enemies, casting away all sins as a snake does its worn out slough, which cannot remain on it, shines resplendent having transferred (the effect of) his sins to you.

data.v: अङ्गात्मनः कर्म निबोध राज;न्धर्मार्थयुक्तादार्यवृत्तादपेतम् । उपक्रोशं चेह गतोऽसि राज;न्नोहेश्च पापं प्रसजेदमुत्र ।।
data.md: Reflect, Oking, the suicidal (effects of your) acts which are the reverse of the acts of honorable men and unproductive either of virtue or of wealth you have obtained blame, O king, in this world and again will you get misery in another.

data.v: स त्वमर्थं संशयितं विना तै;राशंससे पुत्रवशानुगोऽद्य । अधर्मशब्दश्च महान्पृथिव्यां; नेदं कर्म त्वत्समं भारताग्र्य ।।
data.md: Now following the whims of your son, you expect to obtain the wealth which it is hard to gain; you want to enjoy without them to share it. This act has been loudly proclaimed to be vicious in this world and this act is not worthy of you, O you foremost of the race of Bharata.

data.v: हीनप्रज्ञो दौष्कुलेयो नृशंसो; दीर्घवैरी क्षत्रविद्यास्वधीरः । एवंधर्मा नापदः संतितीर्षे;द्धीनवीर्यो यश्च भवेदशिष्टः ।।
data.md: Those who are devoid of wisdom, who are born is low families, who are cruel, who cherish feelings of enmity for a long time and who are not steady in the acquisitions of a Kshatriya, who are devoid to heroism and who are vicious-those who answer this description are overtaken by ruin.

data.v: कुले जातो धर्मवान्यो यशस्वी; बहुश्रुतः सुखजीवी यतात्मा । धर्मार्थयोर्ग्रथितयोर्बिभर्ति; नान्यत्र दिष्टस्य वशादुपैति ।।
data.md: It is through luck that one is born in a high family, is mighty, is renowned, is vastly learned, is happy in this life, tries to subdue his soul or supports virtue and vice which have a close connection between them.

data.v: कथं हि मन्त्राग्र्यधरो मनीषी; धर्मार्थयोरापदि संप्रणेता । एवंयुक्तः सर्वमन्त्रैरहीनो; अनानृशंस्यं कर्म कुर्यादमूढः ।।
data.md: The Kurus will prematurely cease to exist, if through your sins, he who has created no enemies wishes you misery. He will transfer (effect of) his sins to you and you will be blamed in the world.

data.v: तवापीमे मन्त्रविदः समेत्य; समासते कर्मसु नित्ययुक्ताः । तेषामयं बलवान्निश्चयश्च; कुरुक्षयार्थे निरयो व्यपादि ।।
data.md: Why should a man who is advised by the best of ministers, who is wise and who is master of actions producing virtue and interest in times of distress and who has not lost his senses why should such a man do a cruel deed like a man who is devoid of all advice.

data.v: अकालिकं कुरवो नाभविष्य;न्पापेन चेत्पापमजातशत्रुः । इच्छेज्जातु त्वयि पापं विसृज्य; निन्दा चेयं तव लोकेऽभविष्यत् ।।
data.md: All these ministers of yours, ever devoted to work, wait together. It is through their firm determination (that they will not give back to the Pandavas their share of the kingdom) that the destruction of the Kurus will be accomplished.

data.v: किमन्यत्र विषयादीश्वराणां; यत्र पार्थः परलोकं ददर्श । अत्यक्रामत्स तथा संमतः स्या;न्न संशयो नास्ति मनुष्यकारः ।।
data.md: What else is it but divine that the son of Pritha left this world to behold the other and was there honored like one having the privilege of roaming about both the worlds. This is not the doing of a man. There is no doubt about it.

data.v: एतान्गुणान्कर्मकृतानवेक्ष्य; भावाभावौ वर्तमानावनित्यौ । बलिर्हि राजा पारमविन्दमानो; नान्यत्कालात्कारणं तत्र मेने ।।
data.md: Seeing that the growth of these attributes (viz., heroism etc.) depended on action and that wealth and poverty were transient, king Bali, in his search about the cause of this came to the conclusion that god and nothing else was the cause thereof.

data.v: चक्षुः श्रोत्रे नासिका त्वक्च जिह्वा; ज्ञानस्यैतान्यायतनानि जन्तोः । तानि प्रीतान्येव तृष्णाक्षयान्ते; तान्यव्यथो दुःखहीनः प्रणुद्यात् ।।
data.md: The eye, the ear, the nose, the touch and the tongue, these are the sources of the knowledge of animals. These are gratified if thirst is destroyed; therefore should a man cheerfully bring these under control.

data.v: न त्वेव मन्ये पुरुषस्य कर्म; संवर्तते सुप्रयुक्तं यथावत् । मातुः पितुः कर्मणाभिप्रसूतः; संवर्धते विधिवद्भोजनेन ।।
data.md: Others put it in a different way. (They say) that the desired effect must come out of one's acts when done properly. (Thus) the child is the outcome of the act of its father and mother and it grows by proper diet.

data.v: प्रियाप्रिये सुखदुःखे च राज;न्निन्दाप्रशंसे च भजेत एनम् । परस्त्वेनं गर्हयतेऽपराधे; प्रशंसते साधुवृत्तं तमेव ।।
data.md: O king, man is subject to good and bad, happiness and misery, praise and censure. He wins praise when he does any good act and blame when he commits any wrong.

data.v: स त्वा गर्हे भारतानां विरोधा;दन्तो नूनं भवितायं प्रजानाम् । नो चेदिदं तव कर्मापराधा;त्कुरून्दहेत्कृष्णवर्त्मेव कक्षम् ।।
data.md: I blame you; for, the result of this struggle between the sons of Bharata will surely be the destruction of innumerable human lives and if peace be not concluded the Kurus will be consumed by Arjuna like a heap of dried grass by a blazing fire through your fault.

data.v: त्वमेवैको जातपुत्रेषु राज;न्वशं गन्ता सर्वलोके नरेन्द्र । कामात्मनां श्लाघसे द्यूतकाले; नान्यच्छमात्पश्य विपाकमस्य ।।
data.md: O Lord of men, you, alone of all the world having come under the influence of your headstrong son, regarded success as sure and did not prevent the dispute at the time of the game; now, see the result of this.

data.v: अनाप्तानां प्रग्रहात्त्वं नरेन्द्र; तथाप्तानां निग्रहाच्चैव राजन् । भूमिं स्फीतां दुर्बलत्वादनन्तां; न शक्तस्त्वं रक्षितुं कौरवेय ।।
data.md: O king, O lord of men, you will not be able to return this broad domain on account of your weakness, in listening to the counsels of false ministers and rejecting that of faithful advisers, Oson of Kuru.

data.v: अनुज्ञातो रथवेगावधूतः; श्रान्तो निपद्ये शयनं नृसिंह । प्रातः श्रोतारः कुरवः सभाया;मजातशत्रोर्वचनं समेताः ।।
data.md: O best of men, being very much fatigued by the speedy motion of the car I solicit your permission to retire to rest; for in the morning the sons of Kuru assembled in the council chamber will listen to the message of him who has created no enemies.

data.v: द्वाःस्थं प्राह महाप्राज्ञो धृतराष्ट्रो महीपतिः । विदुरं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि तमिहानय माचिरम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said The Lord of the Earth Dhritarashtra of great wisdom, said to his attendant-I desire to see Vidura. Bring him here without delay.

data.v: प्रहितो धृतराष्ट्रेण दूतः क्षत्तारमब्रवीत् । ईश्वरस्त्वां महाराजो महाप्राज्ञ दिदृक्षति ।।
data.md: Being sent by Dhritarashtra the messenger said to the Kshatriya-"O you of great wisdom, my lord, the king wants to see you."

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु विदुरः प्राप्य राजनिवेशनम् । अब्रवीद्धृतराष्ट्राय द्वाःस्थ मां प्रतिवेदय ।।
data.md: Being thus addressed, Vidura, having come to the royal palace, said to the gate keeper-'Announce me to Dhritarashtra.'

data.v: विदुरोऽयमनुप्राप्तो राजेन्द्र तव शासनात् । द्रष्टुमिच्छति ते पादौ किं करोतु प्रशाधि माम् ।।
data.md: The gate keeper said O chief among kings, Vidura, having come here at your command, desires to behold your feet. Command me what he is to do.

data.v: प्रवेशय महाप्राज्ञं विदुरं दीर्घदर्शिनम् । अहं हि विदुरस्यास्य नाकाल्यो जातु दर्शने ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Let the very wise Vidura endued with great foresight enter. I am always willing and prepared to see Vidura.

data.v: प्रविशान्तःपुरं क्षत्तर्महाराजस्य धीमतः । न हि ते दर्शनेऽकाल्यो जातु राजा ब्रवीति माम् ।।
data.md: The gate keeper said O Kshattri, enter the inner apartments of the wise king; the king told me that he was never unwilling to see you.

data.v: ततः प्रविश्य विदुरो धृतराष्ट्रनिवेशनम् । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं चिन्तयानं नराधिपम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then Vidura having entered the palace of Dhritarashtra said with clasped hands to the lord of men who was absorbed in thought.

data.v: विदुरोऽहं महाप्राज्ञ संप्राप्तस्तव शासनात् । यदि किंचन कर्तव्यमयमस्मि प्रशाधि माम् ।।
data.md: The gate keeper said O chief among kings, Vidura, having come here at your command, desires to behold your feet. Command me what he is to do.

data.v: संजयो विदुर प्राप्तो गर्हयित्वा च मां गतः । अजातशत्रोः श्वो वाक्यं सभामध्ये स वक्ष्यति ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Vidura, Sanjaya has arrived here and having found fault with me gone away; the message of Yudhishthira he will deliver in the council.

data.v: तस्याद्य कुरुवीरस्य न विज्ञातं वचो मया । तन्मे दहति गात्राणि तदकार्षीत्प्रजागरम् ।।
data.md: This day was I unable to know (the nature of) the message of the hero among the Kurus; therefore is my body burning, which has caused sleeplessness.

data.v: जाग्रतो दह्यमानस्य श्रेयो यदिह पश्यसि । तद्ब्रूहि त्वं हि नस्तात धर्मार्थकुशलो ह्यसि ।।
data.md: What you consider good for a man who gets no sleep and whose body is burning, tell (me) you are versed in what is regions and what leads to profit.

data.v: यतः प्राप्तः संजयः पाण्डवेभ्यो; न मे यथावन्मनसः प्रशान्तिः । सर्वेन्द्रियाण्यप्रकृतिं गतानि; किं वक्ष्यतीत्येव हि मेऽद्य चिन्ता ।।
data.md: Since Sanjaya has come back from the Pandavas, I have not my usual calmness of mind; all my senses are in disorders I am thinking what he will say.

data.v: अभियुक्तं बलवता दुर्बलं हीनसाधनम् । हृतस्वं कामिनं चोरमाविशन्ति प्रजागराः ।।
data.md: Vidura said Sleeplessness overpowers one attacked by a stronger man, the weak, those who have failed to attain an end, those whose wealth has been stolen, those fired with desire and thieves.

data.v: कच्चिदेतैर्महादोषैर्न स्पृष्टोऽसि नराधिप । कच्चिन्न परवित्तेषु गृध्यन्विपरितप्यसे ।।
data.md: I hope, O Lord of men, you have not been affected by any of these grave evils nor are you possessed by covetousness at other people's wealth.

data.v: श्रोतुमिच्छामि ते धर्म्यं परं नैःश्रेयसं वचः । अस्मिन्राजर्षिवंशे हि त्वमेकः प्राज्ञसंमतः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said I desire to hear words from you that are at once moral in spirit and beneficial; in this race i of royal devotees; you are the only one ; hundred by the wise.

data.v: निषेवते प्रशस्तानि निन्दितानि न सेवते । अनास्तिकः श्रद्दधान एतत्पण्डितलक्षणम् ।।
data.md: Vidura said He is said to be a wise man, whom for a consciousness of the power of one's own self, exertion, forbearance and constancy in religion does not draw aside from the acquisition of the high ends in life.

data.v: क्रोधो हर्षश्च दर्पश्च ह्रीस्तम्भो मान्यमानिता । यमर्थान्नापकर्षन्ति स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man whom anger, exultation, pride, shame, stupefaction and vanity cannot draw aside from the acquisition of the high ends in life.

data.v: यस्य कृत्यं न जानन्ति मन्त्रं वा मन्त्रितं परे । कृतमेवास्य जानन्ति स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man whose proposed acts, line of action agreed on are not known to other and known only after they have been put into execution.

data.v: यस्य कृत्यं न विघ्नन्ति शीतमुष्णं भयं रतिः । समृद्धिरसमृद्धिर्वा स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man whose proposed acts, line of action agreed on are not known to other and known only after they have been put into execution.

data.v: यस्य संसारिणी प्रज्ञा धर्मार्थावनुवर्तते । कामादर्थं वृणीते यः स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is called a wise man whose wisdom naturally follows both religion and profit and who chooses such course of life as is of use in both the worlds and not acts immediately resulting in pleasure.

data.v: यथाशक्ति चिकीर्षन्ति यथाशक्ति च कुर्वते । न किंचिदवमन्यन्ते पण्डिता भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: Wise men exert to the best of their ability and also act to the best of their ability and they disregard nothing.

data.v: क्षिप्रं विजानाति चिरं शृणोति; विज्ञाय चार्थं भजते न कामात् । नासंपृष्टो व्युपयुङ्क्ते परार्थे; तत्प्रज्ञानं प्रथमं पण्डितस्य ।।
data.md: It the wisdom of the foremost wise man to understand quickly, listen pertinently and having understood the effects of action not to follow them from desire to get pleasure (but from judgment) and not to connect one's self with other peoples' affairs unsolicited.

data.v: नाप्राप्यमभिवाञ्छन्ति नष्टं नेच्छन्ति शोचितुम् । आपत्सु च न मुह्यन्ति नराः पण्डितबुद्धयः ।।
data.md: Men with the wisdom of a wise man do not strive for the unattainable, do not grieves for what is lost and do not lose their senses in calamities.

data.v: निश्चित्य यः प्रक्रमते नान्तर्वसति कर्मणः । अवन्ध्यकालो वश्यात्मा स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man who exerts after having decided on a courts of action and who dose not stop in the middle, who dose not waste his time and who has his self under control.

data.v: आर्यकर्मणि रज्यन्ते भूतिकर्माणि कुर्वते । हितं च नाभ्यसूयन्ति पण्डिता भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: Wise men rejoice in virtuous deeds and do those that tend to their prosperity and look not with contempt on what is good.

data.v: न हृष्यत्यात्मसंमाने नावमानेन तप्यते । गाङ्गो ह्रद इवाक्षोभ्यो यः स पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said be a wise man who dose not exult in honors to himself and grieves not at intuits and who remains unagitated like a lake near the Ganga.

data.v: तत्त्वज्ञः सर्वभूतानां योगज्ञः सर्वकर्मणाम् । उपायज्ञो मनुष्याणां नरः पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: That man is said to be wise who is cognizant of the nature of all creatures (their ultimate destructibility), of the connections (causes and effects) of all acts and the means of human beings (employed in the attainment of their ends).

data.v: प्रवृत्तवाक्चित्रकथ ऊहवान्प्रतिभानवान् । आशु ग्रन्थस्य वक्ता च स वै पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man whose proposed acts, line of action agreed on are not known to other and known only after they have been put into execution.

data.v: श्रुतं प्रज्ञानुगं यस्य प्रज्ञा चैव श्रुतानुगा । असंभिन्नार्यमर्यादः पण्डिताख्यां लभेत सः ।।
data.md: He gains the reputation of wise man who regulates his studies by wisdom and whose wisdom follows the books, who is ever ready to respect those that are good.

data.v: अश्रुतश्च समुन्नद्धो दरिद्रश्च महामनाः । अर्थांश्चाकर्मणा प्रेप्सुर्मूढ इत्युच्यते बुधैः ।।
data.md: Wise men call them fools, who though not learned are haughty, though poor are vain and who are who are are desirous of attaining prosperity by wrong acts.

data.v: स्वमर्थं यः परित्यज्य परार्थमनुतिष्ठति । मिथ्या चरति मित्रार्थे यश्च मूढः स उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said be a fool who neglecting his own interests looks after those of others and who resorts to deceit for (serving) his friends.

data.v: अकामान्कामयति यः कामयानान्परिद्विषन् । बलवन्तं च यो द्वेष्टि तमाहुर्मूढचेतसम् ।।
data.md: He is said to be foolish-minded who desires what ought not to be desired and forsakes those that are fit to be desired and who treats stronger parties with contempt.

data.v: अमित्रं कुरुते मित्रं मित्रं द्वेष्टि हिनस्ति च । कर्म चारभते दुष्टं तमाहुर्मूढचेतसम् ।।
data.md: He is said be foolish-minded who makes friends of those that are foes and who hates and slays that are well-wishers and who commits wicked acts.

data.v: संसारयति कृत्यानि सर्वत्र विचिकित्सते । चिरं करोति क्षिप्रार्थे स मूढो भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: He is a fool who gives out his intended acts, who has doubts in every case and who delays in doing things that ought to be done quickly.

data.v: अनाहूतः प्रविशति अपृष्टो बहु भाषते । विश्वसत्यप्रमत्तेषु मूढचेता नराधमः ।।
data.md: That fool the worst of men who enters unasked, speaks much unsolicited and has; confidence in those that are untrust-worthy.

data.v: परं क्षिपति दोषेण वर्तमानः स्वयं तथा । यश्च क्रुध्यत्यनीशः सन्स च मूढतमो नरः ।।
data.md: That man is the worst of fools who throws the blame on others, though himself is to blame and who is though unable to do anything.

data.v: आत्मनो बलमज्ञाय धर्मार्थपरिवर्जितम् । अलभ्यमिच्छन्नैष्कर्म्यान्मूढबुद्धिरिहोच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be foolish-headed in this world who is desirous of an object hard to gain without knowing his own strength, without employing adequate means for it and the object if gained securing him neither merit in heaven nor profit in this world.

data.v: अशिष्यं शास्ति यो राजन्यश्च शून्यमुपासते । कदर्यं भजते यश्च तमाहुर्मूढचेतसम् ।।
data.md: He is said to be foolish-minded who punishes, Oking him who deserves not punishment, who flatters big people without their knowledge and who attends on misers.

data.v: अर्थं महान्तमासाद्य विद्यामैश्वर्यमेव वा । विचरत्यसमुन्नद्धो यः स पण्डित उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is said to be a wise man who, having acquired immense wealth, learning or power, conducts himself without any haughtiness.

data.v: एकः संपन्नमश्नाति वस्ते वासश्च शोभनम् । योऽसंविभज्य भृत्येभ्यः को नृशंसतरस्ततः ।।
data.md: Who is meaner then he who though possessed of riches eats and wears pretty looking dresses alone without sharing them amongst his dependents.

data.v: एकः पापानि कुरुते फलं भुङ्क्ते महाजनः । भोक्तारो विप्रमुच्यन्ते कर्ता दोषेण लिप्यते ।।
data.md: One man dose wicked deeds while the fruit is enjoyed by many; others enjoy while the doer alone is blamed.

data.v: एकं हन्यान्न वा हन्यादिषुर्मुक्तो धनुष्मता । बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतोत्सृष्टा हन्याद्राष्ट्रं सराजकम् ।।
data.md: Only one may or may not be killed by a bowman who has shot an arrow but when a wise man employs his wisdom (viciously) a kingdom may be destroyed along with the king.

data.v: एकया द्वे विनिश्चित्य त्रींश्चतुर्भिर्वशे कुरु । पञ्च जित्वा विदित्वा षट्सप्त हित्वा सुखी भव ।।
data.md: Discriminating the two (right and wrong or the transient and the permanent effect of actions) by means of the one (intellect), bring under your control the three (friend, foe and one who is indifferent in these respects or desire, anger and greed) by means of four (Conciliation, gift dissension and punishment) and subjugating the five (senses) and knowing the six (treaty, war, hunger, thirst, calamity, imbecility, old age and death or desire anger, greed, &c) and keeping yourself away from the seven (women, dice, hunting, drink, harshness of speech severity of punishment and misuse of wealth) be happy.

data.v: एकं विषरसो हन्ति शस्त्रेणैकश्च वध्यते । सराष्ट्रं सप्रजं हन्ति राजानं मन्त्रविस्रवः ।।
data.md: Poison kills but one and also one is slain by a weapon, while disagreement between ministers destroys a king with the kingdom and the subjects.

data.v: एकः स्वादु न भुञ्जीत एकश्चार्थान्न चिन्तयेत् । एको न गच्छेदध्वानं नैकः सुप्तेषु जागृयात् ।।
data.md: Alone one should not taste a delicious dish, alone one should not think of profitable undertakings, alone one should not go on a journey and alone one should not be awake amidst those that are asleep.

data.v: एकमेवाद्वितीयं तद्यद्राजन्नावबुध्यसे । सत्यं स्वर्गस्य सोपानं पारावारस्य नौरिव ।।
data.md: The Being, who has no rival, whom you have not been able to comprehend, is Truth and the Way to Heaven, like a boat in the ocean.

data.v: एकः क्षमावतां दोषो द्वितीयो नोपलभ्यते । यदेनं क्षमया युक्तमशक्तं मन्यते जनः ।।
data.md: There is but one defect in persons of a forgiving disposition; since people consider this man of a foregoing nature to be weak.

data.v: एको धर्मः परं श्रेयः क्षमैका शान्तिरुत्तमा । विद्यैका परमा दृष्टिरहिंसैका सुखावहा ।।
data.md: Virtue is the only highest good forgiveness the supreme peace, knowledge the deepest satisfaction and benevolence the one cause of happiness.

data.v: द्वाविमौ ग्रसते भूमिः सर्पो बिलशयानिव । राजानं चाविरोद्धारं ब्राह्मणं चाप्रवासिनम् ।।
data.md: The earth devours these two, as a serpent destroys living in holes viz., a king who is not a warrior and a Brahmana who has never been away form home (to holy places).

data.v: द्वे कर्मणी नरः कुर्वन्नस्मिँल्लोके विरोचते । अब्रुवन्परुषं किंचिदसतो नार्थयंस्तथा ।।
data.md: By doing two things a man can attain to renown in this world by not indulging in harshness of speech and by disregarding the slightly his honest.

data.v: द्वाविमौ पुरुषव्याघ्र परप्रत्ययकारिणौ । स्त्रियः कामितकामिन्यो लोकः पूजितपूजकः ।।
data.md: These two, 0 best of men, place confidence in others viz. The women who desire men (only because the latter are) desired by other women and the men who worship another (only because the latter is) worshipped by others.

data.v: द्वाविमौ कण्टकौ तीक्ष्णौ शरीरपरिशोषणौ । यश्चाधनः कामयते यश्च कुप्यत्यनीश्वरः ।।
data.md: These two are like sharp thorns consuming the body viz. the man, who being poor, has desires and one, who thought powerless, is yet wrathful.

data.v: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ राजन्स्वर्गस्योपरि तिष्ठतः । प्रभुश्च क्षमया युक्तो दरिद्रश्च प्रदानवान् ।।
data.md: These two men, O king, are placed above heaven, viz. the powerful man graced with forgiveness and the poor man with charity.

data.v: न्यायागतस्य द्रव्यस्य बोद्धव्यौ द्वावतिक्रमौ । अपात्रे प्रतिपत्तिश्च पात्रे चाप्रतिपादनम् ।।
data.md: Of things earned by just means these two must be looked upon as abuses viz. gifts to the unworthy and refusal to the worthy.

data.v: त्रयो न्याया मनुष्याणां श्रूयन्ते भरतर्षभ । कनीयान्मध्यमः श्रेष्ठ इति वेदविदो विदुः ।।
data.md: Men are known to have three means (for attaining of their ends) 0 best the race of Bharatas, they are kuown to people versed in the Vedas as the bad, the middling and the good.

data.v: त्रिविधाः पुरुषा राजन्नुत्तमाधममध्यमाः । नियोजयेद्यथावत्तांस्त्रिविधेष्वेव कर्मसु ।।
data.md: Men too, o king, of three denominations viz., the good, bad middling; they should therefore be employed in their respective avocations-in three sorts of work. are

data.v: त्रय एवाधना राजन्भार्या दासस्तथा सुतः । यत्ते समधिगच्छन्ति यस्य ते तस्य तद्धनम् ।।
data.md: The three are without wealth, O king, viz., the wife, the slave and the son; what ever they earn beings to him to whom they belong.

data.v: चत्वारि राज्ञा तु महाबलेन; वर्ज्यान्याहुः पण्डितस्तानि विद्यात् । अल्पप्रज्ञैः सह मन्त्रं न कुर्या;न्न दीर्घसूत्रैरलसैश्चारणैश्च ।।
data.md: These four should be excluded from counsels even by a greatly powerful king-the learned men have said men of little sense should not be consulted-nor men who make unnecessary delays, iazy men and flatterers.

data.v: चत्वारि ते तात गृहे वसन्तु; श्रियाभिजुष्टस्य गृहस्थधर्मे । वृद्धो ज्ञातिरवसन्नः कुलीनः; सखा दरिद्रो भगिनी चानपत्या ।।
data.md: Let these four dwell at your house, O sire, who a householder crowned with are prosperity; viz., aged and worn out cousins, men of noble families, destitute friends and childless sisters.

data.v: चत्वार्याह महाराज सद्यस्कानि बृहस्पतिः । पृच्छते त्रिदशेन्द्राय तानीमानि निबोध मे ।।
data.md: Four things, O great king, were declared to bear fruit instantaneously by Brihaspati on being asked by the chief of the celestial; they are these, listen to me.

data.v: देवतानां च संकल्पमनुभावं च धीमताम् । विनयं कृतविद्यानां विनाशं पापकर्मणाम् ।।
data.md: The resolve of the gods, the intellect, of the wise, the humility of the accomplished and the destruction of wicked deeds.

data.v: पञ्चाग्नयो मनुष्येण परिचर्याः प्रयत्नतः । पिता माताग्निरात्मा च गुरुश्च भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: Five fires should be worshipped by a man with care viz., father, mother, Agni, self and spiritual guide, O best the race of Bharata.

data.v: पञ्चैव पूजयँल्लोके यशः प्राप्नोति केवलम् । देवान्पितॄन्मनुष्यांश्च भिक्षूनतिथिपञ्चमान् ।।
data.md: By worshipping these five viz., the gods, the ancestors, men, beggars and guest a man obtains renown in this world.

data.v: पञ्च त्वानुगमिष्यन्ति यत्र यत्र गमिष्यसि । मित्राण्यमित्रा मध्यस्था उपजीव्योपजीविनः ।।
data.md: These five follow you wherever you go viz., friends, those that are neither, dependents nor those who ought to be supported by you.

data.v: पञ्चेन्द्रियस्य मर्त्यस्य छिद्रं चेदेकमिन्द्रियम् । ततोऽस्य स्रवति प्रज्ञा दृतेः पादादिवोदकम् ।।
data.md: Of the five senses in this world, if one has a hole, them from that hole gets out the wisdom of an intelligent man like water, from a pot.

data.v: षड्दोषाः पुरुषेणेह हातव्या भूतिमिच्छता । निद्रा तन्द्री भयं क्रोध आलस्यं दीर्घसूत्रता ।।
data.md: These six defects should be shunned by a man in this world who desires for prosperity viz., sleep drowsiness, fear, anger, laziness and procrastination.

data.v: षडिमान्पुरुषो जह्याद्भिन्नां नावमिवार्णवे । अप्रवक्तारमाचार्यमनधीयानमृत्विजम् ।।
data.md: These six should be avoided by a man like a broken boat in the sea; a tutor that cannot interpret the meaning of the holy books, a priest that is not well read, a king that cannot protect a wife given to the use of disagreeable words, a cowherd that desires always for the village (and not the pasture) and barber that desires for the wilderness.

data.v: अरक्षितारं राजानं भार्यां चाप्रियवादिनीम् । ग्रामकामं च गोपालं वनकामं च नापितम् ।।
data.md: These six should be avoided by a man like a broken boat in the sea; a tutor that cannot interpret the meaning of the holy books, a priest that is not well read, a king that cannot protect a wife given to the use of disagreeable words, a cowherd that desires always for the village (and not the pasture) and barber that desires for the wilderness.

data.v: षडेव तु गुणाः पुंसा न हातव्याः कदाचन । सत्यं दानमनालस्यमनसूया क्षमा धृतिः ।।
data.md: The six qualities should never be renounced by a man viz, truth, charity, the reverse of laziness, benevolence, forgiveness and patience.

data.v: षण्णामात्मनि नित्यानामैश्वर्यं योऽधिगच्छति । न स पापैः कुतोऽनर्थैर्युज्यते विजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.md: These six always cease to care those who have previously done them good viz., a learned pupil, the tutor, he who has got a wife the mother, one whose desire has been satisfied, the woman, one whose wants have been removed, the giver, one who has crossed a river, boat and the diseased (who has been cured) and the physician.

data.v: षडिमे षट्सु जीवन्ति सप्तमो नोपलभ्यते । चोराः प्रमत्ते जीवन्ति व्याधितेषु चिकित्सकाः ।।
data.md: These six always cease to care those who have previously done them good viz., a learned pupil, the tutor, he who has got a wife the mother, one whose desire has been satisfied, the woman, one whose wants have been removed, the giver, one who has crossed a river, boat and the diseased (who has been cured) and the physician.

data.v: प्रमदाः कामयानेषु यजमानेषु याजकाः । राजा विवदमानेषु नित्यं मूर्खेषु पण्डिताः ।।
data.md: Immunity from malady, unindebtedness, the reverse of exile, coming in contact with good men, confidence in one's own livelihood and life without fear-these six, constitute the happiness of men, O king.

data.v: सप्त दोषाः सदा राज्ञा हातव्या व्यसनोदयाः । प्रायशो यैर्विनश्यन्ति कृतमूलाश्च पार्थिवाः ।।
data.md: Seven defects which are the sources of calainity should also be avoided by a king since they always accomplish the destruction of even firmly established king.

data.v: स्त्रियोऽक्षा मृगया पानं वाक्पारुष्यं च पञ्चमम् । महच्च दण्डपारुष्यमर्थदूषणमेव च ।।
data.md: (They are) women, dice, game, drink, harshness of speech, these five and the great severity of punishment and abuse of wealth.

data.v: अष्टौ पूर्वनिमित्तानि नरस्य विनशिष्यतः । ब्राह्मणान्प्रथमं द्वेष्टि ब्राह्मणैश्च विरुध्यते ।।
ब्राह्मणस्वानि चादत्ते ब्राह्मणांश्च जिघांसति । रमते निन्दया चैषां प्रशंसां नाभिनन्दति ।।
नैतान्स्मरति कृत्येषु याचितश्चाभ्यसूयति । एतान्दोषान्नरः प्राज्ञो बुद्ध्या बुद्ध्वा विवर्जयेत् ।।
अष्टाविमानि हर्षस्य नवनीतानि भारत । वर्तमानानि दृश्यन्ते तान्येव सुसुखान्यपि ।।
समागमश्च सखिभिर्महांश्चैव धनागमः । पुत्रेण च परिष्वङ्गः संनिपातश्च मैथुने ।।
समये च प्रियालापः स्वयूथेषु च संनतिः । अभिप्रेतस्य लाभश्च पूजा च जनसंसदि ।।
नवद्वारमिदं वेश्म त्रिस्थूणं पञ्चसाक्षिकम् । क्षेत्रज्ञाधिष्ठितं विद्वान्यो वेद स परः कविः ।।
data.md: This house has nine doors, three pillars and five witnesses presided over by the soul. That learned man who knows this is the best of the wise.

data.v: दश धर्मं न जानन्ति धृतराष्ट्र निबोध तान् । मत्तः प्रमत्त उन्मत्तः श्रान्तः क्रुद्धो बुभुक्षितः ।।
data.md: These ten know not what virtue is, o Dhritarashtra, listen (as I name them, the intoxicated, the absent-minded, the insane, the weary, the angry, the hungry, the hasty, the covetous, the frightened and lustful, these are the ten; therefore should a wise man shun the company of these all.

data.v: त्वरमाणश्च भीरुश्च लुब्धः कामी च ते दश । तस्मादेतेषु भावेषु न प्रसज्जेत पण्डितः ।।
data.md: These ten know not what virtue is, o Dhritarashtra, listen (as I name them, the intoxicated, the absent-minded, the insane, the weary, the angry, the hungry, the hasty, the covetous, the frightened and lustful, these are the ten; therefore should a wise man shun the company of these all.

data.v: अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । पुत्रार्थमसुरेन्द्रेण गीतं चैव सुधन्वना ।।
data.md: In this connection people cite the old story that is related about what passed between Sudhanvan and the chief of the Asuras for the sake of his (the latter's) son.

data.v: यः काममन्यू प्रजहाति राजा; पात्रे प्रतिष्ठापयते धनं च । विशेषविच्छ्रुतवान्क्षिप्रकारी; तं सर्वलोकः कुरुते प्रमाणम् ।।
data.md: The king, who shuns desire and spite and distributes wealth among worthy parties, is discriminating, learned, active and is regarded as an authority by all men.

data.v: जानाति विश्वासयितुं मनुष्या;न्विज्ञातदोषेषु दधाति दण्डम् । जानाति मात्रां च तथा क्षमां च; तं तादृशं श्रीर्जुषते समग्रा ।।
data.md: One who knows how to make other people confident on him, who awards punishment after guilt has been established, knows its proper degree and knows also forgiveness it attended with great prosperity.

data.v: सुदुर्बलं नावजानाति कंचि;द्युक्तो रिपुं सेवते बुद्धिपूर्वम् । न विग्रहं रोचयते बलस्थैः; काले च यो विक्रमते स धीरः ।।
data.md: He is a wise man, who does think lightly of the weak (foe), who proceeds with intelligence in respect to a foe waiting for an opportunity, who does not quarrel with the strong and who shows prowess only at the proper time.

data.v: प्राप्यापदं न व्यथते कदाचि;दुद्योगमन्विच्छति चाप्रमत्तः । दुःखं च काले सहते जितात्मा; धुरंधरस्तस्य जिताः सपत्नाः ।।
data.md: That illustrious man, who does not grieve when a calamity is already on him and who (then) experts with his senses about him and who also patiently bears calamities (when they are unavoidable), is a noble-minded one and his opponents are always subdued.

data.v: अनर्थकं विप्रवासं गृहेभ्यः; पापैः संधिं परदाराभिमर्शम् । दम्भं स्तैन्यं पैशुनं मद्यपानं; न सेवते यः स सुखी सदैव ।।
data.md: He who never remains away from home for nothing, who does not mix with wicked people, never outrages another's wife, who is not arrogant, who does not steal, is not ungrateful and does not drink, is always happy.

data.v: न संरम्भेणारभतेऽर्थवर्ग;माकारितः शंसति तथ्यमेव । न मात्रार्थे रोचयते विवादं; नापूजितः कुप्यति चाप्यमूढः ।।
data.md: He who never pursues the three objects (virtue, profit and desire) in a spirit of boastfulness, who when appealed declares the truth, who does not sow discussions even for friends and who through insulted is not angry is the reverse of a fool.

data.v: न योऽभ्यसूयत्यनुकम्पते च; न दुर्बलः प्रातिभाव्यं करोति । नात्याह किंचित्क्षमते विवादं; सर्वत्र तादृग्लभते प्रशंसाम् ।।
data.md: He, who is not malicious towards others and who being weak does not quarrel, who does not speak haughtily and who always forgives quarrels, wins renown.

data.v: यो नोद्धतं कुरुते जातु वेषं; न पौरुषेणापि विकत्थतेऽन्यान् । न मूर्च्छितः कटुकान्याह किंचि;त्प्रियं सदा तं कुरुते जनोऽपि ।।
data.md: One, who is never haughty, who never speaks ill of others, praising himself and who in a moment of self forgetfulness never speaks harshly, is loved by all men.

data.v: न वैरमुद्दीपयति प्रशान्तं; न दर्पमारोहति नास्तमेति । न दुर्गतोऽस्मीति करोति मन्युं; तमार्यशीलं परमाहुरग्र्यम् ।।
data.md: One, who does not revive disputes that have been settled and who behaves not with too much arrogance, nor with excessive humility and who does not do a wrong deed, because he is in distress, is said to be a man, of good behaviour by very good men.

data.v: न स्वे सुखे वै कुरुते प्रहर्षं; नान्यस्य दुःखे भवति प्रतीतः । दत्त्वा न पश्चात्कुरुतेऽनुतापं; न कत्थते सत्पुरुषार्यशीलः ।।
data.md: One, who exults not in his own happiness nor is giad at another's distress and who does not repent after having given away, is said by good men to be of good conduct.

data.v: देशाचारान्समयाञ्जातिधर्मा;न्बुभूषते यस्तु परावरज्ञः । स तत्र तत्राधिगतः सदैव; महाजनस्याधिपत्यं करोति ।।
data.md: He, who desires knowledge of the manners and customs of different countries and of the different languages and of the duties of the different casts, knows everything, high and low; wherever he goes, he attains to lordship over great men.

data.v: दम्भं मोहं मत्सरं पापकृत्यं; राजद्विष्टं पैशुनं पूगवैरम् । मत्तोन्मत्तैर्दुर्जनैश्चापि वादं; यः प्रज्ञावान्वर्जयेत्स प्रधानः ।।
data.md: The wise man who keeps away pride, folly, impertinence, sinful deeds, disloyalty towards his sovereign, roguery enmity with many, speech with the drunk, the insane and the wicked, is a chief among men,

data.v: दमं शौचं दैवतं मङ्गलानि; प्रायश्चित्तं विविधाँल्लोकवादान् । एतानि यः कुरुते नैत्यकानि; तस्योत्थानं देवता राधयन्ति ।।
data.md: Charity, worship of the gods, auspicious ceremonies and the several penances laid down by men-the gods exert themselves for the advancement of him who practices these daily.

data.v: समैर्विवाहं कुरुते न हीनैः; समैः सख्यं व्यवहारं कथाश्च । गुणैर्विशिष्टांश्च पुरोदधाति; विपश्चितस्तस्य नयाः सुनीताः ।।
data.md: One, who forms matrimonial relationship with a man in equal station and not with those who are below him and who forms friendships with his equals and converses and treats with them, who puts those that are graced with accomplishments before him-performs acts after the best policy.

data.v: मितं भुङ्क्ते संविभज्याश्रितेभ्यो; मितं स्वपित्यमितं कर्म कृत्वा । ददात्यमित्रेष्वपि याचितः सं;स्तमात्मवन्तं प्रजहत्यनर्थाः ।।
data.md: One who eats with moderation after doing excessive work, who gives away, (even) to foes when asked, is never beside himself; and evils always avoid him.

data.v: चिकीर्षितं विप्रकृतं च यस्य; नान्ये जनाः कर्म जानन्ति किंचित् । मन्त्रे गुप्ते सम्यगनुष्ठिते च; स्वल्पो नास्य व्यथते कश्चिदर्थः ।।
data.md: He, whose proposed acts and acts put into execution are seldom known to others and whose intentions are kept secret and put into practice suitably, does not fail in his objects even when trifling.

data.v: यः सर्वभूतप्रशमे निविष्टः; सत्यो मृदुर्दानकृच्छुद्धभावः । अतीव संज्ञायते ज्ञातिमध्ये; महामणिर्जात्य इव प्रसन्नः ।।
data.md: He, who is engaged in doing good to all creatures, who is attached to truth, not haughty, of a good mind and not a miser, is known very well among his cousins like a gem of the purest ray obtained from a good mine.

data.v: य आत्मनापत्रपते भृशं नरः; स सर्वलोकस्य गुरुर्भवत्युत । अनन्ततेजाः सुमनाः समाहितः; स्वतेजसा सूर्य इवावभासते ।।
data.md: The man, who is ashamed of his faults unknown to others, is respected by all men, being of illimitable luster, of an excellent mind; and his mind is intent on his inner self and his luster shines like the sun.

data.v: वने जाताः शापदग्धस्य राज्ञः; पाण्डोः पुत्राः पञ्च पञ्चेन्द्रकल्पाः । त्वयैव बाला वर्धिताः शिक्षिताश्च; तवादेशं पालयन्त्याम्बिकेय ।।
data.md: The king Pandu, burning under the influence of a curse, begot in the woods, five sons each equal to Indra; under your supervision did the boys grow up and were instructed and you have been rearing them up to now, O son of Ambika.

data.v: प्रदायैषामुचितं तात राज्यं; सुखी पुत्रैः सहितो मोदमानः । न देवानां नापि च मानुषाणां; भविष्यसि त्वं तर्कणीयो नरेन्द्र ।।
data.md: Giving back to them their rightful kingdom, O Sire, be happy with your sons and pass your time agreeably; O Lord of man, then will you not be mistrusted by the gods, nor by the men.

data.v: जाग्रतो दह्यमानस्य यत्कार्यमनुपश्यसि । तद्ब्रूहि त्वं हि नस्तात धर्मार्थकुशलः शुचिः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Tell me what you think ought to be done by a sleepless man and burning (with anxiety); you alone among us, are accomplished, both in the codes of morality and policy.

data.v: त्वं मां यथावद्विदुर प्रशाधि; प्रज्ञापूर्वं सर्वमजातशत्रोः । यन्मन्यसे पथ्यमदीनसत्त्व; श्रेयस्करं ब्रूहि तद्वै कुरूणाम् ।।
data.md: Tell me, O Vidura, as suits the occasion, after exercising your wisdom, all that you consider to be beneficial for Ajatashatru; tell speak also what conduces to the good of the Kurus.
