data.md: A Shudra, after worshipping in due order Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas; and a Vaishya, having completed his study and on distributed his wealth among Brahmanas and Kshatriyas and among his dependents and after having smelt the sacred smokes purified by the three sorts of fire, enjoy heavenly bliss after death.

data.v: ब्रह्मक्षत्रं वैश्यवर्णं च शूद्रः; क्रमेणैतान्न्यायतः पूजयानः । तुष्टेष्वेतेष्वव्यथो दग्धपाप;स्त्यक्त्वा देहं स्वर्गसुखानि भुङ्क्ते ।।
data.md: These having been satisfied, they become devoid of sins by burning them and casting off their body enjoy heavenly bliss.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यस्यैष धर्मस्तवोक्तो; हेतुं चात्र ब्रुवतो मे निबोध । क्षात्राद्धर्माद्धीयते पाण्डुपुत्र;स्तं त्वं राजन्राजधर्मे नियुङ्क्ष्व ।।
data.md: Such are the duties of the four orders told to you. Listen to the reason of my describing them. The son of Pandu (Yudhishthira) is falling from the duties of a Kshatriya; O king, you place him in a position to discharge the duties of a king.

data.v: एवमेतद्यथा मां त्वमनुशाससि नित्यदा । ममापि च मतिः सौम्य भवत्येवं यथात्थ माम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said It is even as you have been instructing me constantly; my inclination, too, turns towards peace, of which you speak to me.

data.v: सा तु बुद्धिः कृताप्येवं पाण्डवान्प्रति मे सदा । दुर्योधनं समासाद्य पुनर्विपरिवर्तते ।।
data.md: My inclination through made to turn towards the Pandavas constantly turns away in a contrary; direction by coming in contact with Duryodhana.

data.v: न दिष्टमभ्यतिक्रान्तुं शक्यं मर्त्येन केनचित् । दिष्टमेव कृतं मन्ये पौरुषं तु निरर्थकम् ।।
data.md: Destiny cannot be transgressed by any created beings. I consider that destiny alone is certain; human exertion is vain.

data.v: अनुक्तं यदि ते किंचिद्वाचा विदुर विद्यते । तन्मे शुश्रूषवे ब्रूहि विचित्राणि हि भाषसे ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said If there is anything you have left unsaid, O Vidura, speak to me who am listening to you. You are speaking of interesting things.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्र कुमारो वै यः पुराणः सनातनः । सनत्सुजातः प्रोवाच मृत्युर्नास्तीति भारत ।।
data.md: Vidura said O Dhritarashtra, the ancient and eternal Rishi Sanat-Sujata, who lived a life of perpetual celibacy, said that there was no death, O Bharata.

data.v: स ते गुह्यान्प्रकाशांश्च सर्वान्हृदयसंश्रयान् । प्रवक्ष्यति महाराज सर्वबुद्धिमतां वरः ।।
data.md: That chief among intelligent beings will speak to you. O great king, on the subjects thought of by you, whether you have made them known or kept them locked up in your heart.

data.v: किं त्वं न वेद तद्भूयो यन्मे ब्रूयात्सनातनः । त्वमेव विदुर ब्रूहि प्रज्ञाशेषोऽस्ति चेत्तव ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Do you not know what that internal being will say to me? You, O Vidura, speak (about these things) if your mind has that limit of wisdom.

data.v: शूद्रयोनावहं जातो नातोऽन्यद्वक्तुमुत्सहे । कुमारस्य तु या बुद्धिर्वेद तां शाश्वतीमहम् ।।
data.md: Vidura said I am born among the Shudra class; for that reason, I do not dare say anything more (than what I have already said); the knowledge of that celebrate being, however, is considered by me as eternal.

data.v: ब्राह्मीं हि योनिमापन्नः सुगुह्यमपि यो वदेत् । न तेन गर्ह्यो देवानां तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: He, born is the Brahmana class, even when speaking of highly mysterious affairs, will not incur the blame of the gods; therefore I am speaking thus to you.

data.v: ब्रवीहि विदुर त्वं मे पुराणं तं सनातनम् । कथमेतेन देहेन स्यादिहैव समागमः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Tell me, O Vidura, how I can with this body of mine meet with that ancient and eternal being in this world.

data.v: चिन्तयामास विदुरस्तमृषिं संशितव्रतम् । स च तच्चिन्तितं ज्ञात्वा दर्शयामास भारत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then did Vidura think of that Rishi of rigid austerities; he, too, becoming aware of that thought showed himself then, O Bharata.

data.v: स चैनं प्रतिजग्राह विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा । सुखोपविष्टं विश्रान्तमथैनं विदुरोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Vidura, too, received him by the rites prescribed by custom; and Vidura addressed him when he (the latter) was seated at his ease and taking rest.

data.v: भगवन्संशयः कश्चिद्धृतराष्ट्रस्य मानसे । यो न शक्यो मया वक्तुं तमस्मै वक्तुमर्हसि । यं श्रुत्वायं मनुष्येन्द्रः सुखदुःखातिगो भवेत् ।।
data.md: O Lord, there is certainly a doubt in the mind of Dhritarashtra, which cannot be removed by me; therefore it is fitting that you should speak to him (and remove the doubt).

data.v: लाभालाभौ प्रियद्वेष्यौ यथैनं न जरान्तकौ । विषहेरन्भयामर्षौ क्षुत्पिपासे मदोद्भवौ । अरतिश्चैव तन्द्री च कामक्रोधौ क्षयोदयौ ।।
data.md: Hearing which (your speech) this chief among men will be past all misery; so that gain and the reverse of gain, what is agreeable and disagreeable, old age and death, fear and jealously, hunger and thirst, pride and prosperity, disinclination for women, sleep, desire, anger, loss and gain may be borne by him (with ease).

data.v: ततो राजा धृतराष्ट्रो मनीषी; संपूज्य वाक्यं विदुरेरितं तत् । सनत्सुजातं रहिते महात्मा; पप्रच्छ बुद्धिं परमां बुभूषन् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then the high-souled and wise king Dhritarashtra, after having supported the speech made by Vidura, questioned SanatSujata in private, desirous of obtaining the highest knowledge.

data.v: सनत्सुजात यदीदं शृणोमि; मृत्युर्हि नास्तीति तवोपदेशम् । देवासुरा ह्याचरन्ब्रह्मचर्य;ममृत्यवे तत्कतरन्नु सत्यम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Sanat-Sujata, I hear that in your opinion, death does not exist. The gods and the Asura however practiced austere asceticism for the sake of immortality, Wish of these is true?

data.v: अमृत्युः कर्मणा केचिन्मृत्युर्नास्तीति चापरे । शृणु मे ब्रुवतो राजन्यथैतन्मा विशङ्किथाः ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said You have asked how death is avoided by certain actions and how it does not exit at all. Listen to me, discoursing on this, and do not be moved by doubts for this (inconsistency).

data.v: उभे सत्ये क्षत्रियाद्यप्रवृत्ते; मोहो मृत्युः संमतो यः कवीनाम् । प्रमादं वै मृत्युमहं ब्रवीमि; सदाप्रमादममृतत्वं ब्रवीमि ।।
data.md: Both of these (statements) are true; know what is the great death in the opinion of the wise. Ignorance is death. In the same way, I say that there is no death where there is no ignorance.

data.v: प्रमादाद्वै असुराः पराभव;न्नप्रमादाद्ब्रह्मभूता भवन्ति । न वै मृत्युर्व्याघ्र इवात्ति जन्तू;न्न ह्यस्य रूपमुपलभ्यते ह ।।
data.md: From ignorance do the Asuras become subject (to death); and from the reverse of ignorance do they attain to the conditions of Brahma. Death does not destroy animals like a tiger; its shape cannot be known.

data.v: यमं त्वेके मृत्युमतोऽन्यमाहु;रात्मावसन्नममृतं ब्रह्मचर्यम् । पितृलोके राज्यमनुशास्ति देवः; शिवः शिवानामशिवोऽशिवानाम् ।।
data.md: Current opinion is that Yama is one sort of Death; the wearing out of the soul is said to be another sort; the pursuit of Brahman or selfknowledge is immortality. The god (Yama) rules the region of the Pitris, conferring blessings on the honest and curses on the dishonest.

data.v: आस्यादेष निःसरते नराणां; क्रोधः प्रमादो मोहरूपश्च मृत्युः । ते मोहितास्तद्वशे वर्तमाना; इतः प्रेतास्तत्र पुनः पतन्ति ।।
data.md: At his command there is death in the form of anger, ignorance and covetousness among men; out of vanity they follow unrighteous paths; and of them attains selfknowledge.

data.v: ततस्तं देवा अनु विप्लवन्ते; अतो मृत्युर्मरणाख्यामुपैति । कर्मोदये कर्मफलानुरागा;स्तत्रानु यान्ति न तरन्ति मृत्युम् ।।
योऽभिध्यायन्नुत्पतिष्णून्निहन्या;दनादरेणाप्रतिबुध्यमानः । स वै मृत्युर्मृत्युरिवात्ति भूत्वा; एवं विद्वान्यो विनिहन्ति कामान् ।।
data.md: some cause He who has succeeded in controlling his soul, having an eye on himself kills (keeps away from) his soaring desires regarding them as not worth having by means of his selfknowledge. The (real) Death assuming the form of death (as known to the people in general) cannot destroy that learned man who controls his desires in this way.

data.v: कामानुसारी पुरुषः कामाननु विनश्यति । कामान्व्युदस्य धुनुते यत्किंचित्पुरुषो रजः ।।
data.md: A man who follows his desires is destroyed soon after the desires (are destroyed). The man, however, who can control his desires can keep away from woes in whatever form they come.

data.v: तमोऽप्रकाशो भूतानां नरकोऽयं प्रदृश्यते । गृह्यन्त इव धावन्ति गच्छन्तः श्वभ्रमुन्मुखाः ।।
data.md: Desire appears to be ignorance, darkness and hell of all creatures (for when they follow desire, they loose all control over their senses). Persons following desire run on like intoxicated men towards the drains and holes of this life.

data.v: अभिध्या वै प्रथमं हन्ति चैनं; कामक्रोधौ गृह्य चैनं तु पश्चात् । एते बालान्मृत्यवे प्रापयन्ति; धीरास्तु धैर्येण तरन्ति मृत्युम् ।।
data.md: The remembrance of earthy enjoyments is the first cause of death to men; afterwards come desire (to have those enjoyments) and anger (at the failure to have enjoyments from or other). These (i.e. the remembrance of enjoyments, desire and anger) cause death to be met with by boys (men of little sense); but those that have successes in controlling their souls cross over death unharmed by means of their self-restraint.

data.v: अमन्यमानः क्षत्रिय किंचिदन्य;न्नाधीयते तार्ण इवास्य व्याघ्रः । क्रोधाल्लोभान्मोहमयान्तरात्मा; स वै मृत्युस्त्वच्छरीरे य एषः ।।
एवं मृत्युं जायमानं विदित्वा; ज्ञाने तिष्ठन्न बिभेतीह मृत्योः । विनश्यते विषये तस्य मृत्यु;र्मृत्योर्यथा विषयं प्राप्य मर्त्यः ।।
data.md: That inner soul exists in your body, wedded to wrath and desire as it is like death; and knowing that death is generated in this way, the person who puts his faith in knowledge is not afraid of death. Death itself is destroyed when it comes under the influence of knowledge, even as earthly beings are destroyed when they come under the influence of death.

data.v: येऽस्मिन्धर्मान्नाचरन्तीह केचि;त्तथा धर्मान्केचिदिहाचरन्ति । धर्मः पापेन प्रतिहन्यते स्म; उताहो धर्मः प्रतिहन्ति पापम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Some there are in this world who practice virtue and some that do not practice virtue but renounce all sorts of actions. (Regarding the former I ask) Is virtue destroyed by unrighteousness or does righteousness destroy virtue?

data.v: उभयमेव तत्रोपभुज्यते फलं; धर्मस्यैवेतरस्य च । धर्मेणाधर्मं प्रणुदतीह विद्वा;न्धर्मो बलीयानिति तस्य विद्धि ।।
data.md: Having acquired both (i.e. the fruits of virtue and vice) which have an end (men of action attains heaven or hell for a limited time only), men of action again come into this world and become attached to actions by reasons of their previous virtue of vice. A wise man neutralizes the effects of his sinful acts by his virtues. Virtue is strong and hence his emancipation.

data.v: यानिमानाहुः स्वस्य धर्मस्य लोका;न्द्विजातीनां पुण्यकृतां सनातनान् । तेषां परिक्रमान्कथयन्तस्ततोऽन्या;न्नैतद्विद्वन्नैव कृतं च कर्म ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said The blessed regions, highly sacred and eternal, to which, it is said, the twice-born can go by the performance of sacrificial ceremonies, are declared by the Vedas of offer emancipation to mortals. Having got this knowledge why should not learned man engage in acts in this world.

data.v: येषां बले न विस्पर्धा बले बलवतामिव । ते ब्राह्मणा इतः प्रेत्य स्वर्गलोके प्रकाशते ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said These Brahmanas, who are proud of their austerities like powerful men of strength, on their exit from the world shine in the eternal regions.

data.v: यत्र मन्येत भूयिष्ठं प्रावृषीव तृणोलपम् । अन्नं पानं च ब्राह्मणस्तज्जीवन्नानुसंज्वरेत् ।।
data.md: Whenever (in whatever family) food and drink fit for a Brahmana abound like grass and reeds in the spots, there should (a Yogi) go for his living and not pain himself (by hunger and thirst).

data.v: यत्राकथयमानस्य प्रयच्छत्यशिवं भयम् । अतिरिक्तमिवाकुर्वन्स श्रेयान्नेतरो जनः ।।
data.md: In a place where there is fear of great danger for not proclamation one's superiority, he who does not do so (speak out his superiority) is worthier than the other (who does).

data.v: यो वाकथयमानस्य आत्मानं नानुसंज्वरेत् । ब्रह्मस्वं नोपभुञ्जेद्वा तदन्नं संमतं सताम् ।।
data.md: He who is not pained by another proclaiming his (the latter) true worth and who eats his food after offering it to the gods, the food offered by such a man is approved by the righteous.

data.v: यथा स्वं वान्तमश्नाति श्वा वै नित्यमभूतये । एवं ते वान्तमश्नन्ति स्ववीर्यस्योपजीवनात् ।।
data.md: As dogs eat up their own vomit to their constant injury, so they who proclaim their own worth eat up their own vomit.

data.v: नित्यमज्ञातचर्या मे इति मन्येत ब्राह्मणः । ज्ञातीनां तु वसन्मध्ये नैव विद्येत किंचन ।।
data.md: That man is to be regarded as a Brahmana whose religious practices remain ever unknown even to the members of his family among whom he lives, wise men also know him to be a Brahmana.

data.v: को ह्येवमन्तरात्मानं ब्राह्मणो हन्तुमर्हति । तस्माद्धि किंचित्क्षत्रिय ब्रह्मावसति पश्यति ।।
data.md: What other Brahmana is worthy to know the supreme soul, that has no form, is without change, is alone and is devoid of all sorts of duality. By the performance of such practices, the supreme soul resides in a Kshatriya too and is seen by him.

data.v: अश्रान्तः स्यादनादानात्संमतो निरुपद्रवः । शिष्टो न शिष्टवत्स स्याद्ब्राह्मणो ब्रह्मवित्कविः ।।
data.md: He who never exerts himself, never accepts gifts from others, who is respected quiet, who though well versed (in the holy books) does not seem to be well versed, is a Brahmana-a wise man knowing Brahman or the Supreme soul.

data.v: अनाढ्या मानुषे वित्ते आढ्या वेदेषु ये द्विजाः । ते दुर्धर्षा दुष्प्रकम्प्या विद्यात्तान्ब्रह्मणस्तनुम् ।।
data.md: Those, who are but poor in what is regarded as wealth by ordinary men, are yet rich in heavenly wealth and in devotion and become hard to vanquish and without fear reside and they become equal to Brahma for their learning.

data.v: सर्वान्स्विष्टकृतो देवान्विद्याद्य इह कश्चन । न समानो ब्राह्मणस्य यस्मिन्प्रयतते स्वयम् ।।
data.md: That man, who in this world having performed all sorts of sacrifices comes to know the gods, cannot be equal to one knowing Brahma; for he (the former) has to exert himself.

data.v: यमप्रयतमानं तु मानयन्ति स मानितः । न मान्यमानो मन्येत नामानादभिसंज्वरेत् ।।
data.md: He, who is honoured (by the gods) without any action, is honoured (like one knowing the true nature of the inner self). If honoured (by others than gods) a man should not think himself really honoured; and he should not be sorry at others not honouring him.

data.v: विद्वांसो मानयन्तीह इति मन्येत मानितः । अधर्मविदुषो मूढा लोकशास्त्रविशारदाः । न मान्यं मानयिष्यन्ति इति मन्येदमानितः ।।
data.md: Those wretches again in this world who are adepts at unrighteousness and at deceit do not respect those that are worthy of respect. On the contrary, they insult those who ought to be respected.

data.v: न वै मानं च मौनं च सहितौ चरतः सदा । अयं हि लोको मानस्य असौ मानस्य तद्विदुः ।।
data.md: The esteem of the world and the vow of silence (holy asceticism) can never dwell together. Know that this (world) is for those who want esteem and the other for those that have observed the vow of silence.

data.v: श्रीः सुखस्येह संवासः सा चापि परिपन्थिनी । ब्राह्मी सुदुर्लभा श्रीर्हि प्रज्ञाहीनेन क्षत्रिय ।।
data.md: In this world, respect resides in worldly prosperity, through it is an impediment to virtue. Heavenly prosperity is not attainable by one that is devoid of (true) wisdom, O Kshatriya.

data.v: द्वाराणि तस्या हि वदन्ति सन्तो; बहुप्रकाराणि दुरावराणि । सत्यार्जवे ह्रीर्दमशौचविद्याः; षण्मानमोहप्रतिबाधनानि ।।
data.md: Virtuous men speak of several doors in this world to heavenly prosperity, which are difficult of being properly watched. The doors are truthfulness, kindness, modesty, selfcontrol and knowledge which are antidotes of ignorance.

data.v: ऋचो यजूंष्यधीते यः सामवेदं च यो द्विजः । पापानि कुर्वन्पापेन लिप्यते न स लिप्यते ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said He who is conversant with the Rig and Yajurvedas and also with the Samaveda, is such a man, having committed sins, guilty thereof?

data.v: नैनं सामान्यृचो वापि न यजूंषि विचक्षण । त्रायन्ते कर्मणः पापान्न ते मिथ्या ब्रवीम्यहम् ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said I speak no falsehood to you when I declare that neither the Sama nor the Yajur nor the Rigvedas do rescue a man, who has no control over his senses, from his sin.

data.v: न छन्दांसि वृजिनात्तारयन्ति; मायाविनं मायया वर्तमानम् । नीडं शकुन्ता इव जातपक्षा;श्छन्दांस्येनं प्रजहत्यन्तकाले ।।
data.md: The hymns of the Veda do not rescue from sin the cheat that lives by deception. Like a bird which has got feathers forsaking its nest, the hymns forsake such a man when his end comes.

data.v: न चेद्वेदा वेदविदं शक्तास्त्रातुं विचक्षण । अथ कस्मात्प्रलापोऽयं ब्राह्मणानां सनातनः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said If the Vedas, without the aid of virtue, are not competent to rescue (men from sins), 0 you, who have control over your senses, then whence is this false and old idea of the Brahmanas (that a knowledge of the Vedas rescues a man from sins)?

data.v: अस्मिँल्लोके तपस्तप्तं फलमन्यत्र दृश्यते । ब्राह्मणानामिमे लोका ऋद्धे तपसि संयताः ।।
data.md: The fruits of asceticism in this world are enjoyed in the other (by those who have not brought their souls under their control); but to those blessed persons engaged in austerities these regions yield fruits.

data.v: कथं समृद्धमप्यृद्धं तपो भवति केवलम् । सनत्सुजात तद्ब्रूहि यथा विद्याम तद्वयम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said How can asceticism which is ever the same be successful now and unsuccessful at another time. O Sanat-Sujata, tell us this that we two may know it.

data.v: क्रोधादयो द्वादश यस्य दोषा;स्तथा नृशंसादि षडत्र राजन् । धर्मादयो द्वादश चाततानाः; शास्त्रे गुणा ये विदिता द्विजानाम् ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said Stained asceticism is that which has for its faults the twelve (vices) with anger at the beginning as also the thirteen descriptions of wickedness, O king. The twelve virtues having righteousness at the beginning which are known to the twice-born are also included in the code of the Pitris.

data.v: क्रोधः कामो लोभमोहौ विवित्सा;कृपासूया मानशोकौ स्पृहा च । ईर्ष्या जुगुप्सा च मनुष्यदोषा; वर्ज्याः सदा द्वादशैते नरेण ।।
data.md: Anger, desire, covetousness, ignorance of right and wrong, discontentment, unkindness, jealousy, vanity, grief, love, of pleasure, envy and a tendency to speak ill of others are the faults of men and these twelve ought ever to be avoided by human beings.

data.v: एकैकमेते राजेन्द्र मनुष्यान्पर्युपासते । लिप्समानोऽन्तरं तेषां मृगाणामिव लुब्धकः ।।
data.md: Each of these by itself by itself can bring about the ruin of mankind, O bull among men; opportunity is awaited by these (vices) like deer by a hunter.

data.v: विकत्थनः स्पृहयालुर्मनस्वी; बिभ्रत्कोपं चपलोऽरक्षणश्च । एते प्राप्ताः षण्नरान्पापधर्मा;न्प्रकुर्वते नोत सन्तः सुदुर्गे ।।
data.md: Speaking ill of others and well of themselves, adopting every means to enjoy the wives of others, vanity, anger, fickleness and not protecting proper persons-these vices wretches of wicked soul commit and do not fear the gravest dangers in this world and in the other.

data.v: संभोगसंविद्द्विषमेधमानो; दत्तानुतापी कृपणोऽबलीयान् । वर्गप्रशंसी वनितासु द्वेष्टा; एतेऽपरे सप्त नृशंसधर्माः ।।
data.md: He who considers enjoyment to be a grand aim of life, he who repents after making a gift, he who is a miser, he who oppresses others, he who is pleased at the misery of others and he who hates his wife-these seven are extremely wicked.

data.v: धर्मश्च सत्यं च दमस्तपश्च; अमात्सर्यं ह्रीस्तितिक्षानसूया । यज्ञश्च दानं च धृतिः श्रुतं च; महाव्रता द्वादश ब्राह्मणस्य ।।
data.md: Righteousness, truthfulness, self-control, asceticism, delight at other's happiness, modesty, forgiveness, reverse of malice performance of sacrificial ceremonies, gifts, patience, learning and vows, these twelve are the attributes of a Brahmana.

data.v: यस्त्वेतेभ्यः प्रवसेद्द्वादशेभ्यः; सर्वामपीमां पृथिवीं प्रशिष्यात् । त्रिभिर्द्वाभ्यामेकतो वा विशिष्टो; नास्य स्वमस्तीति स वेदितव्यः ।।
data.md: He who excels in these twelve is capable over the whole of this earth and he who is graced with these, too or even one of these should be regarded as having gained his object.

data.v: दमस्त्यागोऽप्रमादश्च एतेष्वमृतमाहितम् । तानि सत्यमुखान्याहुर्ब्राह्मणा ये मनीषिणः ।।
data.md: Self-control, renunciation and true knowledge-in these is centered immortality. Those Brahmanas that have great minds are of opinion that truth underlies all these virtues.

data.v: दमोऽष्टादशदोषः स्यात्प्रतिकूलं कृताकृते । अनृतं चाभ्यसूया च कामार्थौ च तथा स्पृहा ।।
क्रोधः शोकस्तथा तृष्णा लोभः पैशुन्यमेव च । मत्सरश्च विवित्सा च परितापस्तथा रतिः ।।
अपस्मारः सातिवादस्तथा संभावनात्मनि । एतैर्विमुक्तो दोषैर्यः स दमः सद्भिरुच्यते ।।
श्रेयांस्तु षड्विधस्त्यागः प्रियं प्राप्य न हृष्यति । अप्रिये तु समुत्पन्ने व्यथां जातु न चार्च्छति ।।
data.md: The six kinds of renunciation are all good, (they are) not delighting at the acquirement of prosperity; the second is the performance of sacrificial ceremonies and pious acts (renouncement of the reverse of these).

data.v: इष्टान्दारांश्च पुत्रांश्च न चान्यं यद्वचो भवेत् । अर्हते याचमानाय प्रदेयं तद्वचो भवेत् । अप्यवाच्यं वदत्येव स तृतीयो गुणः स्मृतः ।।
त्यक्तैर्द्रव्यैर्यो भवति नोपयुङ्क्ते च कामतः । न च कर्मसु तद्धीनः शिष्यबुद्धिर्नरो यथा । सर्वैरेव गुणैर्युक्तो द्रव्यवानपि यो भवेत् ।।
data.md: (The third sort is) that which abandons enjoyments without enjoying them and not that which abandons them after enjoying them to heart's content.

data.v: अप्रमादोऽष्टदोषः स्यात्तान्दोषान्परिवर्जयेत् । इन्द्रियेभ्यश्च पञ्चभ्यो मनसश्चैव भारत । अतीतानागतेभ्यश्च मुक्तो ह्येतैः सुखी भवेत् ।।
data.md: Ignorance of self has eight vices. These vices should be avoided. He who has attained freedom from the five, senses and from desire, O Bharata and from all concern for the past and future becomes happy.

data.v: दोषैरेतैर्विमुक्तं तु गुणैरेतैः समन्वितम् । एतत्समृद्धमप्यृद्धं तपो भवति केवलम् । यन्मां पृच्छसि राजेन्द्र किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Asceticism devoid of these vices and graced with these virtues becomes eminently successful in achieving prosperity.

data.v: आख्यानपञ्चमैर्वेदैर्भूयिष्ठं कथ्यते जनः । तथैवान्ये चतुर्वेदास्त्रिवेदाश्च तथापरे ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said By the fifth Veda, called Akhyana, it is declared that the Supreme Soul is identical with the universe; but there are some that recognize only three.

data.v: द्विवेदाश्चैकवेदाश्च अनृचश्च तथापरे । तेषां तु कतमः स स्याद्यमहं वेद ब्राह्मणम् ।।
data.md: Some again recognize only two Vedas and others only one; while another class recognize only the Supreme Being. Of these, whom am I to regard as really possessing a knowledge of the Supreme Being.

data.v: एकस्य वेदस्याज्ञानाद्वेदास्ते बहवोऽभवन् । सत्यस्यैकस्य राजेन्द्र सत्ये कश्चिदवस्थितः । एवं वेदमनुत्साद्य प्रज्ञां महति कुर्वते ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said Form ignorance of the one that ought to be known, have several Vedas been conceived. There is but one truth, O chief among kings. Who is there, who has attained to that truth?

data.v: दानमध्ययनं यज्ञो लोभादेतत्प्रवर्तते । सत्यात्प्रच्यवमानानां संकल्पो वितथो भवेत् ।।
data.md: Such acquirement of noble qualities constitutes asceticism. These who practice these with patience attain to emancipation.

data.v: ततो यज्ञः प्रतायेत सत्यस्यैवावधारणात् । मनसान्यस्य भवति वाचान्यस्योत कर्मणा । संकल्पसिद्धः पुरुषः संकल्पानधितिष्ठति ।।
data.md: Owing to having understood the nature of truth of which are directed all sacrifices, a certain class of men perform sacrifices by the mind (meditation), another by words (recitation of hymns) and another by actions.

data.v: अनैभृत्येन वै तस्य दीक्षितव्रतमाचरेत् । नामैतद्धातुनिर्वृत्तं सत्यमेव सतां परम् । ज्ञानं वै नाम प्रत्यक्षं परोक्षं जायते तपः ।।
विद्याद्बहु पठन्तं तु बहुपाठीति ब्राह्मणम् । तस्मात्क्षत्रिय मा मंस्था जल्पितेनैव ब्राह्मणम् । य एव सत्यान्नापैति स ज्ञेयो ब्राह्मणस्त्वया ।।
छन्दांसि नाम क्षत्रिय तान्यथर्वा; जगौ पुरस्तादृषिसर्ग एषः । छन्दोविदस्ते य उ तानधीत्य; न वेद्यवेदस्य विदुर्न वेद्यम् ।।
न वेदानां वेदिता कश्चिदस्ति; कश्चिद्वेदान्बुध्यते वापि राजन् । यो वेद वेदान्न स वेद वेद्यं; सत्ये स्थितो यस्तु स वेद वेद्यम् ।।
अभिजानामि ब्राह्मणमाख्यातारं विचक्षणम् । यश्छिन्नविचिकित्सः सन्नाचष्टे सर्वसंशयान् ।।
तस्य पर्येषणं गच्छेत्प्राचीनं नोत दक्षिणम् । नार्वाचीनं कुतस्तिर्यङ्नादिशं तु कथंचन ।।
तूष्णींभूत उपासीत न चेष्टेन्मनसा अपि । अभ्यावर्तेत ब्रह्मास्य अन्तरात्मनि वै श्रितम् ।।
मौनाद्धि स मुनिर्भवति नारण्यवसनान्मुनिः । अक्षरं तत्तु यो वेद स मुनिः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते ।।
सर्वार्थानां व्याकरणाद्वैयाकरण उच्यते । प्रत्यक्षदर्शी लोकानां सर्वदर्शी भवेन्नरः ।।
सत्ये वै ब्राह्मणस्तिष्ठन्ब्रह्म पश्यति क्षत्रिय । वेदानां चानुपूर्व्येण एतद्विद्वन्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: Living a life according to this and doing one by one all that is prescribed in the Vedas, OKshatriya, does a man learn and see Brahma, O learned one, I tell you this.

data.v: सनत्सुजात यदिमां परार्थां; ब्राह्मीं वाचं प्रवदसि विश्वरूपाम् । परां हि कामेषु सुदुर्लभां कथां; तद्ब्रूहि मे वाक्यमेतत्कुमार ।।
नैतद्ब्रह्म त्वरमाणेन लभ्यं; यन्मां पृच्छस्यभिहृष्यस्यतीव । अव्यक्तविद्यामभिधास्ये पुराणीं; बुद्ध्या च तेषां ब्रह्मचर्येण सिद्धाम् ।।
अव्यक्तविद्यामिति यत्सनातनीं; ब्रवीषि त्वं ब्रह्मचर्येण सिद्धाम् । अनारभ्या वसतीहार्य काले; कथं ब्राह्मण्यममृतत्वं लभेत ।।
येऽस्मिँल्लोके विजयन्तीह कामा;न्ब्राह्मीं स्थितिमनुतितिक्षमाणाः । त आत्मानं निर्हरन्तीह देहा;न्मुञ्जादिषीकामिव सत्त्वसंस्थाः ।।
शरीरमेतौ कुरुतः पिता माता च भारत । आचार्यशास्ता या जातिः सा सत्या साजरामरा ।।
आचार्ययोनिमिह ये प्रविश्य; भूत्वा गर्भं ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति । इहैव ते शास्त्रकारा भवन्ति; प्रहाय देहं परमं यान्ति योगम् ।।
य आवृणोत्यवितथेन कर्णा;वृतं कुर्वन्नमृतं संप्रयच्छन् । तं मन्येत पितरं मातरं च; तस्मै न द्रुह्येत्कृतमस्य जानन् ।।
गुरुं शिष्यो नित्यमभिमन्यमानः; स्वाध्यायमिच्छेच्छुचिरप्रमत्तः । मानं न कुर्यान्न दधीत रोष;मेष प्रथमो ब्रह्मचर्यस्य पादः ।।
आचार्यस्य प्रियं कुर्यात्प्राणैरपि धनैरपि । कर्मणा मनसा वाचा द्वितीयः पाद उच्यते ।।
समा गुरौ यथा वृत्तिर्गुरुपत्न्यां तथा भवेत् । यथोक्तकारी प्रियकृत्तृतीयः पाद उच्यते ।।
नाचार्यायेहोपकृत्वा प्रवादं; प्राज्ञः कुर्वीत नैतदहं करोमि । इतीव मन्येत न भाषयेत; स वै चतुर्थो ब्रह्मचर्यस्य पादः ।।
एवं वसन्तं यदुपप्लवेद्धन;माचार्याय तदनुप्रयच्छेत् । सतां वृत्तिं बहुगुणामेवमेति; गुरोः पुत्रे भवति च वृत्तिरेषा ।।
एवं वसन्सर्वतो वर्धतीह; बहून्पुत्राँल्लभते च प्रतिष्ठाम् । वर्षन्ति चास्मै प्रदिशो दिशश्च; वसन्त्यस्मिन्ब्रह्मचर्ये जनाश्च ।।
एतेन ब्रह्मचर्येण देवा देवत्वमाप्नुवन् । ऋषयश्च महाभागा ब्रह्मलोकं मनीषिणः ।।
गन्धर्वाणामनेनैव रूपमप्सरसामभूत् । एतेन ब्रह्मचर्येण सूर्यो अह्नाय जायते ।।
य आशयेत्पाटयेच्चापि राज;न्सर्वं शरीरं तपसा तप्यमानः । एतेनासौ बाल्यमत्येति विद्वा;न्मृत्युं तथा रोधयत्यन्तकाले ।।
अन्तवन्तः क्षत्रिय ते जयन्ति; लोकाञ्जनाः कर्मणा निर्मितेन । ब्रह्मैव विद्वांस्तेन अभ्येति सर्वं; नान्यः पन्था अयनाय विद्यते ।।
आभाति शुक्लमिव लोहितमिव; अथो कृष्णमथाञ्जनं काद्रवं वा । तद्ब्राह्मणः पश्यति योऽत्र विद्वा;न्कथंरूपं तदमृतमक्षरं पदम् ।।
नाभाति शुक्लमिव लोहितमिव; अथो कृष्णमायसमर्कवर्णम् । न पृथिव्यां तिष्ठति नान्तरिक्षे; नैतत्समुद्रे सलिलं बिभर्ति ।।
न तारकासु न च विद्युदाश्रितं; न चाभ्रेषु दृश्यते रूपमस्य । न चापि वायौ न च देवतासु; न तच्चन्द्रे दृश्यते नोत सूर्ये ।।
नैवर्क्षु तन्न यजुःषु नाप्यथर्वसु; न चैव दृश्यत्यमलेषु सामसु । रथंतरे बार्हते चापि राज;न्महाव्रते नैव दृश्येद्ध्रुवं तत् ।।
अपारणीयं तमसः परस्ता;त्तदन्तकोऽप्येति विनाशकाले । अणीयरूपं क्षुरधारया त;न्महच्च रूपं त्वपि पर्वतेभ्यः ।।
सा प्रतिष्ठा तदमृतं लोकास्तद्ब्रह्म तद्यशः । भूतानि जज्ञिरे तस्मात्प्रलयं यान्ति तत्र च ।।
अनामयं तन्महदुद्यतं यशो; वाचो विकारान्कवयो वदन्ति । तस्मिञ्जगत्सर्वमिदं प्रतिष्ठितं; ये तद्विदुरमृतास्ते भवन्ति ।।
data.md: This grand system of philosophy should be taught to those who desire to obtain Brahma; all other systems, are mere tissues of words, which wise men declare. On this philosophy all this universe stands and those who know it become immortal.

data.v: यत्तच्छुक्रं महज्ज्योतिर्दीप्यमानं महद्यशः । तद्वै देवा उपासन्ते यस्मादर्को विराजते । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Sanat-Sujata said That which is the seed (of the universe) blazes with great effulgence and is of great fame. The gods worship him; from him shines the sun; the ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: शुक्राद्ब्रह्म प्रभवति ब्रह्म शुक्रेण वर्धते । तच्छुक्रं ज्योतिषां मध्येऽतप्तं तपति तापनम् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: By reason of the seed is Brahma the Lord; by means of the seed does he develop. That seed communicates heat and light to lightgiving bodies and not getting heat from any other body; yet it is a source of terror to luminous bodies. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: आपोऽथ अद्भ्यः सलिलस्य मध्ये; उभौ देवौ शिश्रियातेऽन्तरिक्षे । स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसाना; उभे बिभर्ति पृथिवीं दिवं च । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: From Brahma spring up the five subtle elements (Mahabhut) which again give birth to the five gross elements which make up the human body; the heart that is in it contains both the gods (the creature-soul and the supreme soul). Ever-wakeful, this sun of the sun upholds both the earth and the sky. Ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: उभौ च देवौ पृथिवीं दिवं च; दिशश्च शुक्रं भुवनं बिभर्ति । तस्माद्दिशः सरितश्च स्रवन्ति; तस्मात्समुद्रा विहिता महान्तः । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: car The seed supports the two gods (the creature-soul and the supreme soul), the earth and the heaven, the cardinal points of the earth and the universe. From that spring up the cardinal point and the latter and from that the vast oceans have originated. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: चक्रे रथस्य तिष्ठन्तं ध्रुवस्याव्ययकर्मणः । केतुमन्तं वहन्त्यश्वास्तं दिव्यमजरं दिवि । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Attached to the wheels to the (representing the acts of past lives) of human body which is uncertain, but the acts of which are ever present; a man of true knowledge is led by the steeds of the senses towards the regions that have no birth and the Being present there. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: न सादृश्ये तिष्ठति रूपमस्य; न चक्षुषा पश्यति कश्चिदेनम् । मनीषयाथो मनसा हृदा च; य एवं विदुरमृतास्ते भवन्ति । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Its form is not similar to that of any other being; no body ever sees it with his eyes; that wise man who knows it by the mind or the heart becomes immortal. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: द्वादशपूगां सरितं देवरक्षितम् । मधु ईशन्तस्तदा संचरन्ति घोरम् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: From Brahma spring up the five subtle elements (Mahabhut) which again give birth to the five gross elements which make up the human body; the heart that is in it contains both the gods (the creature-soul and the supreme soul). Ever-wakeful, this sun of the sun upholds both the earth and the sky. Ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: तदर्धमासं पिबति संचित्य भ्रमरो मधु । ईशानः सर्वभूतेषु हविर्भूतमकल्पयत् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: The being who, like a bee sucking honey only for half the month, enjoys only one-half of the fruits of his actions and has to come back to the world to enjoy the other half and is present in all creatures ordains sacrifices. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: हिरण्यपर्णमश्वत्थमभिपत्य अपक्षकाः । ते तत्र पक्षिणो भूत्वा प्रपतन्ति यथादिशम् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Drinking of the lake (of life) guarded by the gods and bearing fruits and beholding many a dear object in its middle, man disports in the waters, that lake has its origin in the seed. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: पूर्णात्पूर्णान्युद्धरन्ति पूर्णात्पूर्णानि चक्रिरे । हरन्ति पूर्णात्पूर्णानि पूर्णमेवावशिष्यते । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Form that which is complete (Brahma) has the complete universe sprung; and from that which is complete have also the conditions which are complete sprung and when those which are full (conditions) are separated from that which is full (Brahma) the true full remains. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is eternal.

data.v: तस्माद्वै वायुरायातस्तस्मिंश्च प्रयतः सदा । तस्मादग्निश्च सोमश्च तस्मिंश्च प्राण आततः ।।
data.md: It is from that the air has come and towards that again it ever goes; it is from that Agni (consumer) and Some (consumed) have originated and on them depends the entire living world.

data.v: सर्वमेव ततो विद्यात्तत्तद्वक्तुं न शक्नुमः । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: From Brahma spring up the five subtle elements (Mahabhut) which again give birth to the five gross elements which make up the human body; the heart that is in it contains both the gods (the creature-soul and the supreme soul). Ever-wakeful, this sun of the sun upholds both the earth and the sky. Ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: अपानं गिरति प्राणः प्राणं गिरति चन्द्रमाः । आदित्यो गिरते चन्द्रमादित्यं गिरते परः । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Attached to the wheels to the (representing the acts of past lives) of human body which is uncertain, but the acts of which are ever present; a man of true knowledge is led by the steeds of the senses towards the regions that have no birth and the Being present there. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: एकं पादं नोत्क्षिपति सलिलाद्धंस उच्चरन् । तं चेत्सततमृत्विजं न मृत्युर्नामृतं भवेत् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Drinking of the lake (of life) guarded by the gods and bearing fruits and beholding many a dear object in its middle, man disports in the waters, that lake has its origin in the seed. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: एवं देवो महात्मा स पावकं पुरुषो गिरन् । यो वै तं पुरुषं वेद तस्येहात्मा न रिष्यते । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Drinking of the lake (of life) guarded by the gods and bearing fruits and beholding many a dear object in its middle, man disports in the waters, that lake has its origin in the seed. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: यः सहस्रं सहस्राणां पक्षान्संतत्य संपतेत् । मध्यमे मध्य आगच्छेदपि चेत्स्यान्मनोजवः । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Drinking of the lake (of life) guarded by the gods and bearing fruits and beholding many a dear object in its middle, man disports in the waters, that lake has its origin in the seed. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: न दर्शने तिष्ठति रूपमस्य; पश्यन्ति चैनं सुविशुद्धसत्त्वाः । हितो मनीषी मनसाभिपश्ये;द्ये तं श्रयेयुरमृतास्ते भवन्ति । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Attached to the wheels to the (representing the acts of past lives) of human body which is uncertain, but the acts of which are ever present; a man of true knowledge is led by the steeds of the senses towards the regions that have no birth and the Being present there. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: गूहन्ति सर्पा इव गह्वराणि; स्वशिक्षया स्वेन वृत्तेन मर्त्याः । तेषु प्रमुह्यन्ति जना विमूढा; यथाध्वानं मोहयन्ते भयाय । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Some men conceal their habits which are different from their teachings from others, as serpents conceal themselves in their holes. Men who are ignorant are deceived by them, who following the right Path deceive their victims into ruin. Ascetics perceive that Lord who is immortal.

data.v: सदा सदासत्कृतः स्यान्न मृत्युरमृतं कुतः । सत्यानृते सत्यसमानबन्धने; सतश्च योनिरसतश्चैक एव । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: Like a swan walking out of water the eternal one (as embodied in a man) endued with four legs (respectively called waking dreaming, sleeping and) turiya hides one of the legs (turiya, which can be perceived alone by ascetics, all other men perceiving the other three); he who sees this hidden leg for purpose of grinding the other three, regards and emancipation as the same. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: न साधुना नोत असाधुना वा; समानमेतद्दृश्यते मानुषेषु । समानमेतदमृतस्य विद्या;देवंयुक्तो मधु तद्वै परीप्सेत् । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: It is seen equally among men who have obtained true knowledge and those that have not. It is present equally in men that have obtained immortality and others (i.e. those who have not) but the emancipated ones obtain honey flowing in a thick stream. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: नास्यातिवादा हृदयं तापयन्ति; नानधीतं नाहुतमग्निहोत्रम् । मनो ब्राह्मीं लघुतामादधीत; प्रज्ञानमस्य नाम धीरा लभन्ते । योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम् ।।
data.md: To a man of true knowledge, both the worlds are accessible and though they may not have performed the Agnihotra ceremony, yet do they obtain the fruits thereof. Do you not proclaim your deficiency in matters spiritual. True knowledge is another name of the inner soul which those who have self-control gain. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

data.v: एवं यः सर्वभूतेषु आत्मानमनुपश्यति । अन्यत्रान्यत्र युक्तेषु किं स शोचेत्ततः परम् ।।
data.md: The man who thus perceives soul in all creatures, why should he grieve after this perception? Grief comes to those who are employed occupations.

data.v: यथोदपाने महति सर्वतः संप्लुतोदके । एवं सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः ।।
data.md: As one can do as well with a well as with a large tank, so one who knows the supreme should can do as well with his own knowledge as with the entire Veda.

data.v: अङ्गुष्ठमात्रः पुरुषो महात्मा; न दृश्यतेऽसौ हृदये निविष्टः । अजश्चरो दिवारात्रमतन्द्रितश्च; स तं मत्वा कविरास्ते प्रसन्नः ।।
data.md: Of the measure of the thumb, that illustrious Being, though dwelling in the heart, cannot be seen by the eye. Though without birth, he moves about in full consciousness, day and night. He that knows him becomes wise and full of joy.

data.v: अहमेवास्मि वो माता पिता पुत्रोऽस्म्यहं पुनः । आत्माहमपि सर्वस्य यच्च नास्ति यदस्ति च ।।
data.md: According to the Smritis, I am the mother, the father and again I am the son-I am the soul of everything, past and present.

data.v: पितामहोऽस्मि स्थविरः पिता पुत्रश्च भारत । ममैव यूयमात्मस्था न मे यूयं न वोऽप्यहम् ।।
data.md: I am the old grandfather, father and son; O Bharata, you depend on my soul; O Bharata, yet you are not mine.

data.v: आत्मैव स्थानं मम जन्म चात्मा; वेदप्रोक्तोऽहमजरप्रतिष्ठः ।।
data.md: The soul is my place and the soul is my birth, I am both the warp and the woof; I am established on that which is in destructible. Though without birth, I roam about in full consciousness, day and night; knowing me wise men become satisfied.

data.v: अणोरणीयान्सुमनाः सर्वभूतेषु जागृमि । पितरं सर्वभूतानां पुष्करे निहितं विदुः ।।
data.md: The supreme soul is subtler than the subtle, of noble mind and is present in all creatures. He is known as the universal father, dwelling in the heart of every creature,

data.v: एवं सनत्सुजातेन विदुरेण च धीमता । सार्धं कथयतो राज्ञः सा व्यतीयाय शर्वरी ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said In this way discoursing with Sanat-Sujata and wise Vidura, the king passed that night.

data.v: तस्यां रजन्यां व्युष्टायां राजानः सर्व एव ते । सभामाविविशुर्हृष्टाः सूतस्योपदिदृक्षया ।।
data.md: That night having passed away, all the kings entered the Council Chamber with glad hearts with the desire of seeing the Suta.

data.v: शुश्रूषमाणाः पार्थानां वचो धर्मार्थसंहितम् । धृतराष्ट्रमुखाः सर्वे ययू राजसभां शुभाम् ।।
data.md: Desirous of hearing the message of those sons of Pritha, full of virtue and worldly benefit, all with Dhritarashtra at their head went to the blessed Council Chamber.

data.v: सुधावदातां विस्तीर्णां कनकाजिरभूषिताम् । चन्द्रप्रभां सुरुचिरां सिक्तां परमवारिणा ।।
data.md: Of a bright whit and large area and adorned with a golden floor it was beautiful as the moon and wet with sandal water.

data.v: रुचिरैरासनैः स्तीर्णां काञ्चनैर्दारवैरपि । अश्मसारमयैर्दान्तैः स्वास्तीर्णैः सोत्तरच्छदैः ।।
data.md: It was covered over with handsome seats made of gold and of wood and of marble and of ivory, having excellent covers.

data.v: भीष्मो द्रोणः कृपः शल्यः कृतवर्मा जयद्रथः । अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सोमदत्तश्च बाह्लिकः ।।
data.md: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Shalya, Kritavarman, Jayadratha, Ashvathama, Vikarna, Somadatta, Balhika, Vidura of great wisdom and Yuyutsu of great prowess, all these heroes and rulers of the earth, O bull among the race of Bharata, keeping Dhritarashtra in the front entered that blessed Council Chamber.

data.v: विदुरश्च महाप्राज्ञो युयुत्सुश्च महारथः । सर्वे च सहिताः शूराः पार्थिवा भरतर्षभ । धृतराष्ट्रं पुरस्कृत्य विविशुस्तां सभां शुभाम् ।।
data.md: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Shalya, Kritavarman, Jayadratha, Ashvathama, Vikarna, Somadatta, Balhika, Vidura of great wisdom and Yuyutsu of great prowess, all these heroes and rulers of the earth, O bull among the race of Bharata, keeping Dhritarashtra in the front entered that blessed Council Chamber.

data.v: दुःशासनश्चित्रसेनः शकुनिश्चापि सौबलः । दुर्मुखो दुःसहः कर्ण उलूकोऽथ विविंशतिः ।।
data.md: As also did Dushasana, Shakuni and Saubala. Durmukha, Dussaha, Karna, Uluka, Vivingshati having placed Duryodhana, the wrathful king of the Kurus, in the front, entered that Council, O king, like the gods forming the train of Shakra.

data.md: When like a huge lion falling upon battle, with a mace in hand, Bhimasena like a slayer of terrible appearance approaches the son of Dhritarashtra, then will that son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा कृतास्त्रो द्रुपदः प्रचिन्व;ञ्शिरांसि यूनां समरे रथस्थः । क्रुद्धः शरैश्छेत्स्यति चापमुक्तै;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When the young Prabhadrakas having great activity, skilled in battle and having the might equal to that of lions, fell down the sons of Dhritarashtra along with their armies; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा विराटः परवीरघाती; मर्मान्तरे शत्रुचमूं प्रवेष्टा । मत्स्यैः सार्धमनृशंसरूपै;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When he sees the son of Draupadi, the mighty heroes, skillful in the use of weapons and having a knowledge of fighting on cars, darting at the enemies like serpents of quick poison, then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: ज्येष्ठं मात्स्यानामनृशंसरूपं; विराटपुत्रं रथिनं पुरस्तात् । यदा द्रष्टा दंशितं पाण्डवार्थे; तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When the sons of Kuru see the five heroes, children in years but old in acts, desperate of their lives, working havoc among the sons of Kuru; then will the sons of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: रणे हते कौरवाणां प्रवीरे; शिखण्डिना सत्तमे शंतनूजे । न जातु नः शत्रवो धारयेयु;रसंशयं सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ।।
data.md: The virtuous son of Shantanu; that hero among the sons of Kuru, being killed in battle by Shikhandin; then our enemies will undoubtedly perish. I speak this truly.

data.v: यदा शिखण्डी रथिनः प्रचिन्व;न्भीष्मं रथेनाभियाता वरूथी । दिव्यैर्हयैरवमृद्नन्रथौघां;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When Abhimanyu the slayer of heroes on the other side, shoots arrows on the enemies as the clouds pour water-when he, skilled in the weapons like Krishna, overpowers the enemies, then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा द्रष्टा सृञ्जयानामनीके; धृष्टद्युम्नं प्रमुखे रोचमानम् । अस्त्रं यस्मै गुह्यमुवाच धीमा;न्द्रोणस्तदा तप्स्यति धार्तराष्ट्रः ।।
data.md: When he sees, seated in the front ranks of the Srinjayas, effulgent in his splendour, Dhrishtadyumna, whom the wise Drona initiated in to the mysteries of the use of wcapons; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent.

data.v: यदा स सेनापतिरप्रमेयः; पराभवन्निषुभिर्धार्तराष्ट्रान् । द्रोणं रणे शत्रुसहोऽभियाता; तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When Abhimanyu the slayer of heroes on the other side, shoots arrows on the enemies as the clouds pour water-when he, skilled in the weapons like Krishna, overpowers the enemies, then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: ह्रीमान्मनीषी बलवान्मनस्वी; स लक्ष्मीवान्सोमकानां प्रबर्हः । न जातु तं शत्रवोऽन्ये सहेर;न्येषां स स्यादग्रणीर्वृष्णिसिंहः ।।
data.md: No foe can withstand them who have for their leader of the lion of the Vrishni race, that chief of the Somaka tribe, who is modest, wise, powerful, independent, blessed with prosperity.

data.v: ब्रूयाच्च मा प्रवृणीष्वेति लोके; युद्धेऽद्वितीयं सचिवं रथस्थम् । शिनेर्नप्तारं प्रवृणीम सात्यकिं; महाबलं वीतभयं कृतास्त्रम् ।।
data.md: Tell this also (to Duryodhana); Do not desire (the kingdom), we have chosen Satyaki, the guard of Shini for our leader; he is unequaled in battle in this world, a car-warrior of dauntless and powerful might and skilled in the use of weapons,

data.v: यदा शिनीनामधिपो मयोक्तः; शरैः परान्मेघ इव प्रवर्षन् । प्रच्छादयिष्यञ्शरजालेन योधां;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When Drupada, skilled in the use of weapons, from the car down the heads of young warriors in battle; and when, wrathful, he shoots arrows from his bow; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा धृतिं कुरुते योत्स्यमानः; स दीर्घबाहुर्दृढधन्वा महात्मा । सिंहस्येव गन्धमाघ्राय गावः; संवेष्टन्ते शत्रवोऽस्माद्यथाग्नेः ।।
data.md: When that one with long arms and of firm grasp on the bow makes up his mind for fight; then will the foes before the battle act like cattle who have got scent of a lion.

data.v: स दीर्घबाहुर्दृढधन्वा महात्मा; भिन्द्याद्गिरीन्संहरेत्सर्वलोकान् । अस्त्रे कृती निपुणः क्षिप्रहस्तो; दिवि स्थितः सूर्य इवाभिभाति ।।
data.md: He, of long arms of firm grasp on the bow and of a large fond, can pierce the mountain and destroy the whole world. Acquainted with the use of weapons, skillful and of an agile, hand, he shores like the sun in the sky.

data.v: चित्रः सूक्ष्मः सुकृतो यादवस्य; अस्त्रे योगो वृष्णिसिंहस्य भूयान् । यथाविधं योगमाहुः प्रशस्तं; सर्वैर्गुणैः सात्यकिस्तैरुपेतः ।।
data.md: The lion of the Vrishni race, that descendant of Yadu of superior training, has many delicate and wonderful weapons. Satyaki has competent knowledge of the use of excellent arms; and he is endued with all the good qualities that are said to be good.

data.v: हिरण्मयं श्वेतहयैश्चतुर्भि;र्यदा युक्तं स्यन्दनं माधवस्य । द्रष्टा युद्धे सात्यकेर्वै सुयोधन;स्तदा तप्स्यत्यकृतात्मा स मन्दः ।।
data.md: When he sees the golden car of Satyaki, the descendant of Madhu with four white horses; then that foolish son of Dhritarashtra with a soul addicted to vices repent for the war.

data.v: यदा रथं हेममणिप्रकाशं; श्वेताश्वयुक्तं वानरकेतुमुग्रम् । द्रष्टा रणे संयतं केशवेन; तदा तप्स्यत्यकृतात्मा स मन्दः ।।
data.md: When also he sees my terrible car, guided by Keshava, shining with gold and precious stones, with white horses and with a banner having the figure of a monkey; then will that vicious-souled fool repent.

data.v: यदा मौर्व्यास्तलनिष्पेषमुग्रं; महाशब्दं वज्रनिष्पेषतुल्यम् । विधूयमानस्य महारणे मया; गाण्डीवस्य श्रोष्यति मन्दबुद्धिः ।।
data.md: When that fool hears the fierce twanging sound produced by the contact of the leather covering fingers with the string of the bow, resembling the roaring of thunder and the great battle field covered with smoke by my Gandiva bow; then will the foolish son of Dhritarashtra of weak intellect repent on seeing himself helpless, his soldiers destroyed in the darkness produced by the raining of arrows like herds of cows, before the actual fighting commences.

data.v: तदा मूढो धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्र;स्तप्ता युद्धे दुर्मतिर्दुःसहायः । दृष्ट्वा सैन्यं बाणवर्षान्धकारं; प्रभज्यन्तं गोकुलवद्रणाग्रे ।।
बलाहकादुच्चरन्तीव विद्यु;त्सहस्रघ्नी द्विषतां संगमेषु । अस्थिच्छिदो मर्मभिदो वमेच्छरां;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
यदा द्रष्टा ज्यामुखाद्बाणसंघा;न्गाण्डीवमुक्तान्पततः शिताग्रान् । नागान्हयान्वर्मिणश्चाददानां;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When the ruler of the Shinis, the slayer of foes directed by me, will shower volleys of arrows on the enemy, as the clouds do (the rain) and completely cover them then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा मन्दः परबाणान्विमुक्ता;न्ममेषुभिर्ह्रियमाणान्प्रतीपम् । तिर्यग्विद्वांश्छिद्यमानान्क्षुरप्रै;स्तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When Drupada, skilled in the use of weapons, from the car down the heads of young warriors in battle; and when, wrathful, he shoots arrows from his bow; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा विपाठा मद्भुजविप्रमुक्ता; द्विजाः फलानीव महीरुहाग्रात् । प्रच्छेत्तार उत्तमाङ्गानि यूनां; तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When Drupada, skilled in the use of weapons, from the car down the heads of young warriors in battle; and when, wrathful, he shoots arrows from his bow; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: यदा द्रष्टा पततः स्यन्दनेभ्यो; महागजेभ्योऽश्वगतांश्च योधान् । शरैर्हतान्पातितांश्चैव रङ्गे; तदा युद्धं धार्तराष्ट्रोऽन्वतप्स्यत् ।।
data.md: When he sees the son of Draupadi, the mighty heroes, skillful in the use of weapons and having a knowledge of fighting on cars, darting at the enemies like serpents of quick poison, then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: पदातिसंघान्रथसंघान्समन्ता;द्व्यात्ताननः काल इवाततेषुः । प्रणोत्स्यामि ज्वलितैर्बाणवर्षैः; शत्रूंस्तदा तप्स्यति मन्दबुद्धिः ।।
data.md: When I shall fell down by pouring down burning arrows the enemies and their hosts of infantry and car-warriors in all directions like death with his mouth open, then will that man of weak intellect repent for the war.

data.v: सर्वा दिशः संपतता रथेन; रजोध्वस्तं गाण्डिवेनापकृत्तम् । यदा द्रष्टा स्वबलं संप्रमूढं; तदा पश्चात्तप्स्यति मन्दबुद्धिः ।।
data.md: When he sees his own army covered by the dust of my chariot going in all sides cut down by my Gandiva and rendered senseiess; then will that man of weak intellect repent.

data.v: कांदिग्भूतं छिन्नगात्रं विसंज्ञं; दुर्योधनो द्रक्ष्यति सर्वसैन्यम् । हताश्ववीराग्र्यनरेन्द्रनागं; पिपासितं श्रान्तपत्रं भयार्तम् ।।
data.md: When Duryodhana sees all his soldiers overpowered and runring away all sides with their bodies cut open, senseless and his horses, commanders rulers killed, his army thirsty, struck with fear, crying piteously for help, dead and dying, with their animals rendered faint and hair, bones and heads strewn about as if they were really the work of the Lord of creatures; then will that man of weak intellect repent.

data.v: आर्तस्वरं हन्यमानं हतं च; विकीर्णकेशास्थिकपालसंघम् । प्रजापतेः कर्म यथार्धनिष्ठितं; तदा दृष्ट्वा तप्स्यते मन्दबुद्धिः ।।
data.md: When Duryodhana sees all his soldiers overpowered and runring away all sides with their bodies cut open, senseless and his horses, commanders rulers killed, his army thirsty, struck with fear, crying piteously for help, dead and dying, with their animals rendered faint and hair, bones and heads strewn about as if they were really the work of the Lord of creatures; then will that man of weak intellect repent.

data.v: यदा रथे गाण्डिवं वासुदेवं; दिव्यं शङ्खं पाञ्चजन्यं हयांश्च । तूणावक्षय्यौ देवदत्तं च मां च; द्रष्टा युद्धे धार्तराष्ट्रः समेतान् ।।
data.md: When he sees in the chariot, the Gandiva bow, Vasudeva, the heavenly conch Panchajanya, my horses, the two arrow-holders which are never emptied, Devadatta and myself; then will the son of Dhritarashtra repent for the war.

data.v: उद्वर्तयन्दस्युसंघान्समेता;न्प्रवर्तयन्युगमन्यद्युगान्ते । यदा धक्ष्याम्यग्निवत्कौरवेयां;स्तदा तप्ता धृतराष्ट्रः सपुत्रः ।।
data.md: When I shall burn the sons of Kuru like the god of fire burning at the time of bringing in this world a Yoga, at the end of another a large number of wicked souls, then will Dhritarashtra with his sons repent for the war.

data.v: सहभ्राता सहपुत्रः ससैन्यो; भ्रष्टैश्वर्यः क्रोधवशोऽल्पचेताः । दर्पस्यान्ते विहिते वेपमानः; पश्चान्मन्दस्तप्स्यति धार्तराष्ट्रः ।।
data.md: The son of Dhritarashtra, wrathful and of wicked heart, having lost his property along with his brothers, his soldiers and his dependents, at the end of the period of pride, trembling will afterwards repent.

data.v: पूर्वाह्णे मां कृतजप्यं कदाचि;द्विप्रः प्रोवाचोदकान्ते मनोज्ञम् । कर्तव्यं ते दुष्करं कर्म पार्थ; योद्धव्यं ते शत्रुभिः सव्यसाचिन् ।।
data.md: One day before this when I had finished my prayers a certain Brahmana said to me, after my getting up from the water, these pleasing words-A difficult task will have to be performed by you, O son of Pritha, O Savyasachin, you will have to fight with your enemies.

data.v: इन्द्रो वा ते हरिवान्वज्रहस्तः; पुरस्ताद्यातु समरेऽरीन्विनिघ्नन् । सुग्रीवयुक्तेन रथेन वा ते; पश्चात्कृष्णो रक्षतु वासुदेवः ।।
data.md: Either Indra on his steed, thunderbolt in his hand will go before you in battle, killing your enemies or mounted on a chariot with Sugriva (name of horse) and other steeds Krishna, the son of Vasudeva will protect you from behind.

data.v: वव्रे चाहं वज्रहस्तान्महेन्द्रा;दस्मिन्युद्धे वासुदेवं सहायम् । स मे लब्धो दस्युवधाय कृष्णो; मन्ये चैतद्विहितं दैवतैर्मे ।।
data.md: In this war, have I preferred the help of Vasudeva to Indra with the thunderbolt in his hand. That Krishna has come over to my side for the purpose of slaying these wicked men. This I consider has been ordained by the gods.

data.v: अयुध्यमानो मनसापि यस्य; जयं कृष्णः पुरुषस्याभिनन्देत् । ध्रुवं सर्वान्सोऽभ्यतीयादमित्रा;न्सेन्द्रान्देवान्मानुषे नास्ति चिन्ता ।।
data.md: That man whose victory is merely desired by Krishna, even if the latter does not fight, is sure to triumph over all enemies though they be the gods themselves with Indra. If they are men, there is no anxiety.

data.v: स बाहुभ्यां सागरमुत्तितीर्षे;न्महोदधिं सलिलस्याप्रमेयम् । तेजस्विनं कृष्णमत्यन्तशूरं; युद्धेन यो वासुदेवं जिगीषेत् ।।
data.md: That man is desirous of crossing the ocean of vast expanse and unfathomable waters, with his two arms, who is desirous of vanquishing in fight the exceedingly heroic Krishna, the son of Vasudeva, of great prowess.

data.v: गिरिं य इच्छेत तलेन भेत्तुं; शिलोच्चयं श्वेतमतिप्रमाणम् । तस्यैव पाणिः सनखो विशीर्ये;न्न चापि किंचित्स गिरेस्तु कुर्यात् ।।
data.md: He, who desires to pierce by the palm of his hand the high white mountain of huge dimensions, has his hand with his nails only wasted away; and absolutely no harm is done to the mountain.

data.v: अग्निं समिद्धं शमयेद्भुजाभ्यां; चन्द्रं च सूर्यं च निवारयेत । हरेद्देवानाममृतं प्रसह्य; युद्धेन यो वासुदेवं जिगीषेत् ।।
data.md: He who aspires to vanquish the son of Vasudeva after encountering him in battle, would rob the gods of nectar by force and with his two hands would put out a blazing fire and stop the Sun and the Moon in their course.

data.v: यो रुक्मिणीमेकरथेन भोज्या;मुत्साद्य राज्ञां विषयं प्रसह्य । उवाह भार्यां यशसा ज्वलन्तीं; यस्यां जज्ञे रौक्मिणेयो महात्मा ।।
data.md: That Krishna, who alone in his chariot having encountered in battle vanquished the army of the king of the Bhojas, married Rukmini of great fame and effulgence; in her was born the high-souled Pradyumna.

data.v: अयं गान्धारांस्तरसा संप्रमथ्य; जित्वा पुत्रान्नग्नजितः समग्रान् । बद्धं मुमोच विनदन्तं प्रसह्य; सुदर्शनीयं देवतानां ललामम् ।।
data.md: This favorite of the gods, who had speedily vanquished the Gandharvas and conquered all the sons of Nagnajita by sheer force, liberated the imprisoned Sudarshana of great power.

data.v: अयं कवाटे निजघान पाण्ड्यं; तथा कलिङ्गान्दन्तकूरे ममर्द । अनेन दग्धा वर्षपूगान्विनाथा; वाराणसी नगरी संबभूव ।।
data.md: He by striking his breast slew the king of Pandya and vanquished the Kalingas in battle; burnt by the city of Varanasi for series of years remained without a lord.

data.v: यं स्म युद्धे मन्यतेऽन्यैरजेय;मेकलव्यं नाम निषादराजम् । वेगेनेव शैलमभिहत्य जम्भः; शेते स कृष्णेन हतः परासुः ।।
data.md: He was challenged by the king of Nishadas, named Ekalavya, who was incapable of being vanquished by others; but he being struck with force by Krishna lay dead smashed on the hillock like Jambha.

data.md: Then did he, having Baladeva as his coadjutor, fell down the extremely wicked son of Baladeva who was seated in court amidst the Vrishnis and Andhakas and then bestowed the kingdom on Ugrasena.

data.md: He fought with the terrible king Shalva, the lord of Saubha, without being beside himself (through fear) in consequence of his power of producing effect; and near the gate of Saubha caught hold of Shataghni with his hand; what being on this earth can withstand him in fight?

data.v: प्राग्ज्योतिषं नाम बभूव दुर्गं; पुरं घोरमसुराणामसह्यम् । महाबलो नरकस्तत्र भौमो; जहारादित्या मणिकुण्डले शुभे ।।
data.md: There was fastness of the Asuras, terrible and impenetrable, named Pragjyotisha. There Naraka, son of the Earth of great strength stole the beautiful earrings of Aditi bedecked with gems and kept them.

data.md: And knowing his nature, they employed Krishna far slaying that wicked being. And Vasudeva undertook (endued with all kinds of prosperity), the accomplishment of that difficult task.

data.md: Having slain six thousand near the city of Nirmochana and having broken sharp-edged arrows suddenly coming on him, having killed Mura and also having killed crowds of Rakshasas, that hero went into the city of Nirmochana.

data.md: There did take place a battle between him (Naraka) possessed of great strength and this Vishnu also endued with great strength. And he lay killed by Krishna like a Karnikara tree uprooted by a gale.

data.md: Having killed Naraka, the son of the earth and Mura and taking back that pair of earrings bedecked with gems, the learned one endued with prosperity and fame and of unparalled proves came back.

data.md: To him the gods seeing the terrible tasks done in that battle granted boons there, saying-“When you are fighting, you will not have fatigue and there shall be no impediment in your way either in the sky or below the waters.

data.md: The son of Dhritarashtra aspires to vanquish this Vishnu, who cannot be withstood in fight and who is of endless strength; and that one of wicked soul is ever trying to imprison him. This Krishna however endures even this for our sake.

data.md: Having paid due respects to the son of Shantanu and also the king Drona with his son and also to the son of Sharadvata and being desirous of getting back the kingdom, shall I oppose them in battle.

data.v: धर्मेणास्त्रं नियतं तस्य मन्ये; यो योत्स्यते पाण्डवैर्धर्मचारी । मिथ्याग्लहे निर्जिता वै नृशंसैः; संवत्सरान्द्वादश पाण्डुपुत्राः ।।
data.md: That man of wicked intelligence fights with the Pandavas. I shall regard this death as being justly got. Conquered by deceit at the game of dice by those inhuman ones, we ourselves, the sons of a king, for twelve long years.

data.md: If the effects of a man's actions redound on him; and if we be superior to him, as I think we are, I hope that with the son of Vasudeva as my coadjutor, I shall kill Duryodhana with all his assistants.

data.md: This act, O chief of me, (sending us into exile and themselves possessing our kingdom) cannot but be wicked; and all our good deeds cannot be totally devoid of good fruits. Having considered this as well as that (I think that) the defeat of the son of Dhritarashtra is certain.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं वः कुरवो यद्ब्रवीमि; युध्यमाना धार्तराष्ट्रा न सन्ति । अन्यत्र युद्धात्कुरवः परीप्स;न्न युध्यतां शेष इहास्ति कश्चित् ।।
data.md: You will yourselves be witnesses, O son of Kuru, to (the events) I prophesy; the sons of Dhritarashtra will cease to exist, if they fight. If they do not fight, then they may live; but in a fight with us, none of them will be alive.

data.v: हत्वा त्वहं धार्तराष्ट्रान्सकर्णा;न्राज्यं कुरूणामवजेता समग्रम् । यद्वः कार्यं तत्कुरुध्वं यथास्व;मिष्टान्दारानात्मजांश्चोपभुङ्क्त ।।
data.md: Having killed the sons of Dhritarashtra along with Karna, I shall take the whole of the kingdom from the sons of Kúru. (In the mean time) do whatever work you may have and enjoy yourselves and your wives and everything sweet.

data.md: I, too, who have not lost my senses see all these events of the future by my foresight. My power of vision into the future) acquired a long time ago does not pain me. I see clearly that the sons of Dhritarashtra fighting shall cease to exist.

data.md: Bringing all my powers and by the aid of my work of destruction, shall I fling these weapons and leave no trace of those that come to the field; and then shall I obtain rest. Such a state of rest is excellent. This is my determination. Tell them this, O son of Gavalgani.

data.v: नित्यं पुनः सचिवैर्यैरवोच;द्देवानपीन्द्रप्रमुखान्सहायान् । तैर्मन्यते कलहं संप्रयुज्य; स धार्तराष्ट्रः पश्यत मोहमस्य ।।
data.md: Those who are victors in battle even with the entire body of gods headed by Indra, O Suta-the son of Dhritarashtra thinks that in a battle with them, he will be the victor. Look at his folly.

data.md: The aged Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, Kripa, Drona with his son and the wise Vidura, what all these say, let that be. May all the sons of Kuru attain to old age.

data.md: (Once on a time) Brihaspati along with Shakra went to Brahma, as also did thc Maruta with Indra and the Vasus with Agni.

data.md: The Adityas, the Sadhyas, the seven heavenly Rishis, the Vishvavasu, the Gandharvas and beautiful cluster of the Apsaras.

data.md: As if attracting unto themselves by their own energy the intellects and energies of them all, the two ancient Rishis, Nara and Narayana, departed.

data.v: बृहस्पतिश्च पप्रच्छ ब्राह्मणं काविमाविति । भवन्तं नोपतिष्ठेते तौ नः शंस पितामह ।।

data.md: Brahma said These two ascetics blazing, as it were with beauty and illuminating the earth and heaven and possessed of great energy went away.

data.v: नरनारायणावेतौ लोकाल्लोकं समास्थितौ । ऊर्जितौ स्वेन तपसा महासत्त्वपराक्रमौ ।।
data.md: They are Nara and Narayana who have just come from the earth and are at present staying in these regions. With the fruits of their own asceticism they are resplendent and are possessed of great energy and prowess.

data.v: एतौ हि कर्मणा लोकान्नन्दयामासतुर्ध्रुवौ । असुराणामभावाय देवगन्धर्वपूजितौ ।।
data.md: These two by their acts ever bring rejoicing to the words; they worshipped by the gods and the Gandharvas live for the destruction of the Asuras.

data.md: Beautiful, independent, endued with prosperity and with the force of Brahma, intelligent, of great wisdom and of virtuous soul, is that son of Pandu (Yudhishthira).

धृत्या च पुरुषव्याघ्रो नैभृत्येन च पाण्डवः । अनृशंसो वदान्यश्च ह्रीमान्सत्यपराक्रमः ।।
बहुश्रुतः कृतात्मा च वृद्धसेवी जितेन्द्रियः । तं सर्वगुणसंपन्नं समिद्धमिव पावकम् ।।
तपन्तमिव को मन्दः पतिष्यति पतंगवत् । पाण्डवाग्निमनावार्यं मुमूर्षुर्मूढचेतनः ।।
data.md: What fool, about to die and who has lost his consciousness is there who will fall into the inextinguishable fire of the Pandavas ablaze like a moth.

data.v: तनुरुच्चः शिखी राजा शुद्धजाम्बूनदप्रभः । मन्दानां मम पुत्राणां युद्धेनान्तं करिष्यति ।।
data.md: That king resembling a fire of high and long flames has been treated deceitfully by me and he will, in battle, put an end to the existence of all my sons of weak intellect.

data.v: तैरयुद्धं साधु मन्ये कुरवस्तन्निबोधत । युद्धे विनाशः कृत्स्नस्य कुलस्य भविता ध्रुवम् ।।
data.md: I consider that it is best not to fight with them; you, Kurus, follow that (my opinion). If you wage war, destruction will surely overtake the race which will be extinct.

data.v: एषा मे परमा शान्तिर्यया शाम्यति मे मनः । यदि त्वयुद्धमिष्टं वो वयं शान्त्यै यतामहे ।।
data.md: This appears to me very clear and by acting in accordance with it my mind will obtain peace. If you consider that peace with them is desirable, then we shall try for peace.

data.v: न तु नः शिक्षमाणानामुपेक्षेत युधिष्ठिरः । जुगुप्सति ह्यधर्मेण मामेवोद्दिश्य कारणम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira will never adopt an attitude of indifference towards ourselves, when distressed; he blames me by ascribing unrighteousness, thinking me to be the cause (of the war).

data.v: एवमेतन्महाराज यथा वदसि भारत । युद्धे विनाशः क्षत्रस्य गाण्डीवेन प्रदृश्यते ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said It is, O great king, as you say, O Bharata. The destruction of the Kshatriya by war with the Gandiva bow seems apparent.

data.v: इदं तु नाभिजानामि तव धीरस्य नित्यशः । यत्पुत्रवशमागच्छेः सत्त्वज्ञः सव्यसाचिनः ।।
data.md: I do not know how it is that you, who are ever wise and know about the attributes of Savyasachin, allow yourself to be controlled by your sons.

data.v: नैष कालो महाराज तव शश्वत्कृतागसः । त्वया ह्येवादितः पार्था निकृता भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: This is not the time, O great king, (to give way to grief); for you have repeatedly wronged them. By you in the beginning were the Parthas cxiled, O bull among the race of Bharata.

data.v: पिता श्रेष्ठः सुहृद्यश्च सम्यक्प्रणिहितात्मवान् । आस्थेयं हि हितं तेन न द्रोग्धा गुरुरुच्यते ।।
data.md: A father is the best friend and he should guide well those who are his own selves. Their welfare should be sought after carefully; but he who overlooks this duty, cannot be called a superior.

data.v: इदं जितमिदं लब्धमिति श्रुत्वा पराजितान् । द्यूतकाले महाराज स्मयसे स्म कुमारवत् ।।
data.md: Hearing of the defeat (at the game), like a boy you laughed out, O great king, saying-"this is gained, this is won”.

data.v: परुषाण्युच्यमानान्स्म पुरा पार्थानुपेक्षसे । कृत्स्नं राज्यं जयन्तीति प्रपातं नानुपश्यसि ।।
data.md: Formerly you neglected the Parthas, who were being addressed in hashed words thinking that the kingdom had been acquired (by your sons). You did not then foresee this fall.

data.v: पित्र्यं राज्यं महाराज कुरवस्ते सजाङ्गलाः । अथ वीरैर्जितां भूमिमखिलां प्रत्यपद्यथाः ।।
data.md: The country of the Kurus, with Jangala, O great king, is your ancestral kingdom; but you have possessed yourself the entire kingdom subjugated by the heroes.

data.v: बाहुवीर्यार्जिता भूमिस्तव पार्थैर्निवेदिता । मयेदं कृतमित्येव मन्यसे राजसत्तम ।।
data.md: The kingdom acquired by their arms and prowess was made over to you by the Parthas and you think, "it has been acquired by me," O best of kings.

data.v: ग्रस्तान्गन्धर्वराजेन मज्जतो ह्यप्लवेऽम्भसि । आनिनाय पुनः पार्थः पुत्रांस्ते राजसत्तम ।।
data.md: Your sons, O best of kings, overpowered by the king of the Gandharvas and thus sinking as it were in a scoreless open, were brought back by Partha.

data.v: कुमारवच्च स्मयसे द्यूते विनिकृतेषु यत् । पाण्डवेषु वनं राजन्प्रव्रजत्सु पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: Like a boy, too, did you repeatedly laugh at the defeat (of the Pandavas) at dice and also when they were wandering about being exiled.

data.v: प्रवर्षतः शरव्रातानर्जुनस्य शितान्बहून् । अप्यर्णवा विशुष्येयुः किं पुनर्मांसयोनयः ।।
data.md: At the shower, by Arjuna, of a great many sharp edged arrows, even the oceans dry up, not to speak of those things, that owe their origin to flesh.

data.v: अस्यतां फल्गुनः श्रेष्ठो गाण्डीवं धनुषां वरम् । केशवः सर्वभूतानां चक्राणां च सुदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: Among the shooters of arrows, the son of Falguna is the chief, among the bows the Gandiva is the best; Keshava is the chief of all creatures, and the Sudarshana among weapons.

data.v: वानरो रोचमानश्च केतुः केतुमतां वरः । एवमेतानि सरथो वहञ्श्वेतहयो रणे । क्षपयिष्यति नो राजन्कालचक्रमिवोद्यतम् ।।
data.md: Of all things having banners the one shining with the banner and having the device of an ape (is the foremost). The car, having all these and having many white horses in battle.

data.v: तस्याद्य वसुधा राजन्निखिला भरतर्षभ । यस्य भीमार्जुनौ योधौ स राजा राजसत्तम ।।
तथा भीमहतप्रायां मज्जन्तीं तव वाहिनीम् । दुर्योधनमुखा दृष्ट्वा क्षयं यास्यन्ति कौरवाः ।।
न हि भीमभयाद्भीता लप्स्यन्ते विजयं विभो । तव पुत्रा महाराज राजानश्चानुसारिणः ।।
मत्स्यास्त्वामद्य नार्चन्ति पाञ्चालाश्च सकेकयाः । शाल्वेयाः शूरसेनाश्च सर्वे त्वामवजानते । पार्थं ह्येते गताः सर्वे वीर्यज्ञास्तस्य धीमतः ।।
data.md: By your son, O great king or by the kings who are his followers. The king of the Matsyas does not pay you homage now; nor does the Panchala with the Kaikeyas; nor do the Shalvas and the Shurasenas. All disregard you. All of them have gone over to the side of Partha, well knowing the heroism of that wise one.

data.v: अनर्हानेव तु वधे धर्मयुक्तान्विकर्मणा । सर्वोपायैर्नियन्तव्यः सानुगः पापपूरुषः । तव पुत्रो महाराज नात्र शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: Out of regard for him, they are ever against your sons. He who troubles the sons of Pandu endued with virtue and undeserving of injury by unworthy actions and he who despises them even now, that evil-minded man, along with his followers, should be checked by all means.

data.v: द्यूतकाले मया चोक्तं विदुरेण च धीमता । यदिदं ते विलपितं पाण्डवान्प्रति भारत । अनीशेनेव राजेन्द्र सर्वमेतन्निरर्थकम् ।।
data.md: All these lamentations of yours for the sons of Pandu, O Bharata, as if you had no hand in the matter, are all useless, O chief among kings.

data.v: न भेतव्यं महाराज न शोच्या भवता वयम् । समर्थाः स्म परान्राजन्विजेतुं समरे विभो ।।
data.md: Duryodhana said There is nothing to fear, O great king; nor should you grieve for us. We are capable, O king, of winning victory over our battle, O king.

data.v: वनं प्रव्राजितान्पार्थान्यदायान्मधुसूदनः । महता बलचक्रेण परराष्ट्रावमर्दिना ।।
data.md: When the slayer of Madhu came to the sons of Pritha wandering in exile in the forest with a large army capable of subjugating the kingdom of the enemies and when Kaikeya, Dhrishtaketu, Dhrishtadyumna of the race of Prishata and many other kings followed them to the sons of Pritha.

data.v: केकया धृष्टकेतुश्च धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः । राजानश्चान्वयुः पार्थान्बहवोऽन्येऽनुयायिनः ।।
data.md: When the slayer of Madhu came to the sons of Pritha wandering in exile in the forest with a large army capable of subjugating the kingdom of the enemies and when Kaikeya, Dhrishtaketu, Dhrishtadyumna of the race of Prishata and many other kings followed them to the sons of Pritha.

data.v: इन्द्रप्रस्थस्य चादूरात्समाजग्मुर्महारथाः । व्यगर्हयंश्च संगम्य भवन्तं कुरुभिः सह ।।
data.md: And when not far from Indraprastha there assembled together the car-warriors and having joined together, they blamed you along with the Kurus.

data.v: ते युधिष्ठिरमासीनमजिनैः प्रतिवासितम् । कृष्णप्रधानाः संहत्य पर्युपासन्त भारत ।।
data.md: And when they, with Krishna at their head, paid homage to Yudhishthira, who was wearing deer skin, O Bharata, and when the rulers of men spoke of giving back the duties of a king (to Yudhishthira) and they longed to bring about the overthrow of yourself with all your followers.

data.v: प्रत्यादानं च राज्यस्य कार्यमूचुर्नराधिपाः । भवतः सानुबन्धस्य समुच्छेदं चिकीर्षवः ।।
data.md: And when they, with Krishna at their head, paid homage to Yudhishthira, who was wearing deer skin, O Bharata, and when the rulers of men spoke of giving back the duties of a king (to Yudhishthira) and they longed to bring about the overthrow of yourself with all your followers.

data.v: श्रुत्वा चैतन्मयोक्तास्तु भीष्मद्रोणकृपास्तदा । ज्ञातिक्षयभयाद्राजन्भीतेन भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: Then were Bhishma, Drona and Kripa thus addressed by me, who heard this, through fear of the ruin of our cousins, Oking, "That the sons of Pandu will abide by the terms agreed to, is my opinion; our destruction does the son of Vasudeva desire.

data.v: न ते स्थास्यन्ति समये पाण्डवा इति मे मतिः । समुच्छेदं हि नः कृत्स्नं वासुदेवश्चिकीर्षति ।।
data.md: Then were Bhishma, Drona and Kripa thus addressed by me, who heard this, through fear of the ruin of our cousins, Oking, "That the sons of Pandu will abide by the terms agreed to, is my opinion; our destruction does the son of Vasudeva desire.

data.v: ऋते च विदुरं सर्वे यूयं वध्या महात्मनः । धृतराष्ट्रश्च धर्मज्ञो न वध्यः कुरुसत्तमः ।।
data.md: That with the exception of Vidura, will you be slain, is my opinion; and Dhritarashtra, who knows the nature of virtue-that best one among the Kurus cannot possibly be slain.

data.v: समुच्छेदं च कृत्स्नं नः कृत्वा तात जनार्दनः । एकराज्यं कुरूणां स्म चिकीर्षति युधिष्ठिरे ।।
data.md: O dear, having effected our extinction, Janardana desires to bestow on Yudhishthira the entire kingdom of the Kurus.

data.v: तत्र किं प्राप्तकालं नः प्रणिपातः पलायनम् । प्राणान्वा संपरित्यज्य प्रतियुध्यामहे परान् ।।
data.md: When the time comes, what should we do? Surrender or fly or shall we fight against the enemies and give up (all hopes of) our lives.

data.v: प्रतियुद्धे तु नियतः स्यादस्माकं पराजयः । युधिष्ठिरस्य सर्वे हि पार्थिवा वशवर्तिनः ।।
data.md: In a fight against them, defeat shall surely be ours; all the rulers are on the side of Yudhishthira.

data.v: विरक्तराष्ट्राश्च वयं मित्राणि कुपितानि नः । धिक्कृताः पार्थिवैः सर्वैः स्वजनेन च सर्वशः ।।
data.md: On their being dispossessed of their kingdom, our friends are angry with us; and we are reviled by all the kings and by all our kinsmen.

data.v: प्रणिपाते तु दोषोऽस्ति बन्धूनां शाश्वतीः समाः । पितरं त्वेव शोचामि प्रज्ञानेत्रं जनेश्वरम् । मत्कृते दुःखमापन्नं क्लेशं प्राप्तमनन्तकम् ।।
data.md: There is no objection to our surrender; for men or our position seek peace from a long time; but I grieve for my father, that lord of men, who has his wisdom only for his eyes.

data.v: कृतं हि तव पुत्रैश्च परेषामवरोधनम् । मत्प्रियार्थं पुरैवैतद्विदितं ते नरोत्तम ।।
data.md: And who may for my doings be beset with troubles and endless woes. The enemies were opposed by your sons simply for our good; which is known to you before, O best among men.

data.v: ते राज्ञो धृतराष्ट्रस्य सामात्यस्य महारथाः । वैरं प्रतिकरिष्यन्ति कुलोच्छेदेन पाण्डवाः ।।
data.md: The sons of Pandu, these mighty carwarriors, will have their revenge for their wrongs by the extinction of the race of the king Dhritarashtra with that of his ministers.

data.v: ततो द्रोणोऽब्रवीद्भीष्मः कृपो द्रौणिश्च भारत । मत्वा मां महतीं चिन्तामास्थितं व्यथितेन्द्रियम् ।।
data.md: Then did Drona and Bhima and Kripa and the son of Drona thus speak, O Bharata, thinking me to be in the midst of great anxiety and with the senses tortured.

data.v: अभिद्रुग्धाः परे चेन्नो न भेतव्यं परंतप । असमर्थाः परे जेतुमस्मान्युधि जनेश्वर ।।
data.md: The enemies ready to fight need not be feared, 0 subduer of foes; for the foes when in the battle field are incapable of conquering us.

data.v: एकैकशः समर्थाः स्मो विजेतुं सर्वपार्थिवान् । आगच्छन्तु विनेष्यामो दर्पमेषां शितैः शरैः ।।
data.md: Each one of us by himself can conquer all the rulers of the earth. Let them come; we shall curb their pride by sharp arrows.

data.v: पुरैकेन हि भीष्मेण विजिताः सर्वपार्थिवाः । मृते पितर्यभिक्रुद्धो रथेनैकेन भारत ।।
data.md: In days of old, all the rulers of the earth were conquered by the single Bhima seated on the single car, extremely wrathful on the death of his father.

data.v: जघान सुबहूंस्तेषां संरब्धः कुरुसत्तमः । ततस्ते शरणं जग्मुर्देवव्रतमिमं भयात् ।।
data.md: That best one among the race of the Kurus, wrathful, killed many among them (enemies); them they out of fear sought the protection of this Devavrata.

data.v: स भीष्मः सुसमर्थोऽयमस्माभिः सहितो रणे । परान्विजेतुं तस्मात्ते व्येतु भीर्भरतर्षभ । इत्येषां निश्चयो ह्यासीत्तत्कालममितौजसाम् ।।
data.md: That Bhishma is well capable to fight along with us and to conquer to enemies; therefore, O bull among the race of Bharata, let your fears be dispelled.

data.v: पुरा परेषां पृथिवी कृत्स्नासीद्वशवर्तिनी । अस्मान्पुनरमी नाद्य समर्था जेतुमाहवे । छिन्नपक्षाः परे ह्यद्य वीर्यहीनाश्च पाण्डवाः ।।
data.md: Now they are not capable of again conquering us; the Pandavas are now shorn of their wings and devoid of strength.

data.v: अस्मत्संस्था च पृथिवी वर्तते भरतर्षभ । एकार्थाः सुखदुःखेषु मयानीताश्च पार्थिवाः ।।
data.md: The earth, too, O bull among the race of Bharata, is now under our subjection and the rulers of the earth assembled are of the same mind with me in happiness or misery.

data.v: अप्यग्निं प्रविशेयुस्ते समुद्रं वा परंतप । मदर्थे पार्थिवाः सर्वे तद्विद्धि कुरुसत्तम ।।
data.md: O subduer of foes, for my sake, the rulers of the earth, can enter into fireor even the ocean; know this, O you best among the race of Kurus.

data.v: उन्मत्तमिव चापि त्वां प्रहसन्तीह दुःखितम् । विलपन्तं बहुविधं भीतं परविकत्थने ।।
data.md: In this case they laugh at you, who are grieved and like one insane and giving vent to many sorts of lamentations, struck with fear by the descriptions of the enemies.

data.v: एषां ह्येकैकशो राज्ञां समर्थः पाण्डवान्प्रति । आत्मानं मन्यते सर्वो व्येतु ते भयमागतम् ।।
data.md: Each of these kings by himself are capable of opposing the Pandavas. Every one considers himself all in all. Let the fear which has come on you be dispelled,

data.v: सर्वां समग्रां सेनां मे वासवोऽपि न शक्नुयात् । हन्तुमक्षय्यरूपेयं ब्रह्मणापि स्वयम्भुवा ।।
