भीष्मं चैव ब्रूहि गत्वा त्वमाशु; युधिष्ठिरं साधुनैवाभ्युपेत । मा वो वधीदर्जुनो देवगुप्तः; क्षिप्रं याचध्वं पाण्डवं लोकवीरम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira should be approached by an honourable man, let not Arjuna, protected by the gods, kill you and the king of virtue the son of Pandu-that hero among men should be forthwith asked to accept the kingdom surrender to him.

data.v: नैतादृशो हि योधोऽस्ति पृथिव्यामिह कश्चन । यथाविधः सव्यसाची पाण्डवः शस्त्रवित्तमः ।।
data.md: There is no warrior in this world as the son of Pandu, Savyasachin of true strength.

data.v: देवैर्हि संभृतो दिव्यो रथो गाण्डीवधन्वनः । न स जेयो मनुष्येण मा स्म कृध्वं मनो युधि ।।
data.md: By the gobs themselves in the heavenly car of the wielder of the Gandiva bow protected; he cannot be defeated by men; do not think in mind even of a fight with him.

data.v: क्षत्रतेजा ब्रह्मचारी कौमारादपि पाण्डवः । तेन संयुगमेष्यन्ति मन्दा विलपतो मम ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said The son of Pandu, from his youth, has the prowess of a Kshatriya and leads the life of a Brahmachari. Those fools desire to fight with him, thought I am lamenting.

data.v: दुर्योधन निवर्तस्व युद्धाद्भरतसत्तम । न हि युद्धं प्रशंसन्ति सर्वावस्थमरिंदम ।।
data.md: O Duryodhana, O you best among the race of Bharata, turn your mind away from fight; war is not desirable under all conditions, O you subduer of enemies.

data.v: अलमर्धं पृथिव्यास्ते सहामात्यस्य जीवितुम् । प्रयच्छ पाण्डुपुत्राणां यथोचितमरिंदम ।।
data.md: One half of the earth is sufficient for the livelihood of yourself and your ministers. Give back to the sons of Pandu their dues, O you subduer of enemies.

data.v: एतद्धि कुरवः सर्वे मन्यन्ते धर्मसंहितम् । यत्त्वं प्रशान्तिमिच्छेथाः पाण्डुपुत्रैर्महात्मभिः ।।
data.md: All the Kurus think this to be in accordance with virtue that you should conclude peace with the high-souled sons of Pandu.

data.v: अङ्गेमां समवेक्षस्व पुत्र स्वामेव वाहिनीम् । जात एव तव स्रावस्त्वं तु मोहान्न बुध्यसे ।।
data.md: Think well, O son, of the elements of your own army; it has been collected for your own death; you do not accept this out of folly.

data.v: न ह्यहं युद्धमिच्छामि नैतदिच्छति बाह्लिकः । न च भीष्मो न च द्रोणो नाश्वत्थामा न संजयः ।।
data.md: I do not wish war; nor is Balhika desirous of it; nor is Bhishma; nor is Drona, nor is Ashvathama; nor is Sanjaya nor Somadatta, nor Shala, nor Kripa desire war; nor does Satyavrata, nor Purumitra, nor Jaya, nor Bhurishravas.

data.v: न सोमदत्तो न शल्यो न कृपो युद्धमिच्छति । सत्यव्रतः पुरुमित्रो जयो भूरिश्रवास्तथा ।।
data.md: I do not wish war; nor is Balhika desirous of it; nor is Bhishma; nor is Drona, nor is Ashvathama; nor is Sanjaya nor Somadatta, nor Shala, nor Kripa desire war; nor does Satyavrata, nor Purumitra, nor Jaya, nor Bhurishravas.

data.v: येषु संप्रतितिष्ठेयुः कुरवः पीडिताः परैः । ते युद्धं नाभिनन्दन्ति तत्तुभ्यं तात रोचताम् ।।
data.md: Those on whom depend the Kurus, when troubled by the enemy not rejoice at the prospect of war; O dear, may you accept that.

data.v: न त्वं करोषि कामेन कर्णः कारयिता तव । दुःशासनश्च पापात्मा शकुनिश्चापि सौबलः ।।
data.md: You do not act in this way of your own will; but Karna leads you to it and Dushasana and the wicked-souled Shakuni and the son of Subala (lead you).

data.v: नाहं भवति न द्रोणे नाश्वत्थाम्नि न संजये । न विकर्णे न काम्बोजे न कृपे न च बाह्लिके ।।
data.md: Duryodhana said I do not depend on Drona or Ashvathama or Sanjaya or Bhishma or Kamboja or Kripa or Balhika or Satyavrata or Purumitra or on Bhurishravas, nor do I challenge them to fight, depending on others.

data.v: सत्यव्रते पुरुमित्रे भूरिश्रवसि वा पुनः । अन्येषु वा तावकेषु भारं कृत्वा समाह्वये ।।
data.md: Duryodhana said I do not depend on Drona or Ashvathama or Sanjaya or Bhishma or Kamboja or Kripa or Balhika or Satyavrata or Purumitra or on Bhurishravas, nor do I challenge them to fight, depending on others.

data.v: अहं च तात कर्णश्च रणयज्ञं वितत्य वै । युधिष्ठिरं पशुं कृत्वा दीक्षितौ भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: O Sire, I and Karna will perform the sacrifice of war after preparing ourselves, making Yudhishthira the beast for sacrifice.

data.v: रथो वेदी स्रुवः खड्गो गदा स्रुक्कवचं सदः । चातुर्होत्रं च धुर्या मे शरा दर्भा हविर्यशः ।।
data.md: In the ceremony my car will be the substitute for the platform; my scimitar, the ladle; my mace, the large ladle; and my coat of mail, the witnesses; my horses will answer the purpose of the four priests; my rafts will stand for the Kusha grass; and my fame, for the clarified butter.

data.v: आत्मयज्ञेन नृपते इष्ट्वा वैवस्वतं रणे । विजित्य स्वयमेष्यावो हतामित्रौ श्रिया वृतौ ।।
data.md: Having performed, O king, this sacrifice in the field of battle, in honour of the God of death, by ourselves and having won a victory and slain our enemies, we shall come back surrounded by a halo of glory.

data.v: अहं च तात कर्णश्च भ्राता दुःशासनश्च मे । एते वयं हनिष्यामः पाण्डवान्समरे त्रयः ।।
data.md: Myself, O Sire, Karna and my brother Dushasana, these three of us will kill the sons of Pandu in battle.

data.v: अहं हि पाण्डवान्हत्वा प्रशास्ता पृथिवीमिमाम् । मां वा हत्वा पाण्डुपुत्रा भोक्तारः पृथिवीमिमाम् ।।
data.md: Either I shall rule this earth, having slain the sons of Pandu; or the sons of Pandu will enjoy sovereignty over this earth after having slain me.

data.v: त्यक्तं मे जीवितं राजन्धनं राज्यं च पार्थिव । न जातु पाण्डवैः सार्धं वसेयमहमच्युत ।।
data.md: I can sacrifice my life, my kingdom, my wealth, my everything, O king; but I cannot live in peace with the sons of Pandu, O you of unfading renown.

data.v: यावद्धि सूच्यास्तीक्ष्णाया विध्येदग्रेण मारिष । तावदप्यपरित्याज्यं भूमेर्नः पाण्डवान्प्रति ।।
data.md: That extent of land which is pierced by the extremity of a sharp needle, O venerable Sire, I shall not surrender to the sons of Pandu.

data.v: सर्वान्वस्तात शोचामि त्यक्तो दुर्योधनो मया । ये मन्दमनुयास्यध्वं यान्तं वैवस्वतक्षयम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said I grieve for you all, O rulers, who are following that fool to the abode of the king of death; but Duryodhana is cast off by me forever.

data.v: रुरूणामिव यूथेषु व्याघ्राः प्रहरतां वराः । वरान्वरान्हनिष्यन्ति समेता युधि पाण्डवाः ।।
data.md: Like tigers in a herd of deer these foremost of strikers, those Pandavas assembled together will kill the principal warriors in battle.

data.v: प्रतीपमिव मे भाति युयुधानेन भारती । व्यस्ता सीमन्तिनी त्रस्ता प्रमृष्टा दीर्घबाहुना ।।
data.md: The army of the Bharatas appears to me as already fallen down like a woman troubled and afflicted and struck by one of the long arms.

data.v: संपूर्णं पूरयन्भूयो बलं पार्थस्य माधवः । शैनेयः समरे स्थाता बीजवत्प्रवपञ्शरान् ।।
data.md: Increasing in strength, what was already full, viz., Yudhishthira's army the son of Shini will stand on the field shooting arrows as one sows the seeds.

data.v: सेनामुखे प्रयुद्धानां भीमसेनो भविष्यति । तं सर्वे संश्रयिष्यन्ति प्राकारमकुतोभयम् ।।
data.md: In front of the fighting soldiers Bhimasena will stand and all will be shatered behind him as behind a strong wall, fearlessly.

data.v: यदा द्रक्ष्यसि भीमेन कुञ्जरान्विनिपातितान् । विशीर्णदन्तान्गिर्याभान्भिन्नकुम्भान्सशोणितान् ।।
data.md: When you will see your elephants, big as mountains, felled down by Bhima with their tusks broken and with blood flowing resembling a broken pot (with water flowing).

data.v: तानभिप्रेक्ष्य संग्रामे विशीर्णानिव पर्वतान् । भीतो भीमस्य संस्पर्शात्स्मर्तासि वचनस्य मे ।।
data.md: Beholding them in the field of battle like mountains separated and struck with fear by coming in contract with Bhima, then will you remember my words.

data.v: निर्दग्धं भीमसेनेन सैन्यं हतरथद्विपम् । गतिमग्नेरिव प्रेक्ष्य स्मर्तासि वचनस्य मे ।।
data.md: Beholding your army composed of chariot, horses and elephants burnt up as it were by Bhimasena like the path followed by a fire, will you remember my words.

data.v: महद्वो भयमागामि न चेच्छाम्यथ पाण्डवैः । गदया भीमसेनेन हताः शममुपैष्यथ ।।
data.md: A heavy calamity will you meet, if you do not conclude peace with the Pandavas. Killed by Bhimasena with his mace, will you ever remain in peace.

data.v: महावनमिव छिन्नं यदा द्रक्ष्यसि पातितम् । बलं कुरूणां संग्रामे तदा स्मर्तासि मे वचः ।।
data.md: When you will see the army of the Kurus, felled down by Bhima like a large forest torn off, then will you remember my words.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा राजा तु स सर्वान्पृथिवीपतीन् । अनुभाष्य महाराज पुनः पप्रच्छ संजयम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said this to all those rulers of the earth, the king, O great king, addressing Sanjaya asked him.

data.v: यदब्रूतां महात्मानौ वासुदेवधनंजयौ । तन्मे ब्रूहि महाप्राज्ञ शुश्रूषे वचनं तव ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said What the two great-souled ones, the son of Vasudeva and Dhananjaya, said? Tell me that, O exceedingly wise one. I shall hear your words.

data.v: शृणु राजन्यथा दृष्टौ मया कृष्णधनंजयौ । ऊचतुश्चापि यद्वीरौ तत्ते वक्ष्यामि भारत ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said Listen, O king, how the two, Krishna and Dhananjaya, were seen by me and what the two heroes said. I shall tell you, O Bharata.

data.v: पादाङ्गुलीरभिप्रेक्षन्प्रयतोऽहं कृताञ्जलिः । शुद्धान्तं प्राविशं राजन्नाख्यातुं नरदेवयोः ।।
data.md: Looking towards my toes and with my hands clasped together and thinking of holy things in my mind, did I enter the inner apartments to meet with those gods among men.

data.v: नैवाभिमन्युर्न यमौ तं देशमभियान्ति वै । यत्र कृष्णौ च कृष्णा च सत्यभामा च भामिनी ।।
data.md: Neither Abhimanyu nor the twins can go to the place where the two Krishna and Krishna (Draupadi) and the lady Satyabhama reside.

data.v: उभौ मध्वासवक्षीबावुभौ चन्दनरूषितौ । स्रग्विणौ वरवस्त्रौ तौ दिव्याभरणभूषितौ ।।
data.md: The two were there, cheerful with a drink of the Madri wine; and both had their bodies smeared with sandal; and both also were dressed in excellent attires and wore beautiful ornaments.

data.v: नैकरत्नविचित्रं तु काञ्चनं महदासनम् । विविधास्तरणास्तीर्णं यत्रासातामरिंदमौ ।।
data.md: The two subduer of enemies were seated there on a spacious seat of gold covered with many sorts of carpets.

data.v: अर्जुनोत्सङ्गगौ पादौ केशवस्योपलक्षये । अर्जुनस्य च कृष्णायां सत्यायां च महात्मनः ।।
data.md: On the lap of Arjuna were the feet of Keshava and those of the noble-minded Arjuna rested on Krishna and Satyabhama.

data.v: काञ्चनं पादपीठं तु पार्थो मे प्रादिशत्तदा । तदहं पाणिना स्पृष्ट्वा ततो भूमावुपाविशम् ।।
data.md: A seat made of gold did the son of Pritha point out to me; after touching which with my hands, I took my seat on the ground.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वरेखतलौ पादौ पार्थस्य शुभलक्षणौ । पादपीठादपहृतौ तत्रापश्यमहं शुभौ ।।
data.md: Two longitudinal lines on the soles of the son of Pritha, the auspicious marks, did I see on his taking away his feet from the seat.

data.v: श्यामौ बृहन्तौ तरुणौ शालस्कन्धाविवोद्गतौ । एकासनगतौ दृष्ट्वा भयं मां महदाविशत् ।।
data.md: Having seen the two young men of black complexion and large stature rising like the trunks of Shala trees, seated on the same seat, a great fear seized me.

data.v: इन्द्रविष्णुसमावेतौ मन्दात्मा नावबुध्यते । संश्रयाद्द्रोणभीष्माभ्यां कर्णस्य च विकत्थनात् ।।
data.md: They were like Indra and Vishnu seated together. That one of foolish intellect does not understand that owing to his belief in the power of Drona and Bhishma.

data.v: निदेशस्थाविमौ यस्य मानसस्तस्य सेत्स्यते । संकल्पो धर्मराजस्य निश्चयो मे तदाभवत् ।।
data.md: The wishes of him who had under his command these two, the desires of the king of virtue were bound to bear fruit such was my belief at the time.

data.v: सत्कृतश्चान्नपानाभ्यामाच्छन्नो लब्धसत्क्रियः । अञ्जलिं मूर्ध्नि संधाय तौ संदेशमचोदयम् ।।
data.md: Entertained with food and drink and having my wishes (of beholding the two) gratified, I placed my clasped hands on my head and conveyed to them your message.

data.v: धनुर्बाणोचितेनैकपाणिना शुभलक्षणम् । पादमानमयन्पार्थः केशवं समचोदयत् ।।
data.md: With his hands, having auspicious signs and marks made by friction with the bow and string, the son of Pritha removing the feet of Keshava asked him to give a suitable reply.

data.v: इन्द्रकेतुरिवोत्थाय सर्वाभरणभूषितः । इन्द्रवीर्योपमः कृष्णः संविष्टो माभ्यभाषत ।।
data.md: Then did Krishna of prowess similar to Indra's and adorned with all sorts of ornaments and rising like the banner of Indra speak addressing me, the words of that foremost of the speakers were mild, charming and conciliatory but were awful and calculated to cause fear in the sons of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: वाचं स वदतां श्रेष्ठो ह्लादिनीं वचनक्षमाम् । त्रासनीं धार्तराष्ट्राणां मृदुपूर्वां सुदारुणाम् ।।
data.md: Then did Krishna of prowess similar to Indra's and adorned with all sorts of ornaments and rising like the banner of Indra speak addressing me, the words of that foremost of the speakers were mild, charming and conciliatory but were awful and calculated to cause fear in the sons of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: वाचं तां वचनार्हस्य शिक्षाक्षरसमन्विताम् । अश्रौषमहमिष्टार्थां पश्चाद्धृदयशोषिणीम् ।।
data.md: I then heard the words of that one who is fit to speak, which were rhythmical and calculated to lead to the good of all, though heart-rending in the end.

data.v: संजयेदं वचो ब्रूया धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् । शृण्वतः कुरुमुख्यस्य द्रोणस्यापि च शृण्वतः ।।
data.md: The son of Vasudeva said O Sanjaya, speak these words to the intelligent Dhritarashtra in the hearing of the foremost of Kurus, Bhishma and Drona.

data.v: यजध्वं विपुलैर्यज्ञैर्विप्रेभ्यो दत्त दक्षिणाः । पुत्रैर्दारैश्च मोदध्वं महद्वो भयमागतम् ।।
data.md: Perform many sorts of sacrificial ceremonies and make many presents to the Brahmanas and make merry with your sons and wives; for a heavy calamity is come on you.

data.v: अर्थांस्त्यजत पात्रेभ्यः सुतान्प्राप्नुत कामजान् । प्रियं प्रियेभ्यश्चरत राजा हि त्वरते जये ।।
data.md: Distribute wealth among proper recipients; get desirable sons and serve those that are dear to you by doing them good; for the king is anxious for victory.

data.v: ऋणमेतत्प्रवृद्धं मे हृदयान्नापसर्पति । यद्गोविन्देति चुक्रोश कृष्णा मां दूरवासिनम् ।।
data.md: That old debt has not yet been wiped off from my mind (for I have not paid it), that is the invocation of me living at a distance by Krishna saying "Govinda".

data.v: वासुदेवोऽपि दुर्धर्षो यतात्मा यत्र पाण्डवः । अविषह्यं पृथिव्यापि तद्बलं यत्र केशवः ।।
data.md: The son of Vasudeva too who is relied on by the son of Pandu, is hard to be vanquished and the army in which Keshava takes part is invincible even by the whole world.

data.v: तिष्ठ तात सतां वाक्ये सुहृदामर्थवादिनाम् । वृद्धं शांतनवं भीष्मं तितिक्षस्व पितामहम् ।।
data.md: Abide then, my dear, by what your friends who tell you to do only what is conducive to your interests say. Accept the old Bhishma, the son of Shantanu and your grandfather as your guides.

data.v: मां च ब्रुवाणं शुश्रूष कुरूणामर्थवादिनम् । द्रोणं कृपं विकर्णं च महाराजं च बाह्लिकम् ।।
data.md: Listen therefore to what these seekers of good to the Kurus-Drona, Kripa, Vikarna and the great king Bahlika, say and to myself as well.

data.v: एते ह्यपि यथैवाहं मन्तुमर्हसि तांस्तथा । सर्वे धर्मविदो ह्येते तुल्यस्नेहाश्च भारत ।।
data.md: These stand in the same relation to you as I myself and it is proper that you should regard them in the same light. All of them know what virtue is and have the same degree of affection for you, O Bharata.

data.v: यत्तद्विराटनगरे सह भ्रातृभिरग्रतः । उत्सृज्य गाः सुसंत्रस्तं बलं ते समशीर्यत ।।
data.md: Your host headed by your brothers fled from that city of Virata leaving the king to surrender.

data.v: यच्चैव तस्मिन्नगरे श्रूयते महदद्भुतम् । एकस्य च बहूनां च पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: This tall story that we hear of what occurred in that city-the struggle between one and many is sufficient proof (of what I say regarding their superiority).

data.v: अर्जुनस्तत्तथाकार्षीत्किं पुनः सर्व एव ते । सभ्रातॄनभिजानीहि वृत्त्या च प्रतिपादय ।।
data.md: Such was the feat of Arjuna single; what will they all united not do? Treat them as your own brothers and give them their rights.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महाप्राज्ञो धृतराष्ट्रः सुयोधनम् । पुनरेव महाभागः संजयं पर्यपृच्छत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said The very wise Dhritarashtra of great prosperity having thus addressed Suyodhana again asked of Sanjaya-

data.v: ब्रूहि संजय यच्छेषं वासुदेवादनन्तरम् । यदर्जुन उवाच त्वां परं कौतूहलं हि मे ।।
data.md: Tell me, O Sanjaya, the remaining part, after the speech of Vasudeva, viz., what Arjuna said to you. I have great curiosity for it.

data.v: वासुदेववचः श्रुत्वा कुन्तीपुत्रो धनंजयः । उवाच काले दुर्धर्षो वासुदेवस्य शृण्वतः ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said Having heard the speech of Vasudeva, Dhananjaya the son of Kunti and hard to be vanquished said at the proper time within the hearing of Vasudeva.

data.v: पितामहं शांतनवं धृतराष्ट्रं च संजय । द्रोणं कृपं च कर्णं च महाराजं च बाह्लिकम् ।।
data.md: Listen therefore to what these seekers of good to the Kurus-Drona, Kripa, Vikarna and the great king Bahlika, say and to myself as well.

data.v: द्रौणिं च सोमदत्तं च शकुनिं चापि सौबलम् । दुःशासनं शलं चैव पुरुमित्रं विविंशतिम् ।।
विकर्णं चित्रसेनं च जयत्सेनं च पार्थिवम् । विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ दुर्मुखं चापि कौरवम् ।।
सैन्धवं दुःसहं चैव भूरिश्रवसमेव च । भगदत्तं च राजानं जलसंधं च पार्थिवम् ।।
ये चाप्यन्ये पार्थिवास्तत्र योद्धुं; समागताः कौरवाणां प्रियार्थम् । मुमूर्षवः पाण्डवाग्नौ प्रदीप्ते; समानीता धार्तराष्ट्रेण सूत ।।
यथान्यायं कौशलं वन्दनं च; समागता मद्वचनेन वाच्याः । इदं ब्रूयाः संजय राजमध्ये; सुयोधनं पापकृतां प्रधानम् ।।
data.md: The assembled ones are to be asked in my name about their health each in terms suitable to his rank and the proper greetings are to be presented. Tell this, O Sanjaya, in the midst of those kings to the foremost of sinners, Suyodhana.

data.v: अमर्षणं दुर्मतिं राजपुत्रं; पापात्मानं धार्तराष्ट्रं सुलुब्धम् । सर्वं ममैतद्वचनं समग्रं; सहामात्यं संजय श्रावयेथाः ।।
data.md: Make that wrathful prince of wicked intellect, that covetous son of Dhritarashtra of vicious soul hear all these words of mine, O Sanjaya, in the midst of all his ministers and parties.

data.v: एवं प्रतिष्ठाप्य धनंजयो मां; ततोऽर्थवद्धर्मवच्चापि वाक्यम् । प्रोवाचेदं वासुदेवं समीक्ष्य; पार्थो धीमाँल्लोहितान्तायताक्षः ।।
data.md: Saying this by way of an introduction, Dhananjaya the wise son of Pritha then looking at the son of Vasudeva with distended eyes with red corners, spoke these words consistent with both righteousness and morality to me.

data.v: यथा श्रुतं ते वदतो महात्मनो; मधुप्रवीरस्य वचः समाहितम् । तथैव वाच्यं भवता हि मद्वचः; समागतेषु क्षितिपेषु सर्वशः ।।
data.md: You have heard the measured speech of the high-souled hero of Madhu's race. You are to say the same thing to all the assembled rulers of the earth as my words.

data.v: शराग्निधूमे रथनेमिनादिते; धनुःस्रुवेणास्त्रबलापहारिणा । यथा न होमः क्रियते महामृधे; तथा समेत्य प्रयतध्वमादृताः ।।
data.md: Let them act in such a way that offerings may not have to be made to the smoky fire of arrows in the great sacrificial ceremony with the rattles of the car-wheels as substituting for incantations and the bow-string which will neutralize the effects of their arms as that for the ladle.

data.v: न चेत्प्रयच्छध्वममित्रघातिनो; युधिष्ठिरस्यांशमभीप्सितं स्वकम् । नयामि वः स्वाश्वपदातिकुञ्जरा;न्दिशं पितॄणामशिवां शितैः शरैः ।।
data.md: If you do not return to Yudhishthira, the slayer of his enemies, his own share which he desires; then shall I conduct you with your horses, foot soldiers and elephants to the inauspicious regions of departed spirits by my sharp arrows.

data.v: ततोऽहमामन्त्र्य चतुर्भुजं हरिं; धनंजयं चैव नमस्य सत्वरः । जवेन संप्राप्त इहामरद्युते; तवान्तिकं प्रापयितुं वचो महत् ।।
data.md: Then quickly bidding farewell to Dhananjaya and the One with four arms and bowing down to them, have I come here with speed to tell you this great news, O you of the luster of immortals.

data.v: दुर्योधने धार्तराष्ट्रे तद्वचोऽप्रतिनन्दति । तूष्णींभूतेषु सर्वेषु समुत्तस्थुर्नरेश्वराः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said On Duryodhana; the son of Dhritarashtra, not minding this speech much and all the others remaining damp those bulls among men rose up (and departed).

data.v: उत्थितेषु महाराज पृथिव्यां सर्वराजसु । रहिते संजयं राजा परिप्रष्टुं प्रचक्रमे ।।
data.md: After all the kings of the earth have stood up, the great king (Dhritarashtra) began to enquire of Sanjaya in secret, the resolves of his own party and of his enemies and Pandavas, after the one who was subject to wishes of his son had wished them (the kings) success.

data.v: आशंसमानो विजयं तेषां पुत्रवशानुगः । आत्मनश्च परेषां च पाण्डवानां च निश्चयम् ।।
data.md: After all the kings of the earth have stood up, the great king (Dhritarashtra) began to enquire of Sanjaya in secret, the resolves of his own party and of his enemies and Pandavas, after the one who was subject to wishes of his son had wished them (the kings) success.

data.v: गावल्गणे ब्रूहि नः सारफल्गु; स्वसेनायां यावदिहास्ति किंचित् । त्वं पाण्डवानां निपुणं वेत्थ सर्वं; किमेषां ज्यायः किमु तेषां कनीयः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O son of Gavalgani, tell one of the little superiority that exists in our own army. You know the affairs of the Pandavas fuliy, in what points they are superior and in what inferior.

data.v: त्वमेतयोः सारवित्सर्वदर्शी; धर्मार्थयोर्निपुणो निश्चयज्ञः । स मे पृष्टः संजय ब्रूहि सर्वं; युध्यमानाः कतरेऽस्मिन्न सन्ति ।।
data.md: You know the points of superiority of these two armies. You know everything and can foresee them. You are well conversant with what is conducive to righteousness and worldly profit. You, who are such, O Sanjaya, asked by me, tell me which of the parties, in the event of war between them, will cease to exist.

data.v: न त्वां ब्रूयां रहिते जातु किंचि;दसूया हि त्वां प्रसहेत राजन् । आनयस्व पितरं संशितव्रतं; गांधारीं च महिषीमाजमीढ ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said I shall not tell you any thing in secret, for then ill felling against mc may enter within you, O king. Have our sire of great vows and queen Gandhari brought here, O Ajamida.

data.v: तौ तेऽसूयां विनयेतां नरेन्द्र; धर्मज्ञौ तौ निपुणौ निश्चयज्ञौ । तयोस्तु त्वां संनिधौ तद्वदेयं; कृत्स्नं मतं वासुदेवार्जुनाभ्याम् ।।
data.md: They will be able to remove any ill feeling, O chief among men, (you may harbour against me), acquainted as they are with virtue and skilled as they are in foresight. In their presence shall I tell you everything about the purposes determined on by Keshava and the son of Pritha.

data.v: ततस्तन्मतमाज्ञाय संजयस्यात्मजस्य च । अभ्युपेत्य महाप्राज्ञः कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: And knowing that intention of Sanjaya and of his son, the exceedingly wise Krishna Dvaipayana after coming there said-

data.v: संपृच्छते धृतराष्ट्राय संजय; आचक्ष्व सर्वं यावदेषोऽनुयुङ्क्ते । सर्वं यावद्वेत्थ तस्मिन्यथाव;द्याथातथ्यं वासुदेवेऽर्जुने च ।।
data.md: Vyasa said To Dhritarashtra, who is asking, 0 Sanjaya, tell everything that he wants to know. Tell everything to him about the son of Vasudeva and Arjuna, as you know them.

data.v: अर्जुनो वासुदेवश्च धन्विनौ परमार्चितौ । कामादन्यत्र संभूतौ सर्वाभावाय संमितौ ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said Arjuna and the son of Vasudeva, the two very adorable wielders of the bow, born in a region other than their own out of their own will are equal to each other in every detail of their nature.

data.v: द्यामन्तरं समास्थाय यथायुक्तं मनस्विनः । चक्रं तद्वासुदेवस्य मायया वर्तते विभो ।।
data.md: That disc of the son of Vasudeva exists, as illusion, O lord though five cubits in diameter it can be hurled by that intelligent in any form he likes.

data.v: सापह्नवं पाण्डवेषु पाण्डवानां सुसंमतम् । सारासारबलं ज्ञात्वा तत्समासेन मे शृणु ।।
data.md: (That disc) is the destroyer of the Kurus and therefore dear to the Pandavas. Shining with effulgence, it is the best measure for forming an idea of points of strength and weakness.

data.v: नरकं शम्बरं चैव कंसं चैद्यं च माधवः । जितवान्घोरसंकाशान्क्रीडन्निव जनार्दनः ।।
data.md: That descendant of Madhu, of great strength, as if in play, conquered Naraka, Shambara, Kansa and the king of the Chedis in terrific battle.

data.v: पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षं च द्यां चैव पुरुषोत्तमः । मनसैव विशिष्टात्मा नयत्यात्मवशं वशी ।।
data.md: That foremost men, of a superior soul, can by mere force of his will bring under control the earth, the sky and the heavens.

data.v: भूयो भूयो हि यद्राजन्पृच्छसे पाण्डवान्प्रति । सारासारबलं ज्ञातुं तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ।।
data.md: Again and again, have you, O king, asked me about the Pandavas with a view to know their strength and the points of their superiority and inferiority. Listen to that from me in brief:

data.v: एकतो वा जगत्कृत्स्नमेकतो वा जनार्दनः । सारतो जगतः कृत्स्नादतिरिक्तो जनार्दनः ।।
data.md: If the entire world be placed on one side and Janardana on the other; then will the entire world be surpassed by Janardana in point of strength.

data.v: भस्म कुर्याज्जगदिदं मनसैव जनार्दनः । न तु कृत्स्नं जगच्छक्तं भस्म कर्तुं जनार्दनम् ।।
data.md: The entire world is not able to reduce Janardana to ashes; while Janardana can reduce the world into ashes.

data.v: यतः सत्यं यतो धर्मो यतो ह्रीरार्जवं यतः । ततो भवति गोविन्दो यतः कृष्णस्ततो जयः ।।
data.md: Where there is truth, where there is righteousness, where there is modesty and where there is humanity, there is Govinda. Where there is Krishna; there is victory.

data.v: पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षं च दिवं च पुरुषोत्तमः । विचेष्टयति भूतात्मा क्रीडन्निव जनार्दनः ।।
data.md: That foremost men, of a superior soul, can by mere force of his will bring under control the earth, the sky and the heavens.

data.v: स कृत्वा पाण्डवान्सत्रं लोकं संमोहयन्निव । अधर्मनिरतान्मूढान्दग्धुमिच्छति ते सुतान् ।।
data.md: He, making the Pandavas his instruments, desires to consume your foolish sons, who are attached to vice, sleeping the world in illusion.

data.v: कालचक्रं जगच्चक्रं युगचक्रं च केशवः । आत्मयोगेन भगवान्परिवर्तयतेऽनिशम् ।।
data.md: The wheel of time, the wheel of the world and the wheel of the Yuga (i.e. the wheel of work leading to births and rebirths) dose that ! prosperous bcing ever cause to revolve by application of his soul.

data.v: कालस्य च हि मृत्योश्च जङ्गमस्थावरस्य च । ईशते भगवानेकः सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: That prosperous Being alone is lord over Time, Death and over all mobile and immobile beings. I tell you the truth.

data.v: ईशन्नपि महायोगी सर्वस्य जगतो हरिः । कर्माण्यारभते कर्तुं कीनाश इव दुर्बलः ।।
data.md: Though larding over the entire world, Hari, that great anchorite, has recourse to work, as a cultivator tills the soil.

data.v: तेन वञ्चयते लोकान्मायायोगेन केशवः । ये तमेव प्रपद्यन्ते न ते मुह्यन्ति मानवाः ।।
data.md: By such illusion dose Keshava deceive the world; but those men that have understood him are not deceived.

data.v: कथं त्वं माधवं वेत्थ सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् । कथमेनं न वेदाहं तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said How have you come to know, Madhava, the great lord of all the worlds; and how is it that I do not know him? Tell me that, O Sanjaya.

data.v: विद्या राजन्न ते विद्या मम विद्या न हीयते । विद्याहीनस्तमोध्वस्तो नाभिजानाति केशवम् ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said Listen, O king; you have no knowledge and my knowledge has diminished (since my last birth). You being without knowiedge and steeped in ignorance, do not know Keshava.

data.v: विद्यया तात जानामि त्रियुगं मधुसूदनम् । कर्तारमकृतं देवं भूतानां प्रभवाप्ययम् ।।
data.md: By my knowledge, O dear, I do know the slayer of Madhu to be the combination of the there ( the cause, the subtie and the gross), that he is the creator of all, though himself created by none and that he is the God by Whom all creatures are created and to Whom they are all lost they are lost in the end.

data.v: गावल्गणेऽत्र का भक्तिर्या ते नित्या जनार्दने । यया त्वमभिजानासि त्रियुगं मधुसूदनम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O son of Gavalgani, what is the extent of the belief you ever have in Janardana, by which you Janardana, who is the union of the three.

data.v: मायां न सेवे भद्रं ते न वृथाधर्ममाचरे । शुद्धभावं गतो भक्त्या शास्त्राद्वेद्मि जनार्दनम् ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said I do not care much for illusion (worldly matters); nor do I practice useless things (religious ceremonies in form without faith in the Supreme Being). Good betide you! With the aid of faith derived from purity of mind, do I know Janardana from the holy books.

data.v: दुर्योधन हृषीकेशं प्रपद्यस्व जनार्दनम् । आप्तो नः संजयस्तात शरणं गच्छ केशवम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Duryodhana, have recourse to Hrishikesha or Janardana. Sanjaya, my dear, cver seeks our interests; do you therefore seek refuge under Keshava.

data.v: भगवान्देवकीपुत्रो लोकं चेन्निहनिष्यति । प्रवदन्नर्जुने सख्यं नाहं गच्छेऽद्य केशवम् ।।
data.md: Duryodhana said If the son of Devaki, that divine Being, destroys the worlds the worlds, having recourse to the co-operation of Arjuna; even then shall I not seek refuge under Keshava.

data.v: अवाग्गान्धारि पुत्रस्ते गच्छत्येष सुदुर्मतिः । ईर्ष्युर्दुरात्मा मानी च श्रेयसां वचनातिगः ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Gandhari, this wicked-minded son of yours would precipitate himself in misery. This evil-souled one, of an envious disposition and vain, he would not listen to the advice of his elders.

data.v: ऐश्वर्यकाम दुष्टात्मन्वृद्धानां शासनातिग । ऐश्वर्यजीविते हित्वा पितरं मां च बालिश ।।
data.md: Gandhari said O you desiring supremacy, O you of wicked soul, who do not listen to the advice of your elders and who do not pay regard to your father and myself, after losing your position during your life time.

data.v: वर्धयन्दुर्हृदां प्रीतिं मां च शोकेन वर्धयन् । निहतो भीमसेनेन स्मर्तासि वचनं पितुः ।।
data.md: And enhancing the Joy of wicked hearted person as also my grief, when you will be slain by Bhimasena, you will remember the words of your father.

data.v: दयितोऽसि राजन्कृष्णस्य धृतराष्ट्र निबोध मे । यस्य ते संजयो दूतो यस्त्वां श्रेयसि योक्ष्यते ।।
data.md: Vyasa said You are, O king, dear to Krishna, O Dhritarashtra; listen to me; since Sanjaya has acted as your ambassador, he will do what is conducive to your interests.

data.v: जानात्येष हृषीकेशं पुराणं यच्च वै नवम् । शुश्रूषमाणमेकाग्रं मोक्ष्यते महतो भयात् ।।
data.md: This man knows the ancient and blessed Being Hrishikesha. Listening to him with earnestness, you free from even the greatest dangers.

data.v: वैचित्रवीर्य पुरुषाः क्रोधहर्षतमोवृताः । सिता बहुविधैः पाशैर्ये न तुष्टाः स्वकैर्धनैः ।।
data.md: O son of Vichitravirya, men are surrounded with joy and wrath and so they are entangled in several sorts of trap. Those, who are not satisfied with their own wealth and those fools who act by desire, again and again come under the influence of the god of death in consequence of their own acts like those of blind eyes (falling again and again into pits) when led by the blind.

data.v: यमस्य वशमायान्ति काममूढाः पुनः पुनः । अन्धनेत्रा यथैवान्धा नीयमानाः स्वकर्मभिः ।।
data.md: O son of Vichitravirya, men are surrounded with joy and wrath and so they are entangled in several sorts of trap. Those, who are not satisfied with their own wealth and those fools who act by desire, again and again come under the influence of the god of death in consequence of their own acts like those of blind eyes (falling again and again into pits) when led by the blind.

data.v: एष एकायनः पन्था येन यान्ति मनीषिणः । तं दृष्ट्वा मृत्युमत्येति महांस्तत्र न सज्जते ।।
data.md: That one is the only path by which the wise man goes (with a view to attain Brahma) and by aiming at that path a superior man overcomes death and attains the object of his ambition.

data.v: अङ्ग संजय मे शंस पन्थानमकुतोभयम् । येन गत्वा हृषीकेशं प्राप्नुयां शान्तिमुत्तमाम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Let me know, O Sanjaya, of that path, devoid of fears, going by which I shall obtain Hrishikesha and eternal salvation.

data.v: नाकृतात्मा कृतात्मानं जातु विद्याज्जनार्दनम् । आत्मनस्तु क्रियोपायो नान्यत्रेन्द्रियनिग्रहात् ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said A man who has not his soul under control cannot know Janardana, who has his soul under control. The performance of sacrifices and other ceremonies, without being accompanied by a control of the senses, is not the proper way to go by for a man.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणामुदीर्णानां कामत्यागोऽप्रमादतः । अप्रमादोऽविहिंसा च ज्ञानयोनिरसंशयम् ।।
data.md: The renunciation of the objects of our desire, due to an excitement of the senses, arises from true knowledge. True knowledge and benevolence have their origin in wisdom, there is no doubt about it.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणां यमे यत्तो भव राजन्नतन्द्रितः । बुद्धिश्च मा ते च्यवतु नियच्छैतां यतस्ततः ।।
data.md: Therefore, O king, employ yourself in the controlling of your senses with wakefulness; and let not your intellect take the wrong course and keep it aloof from everything save the true path.

data.v: एतज्ज्ञानं विदुर्विप्रा ध्रुवमिन्द्रियधारणम् । एतज्ज्ञानं च पन्थाश्च येन यान्ति मनीषिणः ।।
data.md: The control of the senses is known by Brahmanas to be certainly the true wisdom; and true wisdom is the path along which an intelligent man goes.

data.v: अप्राप्यः केशवो राजन्निन्द्रियैरजितैर्नृभिः । आगमाधिगतो योगाद्वशी तत्त्वे प्रसीदति ।।
data.md: Keshava is unattainable, o king, by men who have not controlled their senses. One who has his soul under control is pleased with true knowledge, gained by devotion and intimate knowledge of the holy books.

data.v: भूयो मे पुण्डरीकाक्षं संजयाचक्ष्व पृच्छते । नामकर्मार्थवित्तात प्राप्नुयां पुरुषोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Repeat to me, who am asking, all that you have said regarding the Lotus-eyed (Krishna), so that by knowing the meaning of his names and his action I may attain to that best among male beings.

data.v: श्रुतं मे तस्य देवस्य नामनिर्वचनं शुभम् । यावत्तत्राभिजानेऽहमप्रमेयो हि केशवः ।।
data.md: Sanjaya said The blessed list of name of the son of Vasudeva has been heard by me, from which it seems, so far as I can judge, that Keshava is immeasurable.

data.v: वसनात्सर्वभूतानां वसुत्वाद्देवयोनितः । वासुदेवस्ततो वेद्यो वृषत्वाद्वृष्णिरुच्यते ।।
data.md: From his covering all creatures with illusion, from his being the support of the world and from his being of divine origin, he is know as Vasudeva. He is called Vishnu, owing to the fact of his pervading everything.

data.v: मौनाद्ध्यानाच्च योगाच्च विद्धि भारत माधवम् । सर्वतत्त्वलयाच्चैव मधुहा मधुसूदनः ।।
data.md: From his practice of asceticism, from the application of his energy to the supreme truth and from his asceticism know him to be Madhava. O Bharata; and from his having within himself the essence of everything and from the fact of his killing Madhu, he is called Madhusudana.

data.v: कृषिर्भूवाचकः शब्दो णश्च निर्वृतिवाचकः । कृष्णस्तद्भावयोगाच्च कृष्णो भवति शाश्वतः ।।
data.md: Krishi is a word denotes existence; and may denotes eternal tranquility. From the combination of these two states is Vishnu, born of the Satvata race, called Krishna.

data.v: पुण्डरीकं परं धाम नित्यमक्षयमक्षरम् । तद्भावात्पुण्डरीकाक्षो दस्युत्रासाज्जनार्दनः ।।
data.md: Pundarika means the eternal regions; and Akshya ever means that which has no waste. From a combination of these two states is he called Pundarikaksha; and form his causing fear in wicked beings is he Janardana.

data.v: यतः सत्त्वं न च्यवते यच्च सत्त्वान्न हीयते । सत्त्वतः सात्वतस्तस्मादार्षभाद्वृषभेक्षणः ।।
data.md: Since he is never dissociated from Sattva and since also Sattva is never dissociated from him; therefore is he called Sattavata. Owing to (the knowledge of) the Vedas being the eyes by which he is seen and the Vedas being the eyes through which he sees, he is called Vrishabha (Vedas) and Ikshana (eyes).

data.v: न जायते जनित्र्यां यदजस्तस्मादनीकजित् । देवानां स्वप्रकाशत्वाद्दमाद्दामोदरं विदुः ।।
data.md: Not being born in the usual way, that conqueror of armies is called Aja; and from his being conspicuous among the gods and from his self-control is the Lord called Damodara.

data.v: हर्षात्सौख्यात्सुखैश्वर्याद्धृषीकेशत्वमश्नुते । बाहुभ्यां रोदसी बिभ्रन्महाबाहुरिति स्मृतः ।।
data.md: From the combination of the words, eternal happiness (hrishika) and the attributes of divinity (isha) is he called Hrishikesha. He is known as Mahabahu in the Smritis, as by his two arms he supports the earth and the sky.

data.v: अधो न क्षीयते जातु यस्मात्तस्मादधोक्षजः । नराणामयनाच्चापि तेन नारायणः स्मृतः । पूरणात्सदनाच्चैव ततोऽसौ पुरुषोत्तमः ।।
data.md: Since he never falls down; nor he is wasted away; therefore, he is called Adhokshaja; and he is known as Narayana in the Smritis, as he is the refuge of human beings.

data.v: असतश्च सतश्चैव सर्वस्य प्रभवाप्ययात् । सर्वस्य च सदा ज्ञानात्सर्वमेनं प्रचक्षते ।।
सत्ये प्रतिष्ठितः कृष्णः सत्यमत्र प्रतिष्ठितम् । सत्यात्सत्यं च गोविन्दस्तस्मात्सत्योऽपि नामतः ।।
विष्णुर्विक्रमणादेव जयनाज्जिष्णुरुच्यते । शाश्वतत्वादनन्तश्च गोविन्दो वेदनाद्गवाम् ।।
अतत्त्वं कुरुते तत्त्वं तेन मोहयते प्रजाः । एवंविधो धर्मनित्यो भगवान्मुनिभिः सह । आगन्ता हि महाबाहुरानृशंस्यार्थमच्युतः ।।
data.md: The divine slayer of Madhu, who has these qualities and who ever is attached to virtue, that being with long arms, who under goes no waste, will come here to see that there is no unnecessary slaughter.

data.v: चक्षुष्मतां वै स्पृहयामि संजय; द्रक्ष्यन्ति ये वासुदेवं समीपे । विभ्राजमानं वपुषा परेण; प्रकाशयन्तं प्रदिशो दिशश्च ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said I envy those who have eyes, O Sanjaya and who will see before them the son of Vasudeva with his body shining with great lustre in the cardinal points of the earth and in the points between them.

data.v: ईरयन्तं भारतीं भारताना;मभ्यर्चनीयां शंकरीं सृञ्जयानाम् । बुभूषद्भिर्ग्रहणीयामनिन्द्यां; परासूनामग्रहणीयरूपाम् ।।
data.md: And uttering blessed words which ought to be listened to with all respect by the Bharatas, words that are for the good of the Sanjayas, unexceptionable words that ought to be accepted by those praying for prosperity and incapable of being acted up to by those who are about to meet their end.

data.v: समुद्यन्तं सात्वतमेकवीरं; प्रणेतारमृषभं यादवानाम् । निहन्तारं क्षोभणं शात्रवाणां; मुष्णन्तं च द्विषतां वै यशांसि ।।
data.md: Who (Krishna) is ever full of energy, eternal and the one hero in the world, who is the leader of the Yadavas and the bull among them; who is the slayer of his enemies and the cause of terror among them and the destroyer of the fame of his foes.

data.v: द्रष्टारो हि कुरवस्तं समेता; महात्मानं शत्रुहणं वरेण्यम् । ब्रुवन्तं वाचमनृशंसरूपां; वृष्णिश्रेष्ठं मोहयन्तं मदीयान् ।।
data.md: The sons of Kuru, assembled together, will see that worshipful slayer of his foes, of high soul, that foremost among the Vrishnis, speaking words full of benevolence and thus winning over my party.

data.v: ऋषिं सनातनतमं विपश्चितं; वाचः समुद्रं कलशं यतीनाम् । अरिष्टनेमिं गरुडं सुपर्णं; पतिं प्रजानां भुवनस्य धाम ।।
data.md: With that ascetic who is eternal and who has the knowledge of self, the ocean of words easily obtainable by anchorites, with that Arishta bird with beautiful wings, that destroyer of creatures, that refuge of the universe, that being with a thousand heads, that ancient Being who has neither beginning, nor end, nor middle, whose fame has no end who is the cause of the universal seed, who is without birth, who is eternity itself, shall I take refuge.

data.v: सहस्रशीर्षं पुरुषं पुराण;मनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तकीर्तिम् । शुक्रस्य धातारमजं जनित्रं; परं परेभ्यः शरणं प्रपद्ये ।।
data.md: With that ascetic who is eternal and who has the knowledge of self, the ocean of words easily obtainable by anchorites, with that Arishta bird with beautiful wings, that destroyer of creatures, that refuge of the universe, that being with a thousand heads, that ancient Being who has neither beginning, nor end, nor middle, whose fame has no end who is the cause of the universal seed, who is without birth, who is eternity itself, shall I take refuge.

data.v: त्रैलोक्यनिर्माणकरं जनित्रं; देवासुराणामथ नागरक्षसाम् । नराधिपानां विदुषां प्रधान;मिन्द्रानुजं तं शरणं प्रपद्ये ।।
data.md: I shall take refuge under the creator of the three worlds, the creator of the gods, Asuras, Nagas and Rakshasas, the chief among the rulers of men and learned men and that younger brother of Indra. On the return of Sanjaya, Yudhishthira, the king of virtue, said to the scion of the Dhritarashtra race (Krishna), that bull among all the Sattvatas.

data.v: संजये प्रतियाते तु धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । अभ्यभाषत दाशार्हमृषभं सर्वसात्वताम् ।।
अयं स कालः संप्राप्तो मित्राणां मे जनार्दन । न च त्वदन्यं पश्यामि यो न आपत्सु तारयेत् ।।
data.md: This is the time arrived for friends (to show that they are so), O you devoted to the interests of your friends. Any other save yourself I do not see, who could get us through this difficulty.

data.v: त्वां हि माधव संश्रित्य निर्भया मोहदर्पितम् । धार्तराष्ट्रं सहामात्यं स्वमंशमनुयुञ्ज्महे ।।
data.md: Depending on you, Madhava, we have without fear asked back our share (of the kingdom) from the son of Dhritarashtra and all his followers, who are filled with vain pride.

data.v: यथा हि सर्वास्वापत्सु पासि वृष्णीनरिंदम । तथा ते पाण्डवा रक्ष्याः पाह्यस्मान्महतो भयात् ।।
data.md: As you get through the Vrishnis out of all difficulties, O chastiser of chastiser of foes; so are the Pandavas, the proper party, to be protected by you. Get them through this great difficulty.

data.v: अयमस्मि महाबाहो ब्रूहि यत्ते विवक्षितम् । करिष्यामि हि तत्सर्वं यत्त्वं वक्ष्यसि भारत ।।
data.md: The blessed Krishna of divine attributes said Here am I, O you with long arms. Speak what you want to say. I shall do all that you will ask me to do, O Bharata.

data.v: श्रुतं ते धृतराष्ट्रस्य सपुत्रस्य चिकीर्षितम् । एतद्धि सकलं कृष्ण संजयो मां यदब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have heard what Dhritarashtra with his son intends to do. It is, O Krishna, exactly as Sanjaya told me.

data.v: तन्मतं धृतराष्ट्रस्य सोऽस्यात्मा विवृतान्तरः । यथोक्तं दूत आचष्टे वध्यः स्यादन्यथा ब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Such are the intentions of Dhritarashtra; for Sanjaya knows the heart and is as his very soul, so to say. As an ambassador is instructed, so dose he speak; and if he speaks otherwise he should be killed.

data.v: अप्रदानेन राज्यस्य शान्तिमस्मासु मार्गति । लुब्धः पापेन मनसा चरन्नसममात्मनः ।।
data.md: Without restoring to us our kingdom ho wants peace with us; and the covetous man behaves by his sinful heart without impartiality towards those whose interests should be looked after by him equally.

data.v: यत्तद्द्वादश वर्षाणि वने निर्व्युषिता वयम् । छद्मना शरदं चैकां धृतराष्ट्रस्य शासनात् ।।
data.md: For twelve years have the forests been inhabited by us; and at the command of Dhritarashtra have we lived in disguise for another year.

data.v: स्थाता नः समये तस्मिन्धृतराष्ट्र इति प्रभो । नाहास्म समयं कृष्ण तद्धि नो ब्राह्मणा विदुः ।।
data.md: So that Dhritarashtra might abide by those pledges of ours, O lord; the Brahmanas, O Krishna, in our company know that we did not break our pledges.

data.v: वृद्धो राजा धृतराष्ट्रः स्वधर्मं नानुपश्यति । पश्यन्वा पुत्रगृद्धित्वान्मन्दस्यान्वेति शासनम् ।।
data.md: The avaricious king Dhritarashtra dose not follow the path of virtue of his class, and out of affection for his son and with a desire to please him he follows the course marked out by that fool.

data.v: सुयोधनमते तिष्ठन्राजास्मासु जनार्दन । मिथ्या चरति लुब्धः संश्चरन्प्रियमिवात्मनः ।।
data.md: The king listening to the advice of Suyodhna, O Janardana, behaves deceitfully towards his own interests.

data.v: इतो दुःखतरं किं नु यत्राहं मातरं ततः । संविधातुं न शक्नोमि मित्राणां वा जनार्दन ।।
data.md: What is more regrettable than this that I am unable to be of any good to my mother or to my friends, O Janardana.

data.v: काशिभिश्चेदिपाञ्चालैर्मत्स्यैश्च मधुसूदन । भवता चैव नाथेन पञ्च ग्रामा वृता मया ।।
data.md: Five villages were only asked by me, who have the Kashis, the Chedis, the Panchalas and the Matsyas for my supporters and your exalted self for my lord.

data.v: कुशस्थलं वृकस्थलमासन्दी वारणावतम् । अवसानं च गोविन्द किंचिदेवात्र पञ्चमम् ।।
data.md: (The villages were) Avisthala, Vrikasthala, Makandi, Varanavata and any other, O Govinda, for the last or the fifth.

data.v: पञ्च नस्तात दीयन्तां ग्रामा वा नगराणि वा । वसेम सहिता येषु मा च नो भरता नशन् ।।
data.md: Give as, O Sire, (so we said) five villages or towns where we may reside united together; for we do not desire the destruction of the Bharatas.

data.v: न च तानपि दुष्टात्मा धार्तराष्ट्रोऽनुमन्यते । स्वाम्यमात्मनि मत्वासावतो दुःखतरं नु किम् ।।
data.md: Not this even dose the wicked-souled son of Dhritarashtra grant, thinking the proprietary rights of the entire earth to be vested in him. What is there more regrettable than this.

data.v: कुले जातस्य वृद्धस्य परवित्तेषु गृध्यतः । लोभः प्रज्ञानमाहन्ति प्रज्ञा हन्ति हता ह्रियम् ।।
data.md: The avarice of man born in a noble family yet desiring to possess himself the wealth of others nullifies his wisdom; and the wisdom being destroyed, the sense of shame dose nowhere exist.

data.v: ह्रीर्हता बाधते धर्मं धर्मो हन्ति हतः श्रियम् । श्रीर्हता पुरुषं हन्ति पुरुषस्यास्वता वधः ।।
अस्वतो हि निवर्तन्ते ज्ञातयः सुहृदर्त्विजः । अपुष्पादफलाद्वृक्षाद्यथा तात पतत्रिणः ।।
data.md: Form a man stricken with property do cousins, friends and Brahmanas turn away; as from a tree without flowers and fruits the winged creatures turn away.

data.v: एतच्च मरणं तात यदस्मात्पतितादिव । ज्ञातयो विनिवर्तन्ते प्रेतसत्त्वादिवासवः ।।
data.md: This I regard as death to me, O Sire, since from me the cousins away as from a fallen creature or breath forsakes an animal that is dead.

data.v: नातः पापीयसीं कांचिदवस्थां शम्बरोऽब्रवीत् । यत्र नैवाद्य न प्रातर्भोजनं प्रतिदृश्यते ।।
data.md: Shambara was of opinion that there was no condition of life which could be more woeful than that in which a man cannot see what his food is to be tomorrow.

data.v: धनमाहुः परं धर्मं धने सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् । जीवन्ति धनिनो लोके मृता ये त्वधना नराः ।।
data.md: Wealth is said to be the best virtue. Everything is established on wealth; and wealthy men are living in this world and men without wealth are dead.

data.v: ये धनादपकर्षन्ति नरं स्वबलमाश्रिताः । ते धर्ममर्थं कामं च प्रमथ्नन्ति नरं च तम् ।।
data.md: Those, who by force of their physical strength, deprived a man of his wealth, destroy the virtue, profit and pleasure of that man.

data.v: एतामवस्थां प्राप्यैके मरणं वव्रिरे जनाः । ग्रामायैके वनायैके नाशायैके प्रवव्रजुः ।।
data.md: Having reached this condition (i.e. poverty) one class of men prefer death; another retire to villages (form cities); a third to the wilderness; while the fourth rove about with a view to meet speedy death.

data.v: उन्मादमेके पुष्यन्ति यान्त्यन्ये द्विषतां वशम् । दास्यमेके निगच्छन्ति परेषामर्थहेतुना ।।
data.md: One class of men become insane; another go under the control of their enemies; and a third become slaves for the sake of getting the wealth of others.

data.v: आपदेवास्य मरणात्पुरुषस्य गरीयसी । श्रियो विनाशस्तद्ध्यस्य निमित्तं धर्मकामयोः ।।
data.md: Poverty is a more potent evil to a man than death; for it destroys his prosperity. Wealth is the source of a man's virtue well as his pleasure.

data.v: यदस्य धर्म्यं मरणं शाश्वतं लोकवर्त्म तत् । समन्तात्सर्वभूतानां न तदत्येति कश्चन ।।
data.md: The natural death of a man is like the ever recurring point of the wheel of this world. It is the unavoidable path of all creatures and none can avoid it.

data.v: न तथा बाध्यते कृष्ण प्रकृत्या निर्धनो जनः । यथा भद्रां श्रियं प्राप्य तया हीनः सुखैधितः ।।
data.md: A man without wealth from his very birth does not suffer so much, 0 Krishna, as one who after the possession of great prosperity and a life of great happiness is deprived of it.

data.v: स तदात्मापराधेन संप्राप्तो व्यसनं महत् । सेन्द्रान्गर्हयते देवान्नात्मानं च कथंचन ।।
data.md: The man steeped in gigantic difficulties by his own short comings blames the gods with Indra and rarely himself.

data.v: न चास्मिन्सर्वशास्त्राणि प्रतरन्ति निगर्हणाम् । सोऽभिक्रुध्यति भृत्यानां सुहृदश्चाभ्यसूयति ।।
data.md: His intimacy with all the holy books cannot procure him a mitigation of his sufferings. Sometimes he feels wrathful towards his servants; and afterwards he envies his friends.

data.v: तं तदा मन्युरेवैति स भूयः संप्रमुह्यति । स मोहवशमापन्नः क्रूरं कर्म निषेवते ।।
data.md: Ever subject to outbursts of passion, he sometimes loses his senses and getting himself under the control of his folly he attaches himself to the performance of evil deeds.

data.v: पापकर्मात्ययायैव संकरं तेन पुष्यति । संकरो नरकायैव सा काष्ठा पापकर्मणाम् ।।
data.md: From his evil deeds spring confusion of castes; and a mixing up of castes is the way to hell, for it is the very culminating point of sinful deeds.

data.v: न चेत्प्रबुध्यते कृष्ण नरकायैव गच्छति । तस्य प्रबोधः प्रज्ञैव प्रज्ञाचक्षुर्न रिष्यति ।।
data.md: If he does not awake, he goes to hell O Krishna, wisdom alone is his awakening; the ey.es of wisdom alone can rescue him.

data.v: प्रज्ञालाभे हि पुरुषः शास्त्राण्येवान्ववेक्षते । शास्त्रनित्यः पुनर्धर्मं तस्य ह्रीरङ्गमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: A man on obtaining the gift of wisdom follows the holy books. Observance of what is enjoyed in the holy books is the best virtue and modesty is the beautiful accompaniment of such a life.

data.v: ह्रीमान्हि पापं प्रद्वेष्टि तस्य श्रीरभिवर्धते । श्रीमान्स यावद्भवति तावद्भवति पूरुषः ।।
data.md: A man endued with a senses of shame despises sins and his prosperity ever increases. When he becomes endued with prosperity, then he is a man.

data.v: धर्मनित्यः प्रशान्तात्मा कार्ययोगवहः सदा । नाधर्मे कुरुते बुद्धिं न च पापेषु वर्तते ।।
data.md: That clam soul, ever engaged in the practice of virtue and ever attached to action after mature thought, never turns his mind towards vice, nor ever turns to sin.

data.v: अह्रीको वा विमूढो वा नैव स्त्री न पुनः पुमान् । नास्याधिकारो धर्मेऽस्ति यथा शूद्रस्तथैव सः ।।
data.md: The one without a sense of shame is neither a woman nor a man. He has no claims upon virtue; he is as a Shudra.

data.v: ह्रीमानवति देवांश्च पितॄनात्मानमेव च । तेनामृतत्वं व्रजति सा काष्ठा पुण्यकर्मणाम् ।।
data.md: The man endued with a sense of shame pleases the gods, the Pitris and his own self; and by this does he obtain immortality which is the goal of men attached to virtuous acts.

data.v: तदिदं मयि ते दृष्टं प्रत्यक्षं मधुसूदन । यथा राज्यात्परिभ्रष्टो वसामि वसतीरिमाः ।।
data.md: All this has been seen by you in me, o slayer of Madhu, namely, how I have lived these years, deprived of our kingdom.

data.v: ते वयं न श्रियं हातुमलं न्यायेन केनचित् । अत्र नो यतमानानां वधश्चेदपि साधु तत् ।।
data.md: There is no need for us to abandon that prosperity. In this case the death of ourselves, struggling to obtain back our prosperity, would be better.

data.v: तत्र नः प्रथमः कल्पो यद्वयं ते च माधव । प्रशान्ताः समभूताश्च श्रियं तामश्नुवीमहि ।।
data.md: With regard to that our intention the first thing is to enjoy that prosperity, themselves and ourselves united in peace and with the same interests, O Madhava.

data.v: तत्रैषा परमा काष्ठा रौद्रकर्मक्षयोदया । यद्वयं कौरवान्हत्वा तानि राष्ट्राण्यशीमहि ।।
data.md: It is the greatest of all vicious deeds for us to prosper after this destruction-that we should obtain the kingdoms after slaying the sons of Kuru.

data.v: ये पुनः स्युरसंबद्धा अनार्याः कृष्ण शत्रवः । तेषामप्यवधः कार्यः किं पुनर्ये स्युरीदृशाः ।।
data.md: Those that are not related to us, O Krishna, those dishonourable foes-the refrainment of slaying them too is our duty. What then is our duty towards those who are so closely related to us.

data.v: ज्ञातयश्च हि भूयिष्ठाः सहाया गुरवश्च नः । तेषां वधोऽतिपापीयान्किं नु युद्धेऽस्ति शोभनम् ।।
data.md: We have many cousins; and our elders are supporters (on both sides). Their destruction is extremely vicious. What then is the good in engaging in battle?

data.v: पापः क्षत्रियधर्मोऽयं वयं च क्षत्रबान्धवाः । स नः स्वधर्मोऽधर्मो वा वृत्तिरन्या विगर्हिता ।।
data.md: These practices of the Kshatriyas are sinful; but, alas, we are born in Kshatriya families and whether such practices are virtuous or the reverse; any other course of life would not be right!

data.v: शूद्रः करोति शुश्रूषां वैश्या विपणिजीविनः । वयं वधेन जीवामः कपालं ब्राह्मणैर्वृतम् ।।
data.md: A Shudra serves (the other classes); a Vaishya lives by trade and commerce; we live by massacre; and the wooden plate (profession of begging) has been selected by the Brahmanas.

data.v: क्षत्रियः क्षत्रियं हन्ति मत्स्यो मत्स्येन जीवति । श्वा श्वानं हन्ति दाशार्ह पश्य धर्मो यथागतः ।।
data.md: A Kshatriya kills another Kshatriya; a fish lives on another fish; a dog kills another dog. See how each follows his rule of life, O you of the Dasharha race.

data.v: युद्धे कृष्ण कलिर्नित्यं प्राणाः सीदन्ति संयुगे । बलं तु नीतिमात्राय हठे जयपराजयौ ।।
data.md: In battle, O Krishna, Kali is ever present; in a battle lives are lost; but, in spite of fixed policy applied to fighting, success and defeat.

data.v: नात्मच्छन्देन भूतानां जीवितं मरणं तथा । नाप्यकाले सुखं प्राप्यं दुःखं वापि यदूत्तम ।।
data.md: Are not dependent on the will (of the combatants); as life and death are independent of the will of creatures. Until the right time happiness cannot be attained, nor misery, O you best of the Yadu race.

data.v: एको ह्यपि बहून्हन्ति घ्नन्त्येकं बहवोऽप्युत । शूरं कापुरुषो हन्ति अयशस्वी यशस्विनम् ।।
data.md: One man kills many; and many also united kill one. A coward kills a real hero, known to fame, a renowned warrior.

data.v: जयश्चैवोभयोर्दृष्ट उभयोश्च पराजयः । तथैवापचयो दृष्टो व्यपयाने क्षयव्ययौ ।।
data.md: Both parties cannot live to behold victory nor can both parties live to see defeat but the waste and the loss may be seen to be on both sides. To a man attempting to fly there come both loss (of life, and expense.

data.v: सर्वथा वृजिनं युद्धं को घ्नन्न प्रतिहन्यते । हतस्य च हृषीकेश समौ जयपराजयौ ।।
data.md: In all cases fight is an evil. Who that strikes is not struck in return? But victory and defeat, O Hrishikesha, are of the same moment to one that is killed.

data.v: पराजयश्च मरणान्मन्ये नैव विशिष्यते । यस्य स्याद्विजयः कृष्ण तस्याप्यपचयो ध्रुवम् ।।
data.md: Defeat is not very much better than death I think; he on whose side victory is declared, O Krishna, also has surely to meet with a loss.

data.v: अन्ततो दयितं घ्नन्ति केचिदप्यपरे जनाः । तस्याङ्ग बलहीनस्य पुत्रान्भ्रातॄनपश्यतः । निर्वेदो जीविते कृष्ण सर्वतश्चोपजायते ।।
data.md: At least the men on the other side kill some one who is dear; and a man, thus rendered weak, O adorable one and not seeing his sons and brothers.

data.v: ये ह्येव वीरा ह्रीमन्त आर्याः करुणवेदिनः । त एव युद्धे हन्यन्ते यवीयान्मुच्यते जनः ।।
data.md: Lives on, O Krishna, as if in unconsciousness and his purposes are foiled at every step. Those who are modest, prudent, honourable, kind and wise are killed in battle; while a wicked avoids defeat. Even after killing the enemy we become a prey to repentance, OJanardana.

data.v: हत्वाप्यनुशयो नित्यं परानपि जनार्दन । अनुबन्धश्च पापोऽत्र शेषश्चाप्यवशिष्यते ।।
शेषो हि बलमासाद्य न शेषमवशेषयेत् । सर्वोच्छेदे च यतते वैरस्यान्तविधित्सया ।।
जयो वैरं प्रसृजति दुःखमास्ते पराजितः । सुखं प्रशान्तः स्वपिति हित्वा जयपराजयौ ।।
जातवैरश्च पुरुषो दुःखं स्वपिति नित्यदा । अनिर्वृतेन मनसा ससर्प इव वेश्मनि ।।
उत्सादयति यः सर्वं यशसा स वियुज्यते । अकीर्तिं सर्वभूतेषु शाश्वतीं स नियच्छति ।।
न हि वैराणि शाम्यन्ति दीर्घकालकृतान्यपि । आख्यातारश्च विद्यन्ते पुमांश्चोत्पद्यते कुले ।।
न चापि वैरं वैरेण केशव व्युपशाम्यति । हविषाग्निर्यथा कृष्ण भूय एवाभिवर्धते ।।
अतोऽन्यथा नास्ति शान्तिर्नित्यमन्तरमन्ततः । अन्तरं लिप्समानानामयं दोषो निरन्तरः ।।
पौरुषेयो हि बलवानाधिर्हृदयबाधनः । तस्य त्यागेन वा शान्तिर्निवृत्त्या मनसोऽपि वा ।।
data.md: Defects may always be found on either side, by which advantage is sought to be obtained. Manly strength is ever the source of pain in the innermost heart of a man; and peace is attainable only by leaving aside war or by death.

data.v: अथ वा मूलघातेन द्विषतां मधुसूदन । फलनिर्वृत्तिरिद्धा स्यात्तन्नृशंसतरं भवेत् ।।
data.md: By putting an end to the enemy to the roots, O slayer of Madhu, we can attain to our object; but it is most cruel.

data.v: या तु त्यागेन शान्तिः स्यात्तदृते वध एव सः । संशयाच्च समुच्छेदाद्द्विषतामात्मनस्तथा ।।
data.md: The peace that we can obtain by foregoing our claim to the kingdom is in effect the same thing as the total extinction of ourselves and the enemy or the uncertainly of victory.

data.v: न च त्यक्तुं तदिच्छामो न चेच्छामः कुलक्षयम् । अत्र या प्रणिपातेन शान्तिः सैव गरीयसी ।।
data.md: We do not wish to give up that (kingdom); nor do you wish death of our family; and in such a case that peace which we can obtain through bending ourselves to the will of the other side is preferable.

data.v: सर्वथा यतमानानामयुद्धमभिकाङ्क्षताम् । सान्त्वे प्रतिहते युद्धं प्रसिद्धमपराक्रमम् ।।
data.md: When all the attempts of those, who are trying to obtain the kingdom by all means without war, fail; then war is proper for them and not a show of weakness.

data.v: प्रतिघातेन सान्त्वस्य दारुणं संप्रवर्तते । तच्छुनामिव गोपादे पण्डितैरुपलक्षितम् ।।
data.md: On the event of these (attempts at obtaining the desired object without war), the results that follow are terrible. All these have been observed by wise men in a war between dogs.

data.v: लाङ्गूलचालनं क्ष्वेडः प्रतिरावो विवर्तनम् । दन्तदर्शनमारावस्ततो युद्धं प्रवर्तते ।।
data.md: First there comes the wagging of tails, then the bark, then the replying back, then the turning of one round the other, then the show of teeth, then the roaring and then comes the commencement of the fight.

data.v: तत्र यो बलवान्कृष्ण जित्वा सोऽत्ति तदामिषम् । एवमेव मनुष्येषु विशेषो नास्ति कश्चन ।।
data.md: In the fight the one, who is stronger, O Krishna, gains the victory and eats the other's flesh. Such is the case with men; there is no difference whatever.

data.v: सर्वथा त्वेतदुचितं दुर्बलेषु बलीयसाम् । अनादरो विरोधश्च प्रणिपाती हि दुर्बलः ।।
data.md: It should always be the duty of a strong man not to crush hostility with the weak; and the weak should be deferential to the strong.

data.v: पिता राजा च वृद्धश्च सर्वथा मानमर्हति । तस्मान्मान्यश्च पूज्यश्च धृतराष्ट्रो जनार्दन ।।
data.md: It is proper that the father, the king and the aged should be treated always with respect; therefore is Dhritarashtra the object of our worship and respect, O Janardana.

data.md: Duryodhana, O lord of men, will not be able to return you any portion of your prosperous territories which were yours in days of old and which he stole from you at a game of dice.

data.md: Bhima said In such a way that there may be peace among the Kurus, O slayer of Madhu, should you speak. Do not frighten them with the prospect of war.

data.md: Resentful wrathful, not accepting what is for his good and of a vain disposition, Duryodhana should not be spoken to in harsh terms. He should be treated with courtesy.

data.md: He is by nature of a wicked disposition and has a heart equal to that of the robbers; he is vain with the sense of possession of prosperity and an enemy of the Pandavas.

data.md: He is without foresight and cruel; and he has the habit of finding fault with others; and he is of crooked prowess, of malice which lasts for a long time and does not permit himself to be led by others, of a wicked soul and fond of deceit.

data.md: Even if he dies he would not tender his submission, nor give up or alter his own opinions. Peace with such an one, O Krishna, I consider to be difficult of effecting.

data.md: So has this Duryodhana been born at the end of this Yuga in our family-that of the Kurus-that wicked individual, the vilest and most despicable of his race, for the extinction of his race.

data.md: There should he be spoken slowly and mildly in words conducive to our interests and to virtue and worldly good and going fully into the subject, so as to attract his heart towards us and not in harsh words, O you of terrific strength.

data.md: Alas, O son of Pritha, you see in your mind's eye the omens unfavourable to you, whether you are asleep or awake. Therefore do you desire peace!

data.v: किं मात्यवाक्षीः परुषैर्व्रणं सूच्या इवानघ । यथामति ब्रवीम्येतद्विद्धि मामधिकं ततः ।।
द्रष्टासि युधि संबाधे प्रवृत्ते वैशसेऽहनि । मया प्रणुन्नान्मातङ्गान्रथिनः सादिनस्तथा ।।
तथा नरानभिक्रुद्धं निघ्नन्तं क्षत्रियर्षभान् । द्रष्टा मां त्वं च लोकश्च विकर्षन्तं वरान्वरान् ।।
data.md: You will see and the world will see me cutting down the foremost warriors. The marrow of my bones is not wasted away; nor does my mind shake with fear!

data.v: न मे सीदन्ति मज्जानो न ममोद्वेपते मनः । सर्वलोकादभिक्रुद्धान्न भयं विद्यते मम ।।
किं तु सौहृदमेवैतत्कृपया मधुसूदन । सर्वांस्तितिक्षे संक्लेशान्मा स्म नो भरता नशन् ।।
data.md: I have no fear from all the worlds moved with wrath against me. But I am evincing these good wishes only out of mercy, O destroyer of Madhu. I can bear all sorts of troubles, if the Bharatas are not annihilated.

data.v: भावं जिज्ञासमानोऽहं प्रणयादिदमब्रुवम् । न चाक्षेपान्न पाण्डित्यान्न क्रोधान्न विवक्षया ।।
data.md: The blessed God said Desiring to know your intentions, I said this of affection and out of a desire to find fault with you, nor out of a desire to show my learning, not from anger, nor from a desire of saying something.

data.v: वेदाहं तव माहात्म्यमुत ते वेद यद्बलम् । उत ते वेद कर्माणि न त्वां परिभवाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: I know the greatness of your soul; and I know what strength you possess; and I know also your deeds; and I do not find fault with you.

data.v: यथा चात्मनि कल्याणं संभावयसि पाण्डव । सहस्रगुणमप्येतत्त्वयि संभावयाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: What good you yourself consider possible to do to the Pandavas, I consider it possible for you to do a thousand times of that.

data.v: यादृशे च कुले जन्म सर्वराजाभिपूजिते । बन्धुभिश्च सुहृद्भिश्च भीम त्वमसि तादृशः ।।
data.md: You along with your friend and wellwishers, are just what you ought to be, being born in such a family worshipped by all the kings.

data.v: जिज्ञासन्तो हि धर्मस्य संदिग्धस्य वृकोदर । पर्यायं न व्यवस्यन्ति दैवमानुषयोर्जनाः ।।
data.md: O Vrikodara, those men, who enquire after the certainty of the consequence of virtue and vice in the next world in a spirit of doubt any matter regarding god or man, can never arrive at the right conclusion.

data.v: स एव हेतुर्भूत्वा हि पुरुषस्यार्थसिद्धिषु । विनाशेऽपि स एवास्य संदिग्धं कर्म पौरुषम् ।।
data.md: The same thing which is the cause of the attainment of the object of man is (sometimes) also the cause of his ruin. The effect of human acts therefore is doubtful.

data.v: अन्यथा परिदृष्टानि कविभिर्दोषदर्शिभिः । अन्यथा परिवर्तन्ते वेगा इव नभस्वतः ।।
data.md: The act recommended to be followed by wise men competent to foresee the evil effects of actions have consequences other than those foreseen, like the winds from heaven (the direction taken by which no one can predict).

data.v: सुमन्त्रितं सुनीतं च न्यायतश्चोपपादितम् । कृतं मानुष्यकं कर्म दैवेनापि विरुध्यते ।।
data.md: The acts performed by a man well advised, well controlled and done in a way not injurious to any body has contrary effect by the dispensations of Providence.

data.v: दैवमप्यकृतं कर्म पौरुषेण विहन्यते । शीतमुष्णं तथा वर्षं क्षुत्पिपासे च भारत ।।
data.md: Then, again, the dispensation of the gods, that are not the results of any particular actions, are neutralized by the actions of men; as for instance cold, heat and rain and hunger and thirst, O Bharata.

data.v: यदन्यद्दिष्टभावस्य पुरुषस्य स्वयंकृतम् । तस्मादनवरोधश्च विद्यते तत्र लक्षणम् ।।
data.md: Over and above the actions that a man is destined to perform, he can do away with others as well at his will; which the Shastras testify.

data.v: लोकस्य नान्यतो वृत्तिः पाण्डवान्यत्र कर्मणः । एवंबुद्धिः प्रवर्तेत फलं स्यादुभयान्वयात् ।।
data.md: Since, O son of Pandu, there is no other way for than action. A man should engage in acts with this knowledge; and the result will be brought about by both preordainment and action.

data.v: य एवं कृतबुद्धिः सन्कर्मस्वेव प्रवर्तते । नासिद्धौ व्यथते तस्य न सिद्धौ हर्षमश्नुते ।।
data.md: He who engages in action with this knowledge is not annoyed at failure; nor is he elated with success.

data.v: तत्रेयमर्थमात्रा मे भीमसेन विवक्षिता । नैकान्तसिद्धिर्मन्तव्या कुरुभिः सह संयुगे ।।
data.md: In this sense, O Bhimasena, did I speak; and I did not mean that in a battle with the enemy; success would be absolutely theirs.

data.v: नातिप्रणीतरश्मिः स्यात्तथा भवति पर्यये । विषादमर्छेद्ग्लानिं वा एतदर्थं ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.md: I am speaking all this to you; as when a man's intellect is confused, he should not be wholly devoid of cheerfulness; nor yield wholly to sadness or dullness.

data.v: श्वोभूते धृतराष्ट्रस्य समीपं प्राप्य पाण्डव । यतिष्ये प्रशमं कर्तुं युष्मदर्थमहापयन् ।।
data.md: At the dawn of day, going near Dhritarashtra, O son of Pandu, shall I try to effect peace without a sacrifice of your interests.

data.v: शमं चेत्ते करिष्यन्ति ततोऽनन्तं यशो मम । भवतां च कृतः कामस्तेषां च श्रेय उत्तमम् ।।
data.md: If they consent to peace, then unending fame will be mine; while your desires will be fulfilled and advantage will accrue to them.

data.v: ते चेदभिनिवेक्ष्यन्ति नाभ्युपैष्यन्ति मे वचः । कुरवो युद्धमेवात्र रौद्रं कर्म भविष्यति ।।
data.md: If however they stick to their resolve and not listen to my advice, in that case there will be a terrible war among the sons of Kuru.

data.v: अस्मिन्युद्धे भीमसेन त्वयि भारः समाहितः । धूरर्जुनेन धार्या स्याद्वोढव्य इतरो जनः ।।
data.md: In this battle, O 0 Bhimasena, the responsibility of guiding the car of war rests on you; while Arjuna will draw the car, on which will be seated other persons.

data.v: अहं हि यन्ता बीभत्सोर्भविता संयुगे सति । धनंजयस्यैष कामो न हि युद्धं न कामये ।।
data.md: The war taking place, I shall drive Vibhatsu's car; for such is the desire of Dhananjaya and not because I myself am desirous of fight.

data.v: तस्मादाशङ्कमानोऽहं वृकोदर मतिं तव । तुदन्नक्लीबया वाचा तेजस्ते समदीपयम् ।।
data.md: Therefore did I, fearful of the direction your inclination might follow from your words which were like those of an eunuch, rekindle your energy, O Vrikodara.

data.v: उक्तं युधिष्ठिरेणैव यावद्वाच्यं जनार्दन । तव वाक्यं तु मे श्रुत्वा प्रतिभाति परंतप ।।
data.md: Arjuna said By Yudhishthira has been uttered all that ought to be spoken, O Janardana; but hearing your words, O chastiser of foes, it seems to me.

data.v: नैव प्रशममत्र त्वं मन्यसे सुकरं प्रभो । लोभाद्वा धृतराष्ट्रस्य दैन्याद्वा समुपस्थितात् ।।
data.md: That you do not consider peace to be easily obtainable in this instance, O Lord, owing either to avarice on the part of Dhritarashtra or the weakness of ourselves.

data.v: अफलं मन्यसे चापि पुरुषस्य पराक्रमम् । न चान्तरेण कर्माणि पौरुषेण फलोदयः ।।
data.md: You consider, too, that human strength (alone) is without avail and that human desires are fruitless save when attended with action.

data.v: तदिदं भाषितं वाक्यं तथा च न तथैव च । न चैतदेवं द्रष्टव्यमसाध्यमिति किंचन ।।
data.md: These words spoken by you may or may not be true; but there is nothing which ought to be regarded as incapable of attainment.

data.v: किं चैतन्मन्यसे कृच्छ्रमस्माकं पापमादितः । कुर्वन्ति तेषां कर्माणि येषां नास्ति फलोदयः ।।
data.md: You consider peace to be improbable owing to our weakness; but they are doing deeds, which do not seem to bear fruits.

data.v: संपाद्यमानं सम्यक्च स्यात्कर्म सफलं प्रभो । स तथा कृष्ण वर्तस्व यथा शर्म भवेत्परैः ।।
data.md: Done in a proper way, however, our object may be successful, O lord, therefore, O Krishna, act in such a way that there may be enemy.

data.v: पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च भवान्परमकः सुहृत् । सुराणामसुराणां च यथा वीर प्रजापतिः ।।
data.md: You are the best well-wisher of ourselves, of both the Kurus and the Pandavas; as the hero Prajapati was of the Suras and the Asuras.

data.v: कुरूणां पाण्डवानां च प्रतिपत्स्व निरामयम् । अस्मद्धितमनुष्ठातुं न मन्ये तव दुष्करम् ।।
data.md: Do, therefore, that which is conducive to the interests of both the Kurus and the Pandavas. I think that the accomplishment of what is for our good is not difficult for you; and this is a work which is the proper thing for you to do, O Janardana.

data.v: एवं चेत्कार्यतामेति कार्यं तव जनार्दन । गमनादेवमेव त्वं करिष्यसि न संशयः ।।
data.md: You will accomplish this, as soon as you go there, O Janardana; and, O hero, if any other treatment of that evil-souled one is derived by you; it will be as you wish, whether it is to be peace with them or not or whatever is desired by you.

data.v: चिकीर्षितमथान्यत्ते तस्मिन्वीर दुरात्मनि । भविष्यति तथा सर्वं यथा तव चिकीर्षितम् ।।
data.md: O Krishna, whatever you desire after mature deliberation will be accepted by us with due respect. Is not death proper for that evil-minded one, as well as for his friends and sons?

data.v: शर्म तैः सह वा नोऽस्तु तव वा यच्चिकीर्षितम् । विचार्यमाणो यः कामस्तव कृष्ण स नो गुरुः ।।
data.md: By whom was seen the beauty of prosperity established on the son of Dharma; and who on seeing that had no righteous means (of wining the kingdom) O slayer of Madhu.

data.v: न स नार्हति दुष्टात्मा वधं ससुतबान्धवः । येन धर्मसुते दृष्ट्वा न सा श्रीरुपमर्षिता ।।
यच्चाप्यपश्यतोपायं धर्मिष्ठं मधुसूदन । उपायेन नृशंसेन हृता दुर्द्यूतदेविना ।।
कथं हि पुरुषो जातः क्षत्रियेषु धनुर्धरः । समाहूतो निवर्तेत प्राणत्यागेऽप्युपस्थिते ।।
अधर्मेण जितान्दृष्ट्वा वने प्रव्रजितांस्तथा । वध्यतां मम वार्ष्णेय निर्गतोऽसौ सुयोधनः ।।
data.md: Did I think that Suyodhana ought to be slain by me when I came out of the forest, O you of the Vrishini race; but what you desire to do on behalf of your friends is not strange, O Krishna, though how that is capable of accomplishment by mildness or by other means (I do not see).

data.v: न चैतदद्भुतं कृष्ण मित्रार्थे यच्चिकीर्षसि । क्रिया कथं नु मुख्या स्यान्मृदुना वेतरेण वा ।।
अथ वा मन्यसे ज्यायान्वधस्तेषामनन्तरम् । तदेव क्रियतामाशु न विचार्यमतस्त्वया ।।
data.md: If you consider their immediate destruction better, do that instantly for there is nothing to be considered about in this matter.

data.v: जानासि हि यथा तेन द्रौपदी पापबुद्धिना । परिक्लिष्टा सभामध्ये तच्च तस्यापि मर्षितम् ।।
data.md: You know, how by that evil-minded one Draupadi was troubled and annoyed in the midst of the Council and that act of his was borne with difficulty.

data.v: स नाम सम्यग्वर्तेत पाण्डवेष्विति माधव । न मे संजायते बुद्धिर्बीजमुप्तमिवोषरे ।।
data.md: That he should treat the Pandavas justly, O Madhava, dose not seem possible to me. Good counsel to him will give the same result as seed thrown on barren lands.

data.v: तस्माद्यन्मन्यसे युक्तं पाण्डवानां च यद्धितम् । तदाशु कुरु वार्ष्णेय यन्नः कार्यमनन्तरम् ।।
data.md: There for what you consider proper and beneficial for Kurus, What ought to be done next by us, do immediately.

data.v: एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि पाण्डव । सर्वं त्विदं समायत्तं बीभत्सो कर्मणोर्द्वयोः ।।
data.md: Everything about these two acts (peace and war) is within my power. Land is moistened and purified (i.e. all weeds are rooted out of it) by action.

data.v: क्षेत्रं हि रसवच्छुद्धं कर्षकेणोपपादितम् । ऋते वर्षं न कौन्तेय जातु निर्वर्तयेत्फलम् ।।
तत्र वै पौरुषं ब्रूयुरासेकं यत्नकारितम् । तत्र चापि ध्रुवं पश्येच्छोषणं दैवकारितम् ।।
तदिदं निश्चितं बुद्ध्या पूर्वैरपि महात्मभिः । दैवे च मानुषे चैव संयुक्तं लोककारणम् ।।
data.md: But there even (i.e. even in artificial irrigation) you will surely behold draught brought on by divine agency (if He so will it). Knowing this to be the case, the great-souled ones of old.

data.v: अहं हि तत्करिष्यामि परं पुरुषकारतः । दैवं तु न मया शक्यं कर्म कर्तुं कथंचन ।।
स हि धर्मं च सत्यं च त्यक्त्वा चरति दुर्मतिः । न हि संतप्यते तेन तथारूपेण कर्मणा ।।
तां चापि बुद्धिं पापिष्ठां वर्धयन्त्यस्य मन्त्रिणः । शकुनिः सूतपुत्रश्च भ्राता दुःशासनस्तथा ।।
data.md: And he dose not regret for doing that sort of acts; and his inclinations which are so vicious are supported by his advisers.

data.v: स हि त्यागेन राज्यस्य न शमं समुपेष्यति । अन्तरेण वधात्पार्थ सानुबन्धः सुयोधनः ।।
न चापि प्रणिपातेन त्यक्तुमिच्छति धर्मराट् । याच्यमानस्तु राज्यं स न प्रदास्यति दुर्मतिः ।।
data.md: Without the slaying of Suyodhana and his kinsmen, O son of Pritha, he dose not desire to give up (the kingdom), not even by our surrendering to him, O virtuous king. That evilminded one will not give you the kingdom by your asking for it.

data.v: न तु मन्ये स तद्वाच्यो यद्युधिष्ठिरशासनम् । उक्तं प्रयोजनं तत्र धर्मराजेन भारत ।।
data.md: I think that Yudhishthira's message ought to be conveyed to him; what is necessary and proper has already been said by the virtuous king, O Bharata.

data.v: तथा पापस्तु तत्सर्वं न करिष्यति कौरवः । तस्मिंश्चाक्रियमाणेऽसौ लोकवध्यो भविष्यति ।।
data.md: The one who is such vicious inclinations will not do even that in its entirety, O son of Kuru; and he, refusing compliance with that will deserve death in this world.

data.v: मम चापि स वध्यो वै जगतश्चापि भारत । येन कौमारके यूयं सर्वे विप्रकृतास्तथा ।।
data.md: (In that case) he would deserve death at my hands and at the hands of the entire world. By him you all in your youth were ever persecuted.

data.v: विप्रलुप्तं च वो राज्यं नृशंसेन दुरात्मना । न चोपशाम्यते पापः श्रियं दृष्ट्वा युधिष्ठिरे ।।
data.md: (And since) your kingdom has been wrested by means of deceit by that evil-souled one, who would not obtain peace at seeing prosperity in Yudhishthira.

data.v: असकृच्चाप्यहं तेन त्वत्कृते पार्थ भेदितः । न मया तद्गृहीतं च पापं तस्य चिकीर्षितम् ।।
data.md: I, too, O son of Pritha, was sought to be withdrawn from four side by that vicious one; but that evil counsel of his was not accepted by me.

data.v: जानासि हि महाबाहो त्वमप्यस्य परं मतम् । प्रियं चिकीर्षमाणं च धर्मराजस्य मामपि ।।
data.md: You, too, know, O you of long of arms, his dearly cherished intentions and purposes; and that the good of the king of virtue is ever desired to be accomplished by me.

data.v: स जानंस्तस्य चात्मानं मम चैव परं मतम् । अजानन्निव चाकस्मादर्जुनाद्याभिशङ्कसे ।।
data.md: Knowing then his purposes and my dearly cherished intentions, why do you, O Arjuna, seem to be afraid of me, as if you did not know them.

data.v: यच्चापि परमं दिव्यं तच्चाप्यवगतं त्वया । विधानविहितं पार्थ कथं शर्म भवेत्परैः ।।
data.md: The one prime object, that has been ordained in Heaven, is known to you. How then can your advice of peace with the enemy be followed?

data.v: यत्तु वाचा मया शक्यं कर्मणा चापि पाण्डव । करिष्ये तदहं पार्थ न त्वाशंसे शमं परैः ।।
data.md: Whatever is capable of being done by me, by speech or by deed, O Pandava, shall be done by me, O son of Pritha, but do not expect peace with the enemy;

data.v: कथं गोहरणे ब्रूयादिच्छञ्शर्म तथाविधम् । याच्यमानोऽपि भीष्मेण संवत्सरगतेऽध्वनि ।।
data.md: Why was not this very peace, which is so beneficial, proposed by Bhishma and humbly besought by him at the time of attacking the cattle of Virata, which is now a year since, concluded?

data.v: तदैव ते पराभूता यदा संकल्पितास्त्वया । लवशः क्षणशश्चापि न च तुष्टः सुयोधनः ।।
data.md: At that moment have they been vanquished, when their defeat has been determined on by you. Suyodhana is not satisfied at the prospect of parting with a small part of his kingdom for even a very brief period.

data.md: The instructions of the king of virtue will always be attended to by me; and the wicked acts of that evil-souled one will have again to be considered by me.

data.md: Nakula said Words of different degrees of worth have been said by the just king, O Madhava, who knows what righteousness is and who is benevolent; and they have all been heard by you.

data.v: मतमाज्ञाय राज्ञश्च भीमसेनेन माधव । संशमो बाहुवीर्यं च ख्यापितं माधवात्मनः ।।
data.md: Bhimasena, having ascertained the wishes of the king, has dwelt on peace as well as on his own strength of arms, O Madhava.

data.v: तथैव फल्गुनेनापि यदुक्तं तत्त्वया श्रुतम् । आत्मनश्च मतं वीर कथितं भवतासकृत् ।।
data.md: In the same way what has been said by Falguna has been heard by you; and your own opinions, O hero have been expressed by you.

data.md: Shutting your mind to all this and hearing what the intentions of the enemy are, do that what you consider to be opportune, O foremost among men.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तस्मिन्निमित्ते हि मतं भवति केशव । प्राप्तकालं मनुष्येण स्वयं कार्यमरिंदम ।।
data.md: Different conclusions are arrived at in different matters, O Keshava, but with a view to success, O chastiser of your enemies, a thing ought to be done by man at the right moment.

data.v: अन्यथा चिन्तितो ह्यर्थः पुनर्भवति सोऽन्यथा । अनित्यमतयो लोके नराः पुरुषसत्तम ।।
data.md: An object, settled on in a particular way, again becomes different, when the conditions are changed; therefore man cannot stick to the same opinions in this world, O you foremost among men.

data.v: अन्यथा बुद्धयो ह्यासन्नस्मासु वनवासिषु । अदृश्येष्वन्यथा कृष्ण दृश्येषु पुनरन्यथा ।।
data.md: While residing in the wood, we were of a different inclination; and while in concealment we came to be of other inclination. But now when we are out of concealment, when we can expose ourselves to the view of others, our inclinations are again changed.

data.v: अस्माकमपि वार्ष्णेय वने विचरतां तदा । न तथा प्रणयो राज्ये यथा संप्रति वर्तते ।।
data.md: O you of the Vrishni race, the love of kingdom, which now exists among us, did not exist to the same degree when we wandered in the woods.

data.v: निवृत्तवनवासान्नः श्रुत्वा वीर समागताः । अक्षौहिण्यो हि सप्तेमास्त्वत्प्रसादाज्जनार्दन ।।
data.md: Hearing that, we are returned from our exile in the woods, O hero. These seven Akshauhinis have gathered round us through your grace, OJanardana.

data.v: इमान्हि पुरुषव्याघ्रानचिन्त्यबलपौरुषान् । आत्तशस्त्रान्रणे दृष्ट्वा न व्यथेदिह कः पुमान् ।।
data.md: What man is there who, seeing these tigers among men of inconceivable strength and prowess and ready for battle with all their arms, will not be struck with fear?

data.v: स भवान्कुरुमध्ये तं सान्त्वपूर्वं भयान्वितम् । ब्रूयाद्वाक्यं यथा मन्दो न व्यथेत सुयोधनः ।।
data.md: Therefore do you in the midst of the Kurus speak words fraught with mildness, so that the foolish Suyodhana may not be struck with fear; and then (when these have failed) use threats.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरं भीमसेनं बीभत्सुं चापराजितम् । सहदेवं च मां चैव त्वां च रामं च केशव ।।
सात्यकिं च महावीर्यं विराटं च सहात्मजम् । द्रुपदं च सहामात्यं धृष्टद्युम्नं च पार्षतम् ।।

स भवान्गमनादेव साधयिष्यत्यसंशयम् । इष्टमर्थं महाबाहो धर्मराजस्य केवलम् ।।
data.md: Therefore you will the moment you go there, accomplish without doubt the only object desired by the virtuous king, O you of long arms. are

data.v: विदुरश्चैव भीष्मश्च द्रोणश्च सहबाह्लिकः । श्रेयः समर्था विज्ञातुमुच्यमानं त्वयानघ ।।
data.md: Vidura, Bhishma and Drona with Bahlika are capable of understanding yourself and of speaking words of wisdom of wisdom which beneficial at the same time.

data.v: ते चैनमनुनेष्यन्ति धृतराष्ट्रं जनाधिपम् । तं च पापसमाचारं सहामात्यं सुयोधनम् ।।
data.md: And they too will lead Dhritarashtra, the lord of men and that Suyodhana of wicked nature with his ministers to do as you bid.

data.v: श्रोता चार्थस्य विदुरस्त्वं च वक्ता जनार्दन । कमिवार्थं विवर्तन्तं स्थापयेतां न वर्त्मनि ।।
data.md: When you, O Janardana, speak and Vidura hears on subjects conducive to their interests; what subject is there in the world which you cannot turn smooth and clear.

data.v: यदेतत्कथितं राज्ञा धर्म एष सनातनः । यथा तु युद्धमेव स्यात्तथा कार्यमरिंदम ।।
data.md: Sahadeva said All this which has been said by the king is eternal virtue; but, O chastiser of foes, should act in that way by which there shall be war.

data.v: यदि प्रशममिच्छेयुः कुरवः पाण्डवैः सह । तथापि युद्धं दाशार्ह योजयेथाः सहैव तैः ।।
data.md: If even the sons of Kuru desire peace with the sons of Pandu, still do you provoke war with them, O you of the Dasharha race.

data.v: कथं नु दृष्ट्वा पाञ्चालीं तथा क्लिष्टां सभागताम् । अवधेन प्रशाम्येत मम मन्युः सुयोधने ।।
data.md: Having seen the princess of Panchala come in the assembly, O Krishna, annoyed in that fashion, how can my wrath towards Suyodhana be appeased without killing him?

data.v: यदि भीमार्जुनौ कृष्ण धर्मराजश्च धार्मिकः । धर्ममुत्सृज्य तेनाहं योद्धुमिच्छामि संयुगे ।।
data.md: If Bhima and Arjuna, O Krishna and the virtuous king are virtuous, then I leading the path of virtue desire to fight with him in battle.

data.v: सत्यमाह महाबाहो सहदेवो महामतिः । दुर्योधनवधे शान्तिस्तस्य कोपस्य मे भवेत् ।।
data.md: Satyaki said Sahadeva of large mind has spoken the truth, O you of long arms. His wrath and mine will be appeased only by killing Duryodhana.
