data.md: Do you not know that you, too seeing the Pandavas clad in rags and deer skin in the forest, felt very sorry and your wrath was kindled

data.md: Therefore what the heroic son of Madri terrific in battle has said is the opinion of all the soldiers, O you foremost of men.

data.v: एवं वदति वाक्यं तु युयुधाने महामतौ । सुभीमः सिंहनादोऽभूद्योधानां तत्र सर्वशः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said While Suyodhana of large mind was yet speaking such, a terrible roar like that of a lion came from all the soldiers assembled there.

data.md: And all the heroes accepted and honoured these words of his in every way saying-Well done, well done; and the soldiers desirous of battle expressed their joy.

data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing the king's words which were beneficial as well as conducive to morality and worldly good, Krishna, the daughter of king Drupada, of long and very black tresses, afflicted with grief, said to the scion of the Dasharha race, who was seated there, after having given due respects to Sahadeva and the great car-warrior Satyaki.

data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing the king's words which were beneficial as well as conducive to morality and worldly good, Krishna, the daughter of king Drupada, of long and very black tresses, afflicted with grief, said to the scion of the Dasharha race, who was seated there, after having given due respects to Sahadeva and the great car-warrior Satyaki.

data.v: भीमसेनं च संशान्तं दृष्ट्वा परमदुर्मनाः । अश्रुपूर्णेक्षणा वाक्यमुवाचेदं मनस्विनी ।।
data.md: Seeing Bhimasena inclined towards peace, that intelligent lady with a sense of her wrongs said these words with tears in her eyes:

data.md: O you of long arms, this is known to you. slayer of Madhu, how the Pandavas were deprived of all happiness through deceit.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रेण सामात्येन जनार्दन । यथा च संजयो राज्ञा मन्त्रं रहसि श्रावितः ।।
data.md: By the son of Dhritarashtra within ministers, O Janardana; and what message was covered through Sanjaya in private by the king.

data.md: Yudhishthira, that too is known to you of the Dasharha race and by you has been heard all what Sanjaya said.

data.md: O you of great luster, (this was the massage) give us, O sire, five villages namely, Avisthala, Vrikasthala, Makandi, Varanavata and any one for the last or the fifth, O you of long arms. In these terms was Duryodhana to be addressed and his friends too, O Keshava.

data.md: O you of great luster, (this was the massage) give us, O sire, five villages namely, Avisthala, Vrikasthala, Makandi, Varanavata and any one for the last or the fifth, O you of long arms. In these terms was Duryodhana to be addressed and his friends too, O Keshava.

data.v: तच्चापि नाकरोद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा कृष्ण सुयोधनः । युधिष्ठिरस्य दाशार्ह ह्रीमतः संधिमिच्छतः ।।
data.md: Suyodhana, though he heard these words of Yudhishthira endued with prosperity and desirous if peace, did not act up to them, O you of the Dasharha race.

data.md: If, O Krishna, Suyodhana desires peace without returning the kingdom; then it is by no means proper that you should go there.

data.v: शक्ष्यन्ति हि महाबाहो पाण्डवाः सृञ्जयैः सह । धार्तराष्ट्रबलं घोरं क्रुद्धं प्रतिसमासितुम् ।।
data.md: O you of long arms, the Pandavas supported by the Srinjayas will be able to fight with the terrible army of Dhritarashtra excited with range.

data.v: न हि साम्ना न दानेन शक्योऽर्थस्तेषु कश्चन । तस्मात्तेषु न कर्तव्या कृपा ते मधुसूदन ।।
data.md: Not by peaceful means, nor by surrender can our object be gained from them; therefore, O destroyer of Madhu, mercy ought not to be shown to them by you.

data.v: साम्ना दानेन वा कृष्ण ये न शाम्यन्ति शत्रवः । मोक्तव्यस्तेषु दण्डः स्याज्जीवितं परिरक्षता ।।
data.md: Those enemies, who do not assume an attitude of peace by words of humility or by surrender, ought to be visited with punishment by him who cares to preserve his life.

data.v: तस्मात्तेषु महादण्डः क्षेप्तव्यः क्षिप्रमच्युत । त्वया चैव महाबाहो पाण्डवैः सह सृञ्जयैः ।।
data.md: Therefore should heavy punishment fall or them from yourself, O Acchyuta of long arms, supported by the Pandavas and the Srinjayas.

data.v: एतत्समर्थं पार्थानां तव चैव यशस्करम् । क्रियमाणं भवेत्कृष्ण क्षत्रस्य च सुखावहम् ।।
data.md: This would be just the thing for the son of Pritha to do; and will also redound to your glory; and the accomplishment will be, O Krishna, the source of happiness to the entire Kshatriya race.

data.v: क्षत्रियेण हि हन्तव्यः क्षत्रियो लोभमास्थितः । अक्षत्रियो वा दाशार्ह स्वधर्ममनुतिष्ठता ।।
data.md: A Kshatriya who is avaricious ought to be killed by a Kshatriya who is desirous of proving true to his our religion; and even if the covetous man is not a Kshatriya he ought to be slain.

data.v: अन्यत्र ब्राह्मणात्तात सर्वपापेष्ववस्थितात् । गुरुर्हि सर्ववर्णानां ब्राह्मणः प्रसृताग्रभुक् ।।
data.md: An exception should be made, O Sire, in the case of a Brahmana, though he be addicted to all sorts of vices; for a Brahmana is the preceptor of all the other classes and he is allowed precedence in everything.

data.v: यथावध्ये भवेद्दोषो वध्यमाने जनार्दन । स वध्यस्यावधे दृष्ट इति धर्मविदो विदुः ।।
data.md: The sin, that accrues from killing from one that ought but to be killed, is ihe fame as that which accrues him not slaying one that deserves death. Such has been the instructions of those conversant with the rulers of virtue.

data.v: यथा त्वां न स्पृशेदेष दोषः कृष्ण तथा कुरु । पाण्डवैः सह दाशार्ह सृञ्जयैश्च ससैनिकैः ।।
data.md: Do that, O Krishna, so that this sin may not touch you along with the Pandavas, O you of the Dasharha race and the Srinjayas and their armies.

data.v: पुनरुक्तं च वक्ष्यामि विश्रम्भेण जनार्दन । का नु सीमन्तिनी मादृक्पृथिव्यामस्ति केशव ।।
data.md: Out of excessive confidence on you, O Janardana, that I repeat what has been already repeated again and again. What woman is there in this world equal to me?

data.md: The daughter of king Drupada born of the sacrificial altar, sister of Dhrishtadyumna and your dear friend, O Krishna.

data.v: आजमीढकुलं प्राप्ता स्नुषा पाण्डोर्महात्मनः । महिषी पाण्डुपुत्राणां पञ्चेन्द्रसमवर्चसाम् ।।
data.md: I have become a member of the Ajamida race; and the daughter-in-law of the highsouled Pandu and the chief queen of the sons of Pandu, who in splendor are equal to five Indra's.

data.v: सुता मे पञ्चभिर्वीरैः पञ्च जाता महारथाः । अभिमन्युर्यथा कृष्ण तथा ते तव धर्मतः ।।
data.md: By the five heroes are born of me five sons, great car-warriors, who morally bear the same relation with you, O Krishna, as Abhimanyu.

data.md: Here many species of Rakshasas and Daityas, O Matali, possessed of celestial weapons lived before, O Matali, which is now inhabited by the gods.

data.v: अग्निरेष महार्चिष्माञ्जागर्ति वरुणह्रदे । वैष्णवं चक्रमाविद्धं विधूमेन हविष्मता ।।
data.md: There are the fire of blazing flame which is burning in the lake of Varuna and the discus of Vishnu surrounded by the fire and smoke.

data.v: एष गाण्डीमयश्चापो लोकसंहारसंभृतः । रक्ष्यते दैवतैर्नित्यं यतस्तद्गाण्डिवं धनुः ।।
data.md: This is the bow, full of knots, which was created for the destruction of the world; it is ever looked after by the gods and from this the name of the Gandiva bow is derived.

data.v: एष कृत्ये समुत्पन्ने तत्तद्धारयते बलम् । सहस्रशतसंख्येन प्राणेन सततं ध्रुवम् ।।
data.md: This bow, at the approach of the proper time of action, is endued as it is with the strength of a hundred thousand bows, inspired with still greater strength.

data.v: अशास्यानपि शास्त्येष रक्षोबन्धुषु राजसु । सृष्टः प्रथमजो दण्डो ब्रह्मणा ब्रह्मवादिना ।।
data.md: It brings under subjugation those kings who are friendly to the Rakshasas, though they are incapable of being reduced to that condition. This terrible weapon was created first by the Brahmana who created in speech the Vedas.

data.v: एतच्छत्रं नरेन्द्राणां महच्छक्रेण भाषितम् । पुत्राः सलिलराजस्य धारयन्ति महोदयम् ।।
data.md: This weapon, in its work among the kings, has been pronounced to be the great by Shakra and the son of the lord of the waters hold this weapon of great energy.

data.v: एतत्सलिलराजस्य छत्रं छत्रगृहे स्थितम् । सर्वतः सलिलं शीतं जीमूत इव वर्षति ।।
data.md: This thing, placed in the umbrella room, is the umbrella of the lord of the waters and always showers cold water like the clouds.

data.v: एतच्छत्रात्परिभ्रष्टं सलिलं सोमनिर्मलम् । तमसा मूर्छितं याति येन नार्छति दर्शनम् ।।
data.md: The water, falling from this umbrella, is pure as the moon and yet is surrounded by such darkness that it cannot be grasped by the sight.

data.v: बहून्यद्भुतरूपाणि द्रष्टव्यानीह मातले । तव कार्योपरोधस्तु तस्माद्गच्छाव माचिरम् ।।
data.md: In these regions, O Matali, there are many things to be seen, but owing to the pressing demands of your business we shall go away from here without delay.

data.v: एतत्तु नागलोकस्य नाभिस्थाने स्थितं पुरम् । पातालमिति विख्यातं दैत्यदानवसेवितम् ।।
data.md: Narada said This city, situated in the very heart of the region of the Nagas, is known as Patalam, inhabited by the Daityas and Danavas.

data.v: इदमद्भिः समं प्राप्ता ये केचिद्ध्रुवजङ्गमाः । प्रविशन्तो महानादं नदन्ति भयपीडिताः ।।
data.md: The few creatures of the earth, who are brought here by the current of the water, when entering the region give out loud shrieks being struck with fear.

data.v: अत्रासुरोऽग्निः सततं दीप्यते वारिभोजनः । व्यापारेण धृतात्मानं निबद्धं समबुध्यत ।।
data.md: In these regions, the fire, called Asura fire, which is fed by water, continually blazes forth. Held in great respect, it regards itself as confined (by the gods).

data.v: अत्रामृतं सुरैः पीत्वा निहितं निहतारिभिः । अतः सोमस्य हानिश्च वृद्धिश्चैव प्रदृश्यते ।।
data.md: Here the gods, who had slain their enemies, having drunk the nectar kept the residue there. It is from here proceed the growth and decline of the moon, which we see.

data.v: अत्र दिव्यं हयशिरः काले पर्वणि पर्वणि । उत्तिष्ठति सुवर्णाभं वार्भिरापूरयञ्जगत् ।।
data.md: Here the son of Aditi, with his head like that of the horse, on every festive occasion, rises up, making the world, called Suvarna, filled with the sound of Vedic hymns and mantras.

data.v: यस्मादत्र समग्रास्ताः पतन्ति जलमूर्तयः । तस्मात्पातालमित्येतत्ख्यायते पुरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Since all those objects, having the form of water, fall on it; therefore is this excellent region known by the name of Patalam.

data.v: ऐरावतोऽस्मात्सलिलं गृहीत्वा जगतो हितः । मेघेष्वामुञ्चते शीतं यन्महेन्द्रः प्रवर्षति ।।
data.md: Airavata, taking up cold water from here for the good of the world, gives them to the clouds and the great Indra showers this water as rain.

data.v: अत्र नानाविधाकारास्तिमयो नैकरूपिणः । अप्सु सोमप्रभां पीत्वा वसन्ति जलचारिणः ।।
data.md: Here aquatic animals of many species and shapes and fishes of different sorts, such as Timi and others, live, subsisting on a drink from the water which is like the beams of the moon.

data.v: अत्र सूर्यांशुभिर्भिन्नाः पातालतलमाश्रिताः । मृता दिवसतः सूत पुनर्जीवन्ति ते निशि ।।
data.md: Some beings, living in this nether world, the Patalam, pierced by the rays of the sun, are dead in the day time, O Suta and are revived again at night.

data.v: उदये नित्यशश्चात्र चन्द्रमा रश्मिभिर्वृतः । अमृतं स्पृश्य संस्पर्शात्संजीवयति देहिनः ।।
data.md: For the moon, rising in these regions every night, by her beams which are her arms as it were, brings nectar in contact with them; and from that are the creatures revived.

data.v: अत्र तेऽधर्मनिरता बद्धाः कालेन पीडिताः । दैतेया निवसन्ति स्म वासवेन हृतश्रियः ।।
data.md: Here are iroprisoned these wicked and unrighteous sons of Diti afflicted with misfortune. They live here being dispossessed of their prosperity by Vasava.

data.v: अत्र भूतपतिर्नाम सर्वभूतमहेश्वरः । भूतये सर्वभूतानामचरत्तप उत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Here the great Lord of all creatures, by name Bhutpati, practiced austere asceticism for the good of all creatures.

data.v: अत्र गोव्रतिनो विप्राः स्वाध्यायाम्नायकर्शिताः । त्यक्तप्राणा जितस्वर्गा निवसन्ति महर्षयः ।।
data.md: Here live the great Rishis those Brahmanas attached to the vow, called go, who have been emaciated with the recitation of the Vedas and who abandoning the pleasures of this life have secured heaven.

data.v: यत्रतत्रशयो नित्यं येनकेनचिदाशितः । येनकेनचिदाच्छन्नः स गोव्रत इहोच्यते ।।
data.md: He, who ever sleeps at any place he likes, who lives on with what others place before him, is safe to be attached to the Go vows in this world.

data.v: ऐरावतो नागराजो वामनः कुमुदोऽञ्जनः । प्रसूताः सुप्रतीकस्य वंशे वारणसत्तमाः ।।
data.md: Here in the race of Supratika are born those best among elephants, namely Airavana, the king among elephants, Kumuda, Vamana and Arjuna.

data.v: पश्य यद्यत्र ते कश्चिद्रोचते गुणतो वरः । वरयिष्याव तं गत्वा यत्नमास्थाय मातले ।।
data.md: See if in these regions there is any bridegroom who pleases you by his accomplishments. If so, I shall, after respectfully going to him, solicit him to accept your daughter, O Matali.

data.v: अण्डमेतज्जले न्यस्तं दीप्यमानमिव श्रिया । आ प्रजानां निसर्गाद्वै नोद्भिद्यति न सर्पति ।।
data.md: This one, placed here in these waters, is an egg, which is shining as it were with beauty. From the very creation of this universe it is here; and it neither moves away, nor is hatched.

data.v: नास्य जातिं निसर्गं वा कथ्यमानं शृणोमि वै । पितरं मातरं वापि नास्य जानाति कश्चन ।।
data.md: I have never heard of its species or birth spoken of. No body knows any one as its father or mother.

data.v: अतः किल महानग्निरन्तकाले समुत्थितः । धक्ष्यते मातले सर्वं त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम् ।।
data.md: From this, at the time of the dissolution of the universe, springs up a fire, which consumes, O Matali, the three entire worlds with all their mobile and immobile creatures.

data.v: मातलिस्त्वब्रवीच्छ्रुत्वा नारदस्याथ भाषितम् । न मेऽत्र रोचते कश्चिदन्यतो व्रज माचिरम् ।।
data.md: Matali too having heard what Narada said, answered-“None in these regions pleases me. Let me go elsewhere without delay.”

data.v: हिरण्यपुरमित्येतत्ख्यातं पुरवरं महत् । दैत्यानां दानवानां च मायाशतविचारिणाम् ।।
data.md: Narada said This excellent and spacious city is known by the name of Hiranyapura. It is the city of the Daityas and the Danavas, who practice a hundred different illusions,

data.v: अनल्पेन प्रयत्नेन निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा । मयेन मनसा सृष्टं पातालतलमाश्रितम् ।।
data.md: It having been built with no little care by the divine architect (Vishvakarama) and planned by Maya (Danava) was placed in these nether regions-the Patalam.

data.v: अत्र मायासहस्राणि विकुर्वाणा महौजसः । दानवा निवसन्ति स्म शूरा दत्तवराः पुरा ।।
data.md: Here the Danavas, endued with great spirit and energy, practicing a thousand kind of different illusions, inhabit. They were, in the days of old, heroes who had received the grant of boons.

data.v: नैते शक्रेण नान्येन वरुणेन यमेन वा । शक्यन्ते वशमानेतुं तथैव धनदेन च ।।
data.md: By Shakra, by Yama or by Varuna or by any body clse they were incapable of being brought inder subjugation; as also by the Lord of wealth (Kubera).

data.v: असुराः कालखञ्जाश्च तथा विष्णुपदोद्भवाः । नैरृता यातुधानाश्च ब्रह्मवेदोद्भवाश्च ये ।।
data.md: The Asuras, known as Kalakhanjas who have their origin in the feet of Vishnu and the Rakshasas, known as Yatudhanas who have their origin in the feet of Brahma, gifted with teeth and of fearful impetus and endued with strength equal to the force of the wind and with the heroism of illusion, live here, O Matali.

data.v: दंष्ट्रिणो भीमरूपाश्च निवसन्त्यात्मरक्षिणः । मायावीर्योपसंपन्ना निवसन्त्यात्मरक्षिणः ।।
निवातकवचा नाम दानवा युद्धदुर्मदाः । जानासि च यथा शक्रो नैताञ्शक्नोति बाधितुम् ।।
data.md: The Danavas named Nivatkavachas, who are hard to be vanquished in battle (also live here.) You know how Shakra is not able to cope with them.

data.v: बहुशो मातले त्वं च तव पुत्रश्च गोमुखः । निर्भग्नो देवराजश्च सहपुत्रः शचीपतिः ।।
data.md: Yourself and your son Gomukha, O Matali and the king of the gods, the lord of Sachi, with his son, have been repulsed by them.

data.v: पश्य वेश्मानि रौक्माणि मातले राजतानि च । कर्मणा विधियुक्तेन युक्तान्युपगतानि च ।।
data.md: See these mansions, O Matali, made of gold and silver and embroidered with suitable workmanship filled up according to their scientific principles.

data.v: वैडूर्यहरितानीव प्रवालरुचिराणि च । अर्कस्फटिकशुभ्राणि वज्रसारोज्ज्वलानि च ।।
data.md: Decorated with Vaidurya-gems and with corals and with the species of white marble, called Arka and with the shining gems, called Vajrasara,

data.v: पार्थिवानीव चाभान्ति पुनर्नगमयानि च । शैलानीव च दृश्यन्ते तारकाणीव चाप्युत ।।
data.md: They shine as if, made of bricks and set with Padmaraga gems, and they look as if made of stones or of wood.

data.v: सूर्यरूपाणि चाभान्ति दीप्ताग्निसदृशानि च । मणिजालविचित्राणि प्रांशूनि निबिडानि च ।।
data.md: They are lustrous like the rays of the sun; and are blazing like the fire and set with cluster of gems and precious stones; they are high and stand close to one another.

data.v: नैतानि शक्यं निर्देष्टुं रूपतो द्रव्यतस्तथा । गुणतश्चैव सिद्धानि प्रमाणगुणवन्ति च ।।
data.md: All these are incapable of being described with reference to their beauty, to with reference to the materials they are made of. They are erected with many advantages and comforts; and they have answered these objects very well. They are of a large size.

data.v: आक्रीडान्पश्य दैत्यानां तथैव शयनान्युत । रत्नवन्ति महार्हाणि भाजनान्यासनानि च ।।
data.md: Look at the sporting grounds of the Daityas; and look at the resting places and beds, as also these vessels and seats set with gems and of great value.

data.v: जलदाभांस्तथा शैलांस्तोयप्रस्रवणान्वितान् । कामपुष्पफलांश्चैव पादपान्कामचारिणः ।।
data.md: Look at these walls which are like masses of clouds; and these fountains of water and also the trees producing flowers and fruits at their will, which can also be removed from one place to another at their pleasure.

data.v: मातले कश्चिदत्रापि रुचितस्ते वरो भवेत् । अथ वान्यां दिशं भूमेर्गच्छाव यदि मन्यसे ।।
data.md: See, O Matali, in these regions if there is a bridegroom who is to your liking or else we shall go to another direction of this earth.

data.v: मातलिस्त्वब्रवीदेनं भाषमाणं तथाविधम् । देवर्षे नैव मे कार्यं विप्रियं त्रिदिवौकसाम् ।।
data.md: Matali then said to him who spoke thus, "O celestial Rishi, I cannot do what would not be to the liking of the dwellers of the heaven.

data.v: नित्यानुषक्तवैरा हि भ्रातरो देवदानवाः । अरिपक्षेण संबन्धं रोचयिष्याम्यहं कथम् ।।
data.md: The gods and the Danavas, though brothers, are in open enmity with each other and how can I approve of an alliance with the enemies.

data.v: अन्यत्र साधु गच्छावो द्रष्टुं नार्हामि दानवान् । जानामि तु तथात्मानं दित्सात्मकमलं यथा ।।
data.md: It is better that we should go elsewhere. It is not proper that we should seek among the Danavas. I know your nature and know that you desire to sow discord."

data.v: अयं लोकः सुपर्णानां पक्षिणां पन्नगाशिनाम् । विक्रमे गमने भारे नैषामस्ति परिश्रमः ।।
data.md: Narada said This region belongs to the birds of excellent feathers which subsist on snakes. They feel no fatigue in showing their strength in traveling or in carrying loads.

data.v: वैनतेयसुतैः सूत षड्भिस्ततमिदं कुलम् । सुमुखेन सुनाम्ना च सुनेत्रेण सुवर्चसा ।।
सुरूपपक्षिराजेन सुबलेन च मातले । वर्धितानि प्रसूत्या वै विनताकुलकर्तृभिः ।।
पक्षिराजाभिजात्यानां सहस्राणि शतानि च । कश्यपस्य ततो वंशे जातैर्भूतिविवर्धनैः ।।
सर्वे ह्येते श्रिया युक्ताः सर्वे श्रीवत्सलक्षणाः । सर्वे श्रियमभीप्सन्तो धारयन्ति बलान्युत ।।
data.md: All these are endued with prosperity; and all have the mark of Srivatsa (an auspicious mark); and all of them, desirous of prosperity, are endued with strength.

data.v: कर्मणा क्षत्रियाश्चैते निर्घृणा भोगिभोजिनः । ज्ञातिसंक्षयकर्तृत्वाद्ब्राह्मण्यं न लभन्ति वै ।।
data.md: By their habits of life they are Kshatriyas; but as they live on snakes, they are without humanity; and owing to their constant warfare with their kinsmen they never attain to the region of Brahma.

data.v: नामानि चैषां वक्ष्यामि यथा प्राधान्यतः शृणु । मातले श्लाघ्यमेतद्धि कुलं विष्णुपरिग्रहम् ।।
data.md: I shall describe their names according to their rank; hear, O Matali. This race is much thought of in consequence of the favor which Vishnu shows to it.

data.v: दैवतं विष्णुरेतेषां विष्णुरेव परायणम् । हृदि चैषां सदा विष्णुर्विष्णुरेव गतिः सदा ।।
data.md: Vishnu is their god; and their object of worship, Vishnu, is ever in their heart; and Vishnu is ever their refuge.

data.v: सुवर्णचूडो नागाशी दारुणश्चण्डतुण्डकः । अनलश्चानिलश्चैव विशालाक्षोऽथ कुण्डली ।।
काश्यपिर्ध्वजविष्कम्भो वैनतेयोऽथ वामनः । वातवेगो दिशाचक्षुर्निमेषो निमिषस्तथा ।।
त्रिवारः सप्तवारश्च वाल्मीकिर्द्वीपकस्तथा । दैत्यद्वीपः सरिद्द्वीपः सारसः पद्मकेसरः ।।
सुमुखः सुखकेतुश्च चित्रबर्हस्तथानघः । मेघकृत्कुमुदो दक्षः सर्पान्तः सोमभोजनः ।।
गुरुभारः कपोतश्च सूर्यनेत्रश्चिरान्तकः । विष्णुधन्वा कुमारश्च परिबर्हो हरिस्तथा ।।

data.v: सप्तर्षीणामन्यतमं वेषमास्थाय भारत । बुभुक्षुः क्षुधितो राजन्नाश्रमं कौशिकस्य ह ।।
data.md: Having assumed the appearance of one of the seven Rishis, O Bharata, he came to the hermitage of the son of Kushika, as if hungry, with the desire of satisfying his hunger.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽथ संभ्रान्तः श्रपयामास वै चरुम् । परमान्नस्य यत्नेन न च स प्रत्यपालयत् ।।
data.md: Vishvamitra, with great respect, employed himself in preparing Charu (rice boiled in milk and honey) and in his anxiety to prepare that excellent repast he could not attend to him in other respects.

data.v: अन्नं तेन यदा भुक्तमन्यैर्दत्तं तपस्विभिः । अथ गृह्यान्नमत्युष्णं विश्वामित्रोऽभ्युपागमत् ।।
data.md: When he had taken the fool offered by other devotees, Vishvamitra too came there taking his food which was very hot.

data.v: भुक्तं मे तिष्ठ तावत्त्वमित्युक्त्वा भगवान्ययौ । विश्वामित्रस्ततो राजन्स्थित एव महाद्युतिः ।।
data.md: I have taken my food; you stay here for the present" saying this the divinely prosperous one went away and then did Vishvamitra, of great effulgence, O king, stand there.

data.v: भक्तं प्रगृह्य मूर्ध्ना तद्बाहुभ्यां पार्श्वतोऽगमत् । स्थितः स्थाणुरिवाभ्याशे निश्चेष्टो मारुताशनः ।।
data.md: Out of reverence, taking the food on his head and holding the same by his hands the devotee, of austere asceticism, stood there in the hermitage like a post and subsisting on air.

data.v: तस्य शुश्रूषणे यत्नमकरोद्गालवो मुनिः । गौरवाद्बहुमानाच्च हार्देन प्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.md: In attending on him the Muni Galava took pains out of respect, reverence, affection and the desire to do what was pleasing to Vishvamitra.

data.v: अथ वर्षशते पूर्णे धर्मः पुनरुपागमत् । वासिष्ठं वेषमास्थाय कौशिकं भोजनेप्सया ।।
data.md: Then on the completion of a hundred years Dharma came there again to the son of Kushika, assuming the appearance of Vasishtha with the desire of eating.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा शिरसा भक्तं ध्रियमाणं महर्षिणा । तिष्ठता वायुभक्षेण विश्वामित्रेण धीमता ।।
data.md: He saw his food held on his head by the wise and great Rishi Vishvamitra who stood there subsisting on air and Dharma then accepting the food which was hot and newly cooked and eating it said-“I am pleased, O regenerate Rishi" and went away.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य ततो धर्मस्तथैवोष्णं तथा नवम् । भुक्त्वा प्रीतोऽस्मि विप्रर्षे तमुक्त्वा स मुनिर्गतः ।।
data.md: He saw his food held on his head by the wise and great Rishi Vishvamitra who stood there subsisting on air and Dharma then accepting the food which was hot and newly cooked and eating it said-“I am pleased, O regenerate Rishi" and went away.

data.v: क्षत्रभावादपगतो ब्राह्मणत्वमुपागतः । धर्मस्य वचनात्प्रीतो विश्वामित्रस्तदाभवत् ।।
data.md: He then became divested of the condition of a Kshatriyas and reached that of a Brahmana and Vishvamitra became pleased at those words Dharma.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु शिष्यस्य गालवस्य तपस्विनः । शुश्रूषया च भक्त्या च प्रीतिमानित्युवाच तम् । अनुज्ञातो मया वत्स यथेष्टं गच्छ गालव ।।
data.md: And Vishvamitra, being pleased with the attention and devotion of his disciple the ascetic Galava, said thus:

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं गालवो मुनिसत्तमम् । प्रीतो मधुरया वाचा विश्वामित्रं महाद्युतिम् ।।
data.md: “With my permission, child, go away wherever you wish, O Galava.” Being thus addressed, Galava, the best of Munis, said this in reply, in words which were sweet and pleasing to Vishvamitra endued with great effulgence-"What gift (Dakshina) shall I give to your exalted self for your favour as my preceptor?

data.v: दक्षिणां कां प्रयच्छामि भवते गुरुकर्मणि । दक्षिणाभिरुपेतं हि कर्म सिध्यति मानवम् ।।
दक्षिणानां हि सृष्टानामपवर्गेण भुज्यते । स्वर्गे क्रतुफलं सद्भिर्दक्षिणा शान्तिरुच्यते । किमाहरामि गुर्वर्थं ब्रवीतु भगवानिति ।।
data.md: Gifts are the fruits of acts (enjoyed) in heaven and are therefore said to be the peace. What shall I procure for my spiritual guide let my lord command.”

data.v: जानमानस्तु भगवाञ्जितः शुश्रूषणेन च । विश्वामित्रस्तमसकृद्गच्छ गच्छेत्यचोदयत् ।।
data.md: The Rishi Vishvamitra, divinely prosperous, knowing that he had been conquered by his attentions (and nothing else) said to him-“Go, go" and sought to send his attendant away by that means,

data.v: असकृद्गच्छ गच्छेति विश्वामित्रेण भाषितः । किं ददानीति बहुशो गालवः प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.md: The attendant, being spoken to by Vishvamitra saying again and again 'go, go,' said by way of reply “What shall I give you."

data.v: निर्बन्धतस्तु बहुशो गालवस्य तपस्विनः । किंचिदागतसंरम्भो विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् ।।
data.md: Vishvamitra, a little angry at the excessive obstinacy of the devotee Galava, said this to him:

data.v: एकतःश्यामकर्णानां शतान्यष्टौ ददस्व मे । हयानां चन्द्रशुभ्राणां गच्छ गालव माचिरम् ।।
data.md: “Give me eight hundred horses, white as the rays of the moon and each having one ear black. Go,OGalava, without delay."

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तदा तेन विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । नास्ते न शेते नाहारं कुरुते गालवस्तदा ।।
data.md: Narada said Being thus commanded by the intelligent Vishvamitra Galava could not sit, nor sleep nor could he take his meals.

data.v: त्वगस्थिभूतो हरिणश्चिन्ताशोकपरायणः । शोचमानोऽतिमात्रं स दह्यमानश्च मन्युना ।।
data.md: His body was reduced to a skeleton and became pale being subject to grief and a prey to excessive anxiety and burning with dissatisfaction. Galava, being very sorry, thus began to lament, O Suyodhana.

data.v: कुतः पुष्टानि मित्राणि कुतोऽर्थाः संचयः कुतः । हयानां चन्द्रशुभ्राणां शतान्यष्टौ कुतो मम ।।
data.md: Where can I get well-to-do friends? Where can I have wealth froin? Where are my saving? Eight hundred horses white as the moon where can I get?

data.v: कुतो मे भोजनश्रद्धा सुखश्रद्धा कुतश्च मे । श्रद्धा मे जीवितस्यापि छिन्ना किं जीवितेन मे ।।
data.md: How can I get satisfaction from eating? How can I get satisfaction from happiness? My happiness derived from life itself is broken up. What is the use of my living on?

data.v: अहं पारं समुद्रस्य पृथिव्या वा परं परात् । गत्वात्मानं विमुञ्चामि किं फलं जीवितेन मे ।।
data.md: Having gone to the other side of the sea or going to the most distant part of the world, I shall cast off my life. What is the use of my living on?

data.v: अधनस्याकृतार्थस्य त्यक्तस्य विविधैः फलैः । ऋणं धारयमाणस्य कुतः सुखमनीहया ।।
data.md: What happiness can there be without hard exertion for him who is poor, unsuccessful, deprived of all the sweets of life and saddled with debts?

data.v: सुहृदां हि धनं भुक्त्वा कृत्वा प्रणयमीप्सितम् । प्रतिकर्तुमशक्तस्य जीवितान्मरणं वरम् ।।
data.md: Having enjoyed the wealth of my friends having given him to understand that I shall return it to him, I am unable to make a return for his kindness and so death is preferable to life for me.

data.v: प्रतिश्रुत्य करिष्येति कर्तव्यं तदकुर्वतः । मिथ्यावचनदग्धस्य इष्टापूर्तं प्रणश्यति ।।
data.md: The religious merit of a man bears no fruit, who having promised to do an act fails to perform it and is thus sullied with falsehood.

data.v: न रूपमनृतस्यास्ति नानृतस्यास्ति संततिः । नानृतस्याधिपत्यं च कुत एव गतिः शुभा ।।
data.md: A man addicted to false-hood can never get beauty, a man addicted to false-hood can get not get children, a man addicted to falsehood cannot power can he then expect to obtain bliss?

data.v: कुतः कृतघ्नस्य यशः कुतः स्थानं कुतः सुखम् । अश्रद्धेयः कृतघ्नो हि कृतघ्ने नास्ति निष्कृतिः ।।
data.md: Where is fame for an ungrateful person? Where is there a proper place for an ungrateful person? An ungrateful person is unworthy of respect and there is no emancipation for an ungrateful person.

data.v: न जीवत्यधनः पापः कुतः पापस्य तन्त्रणम् । पापो ध्रुवमवाप्नोति विनाशं नाशयन्कृतम् ।।
data.md: The wretch who is without wealth is dead as it were; and how can such a wretch support his relatives; the wretch certainly meets with ruin for he is unable to return the favours he receives.

data.v: सोऽहं पापः कृतघ्नश्च कृपणश्चानृतोऽपि च । गुरोर्यः कृतकार्यः संस्तत्करोमि न भाषितम् । सोऽहं प्राणान्विमोक्ष्यामि कृत्वा यत्नमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: I am such a wretch, an ungrateful man, without wealth and addicted to false-hood, who, having my wishes gratified by my spiritual guide, am unable to act up to his orders.

data.v: अर्थना न मया काचित्कृतपूर्वा दिवौकसाम् । मानयन्ति च मां सर्वे त्रिदशा यज्ञसंस्तरे ।।
data.md: I, who am such, shall cast off this life after having made an attempt which cannot be exceeded (by other attempts in point of earnestness). Never before has anything been asked by me from the gods.

data.v: अहं तु विबुधश्रेष्ठं देवं त्रिभुवनेश्वरम् । विष्णुं गच्छाम्यहं कृष्णं गतिं गतिमतां वरम् ।।
data.md: All the gods regard me for this in sacrificial rites; and I shall go to Vishnu the friend of wise men, the god, who is the lord of the three worlds, to Krishna who is the best refuge for those that need refuge.

data.v: भोगा यस्मात्प्रतिष्ठन्ते व्याप्य सर्वान्सुरासुरान् । प्रयतो द्रष्टुमिच्छामि महायोगिनमव्ययम् ।।
data.md: From whom flow all the enjoyments that are enjoyed by the gods and Asuras; with my head bent down I desire to see Krishna, the devotee who is without end.

data.v: एवमुक्ते सखा तस्य गरुडो विनतात्मजः । दर्शयामास तं प्राह संहृष्टः प्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.md: He having thus said, his friend Garuda, the son of Vinata, came into his view who being pleased, said to him with a desire to do him good.

data.v: सुहृद्भवान्मम मतः सुहृदां च मतः सुहृत् । ईप्सितेनाभिलाषेण योक्तव्यो विभवे सति ।।
data.md: Your exalted self is my friend. A friend is prosperity should try to accomplish the wishes of his friends.

data.v: विभवश्चास्ति मे विप्र वासवावरजो द्विज । पूर्वमुक्तस्त्वदर्थं च कृतः कामश्च तेन मे ।।
data.md: O twice-born one, the prosperity I possess has its rise in the younger brother of Vasava; I have already spoken to him about your wishes and he has granted my wishes to do you good).

data.v: स भवानेतु गच्छाव नयिष्ये त्वां यथासुखम् । देशं पारं पृथिव्या वा गच्छ गालव माचिरम् ।।
data.md: Such being the case, wherever you want to go, I will take you without any trouble to yourself, to the countries on the other side of the sea or to the remotest corner of the earth, come, O Galava, without delay.

data.v: अनुशिष्टोऽस्मि देवेन गालवाज्ञातयोनिना । ब्रूहि कामनुसंयामि द्रष्टुं प्रथमतो दिशम् ।।
data.md: Suparna said I have been instructed by the god who is the source of all knowledge (to take you where you wish to be taken); tell me-which direction shall I first go, to show you.

data.v: पूर्वां वा दक्षिणां वाहमथ वा पश्चिमां दिशम् । उत्तरां वा द्विजश्रेष्ठ कुतो गच्छामि गालव ।।
data.md: The east or the south or the western point or the northern, O you foremost among the twice-born, where shall I go, OGalava.

data.v: यस्यामुदयते पूर्वं सर्वलोकप्रभावनः । सविता यत्र संध्यायां साध्यानां वर्तते तपः ।।
यस्यां पूर्वं मतिर्जाता यया व्याप्तमिदं जगत् । चक्षुषी यत्र धर्मस्य यत्र चैष प्रतिष्ठितः ।।
हुतं यतोमुखैर्हव्यं सर्पते सर्वतोदिशम् । एतद्द्वारं द्विजश्रेष्ठ दिवसस्य तथाध्वनः ।।
यत्र पूर्वं प्रसूता वै दाक्षायण्यः प्रजाः स्त्रियः । यस्यां दिशि प्रवृद्धाश्च कश्यपस्यात्मसंभवाः ।।
data.md: Here in days of old the female children of Daksha brought forth their children-the direction in which those born of Kashyapa grew up.

data.v: यतोमूला सुराणां श्रीर्यत्र शक्रोऽभ्यषिच्यत । सुरराज्येन विप्रर्षे देवैश्चात्र तपश्चितम् ।।
data.md: Here is the source of the prosperity of the gods, where Shakra was appointed in the kingship of the immortals, where even the gods, O regenerate Rishi, practiced asceticism.

data.v: एतस्मात्कारणाद्ब्रह्मन्पूर्वेत्येषा दिगुच्यते । यस्मात्पूर्वतरे काले पूर्वमेषावृता सुरैः ।।
data.md: For this, O Brahmana, this direction is called east (Poorvi) for in the days of yore it was over-spread by the gods. Therefore it is said to be in the possession of the oldest inhabitants; in the east, were done all the acts by the gods who were desirous of obtaining happiness.

data.v: अत एव च पूर्वेषां पूर्वामाशामवेक्षताम् । पूर्वकार्याणि कार्याणि दैवानि सुखमीप्सता ।।
अत्र वेदाञ्जगौ पूर्वं भगवाँल्लोकभावनः । अत्रैवोक्ता सवित्रासीत्सावित्री ब्रह्मवादिषु ।।
data.md: Here were the Vedas chanted first by the prosperous Being, the Creator of the universe; in this direction out of the mouth of the sun is said to be born the goddess Savitri among the chanters of the Vedas.

data.v: अत्र दत्तानि सूर्येण यजूंषि द्विजसत्तम । अत्र लब्धवरैः सोमः सुरैः क्रतुषु पीयते ।।
data.md: Here were given Surya the hymn of the Yajurveda, O best among the twice-born and here was drunk the Soma juice, previously sacrificial ceremonies.

data.v: अत्र तृप्ता हुतवहाः स्वां योनिमुपभुञ्जते । अत्र पातालमाश्रित्य वरुणः श्रियमाप च ।।
data.md: Here were sacrificial fires gratified by offerings of objects of the same origin and class (milk and clarified butter) and here did Varuna attain to his prosperity resorting to the region of the Patala.

data.v: अत्र पूर्वं वसिष्ठस्य पौराणस्य द्विजर्षभ । सूतिश्चैव प्रतिष्ठा च निधनं च प्रकाशते ।।
data.md: Here, in days of old, O best among the twice born, took place the birth, attainment to fame and death of the ancient Rishi Vasishtha.

data.v: ओंकारस्यात्र जायन्ते सूतयो दशतीर्दश । पिबन्ति मुनयो यत्र हविर्धाने स्म सोमपाः ।।
data.md: Here was first created the On (the magical beginning of every Mantra) in all its ten times ten branches; and here did the smoke-eating ascetics eat the smoke issuing from sacrificial fire.

data.v: प्रोक्षिता यत्र बहवो वराहाद्या मृगा वने । शक्रेण यत्र भागार्थे दैवतेषु प्रकल्पिताः ।।
data.md: Here were massacred many boars and Other animals by Shakra to be used as offerings for sacrificial ceremonies dedicated to the gods.

data.v: अत्राहिताः कृतघ्नाश्च मानुषाश्चासुराश्च ये । उदयंस्तान्हि सर्वान्वै क्रोधाद्धन्ति विभावसुः ।।
data.md: Here does the sun rise and slay in his rage all ungrateful men and Asuras.

data.v: एतद्द्वारं त्रिलोकस्य स्वर्गस्य च सुखस्य च । एष पूर्वो दिशाभागो विशावैनं यदीच्छसि ।।
data.md: This is the gate of the three worlds and of heaven and happiness; this direction is the eastern quarter and we shall enter it if you like.

data.v: प्रियं कार्यं हि मे तस्य यस्यास्मि वचने स्थितः । ब्रूहि गालव यास्यामि शृणु चाप्यपरां दिशम् ।।
data.md: My duty is to do what you wish, for I am ready to carry out your orders; speaks, O Galava and I shall go; listen to me about another cardinal point.

data.v: इयं विवस्वता पूर्वं श्रौतेन विधिना किल । गुरवे दक्षिणा दत्ता दक्षिणेत्युच्यतेऽथ दिक् ।।
data.md: Suparna said This direction, in days of old, was given away by Vivasvat after the performance of a sacrifice according to the usual custom as a final present (Dakshina) to his spiritual guide; so this direction is called south (Dakshina).

data.v: अत्र लोकत्रयस्यास्य पितृपक्षः प्रतिष्ठितः । अत्रोष्मपानां देवानां निवासः श्रूयते द्विज ।।
data.md: In this direction do the Pitris of the three worlds live and it is said, O twice born one, that this is the residence of those gods that subsist on smoke.

data.v: अत्र विश्वे सदा देवाः पितृभिः सार्धमासते । इज्यमानाः स्म लोकेषु संप्राप्तास्तुल्यभागताम् ।।
data.md: In this part of the universe the gods along with the Pitris ever reside, who are worshipped in sacrifices in the world and get equal share with the Pitris.

data.v: एतद्द्वितीयं धर्मस्य द्वारमाचक्षते द्विज । त्रुटिशो लवशश्चात्र गण्यते कालनिश्चयः ।।
data.md: This direction is said to be the second gate to virtue, O twice born one and here does the king of death, with a sure hand, calculate the life allotted to men, in Trutis and Lavas (periods of time).

data.v: अत्र देवर्षयो नित्यं पितृलोकर्षयस्तथा । तथा राजर्षयः सर्वे निवसन्ति गतव्यथाः ।।
data.md: Here do the divine Rishis and the Rishis of the world of the Pitris as also Rishis of royal descent all reside, always being beyond the reach of pain.

data.v: अत्र धर्मश्च सत्यं च कर्म चात्र निशाम्यते । गतिरेषा द्विजश्रेष्ठ कर्मणात्मावसादिनः ।।
data.md: Here are virtue and truth, here the acts of men bear fruit and this is the refuge, O foremost among the twice born, of the acts of those that are dead.

data.v: एषा दिक्सा द्विजश्रेष्ठ यां सर्वः प्रतिपद्यते । वृता त्वनवबोधेन सुखं तेन न गम्यते ।।
data.md: This is that direction, O foremost among the twice born, where every body must go; and as all of them are surrounded by the darkness of ignorance they cannot come here with perfect happiness.

data.v: नैरृतानां सहस्राणि बहून्यत्र द्विजर्षभ । सृष्टानि प्रतिकूलानि द्रष्टव्यान्यकृतात्मभिः ।।
data.md: Here are many thousands of Rakshasas, O best among the twice born, who have been created to stand in the way of men coming to these regions and who can be perceived by those who have not brought their souls under control.

data.v: अत्र मन्दरकुञ्जेषु विप्रर्षिसदनेषु च । गन्धर्वा गान्ति गाथा वै चित्तबुद्धिहरा द्विज ।।
data.md: Here in the secluded spots of the Mandara mountains and in the residences of regenerate Rishis the Gandharvas chant songs stealing away the head and the heart, O twice born one.

data.v: अत्र सामानि गाथाभिः श्रुत्वा गीतानि रैवतः । गतदारो गतामात्यो गतराज्यो वनं गतः ।।
data.md: The Daityas Raivata, having heard the hymns of the Samaveda chanted here, abandoned wife, friends and kingdoms and went into the forest.

data.v: अत्र सावर्णिना चैव यवक्रीतात्मजेन च । मर्यादा स्थापिता ब्रह्मन्यां सूर्यो नातिवर्तते ।।
data.md: Here by the son of Savarni and that of Yavakrita was fixed a limit, O Brahmana, which Surya does not pass beyond.

data.v: अत्र राक्षसराजेन पौलस्त्येन महात्मना । रावणेन तपश्चीर्त्वा सुरेभ्योऽमरता वृता ।।
data.md: Here by the great-souled son of Pulastya Ravana, the king of Rakshasas who practiced austerities, was solicited immortality of the gods.

data.v: अत्र वृत्तेन वृत्रोऽपि शक्रशत्रुत्वमीयिवान् । अत्र सर्वासवः प्राप्ताः पुनर्गच्छन्ति पञ्चधा ।।
data.md: Here by his habits of life did Vritra (the Asura) incur the hostility of Shankra and here do the lives of all being come and again dissolve into their five elephants.

data.v: अत्र दुष्कृतकर्माणो नराः पच्यन्ति गालव । अत्र वैतरणी नाम नदी वितरणैर्वृता । अत्र गत्वा सुखस्यान्तं दुःखस्यान्तं प्रपद्यते ।।
data.md: Here men, the doers of wicked acts, cannot go, O Galava and here is the river Vaitarani surrounded by people who cannot obtain salvation and cross it.

data.v: अत्रावृत्तो दिनकरः क्षरते सुरसं पयः । काष्ठां चासाद्य धानिष्ठां हिममुत्सृजते पुनः ।।
अत्राहं गालव पुरा क्षुधार्तः परिचिन्तयन् । लब्धवान्युध्यमानौ द्वौ बृहन्तौ गजकच्छपौ ।।
अत्र शक्रधनुर्नाम सूर्याज्जातो महानृषिः । विदुर्यं कपिलं देवं येनात्ताः सगरात्मजाः ।।
अत्र सिद्धाः शिवा नाम ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । अधीत्य सखिलान्वेदानालभन्ते यमक्षयम् ।।
अत्र भोगवती नाम पुरी वासुकिपालिता । तक्षकेण च नागेन तथैवैरावतेन च ।।
अत्र निर्याणकालेषु तमः संप्राप्यते महत् । अभेद्यं भास्करेणापि स्वयं वा कृष्णवर्त्मना ।।
एष तस्यापि ते मार्गः परितापस्य गालव । ब्रूहि मे यदि गन्तव्यं प्रतीचीं शृणु वा मम ।।
data.md: Which is impregnable even by Bhaskara (the sun himself) or by fire. Even this is your way, O Galava, worthy of attention, tell me if you want to go in this direction; listen now to the description of another direction, the west.

data.v: इयं दिग्दयिता राज्ञो वरुणस्य तु गोपतेः । सदा सलिलराजस्य प्रतिष्ठा चादिरेव च ।।
data.md: Suparna said This direction is the favorite one of king Varuna, the lord of the seas. In fact this has been the region of the birth of the king of the waters and even the region of his influence.

data.v: अत्र पश्चादहः सूर्यो विसर्जयति भाः स्वयम् । पश्चिमेत्यभिविख्याता दिगियं द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: Here does the sun abandon his rays himself last of all ((Paschata) in the day; this is known as the western direction, O best among the twice born.

data.v: यादसामत्र राज्येन सलिलस्य च गुप्तये । कश्यपो भगवान्देवो वरुणं स्माभ्यषेचयत् ।।
data.md: For ruling over aquatic animals and for the protection of the waters, the illustrious and divine sage Kashyapa anointed Varuna.

data.v: अत्र पीत्वा समस्तान्वै वरुणस्य रसांस्तु षट् । जायते तरुणः सोमः शुक्लस्यादौ तमिस्रहा ।।
data.md: Here having drunk all the six juices of Varuna, the moon, the destroyer of darkness, becomes new again in the very beginning of the light half of the month.

data.v: अत्र पश्चात्कृता दैत्या वायुना संयतास्तदा । निःश्वसन्तो महानागैरर्दिताः सुषुपुर्द्विज ।।
data.md: Here were the Daityas vanquished by Vayu and then confined by him; and O twice born one, they slept here (the sleep that knows no waking) breathing hard and afflicted by a high wind.

data.v: अत्र सूर्यं प्रणयिनं प्रतिगृह्णाति पर्वतः । अस्तो नाम यतः संध्या पश्चिमा प्रतिसर्पति ।।
data.md: Here does the mountain named Asta receive the sun as if in love owing to which the evening twilight vanishes away in the west.

data.v: अतो रात्रिश्च निद्रा च निर्गता दिवसक्षये । जायते जीवलोकस्य हर्तुमर्धमिवायुषः ।।
data.md: From here at the end of the day do the night and sleep come and spread themselves as it were to steal away half the life of living creatures.

data.v: अत्र देवीं दितिं सुप्तामात्मप्रसवधारिणीम् । विगर्भामकरोच्छक्रो यत्र जातो मरुद्गणः ।।
data.md: In this quarter seeing the goddess Diti, who bore a child, asleep, Shakra cut up the focus from which were born the group of Maruts.

data.v: अत्र मूलं हिमवतो मन्दरं याति शाश्वतम् । अपि वर्षसहस्रेण न चास्यान्तोऽधिगम्यते ।।
data.md: In this direction the base of the Himavat mountain is extended to the eternal Mandara and no one can reach the end of this mountain even in a thousand years.

data.v: अत्र काञ्चनशैलस्य काञ्चनाम्बुवहस्य च । उदधेस्तीरमासाद्य सुरभिः क्षरते पयः ।।
data.md: In this direction coming to the shore of the sea having golden mountains and golden lotuses, does Suravi yield her milk.

data.v: अत्र मध्ये समुद्रस्य कबन्धः प्रतिदृश्यते । स्वर्भानोः सूर्यकल्पस्य सोमसूर्यौ जिघांसतः ।।
data.md: Here in the midst of this ocean is seen the hcadless truck of Svarabhanu, (Rahu) who is like the sun himself, lever bent on allowing the sun the moon.

data.v: सुवर्णशिरसोऽप्यत्र हरिरोम्णः प्रगायतः । अदृश्यस्याप्रमेयस्य श्रूयते विपुलो ध्वनिः ।।
data.md: Here is heard the loud sound of chanting (the Vedas) by Suvarnashiras who is ever youthful and who is immeasurable and invincible in energy.

data.v: अत्र ध्वजवती नाम कुमारी हरिमेधसः । आकाशे तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति तस्थौ सूर्यस्य शासनात् ।।
data.md: Here the daughter of Harimedhas named Dhvajavati remained fixed to the sky by the command of the sun who said-Remain here, remain here.

data.v: अत्र वायुस्तथा वह्निरापः खं चैव गालव । आह्निकं चैव नैशं च दुःखस्पर्शं विमुञ्चति । अतः प्रभृति सूर्यस्य तिर्यगावर्तते गतिः ।।
data.md: Here wind and fire and water and earth, O Galava, remain dispossessed of the power of giving pain at their contact, day and night.

data.v: अत्र ज्योतींषि सर्वाणि विशन्त्यादित्यमण्डलम् । अष्टाविंशतिरात्रं च चङ्क्रम्य सह भानुना । निष्पतन्ति पुनः सूर्यात्सोमसंयोगयोगतः ।।
data.md: Having journeyed for twenty eight nights in company with the sun they come out again from the solar sphere, being united with the moon.

data.v: अत्र नित्यं स्रवन्तीनां प्रभवः सागरोदयः । अत्र लोकत्रयस्यापस्तिष्ठन्ति वरुणाश्रयाः ।।
data.md: Here in this direction life the sources of rivers from which again rise the seas and here in the region of Varuna are the waters of all the three worlds.

data.v: अत्र पन्नगराजस्याप्यनन्तस्य निवेशनम् । अनादिनिधनस्यात्र विष्णोः स्थानमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Here is the residence, of Ananta, the king of snakes and here is the place of Vishnu, who has no beginning nor end and than whom nothing is better.

data.v: अत्रानलसखस्यापि पवनस्य निवेशनम् । महर्षेः कश्यपस्यात्र मारीचस्य निवेशनम् ।।
data.md: Here is also the residence of Pavana (wind) the friend of Anala (fire) and here is the residence of the great Rishi Kashyapa, the son of Maricha.

data.v: एष ते पश्चिमो मार्गो दिग्द्वारेण प्रकीर्तितः । ब्रूहि गालव गच्छावो बुद्धिः का द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: This western direction is described to you in the course of my description of the cardinal points; speak, O Galava, ( best among the twice born, in which direction you will go.

data.v: यस्मादुत्तार्यते पापाद्यस्मान्निःश्रेयसोऽश्नुते । तस्मादुत्तारणफलादुत्तरेत्युच्यते बुधैः ।।
data.md: Suparna said Since a man is absolved from his sins in this quarter and since he attains salvation here, it is called North (Uttara), O twice born one, from its power of absolution (uttarana).

data.v: उत्तरस्य हिरण्यस्य परिवापस्य गालव । मार्गः पश्चिमपूर्वाभ्यां दिग्भ्यां वै मध्यमः स्मृतः ।।
data.md: And since the north, which is the region of gold (and other treasures) stretches between the west and the east therefore is it called the central region.

data.v: अस्यां दिशि वरिष्ठायामुत्तरायां द्विजर्षभ । नासौम्यो नाविधेयात्मा नाधर्म्यो वसते जनः ।।
data.md: In this region, the north, which is the best, O best among the twice born, none that is not tranquil, none that has not brought his soul under control and none that is vicious, lives.

data.v: अत्र नारायणः कृष्णो जिष्णुश्चैव नरोत्तमः । बदर्यामाश्रमपदे तथा ब्रह्मा च शाश्वतः ।।
data.md: Here lives Narayana, the ever victorious Krishna, that best among men in the hermitage of Badri and so does Brahma.

data.v: अत्र वै हिमवत्पृष्ठे नित्यमास्ते महेश्वरः । अत्र राज्येन विप्राणां चन्द्रमाश्चाभ्यषिच्यत ।।
data.md: Here on the breast of the Himayat mountain even lives Maheshvara who is endued with effulgence like that of the fire which blazes at the termination of each Yuga, like Purusha in company with Prakriti.

data.v: अत्र गङ्गां महादेवः पतन्तीं गगनाच्च्युताम् । प्रतिगृह्य ददौ लोके मानुषे ब्रह्मवित्तम ।।
अत्र देव्या तपस्तप्तं महेश्वरपरीप्सया । अत्र कामश्च रोषश्च शैलश्चोमा च संबभुः ।।
अत्र राक्षसयक्षाणां गन्धर्वाणां च गालव । आधिपत्येन कैलासे धनदोऽप्यभिषेचितः ।।
data.md: Here were born Kama (the god of love) Rosha (the ire of Shiva), the Kailasa mountain as also Uma; and here, O Galava, over the Rakshasas and Yakshas and Gandharvas, was the giver of wealth (Kubera) anointed king in the Kailasa; here is suitable the pleasure garden of Kubera-the enchanting Chaitraratha and here is situate the hermitage of the class of Rishis known as Vaikhanas.

data.v: अत्र चैत्ररथं रम्यमत्र वैखानसाश्रमः । अत्र मन्दाकिनी चैव मन्दरश्च द्विजर्षभ ।।
अत्र सौगन्धिकवनं नैरृतैरभिरक्ष्यते । शाड्वलं कदलीस्कन्धमत्र संतानका नगाः ।।
अत्र संयमनित्यानां सिद्धानां स्वैरचारिणाम् । विमानान्यनुरूपाणि कामभोग्यानि गालव ।।
data.md: Here are plains covered with green grass and groups of plantain trees and the celestial trees, the Santanakas and in this quarter the Siddhas, who have ever their passions under control and who always roam about at their pleasure,

data.v: अत्र ते ऋषयः सप्त देवी चारुन्धती तथा । अत्र तिष्ठति वै स्वातिरत्रास्या उदयः स्मृतः ।।
अत्र यज्ञं समारुह्य ध्रुवं स्थाता पितामहः । ज्योतींषि चन्द्रसूर्यौ च परिवर्तन्ति नित्यशः ।।
अत्र गायन्तिकाद्वारं रक्षन्ति द्विजसत्तमाः । धामा नाम महात्मानो मुनयः सत्यवादिनः ।।
न तेषां ज्ञायते सूतिर्नाकृतिर्न तपश्चितम् । परिवर्तसहस्राणि कामभोग्यानि गालव ।।
यथा यथा प्रविशति तस्मात्परतरं नरः । तथा तथा द्विजश्रेष्ठ प्रविलीयति गालव ।।
न तत्केनचिदन्येन गतपूर्वं द्विजर्षभ । ऋते नारायणं देवं नरं वा जिष्णुमव्ययम् ।।
अत्र कैलासमित्युक्तं स्थानमैलविलस्य तत् । अत्र विद्युत्प्रभा नाम जज्ञिरेऽप्सरसो दश ।।
अत्र विष्णुपदं नाम क्रमता विष्णुना कृतम् । त्रिलोकविक्रमे ब्रह्मन्नुत्तरां दिशमाश्रितम् ।।
अत्र राज्ञा मरुत्तेन यज्ञेनेष्टं द्विजोत्तम । उशीरबीजे विप्रर्षे यत्र जाम्बूनदं सरः ।।
जीमूतस्यात्र विप्रर्षेरुपतस्थे महात्मनः । साक्षाद्धैमवतः पुण्यो विमलः कमलाकरः ।।
ब्राह्मणेषु च यत्कृत्स्नं स्वन्तं कृत्वा धनं महत् । वव्रे वनं महर्षिः स जैमूतं तद्वनं ततः ।।

data.v: शुल्कं तु सर्वधर्मज्ञ हयानां चन्द्रवर्चसाम् । एकतःश्यामकर्णानां देयं मह्यं चतुःशतम् ।।

data.v: गुर्वर्थोऽयं समारम्भो न हयैः कृत्यमस्ति मे । यदि शक्यं महाराज क्रियतां मा विचार्यताम् ।।
data.md: For the sake of my spiritual guide that do I make these efforts for the horses and it is not for myself; if you are prepared to act thus, O great king, do what I have said without any reflection or hesitation.

data.v: अनपत्योऽसि राजर्षे पुत्रौ जनय पार्थिव । पितॄन्पुत्रप्लवेन त्वमात्मानं चैव तारय ।।
data.md: You are without children, O royal Rishi; beget then two sons, O ruler of the earth, and by means of these rafts in the shape of sons do you obtain salvation for yourself and for your ancestors.

data.v: न पुत्रफलभोक्ता हि राजर्षे पात्यते दिवः । न याति नरकं घोरं यत्र गच्छन्त्यनात्मजाः ।।

data.md: Galava then saying to him “very well” along with Suparna, taking the horses and the maiden with him, went to Vishvamitra and said.

data.md: "Of the horses asked for by you there are six hundred here and this damsel is a substitute for the other two hundred. Let these be accepted by you.

data.md: Then will you get the full complement of eight hundred horses asked for by you and I too, after having paid off my debt, shall perform asceticism as I please.

data.md: Vishvamitra, seeing Galava along with the bird and also that girl with beautiful hips, said these words.

data.md: "Why was not this girl presented to me beforehand, OGalava? Then would all the four sons have been mine, every one of whom would have perpetuated a dynasty.

data.md: I shall accept this girl from you to beget on her one son and let the horses having been taken to my hermitage roam about at their will in all directions.

data.md: At the moment he was born, the great Muni Vishvamitra instructed him in both virtue and worldly good and presented to him those horses.

data.v: अथाष्टकः पुरं प्रायात्तदा सोमपुरप्रभम् । निर्यात्य कन्यां शिष्याय कौशिकोऽपि वनं ययौ ।।
data.md: Then did Ashtaka go to the city which was like the city of the moon and the son of Kushika (Vishvamitra) too went to the woods after having returned the damsel to his disciple.

data.v: गालवोऽपि सुपर्णेन सह निर्यात्य दक्षिणाम् । मनसाभिप्रतीतेन कन्यामिदमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Galava too, along with Suparna, was light of heart having succeeded in making the final present he had promised, and said this to the girl.

data.v: जातो दानपतिः पुत्रस्त्वया शूरस्तथापरः । सत्यधर्मरतश्चान्यो यज्वा चापि तथापरः ।।
data.md: "By you has been brought forth a son who is the foremost among the givers of wealth, a second one who is a great hero, another who is ever attached to virtue and another who is ever attached to virtue and truth and the fourth who is a great performer of sacrificial ceremonies.

data.v: तदागच्छ वरारोहे तारितस्ते पिता सुतैः । चत्वारश्चैव राजानस्तथाहं च सुमध्यमे ।।
data.md: Therefore do you come, O you of beautiful hips, your father has obtained salvation by your sons and also the four kings (their fathers) and so also have been I, O you of slender waist."

data.md: Galava, then having permitted Suparna who subsisted on serpents to go away and returning the damsel to his father, went to the forest.

data.md: Narada said The king (Yayati) too, being desirous of giving her (Madhvi) a husband by Svayamvara, went to the hermitage at the confluence of the Ganga and Yamuna,

data.md: Making, Madhvi seated on a chariot with garlands and flowers on her person; Puru and Yadu too followed their sister to the hermitage.

data.md: There, in that hermitage, came together Nagas, Yakshas, and human beings, Gandharvas, animals and birds and dwellers of mountains, woods and forests.

data.v: नानापुरुषदेशानामीश्वरैश्च समाकुलम् । ऋषिभिर्ब्रह्मकल्पैश्च समन्तादावृतं वनम् ।।
data.md: There was also a concourse of the kings of many countries and the forest, that surrounded the hermitage, was filled with Rishis equal (in asceticism) to Brahma himself.

data.v: निर्दिश्यमानेषु तु सा वरेषु वरवर्णिनी । वरानुत्क्रम्य सर्वांस्तान्वनं वृतवती वरम् ।।
data.md: The lady, of good complexion, being directed to choose a husband, passed over all these husbands and selected the forest as her husband.

data.v: अवतीर्य रथात्कन्या नमस्कृत्वा च बन्धुषु । उपगम्य वनं पुण्यं तपस्तेपे ययातिजा ।।
data.md: Getting down from the chariot, the damsel saluted her friends and having gone to the sacred forest, the lady born of Yayati, practiced austerities,

data.md: By observing fasts and different sorts of religions rites, as also ceremonies. She reduced her body and adopted the life of a deer.

data.v: वैडूर्याङ्कुरकल्पानि मृदूनि हरितानि च । चरन्ती शष्पमुख्यानि तिक्तानि मधुराणि च ।।
data.md: Subsisting on sweet and green grass resembling the blades of the Vaidurya gem and which were both sweet and bitter,

data.v: स्रवन्तीनां च पुण्यानां सुरसानि शुचीनि च । पिबन्ती वारिमुख्यानि शीतानि विमलानि च ।।
data.md: And drinking the best of holy waters of sacred fountains which was sweet, pure and cool,

data.v: वनेषु मृगराजेषु सिंहविप्रोषितेषु च । दावाग्निविप्रमुक्तेषु शून्येषु गहनेषु च ।।
data.md: And roaming in thick forests from which the kings of animals (lions) and tigers had been exiled and in deserts which had no conflagration in them,

data.v: चरन्ती हरिणैः सार्धं मृगीव वनचारिणी । चचार विपुलं धर्मं ब्रह्मचर्येण संवृता ।।
data.md: In company with deer and adopting their mode of life she earned much religious merit, by practicing Brahmacharya.

data.v: ययातिरपि पूर्वेषां राज्ञां वृत्तमनुष्ठितः । बहुवर्षसहस्रायुरयुजत्कालधर्मणा ।।
data.md: Yayati, too following the mode of life of the kings before him, lived for a thousand years and then paid the debt of nature.

data.v: पूरुर्यदुश्च द्वौ वंशौ वर्धमानौ नरोत्तमौ । ताभ्यां प्रतिष्ठितो लोके परलोके च नाहुषः ।।
data.md: The two best among men Puru and Yadu perpetuating the family were established (as king) in this world and the son of Nahusha in the next.

data.v: महीयते नरपतिर्ययातिः स्वर्गमास्थितः । महर्षिकल्पो नृपतिः स्वर्गाग्र्यफलभुग्विभुः ।।
data.md: O monarch, dwelling in heaven Yayati, resembling a great Rishi, enjoyed the choicest blessings of heaven.

data.v: बहुवर्षसहस्राख्ये काले बहुगुणे गते । राजर्षिषु निषण्णेषु महीयःसु महर्षिषु ।।
data.md: After many thousands of years had elapsed in great happiness and while seated among royal Rishis of great luster and renown.

data.v: अवमेने नरान्सर्वान्देवानृषिगणांस्तथा । ययातिर्मूढविज्ञानो विस्मयाविष्टचेतनः ।।
data.md: Yayati, with his senses stupefied and his intellect beside himself, insulted all the human beings and the gods and the body of Rishis.

data.v: ततस्तं बुबुधे देवः शक्रो बलनिषूदनः । ते च राजर्षयः सर्वे धिग्धिगित्येवमब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Then did the god Shakra, the slayer of Vala, perceived his folly and all those royal Rishis said-fie, fie.

data.v: विचारश्च समुत्पन्नो निरीक्ष्य नहुषात्मजम् । को न्वयं कस्य वा राज्ञः कथं वा स्वर्गमागतः ।।
data.md: And seeing the son of Nahusha, enquiries were made, who is he, what king's son is he, and how did he come to heaven?

data.v: कर्मणा केन सिद्धोऽयं क्व वानेन तपश्चितम् । कथं वा ज्ञायते स्वर्गे केन वा ज्ञायतेऽप्युत ।।
data.md: By which deeds did he obtain salvation? In what forest did he practice asceticism? How is he known in heaven and by whom, is he so known?

data.v: एवं विचारयन्तस्ते राजानः स्वर्गवासिनः । दृष्ट्वा पप्रच्छुरन्योन्यं ययातिं नृपतिं प्रति ।।
data.md: The dwellers of heaven made such enquiries about the king among themselves pointing to Yayati, the ruler of men.

data.v: विमानपालाः शतशः स्वर्गद्वाराभिरक्षिणः । पृष्टा आसनपालाश्च न जानीमेत्यथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: The hundreds of the charioteers of heaven and hundreds of the fate keepers of heaven and the persons who had the seats of heaven in their charge being asked about the matter, saidwe do not know.

data.v: सर्वे ते ह्यावृतज्ञाना नाभ्यजानन्त तं नृपम् । स मुहूर्तादथ नृपो हतौजा अभवत्तदा ।।
data.md: None of them was then in proper senses and did know that ruler of men, and speedily was that ruler of men shorn of his heavenly effulgence.

data.v: अथ प्रचलितः स्थानादासनाच्च परिच्युतः । कम्पितेनैव मनसा धर्षितः शोकवह्निना ।।
data.md: Narada said Being thus turned out from his place in heaven) and deprived of his seat there, his heart trembling and consumed by the fire of grief.

data.md: With his garlands rendered pale, his senses taking leave of him, deprived of his crown and other ornaments, with his head reeling and his entire body relaxed and robbed of his robes and ornaments,

data.md: Incapable of being known, and now seeing and again not seeing those gods he fell down to the earth below with his mind in despair and his intellect a blank.

data.v: किं मया मनसा ध्यातमशुभं धर्मदूषणम् । येनाहं चलितः स्थानादिति राजा व्यचिन्तयत् ।।
data.md: "What inauspicious and sinful thought was entertained by me in my mind, in consequence of which I have been turned out from my place in heaven?” Thus did the king think within himself.

data.v: ते तु तत्रैव राजानः सिद्धाश्चाप्सरसस्तथा । अपश्यन्त निरालम्बं ययातिं तं परिच्युतम् ।।
data.md: All the kings who were there (in heaven) as also those who had obtained salvation and the Apasaras laughed at Yayati being hurled down from heaven and falling down, having you support to cling to.

data.md: You are exceedingly intoxicated with vanity and there is no body you have not insulted and owing to this vanity you are no longer fit for heaven, O you born of a king.

data.v: पतेयं सत्स्विति वचस्त्रिरुक्त्वा नहुषात्मजः । पतिष्यंश्चिन्तयामास गतिं गतिमतां वरः ।।
data.md: No one knows you here too, therefore down you and fall down.” “I shall fall among the good” the son of Nahusha said these words three times.

data.md: Yayati fell towards the earth smelling that river of smoke which connected as it were the earth with the heaven.

data.md: The lord, of the earth following the course of that smoke which was moving like the Ganga in heaven, came among those foremost of the performers of sacrifices who were his own relatives;

data.v: चतुर्षु हुतकल्पेषु राजसिंहमहाग्निषु । पपात मध्ये राजर्षिर्ययातिः पुण्यसंक्षये ।।
data.md: as Among those who were like the supporters of the earth; among those four who were as lions among kings and like the great fire in sacrificial ceremonies the king Yayati fell.

data.v: तमाहुः पार्थिवाः सर्वे प्रतिमानमिव श्रियः । को भवान्कस्य वा बन्धुर्देशस्य नगरस्य वा ।।
data.md: The Royal Rishi Yayati, after all his religious merit had been spent up, fell among them; all the rulers of the earth said to him who was effulgent with beauty. “Who are you? With whom are you related, and from what town and country are you?

data.v: यक्षो वाप्यथ वा देवो गन्धर्वो राक्षसोऽपि वा । न हि मानुषरूपोऽसि को वार्थः काङ्क्षितस्त्वया ।।
data.md: Are you a Yakasha or a god, a Gandharva or a Rakshasa, for you have not the appearance of a human being; and what is the object desired for by you?”

data.v: ययातिरस्मि राजर्षिः क्षीणपुण्यश्च्युतो दिवः । पतेयं सत्स्विति ध्यायन्भवत्सु पतितस्ततः ।।
data.md: Yayati said I am the royal Rishi Yayati and the religious merit acquired by me being spent up have been turned out from heaven; and wishing in my mind that I should fall among the good, I have fallen among you.

data.v: सत्यमेतद्भवतु ते काङ्क्षितं पुरुषर्षभ । सर्वेषां नः क्रतुफलं धर्मश्च प्रतिगृह्यताम् ।।
data.md: The king said May what was desired for by you le successful; accept the religious merit of these sacrificial ceremonies performed by all of us.

data.v: नाहं प्रतिग्रहधनो ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो ह्यहम् । न च मे प्रवणा बुद्धिः परपुण्यविनाशने ।।
data.md: Yayati said I am not a Brahmana and therefore cannot accept wealth (of any sort) from others, and my I heart is not inclined to destroy the religious merit of others.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु मृगचर्याक्रमागताम् । माधवीं प्रेक्ष्य राजानस्तेऽभिवाद्येदमब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Narada said At this time, seeing Madhvi leading the life of a deer and wandering about, those kings bowing to her said

data.v: किमागमनकृत्यं ते किं कुर्मः शासनं तव । आज्ञाप्या हि वयं सर्वे तव पुत्रास्तपोधने ।।
data.md: “What is the reason of your coming here, what orders of yours shall we obey? Being your sons, O devotee, we are ready to be commanded by you."

data.v: तेषां तद्भाषितं श्रुत्वा माधवी परया मुदा । पितरं समुपागच्छद्ययातिं सा ववन्द च ।।
data.md: Madhvi, hearing that speech of theirs with great delight, came to her father and bowed to Yayati.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा मूर्ध्ना नतान्पुत्रांस्तापसी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । दौहित्रास्तव राजेन्द्र मम पुत्रा न ते पराः । इमे त्वां तारयिष्यन्ति दिष्टमेतत्पुरातनम् ।।
data.md: And having touched those sons of hers on their head the anchoring said these words "These are your grandsons, O chief among kings-my sons-they are not unconnected with you.

data.v: अहं ते दुहिता राजन्माधवी मृगचारिणी । मयाप्युपचितो धर्मस्ततोऽर्धं प्रतिगृह्यताम् ।।
data.md: By me too has religious merit been acquired; accept half of that, for, o king, all human beings enjoy the wealth earned by their children.

data.v: यस्माद्राजन्नराः सर्वे अपत्यफलभागिनः । तस्मादिच्छन्ति दौहित्रान्यथा त्वं वसुधाधिप ।।

उच्चैरनुपमैः स्निग्धैः स्वरैरापूर्य मेदिनीम् । मातामहं नृपतयस्तारयन्तो दिवश्च्युतम् ।।
data.md: Bowed down and said the same thing to their maternal grand father, filling the earth with loud and sweet ponds the like of which there was none.

data.v: अथ तस्मादुपगतो गालवोऽप्याह पार्थिवम् । तपसो मेऽष्टभागेन स्वर्गमारोहतां भवान् ।।
data.md: The rulers of men thus saved their grandfather who had been turned out from heaven; just then, Galava, coming there said to the ruler of the earth, “A send you heaven by virtue of a eighth part of my austerities.”

data.v: प्रत्यभिज्ञातमात्रोऽथ सद्भिस्तैर्नरपुंगवः । ययातिर्दिव्यसंस्थानो बभूव विगतज्वरः ।।
data.md: Narada said The moment he was recognized by those good men, those foremost among human beings, that ruler of men went up again without touching the surface of the earth, and Yayati being freed from all his troubles again got his place in heaven.

data.v: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरो दिव्याभरणभूषितः । दिव्यगन्धगुणोपेतो न पृथ्वीमस्पृशत्पदा ।।
data.md: Bedecked with heavenly garlands, clothed in heaven raiment and putting on heavenly ornaments and with heavenly perfumes and endued with heavenly qualities he did not even touch the earth with his feet.

data.v: ततो वसुमनाः पूर्वमुच्चैरुच्चारयन्वचः । ख्यातो दानपतिर्लोके व्याजहार नृपं तदा ।।
data.md: Then did Vasumanas, renowned in this world as the foremost among givers, first uttering these words in a loud voice said to the king.

data.v: प्राप्तवानस्मि यल्लोके सर्ववर्णेष्वगर्हया । तदप्यथ च दास्यामि तेन संयुज्यतां भवान् ।।
data.md: "The merit that I have earned in this world by my conduct towards all the castes, which can not be found fault with, that too I give you and may you earn that.

data.v: यत्फलं दानशीलस्य क्षमाशीलस्य यत्फलम् । यच्च मे फलमाधाने तेन संयुज्यतां भवान् ।।
data.md: The merit that is earned by one who is attached to liberality and the merit that is earned by one who exercises forgiveness and the merit that I have by my sacrificial ceremonies-may you earn all that.”

data.v: ततः प्रतर्दनोऽप्याह वाक्यं क्षत्रियपुंगवः । यथा धर्मरतिर्नित्यं नित्यं युद्धपरायणः ।।
data.md: Then did that foremost among the Kshatriyas, Pratardana too, ever attached to virtue and given to war, said:

data.v: प्राप्तवानस्मि यल्लोके क्षत्रधर्मोद्भवं यशः । वीरशब्दफलं चैव तेन संयुज्यतां भवान् ।।
data.md: "The merit that I have earned in this world by my conduct towards all the castes, which can not be found fault with, that too I give you and may you earn that.

data.v: शिबिरौशीनरो धीमानुवाच मधुरां गिरम् । यथा बालेषु नारीषु वैहार्येषु तथैव च ।।
data.md: The wise Shibi, the son of Ushinara, then said in a sweet voice Since, to children, or women, as also to those who might be cracked jokes with,

data.v: संगरेषु निपातेषु तथापद्व्यसनेषु च । अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे तेन सत्येन खं व्रज ।।
data.md: To those who are in danger, to those engaged in a game of dice, as also to those who are suffering from grief and calamities I have never before said a falsehood, by virtue of that truth, wander about in heaven.

data.v: यथा प्राणांश्च राज्यं च राजन्कर्म सुखानि च । त्यजेयं न पुनः सत्यं तेन सत्येन खं व्रज ।।
data.md: I can abandon my life, my kingdom as also all luxuries and objects of desire but not truth, by that do you wander about in heaven.

data.v: यथा सत्येन मे धर्मो यथा सत्येन पावकः । प्रीतः शक्रश्च सत्येन तेन सत्येन खं व्रज ।।
data.md: The truth by which Dharma, the truth by which Agni and the truth by which the performer of a hundred sacrifices has been gratified by me-by virtue of that truth wander about in heaven.

data.v: अष्टकस्त्वथ राजर्षिः कौशिको माधवीसुतः । अनेकशतयज्वानं वचनं प्राह धर्मवित् ।।
data.md: And the royal Rishi Ashtaka too, the son of Madhvi, by the son of Kushika, conversant with virtue, addressing the son of Nahusha who had performed many hundreds of sacrifices, said:

data.v: शतशः पुण्डरीका मे गोसवाश्च चिताः प्रभो । क्रतवो वाजपेयाश्च तेषां फलमवाप्नुहि ।।
data.md: "O Lord the sacrificial rites Pundarika, Gosava and Vajapeya have been performed by me by hundreds; get the merits of these.

data.v: न मे रत्नानि न धनं न तथान्ये परिच्छदाः । क्रतुष्वनुपयुक्तानि तेन सत्येन खं व्रज ।।
data.md: I have not considered gems nor wealth, nor sort riches too much for the performance of my sacrifices (that is I have not spared them); by virtue of that truth, do you wander about in heaven."

data.v: यथा यथा हि जल्पन्ति दौहित्रास्तं नराधिपम् । तथा तथा वसुमतीं त्यक्त्वा राजा दिवं ययौ ।।
data.md: As one by one his grandsons addressed that ruler of men, so by degrees the king went up to the heaven leaving below the earth.

data.v: एवं सर्वे समस्तास्ते राजानः सुकृतैस्तदा । ययातिं स्वर्गतो भ्रष्टं तारयामासुरञ्जसा ।।
data.md: By this means did all those kings by their good deeds easily save Yayati, who had been turned out from heaven, at that time.

data.v: दौहित्राः स्वेन धर्मेण यज्ञदानकृतेन वै । चतुर्षु राजवंशेषु संभूताः कुलवर्धनाः । मातामहं महाप्राज्ञं दिवमारोपयन्ति ते ।।
data.md: The four grandsons, born in four royal families, and each the perpetuator of a race, sent back by their own virtue, by the sacrificial rites performed by them and gifts made by them, their wise grandfather to heaven.

data.v: राजधर्मगुणोपेताः सर्वधर्मगुणान्विताः । दौहित्रास्ते वयं राजन्दिवमारोह पार्थिवः ।।
data.md: The kings said O king, we are your grandsons endued with kingly virtues and with all virtues and accomplishments; ascend heaven, O ruler of men.

data.v: सद्भिरारोपितः स्वर्गं पार्थिवैर्भूरिदक्षिणैः । अभ्यनुज्ञाय दौहित्रान्ययातिर्दिवमास्थितः ।।
data.md: Narada said Being thus made to ascend heaven by those pious rulers of the earth, who were greatly given liberality, Yayati was established in heaven after taking leave of his grandsons.

data.v: अभिवृष्टश्च वर्षेण नानापुष्पसुगन्धिना । परिष्वक्तश्च पुण्येन वायुना पुण्यगन्धिना ।।
data.md: (He went up heaven) amidst the downpour of a shower of sweet scented flow very smell indicated its holiness.

data.v: अचलं स्थानमारुह्य दौहित्रफलनिर्जितम् । कर्मभिः स्वैरुपचितो जज्वाल परया श्रिया ।।
data.md: Reaching then eternal regions earned for him by his grand sons by the fruit of their own deeds, he became effulgent with excellent beauty.

data.v: उपगीतोपनृत्तश्च गन्धर्वाप्सरसां गणैः । प्रीत्या प्रतिगृहीतश्च स्वर्गे दुन्दुभिनिस्वनैः ।।
data.md: He was gladly received in heaven with songs and dances by groups of Gandharvas and with the sound of cymbals.

data.v: अभिष्टुतश्च विविधैर्देवराजर्षिचारणैः । अर्चितश्चोत्तमार्घेण दैवतैरभिनन्दितः ।।
data.md: He was also duly gratified by various classes of celestial Rishis, royal Rishis, and Charanas and otherwise pleased by the gods.

data.v: प्राप्तः स्वर्गफलं चैव तमुवाच पितामहः । निर्वृतं शान्तमनसं वचोभिस्तर्पयन्निव ।।
data.md: The grandfather then said to him who had earned the merit of ascending heaven as if trying to please him who had obtained gratification and tranquility of mind with his words.

data.v: चतुष्पादस्त्वया धर्मश्चितो लोक्येन कर्मणा । अक्षयस्तव लोकोऽयं कीर्तिश्चैवाक्षया दिवि । पुनस्तवाद्य राजर्षे सुकृतेनेह कर्मणा ।।
data.md: The four Padas (the full amount) of virtue had been earned by you your worldly deeds and these regions were yours for an endless period and your renown in heaven too was eternal.

data.v: आवृतं तमसा चेतः सर्वेषां स्वर्गवासिनाम् । येन त्वां नाभिजानन्ति ततोऽज्ञात्वासि पातितः ।।
प्रीत्यैव चासि दौहित्रैस्तारितस्त्वमिहागतः । स्थानं च प्रतिपन्नोऽसि कर्मणा स्वेन निर्जितम् । अचलं शाश्वतं पुण्यमुत्तमं ध्रुवमव्ययम् ।।
data.md: Earned by your deeds you have now come to a place which is stable, eternal sacred, excellent and surely indestructible.

data.v: भगवन्संशयो मेऽस्ति कश्चित्तं छेत्तुमर्हसि । न ह्यन्यमहमर्हामि प्रष्टुं लोकपितामह ।।
data.md: Yayati said O you endued with divine prosperity, I have a certain doubt which it is proper for you to remove; it is not proper that I should ask any body else, O grandfather of the universe.

data.v: बहुवर्षसहस्रान्तं प्रजापालनवर्धितम् । अनेकक्रतुदानौघैरर्जितं मे महत्फलम् ।।
data.md: Great was the merit earned by me by protecting my subjects and increasing the human stock for a great many thousands of years and by many sacrificial rites and pieties.

data.v: कथं तदल्पकालेन क्षीणं येनास्मि पातितः । भगवन्वेत्थ लोकांश्च शाश्वतान्मम निर्जितान् ।।
data.md: How could that all be spent up in a very short time in consequence of which I was hurled down; O you endued with divine prosperity, you know that the eternal regions were built for me and how and why were all these destroyed, O you of great effulgence?

data.v: बहुवर्षसहस्रान्तं प्रजापालनवर्धितम् । अनेकक्रतुदानौघैर्यत्त्वयोपार्जितं फलम् ।।
data.md: Great was the merit earned by me by protecting my subjects and increasing the human stock for a great many thousands of years and by many sacrificial rites and pieties.

data.v: तदनेनैव दोषेण क्षीणं येनासि पातितः । अभिमानेन राजेन्द्र धिक्कृतः स्वर्गवासिभिः ।।
data.md: Was destroyed by this defect owing to which you were hurled down: O chief among kings, owing to your vanity you cared very little and held in contempt the denizens of heaven.

data.v: नायं मानेन राजर्षे न बलेन न हिंसया । न शाठ्येन न मायाभिर्लोको भवति शाश्वतः ।।
data.md: In the case of a man affected by vanity, O royal Rishi, or by envy or by force or by wickedness, or by deceit, these regions can not be eternal.

data.v: नावमान्यास्त्वया राजन्नवरोत्कृष्टमध्यमाः । न हि मानप्रदग्धानां कश्चिदस्ति समः क्वचित् ।।
data.md: By you, a king, are not to be disregarded or insulted those that are superior or those that are inferior or those are indifferent; salvation cannot be attained by one who is consumed by vanity.

data.v: पतनारोहणमिदं कथयिष्यन्ति ये नराः । विषमाण्यपि ते प्राप्तास्तरिष्यन्ति न संशयः ।।
data.md: Those men, who will converse on this story of your fall and recession, will attain salvation though affected by sins; there is no doubt of it.

data.v: एष दोषोऽभिमानेन पुरा प्राप्तो ययातिना । निर्बन्धतश्चातिमात्रं गालवेन महीपते ।।
data.md: Narada said By Yayati was such a distress met with in days of old of old for his vanity and by Galava owing to an excessive measure of obstinacy, O lord of the world.

data.v: श्रोतव्यं हितकामानां सुहृदां भूतिमिच्छताम् । न कर्तव्यो हि निर्बन्धो निर्बन्धो हि क्षयोदयः ।।
data.md: The advice of your well wishers should be listened to by you, for your friends wise you well; obstinacy should not be resorted for it gives rise to ruin.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वमपि गान्धारे मानं क्रोधं च वर्जय । संधत्स्व पाण्डवैर्वीर संरम्भं त्यज पार्थिव ।।
data.md: Therefore, do you also, O son of Gandhari, abandon vanity and with; ( hero make peace with the sons of Pandu and abandon wrath, O ruler of the earth.

data.v: ददाति यत्पार्थिव यत्करोति; यद्वा तपस्तप्यति यज्जुहोति । न तस्य नाशोऽस्ति न चापकर्षो; नान्यस्तदश्नाति स एव कर्ता ।।
data.md: O ruler of the earth, that which one gives, or dose, or the asceticism one practices or the sacrifices one makes can never be destroyed nor do they suffer deterioration in quality and the fruits are enjoyed by no body save the doer.

data.v: इदं महाख्यानमनुत्तमं मतं; बहुश्रुतानां गतरोषरागिणाम् । समीक्ष्य लोके बहुधा प्रधाविता; त्रिवर्गदृष्टिः पृथिवीमुपाश्नुते ।।
data.md: By understanding this great story than which nothing is better, and which is approved of by those who are well read in holy books and those who are past the operations of desire and wrath, a man obtains in this world a knowledge of (virtue, worldly good and desire) and gets the sovereignty of this world.

data.v: भगवन्नेवमेवैतद्यथा वदसि नारद । इच्छामि चाहमप्येवं न त्वीशो भगवन्नहम् ।।
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O you endued with divine prosperity, it is as you say O Narada, and I too wish the same thing, but you endued with heavenly prosperity, I am not the master.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा ततः कृष्णमभ्यभाषत भारत । स्वर्ग्यं लोक्यं च मामात्थ धर्म्यं न्याय्यं च केशव ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said Saying this the descendant of Kurus said to Krishna "O Keshava, you have said to me what leads to (the attainment of) heaven, to the benefit of the world and which is virtuous and just.

data.v: न त्वहं स्ववशस्तात क्रियमाणं न मे प्रियम् । अङ्ग दुर्योधनं कृष्ण मन्दं शास्त्रातिगं मम ।।
data.md: But I am not my own master, O you of long arms; O best of men, try persuade, O Krishna, my wicked son Duryodhana, who disregards injunctions of the scriptures who never dose what is pleasing to me and never listens to good words.

data.v: अनुनेतुं महाबाहो यतस्व पुरुषोत्तम । सुहृत्कार्यं तु सुमहत्कृतं ते स्याज्जनार्दन ।।
data.md: Then will a very great duty of a friend have been done by you, O Janardana.” Then did the son of Vrishni addressing the wrathful Duryodhana,

data.v: ततोऽभ्यावृत्य वार्ष्णेयो दुर्योधनममर्षणम् । अब्रवीन्मधुरां वाचं सर्वधर्मार्थतत्त्ववित् ।।
दुर्योधन निबोधेदं मद्वाक्यं कुरुसत्तम । समर्थं ते विशेषेण सानुबन्धस्य भारत ।।
data.md: O Duryodhana, my dear son, listen to those words of mine which will conduce to the benefit to yourself along with your followers, which will bring on happiness and which is easy for you to listen.

data.v: महाप्राज्ञ कुले जातः साध्वेतत्कर्तुमर्हसि । श्रुतवृत्तोपसंपन्नः सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः ।।
दौष्कुलेया दुरात्मानो नृशंसा निरपत्रपाः । त एतदीदृशं कुर्युर्यथा त्वं तात मन्यसे ।।
धर्मार्थयुक्ता लोकेऽस्मिन्प्रवृत्तिर्लक्ष्यते सताम् । असतां विपरीता तु लक्ष्यते भरतर्षभ ।।
विपरीता त्वियं वृत्तिरसकृल्लक्ष्यते त्वयि । अधर्मश्चानुबन्धोऽत्र घोरः प्राणहरो महान् ।।
अनेकशस्त्वन्निमित्तमयशस्यं च भारत । तमनर्थं परिहरन्नात्मश्रेयः करिष्यसि ।।
भ्रातॄणामथ भृत्यानां मित्राणां च परंतप । अधर्म्यादयशस्याच्च कर्मणस्त्वं प्रमोक्ष्यसे ।।
प्राज्ञैः शूरैर्महोत्साहैरात्मवद्भिर्बहुश्रुतैः । संधत्स्व पुरुषव्याघ्र पाण्डवैर्भरतर्षभ ।।
तद्धितं च प्रियं चैव धृतराष्ट्रस्य धीमतः । पितामहस्य द्रोणस्य विदुरस्य महामतेः ।।
कृपस्य सोमदत्तस्य बाह्लीकस्य च धीमतः । अश्वत्थाम्नो विकर्णस्य संजयस्य विशां पते ।।
ज्ञातीनां चैव भूयिष्ठं मित्राणां च परंतप । शमे शर्म भवेत्तात सर्वस्य जगतस्तथा ।।
ह्रीमानसि कुले जातः श्रुतवाननृशंसवान् । तिष्ठ तात पितुः शास्त्रे मातुश्च भरतर्षभ ।।
एतच्छ्रेयो हि मन्यन्ते पिता यच्छास्ति भारत । उत्तमापद्गतः सर्वः पितुः स्मरति शासनम् ।।
रोचते ते पितुस्तात पाण्डवैः सह संगमः । सामात्यस्य कुरुश्रेष्ठ तत्तुभ्यं तात रोचताम् ।।
श्रुत्वा यः सुहृदां शास्त्रं मर्त्यो न प्रतिपद्यते । विपाकान्ते दहत्येनं किंपाकमिव भक्षितम् ।।
यस्तु निःश्रेयसं वाक्यं मोहान्न प्रतिपद्यते । स दीर्घसूत्रो हीनार्थः पश्चात्तापेन युज्यते ।।
यस्तु निःश्रेयसं श्रुत्वा प्राप्तमेवाभिपद्यते । आत्मनो मतमुत्सृज्य स लोके सुखमेधते ।।
योऽर्थकामस्य वचनं प्रातिकूल्यान्न मृष्यते । शृणोति प्रतिकूलानि द्विषतां वशमेति सः ।।
सतां मतमतिक्रम्य योऽसतां वर्तते मते । शोचन्ते व्यसने तस्य सुहृदो नचिरादिव ।।
मुख्यानमात्यानुत्सृज्य यो निहीनान्निषेवते । स घोरामापदं प्राप्य नोत्तारमधिगच्छति ।।
योऽसत्सेवी वृथाचारो न श्रोता सुहृदां सदा । परान्वृणीते स्वान्द्वेष्टि तं गौः शपति भारत ।।
स त्वं विरुध्य तैर्वीरैरन्येभ्यस्त्राणमिच्छसि । अशिष्टेभ्योऽसमर्थेभ्यो मूढेभ्यो भरतर्षभ ।।
को हि शक्रसमाञ्ज्ञातीनतिक्रम्य महारथान् । अन्येभ्यस्त्राणमाशंसेत्त्वदन्यो भुवि मानवः ।।
जन्मप्रभृति कौन्तेया नित्यं विनिकृतास्त्वया । न च ते जातु कुप्यन्ति धर्मात्मानो हि पाण्डवाः ।।
मिथ्याप्रचरितास्तात जन्मप्रभृति पाण्डवाः । त्वयि सम्यङ्महाबाहो प्रतिपन्ना यशस्विनः ।।
त्वयापि प्रतिपत्तव्यं तथैव भरतर्षभ । स्वेषु बन्धुषु मुख्येषु मा मन्युवशमन्वगाः ।।
त्रिवर्गयुक्ता प्राज्ञानामारम्भा भरतर्षभ । धर्मार्थावनुरुध्यन्ते त्रिवर्गासंभवे नराः ।।
पृथक्तु विनिविष्टानां धर्मं धीरोऽनुरुध्यते । मध्यमोऽर्थं कलिं बालः काममेवानुरुध्यते ।।
इन्द्रियैः प्रसृतो लोभाद्धर्मं विप्रजहाति यः । कामार्थावनुपायेन लिप्समानो विनश्यति ।।
कामार्थौ लिप्समानस्तु धर्ममेवादितश्चरेत् । न हि धर्मादपैत्यर्थः कामो वापि कदाचन ।।
उपायं धर्ममेवाहुस्त्रिवर्गस्य विशां पते । लिप्समानो हि तेनाशु कक्षेऽग्निरिव वर्धते ।।
स त्वं तातानुपायेन लिप्ससे भरतर्षभ । आधिराज्यं महद्दीप्तं प्रथितं सर्वराजसु ।।
आत्मानं तक्षति ह्येष वनं परशुना यथा । यः सम्यग्वर्तमानेषु मिथ्या राजन्प्रवर्तते ।।
न तस्य हि मतिं छिन्द्याद्यस्य नेच्छेत्पराभवम् । अविच्छिन्नस्य धीरस्य कल्याणे धीयते मतिः ।।
त्यक्तात्मानं न बाधेत त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत । अप्यन्यं प्राकृतं किंचित्किमु तान्पाण्डवर्षभान् ।।
अमर्षवशमापन्नो न किंचिद्बुध्यते नरः । छिद्यते ह्याततं सर्वं प्रमाणं पश्य भारत ।।
श्रेयस्ते दुर्जनात्तात पाण्डवैः सह संगमः । तैर्हि संप्रीयमाणस्त्वं सर्वान्कामानवाप्स्यसि ।।
पाण्डवैर्निर्जितां भूमिं भुञ्जानो राजसत्तम । पाण्डवान्पृष्ठतः कृत्वा त्राणमाशंससेऽन्यतः ।।
दुःशासने दुर्विषहे कर्णे चापि ससौबले । एतेष्वैश्वर्यमाधाय भूतिमिच्छसि भारत ।।
न चैते तव पर्याप्ता ज्ञाने धर्मार्थयोस्तथा । विक्रमे चाप्यपर्याप्ताः पाण्डवान्प्रति भारत ।।
न हीमे सर्वराजानः पर्याप्ताः सहितास्त्वया । क्रुद्धस्य भीमसेनस्य प्रेक्षितुं मुखमाहवे ।।
इदं संनिहितं तात समग्रं पार्थिवं बलम् । अयं भीष्मस्तथा द्रोणः कर्णश्चायं तथा कृपः ।।
भूरिश्रवाः सौमदत्तिरश्वत्थामा जयद्रथः । अशक्ताः सर्व एवैते प्रतियोद्धुं धनंजयम् ।।
अजेयो ह्यर्जुनः क्रुद्धः सर्वैरपि सुरासुरैः । मानुषैरपि गन्धर्वैर्मा युद्धे चेत आधिथाः ।।
दृश्यतां वा पुमान्कश्चित्समग्रे पार्थिवे बले । योऽर्जुनं समरे प्राप्य स्वस्तिमानाव्रजेद्गृहान् ।।
किं ते जनक्षयेणेह कृतेन भरतर्षभ । यस्मिञ्जिते जितं ते स्यात्पुमानेकः स दृश्यताम् ।।
यः स देवान्सगन्धर्वान्सयक्षासुरपन्नगान् । अजयत्खाण्डवप्रस्थे कस्तं युध्येत मानवः ।।
तथा विराटनगरे श्रूयते महदद्भुतम् । एकस्य च बहूनां च पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
तमजेयमनाधृष्यं विजेतुं जिष्णुमच्युतम् । आशंससीह समरे वीरमर्जुनमूर्जितम् ।।
मद्द्वितीयं पुनः पार्थं कः प्रार्थयितुमर्हति । युद्धे प्रतीपमायान्तमपि साक्षात्पुरंदरः ।।
बाहुभ्यामुद्धरेद्भूमिं दहेत्क्रुद्ध इमाः प्रजाः । पातयेत्त्रिदिवाद्देवान्योऽर्जुनं समरे जयेत् ।।
पश्य पुत्रांस्तथा भ्रातॄञ्ज्ञातीन्संबन्धिनस्तथा । त्वत्कृते न विनश्येयुरेते भरतसत्तम ।।
अस्तु शेषं कौरवाणां मा पराभूदिदं कुलम् । कुलघ्न इति नोच्येथा नष्टकीर्तिर्नराधिप ।।
त्वामेव स्थापयिष्यन्ति यौवराज्ये महारथाः । महाराज्ये च पितरं धृतराष्ट्रं जनेश्वरम् ।।
मा तात श्रियमायान्तीमवमंस्थाः समुद्यताम् । अर्धं प्रदाय पार्थेभ्यो महतीं श्रियमाप्स्यसि ।।
पाण्डवैः संशमं कृत्वा कृत्वा च सुहृदां वचः । संप्रीयमाणो मित्रैश्च चिरं भद्राण्यवाप्स्यसि ।।
ततः शांतनवो भीष्मो दुर्योधनममर्षणम् । केशवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रोवाच भरतर्षभ ।।
कृष्णेन वाक्यमुक्तोऽसि सुहृदां शममिच्छता । अनुपश्यस्व तत्तात मा मन्युवशमन्वगाः ।।
अकृत्वा वचनं तात केशवस्य महात्मनः । श्रेयो न जातु न सुखं न कल्याणमवाप्स्यसि ।।
धर्म्यमर्थं महाबाहुराह त्वां तात केशवः । तमर्थमभिपद्यस्व मा राजन्नीनशः प्रजाः ।।
इमां श्रियं प्रज्वलितां भारतीं सर्वराजसु । जीवतो धृतराष्ट्रस्य दौरात्म्याद्भ्रंशयिष्यसि ।।
आत्मानं च सहामात्यं सपुत्रपशुबान्धवम् । सहमित्रमसद्बुद्ध्या जीविताद्भ्रंशयिष्यसि ।।
अतिक्रामन्केशवस्य तथ्यं वचनमर्थवत् । पितुश्च भरतश्रेष्ठ विदुरस्य च धीमतः ।।
मा कुलघ्नोऽन्तपुरुषो दुर्मतिः कापथं गमः । पितरं मातरं चैव वृद्धौ शोकाय मा ददः ।।
अथ द्रोणोऽब्रवीत्तत्र दुर्योधनमिदं वचः । अमर्षवशमापन्नं निःश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः ।।
धर्मार्थयुक्तं वचनमाह त्वां तात केशवः । तथा भीष्मः शांतनवस्तज्जुषस्व नराधिप ।।
प्राज्ञौ मेधाविनौ दान्तावर्थकामौ बहुश्रुतौ । आहतुस्त्वां हितं वाक्यं तदादत्स्व परंतप ।।
अनुतिष्ठ महाप्राज्ञ कृष्णभीष्मौ यदूचतुः । मा वचो लघुबुद्धीनां समास्थास्त्वं परंतप ।।
ये त्वां प्रोत्साहयन्त्येते नैते कृत्याय कर्हिचित् । वैरं परेषां ग्रीवायां प्रतिमोक्ष्यन्ति संयुगे ।।
मा कुरूञ्जीघनः सर्वान्पुत्रान्भ्रातॄंस्तथैव च । वासुदेवार्जुनौ यत्र विद्ध्यजेयं बलं हि तत् ।।
एतच्चैव मतं सत्यं सुहृदोः कृष्णभीष्मयोः । यदि नादास्यसे तात पश्चात्तप्स्यसि भारत ।।
यथोक्तं जामदग्न्येन भूयानेव ततोऽर्जुनः । कृष्णो हि देवकीपुत्रो देवैरपि दुरुत्सहः ।।
किं ते सुखप्रियेणेह प्रोक्तेन भरतर्षभ । एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु । न हि त्वामुत्सहे वक्तुं भूयो भरतसत्तम ।।
